name: Naftal petrol station
description: Very friendly and helpful English speaking owner. Allowed us to camp on the site. Secure, with cameras. Cafeteria, public toilets, mechanic and parts shop on site.

name: Naftal petrol station
description: Petrol station just north of Aïn Touta. A closed motel is on the site. We were allowed to camp in the parking lot, for 200 DZD. A cafeteria is on the site.

name: Wooded area
description: A wooded area about 100 meters north of the main road. Very secluded, and obviously used for camping before.

name: Bushy Area
description:
An area with bushes about 50 meters west of the main road. Somewhat secluded. Small cars can park behind bushes, and not be seen from the road.
Seems to have been used for camping before.

name: Oued with trees
description: Entrance to a oued with bushes and trees. First one for hours.

name: Military Checkpoint
description: Going south, we were forced to have an escort starting from here, all the way to Tamanrasset.

name: Arak Gendarmerie Checkpoint
description:
Gendarmerie checkpoint at Arak.
They change the escort to Tamanrasset here.

name: Arak fuel station
description: Fuel station next to gendarmerie checkpoint. Next fuel station towards Tamanrasset is 250 km away, in In Amguel.

name: Hazoua border crossing
description: newly opened crossing between Algeria and Tunisia

name: In Amguel fuel station
description:
Fuel station next to gendarmerie checkpoint in In Amguel.
Next fuel station towards In Salah is in Arak, 250 km away.

name: Directorate of Tourism
description: This is where you have to go in order to arrange escorts for tours around Tamanrasset. Also where the tours to Assekram start from.

name: Camping Dassine
description:
Camping site in Tamanrasset. A bit derelict, toilets and showers not working well. Water is on and off.
I think we are the first tourists here this year.
Initial price before haggling for camping was 1200 dinars per person.

name: Naftal Fuel Station
description: Last fuel station before In Salah, in 340 km. Also last fuel station before Timimoun, in 300 km.

name: Rose de Sable
description:
1,4 km NW of RN118. There are signs in the main road.
Enclosed camping ground, with beautiful view of the dunes. Owner speaks acceptable English.
Clean and nice area.
Price for camping is 800 dinars pp.

name: Naftal Fuel Station
description: The first fuel station since Abadla. After 200 km.

name: Border Crossing
description:
Border crossing to Mauritania, south of Tindouf. 

We were the third group of tourists that used this border crossing, according to the officials here. 
The total time on both sides was about 3,5 hours. It seemed like this was mainly because the officials didn’t have anything else to do, so they had no reason to hurry up. There were no “helpers” of any kind there.
First we went to the police for getting our passports stamped.
After this, we had to go to the customs. They wanted to know how much cash we had. And they demanded to see all of our cash. They then searched the car fairly thoroughly.
I believe that after this, we were sent to the Mauritanian side.
The first post on the Mauritanian side was with the gendarmerie. They demanded 2000 DZD to register us. We were 3 people. I do not know if it was a per person fee, or per group. Nor do I know if the fee was legitimate.
We then went to get our visas. That was €55 per person. And they demanded €5 per person for the archive. Again, I do not know if the archive fee was a legitimate fee. We only got single entry visas. We forgot to ask for double entry.
I believe after this we went to the customs. They asked if we had alcohol, but did not really check the car.
I asked where we could get insurance for the car. They said to do it at Bir Moghrein. But we met with a couple who crossed after us. They were going to get it at Zouerat. I’m not sure if they were told so at the border. Bir Moghrein did not look like it has any insurance office, and we forgot about it there. So we will try at Zouerat or Fderik.
Just before the exit, we met with the police. They wanted to know where we were going. Probably so they could know where to start looking if we went missing, and to tell the police along the way to look for us.
All in all a simple bordercrossing with no hassle, except for the Algerian customs asking us to show all of our cash. It just took some time, that’s all.

name: Spring Water
description: Good, clean spring water fed from rocky hillside

name: Vidange Lambton
description: Right by the road.. free and easy access

name: A&A Fuel
description: Propane fill station. Corner of parking lot at gas station. Cheap gas too.

name: Ouray KOA
description: Established campsite with great showers for $5

name: Kaser
description: its good in national, nice, clean hotel with a cars park ,town centre .

name: Jaichy Yurt camp
description: Beautiful camp with a very welcoming family. Enjoy Your stay

name: Willamette National Forest Boondocking site
description: Great little spot, right on a creek with plenty of parking off a quiet forest service road.

name: Checkers Welcome Campground
description: This is an established campground, right off of I-90. Full hook-up with pull through sites for RV’ Friendly staff and well taken care of property. Flushing toilets and hot showers along with laundry facilities. I am tent camping and paid $32 for the night. It is close to the road so there is a bit of road noise. It does die off at night some, but doesn’t completely stop.

name: police checkpoint
description: police stop 7km before Beni Ounif. We (toyota+2 europeans) were stopped for a length of time checking our passports. eventually they let us go with no additional requirements,  we should be able to drive to Tindouff without police escort

name: Hotel Djebilet
description: Hotel in Tindouf. 7500 DZD double, 9000 DZD, breakfast include. Prices as in 2022.

name: Catholic Mission Cabinda
description: Very welcoming people, especially the priest Futi is very kind and a joy to talk to, camping inside their grounds with good toilets but no showers, water available, we stayed for free and everybody was happy that we visited Cabinda

name: Club Naval Luanda
description: The yacht club people love overlanders and you are allowed to stay for free  on their car park with one of the best views in town, use the toilets and showers and the free wifi

name: Namibe Campsite
description:
The only real campsite we stumbled upon in Angola, right at the beach, we did not actually stay but were allowed to fill up with drinking water for free, 25US$/night (18,25€) for two people

They asked 2000kz on 24-07-2017 for camping.

name: Flamingo Lodge
description: Simple but nice camp at an isolated beach catering mostly for sport fishermen, simple and clean ablutions, nice bar/restaurant on top of a hill, friendly South African managers, 60US$/night (43,80€) for two people which is very steep but they are willing to lower the price for overlanders

name: Bush camp gravel pit
description: Close to the road but not visible from it. Low risk of land mines as the spot has been used for the construction of the road previously.

name: Bush camp lonely bay
description: A beautiful beach at a bay which is mostly deserted.

name: Bush camp little waterfall
description: A clearing with a big tree next to a small waterfall. The road leading there connects a couple of villages but leads nowhere specific.

name: Calandula Falls
description: Huge waterfalls which sees few visitors. Definitely worth the drive.

name: Pedras Negras veiw point
description: A beautiful spot for enjoying a sunrise and/or sunset. Stairs lead up to the top of the black rocks.

name: Toyota Lobito
description: The local Toyota branch.

name: SME/Immigration Benguela
description: Come here to prolong your visa. We had to fill out one Portuguese form, hand in 2 passport photos and copies of our current visa and the passport main page. The cost for the extension was the equivalent of 90US$ in kwanza. We were first told that they could only give us another month from the date of issue so if you are only two weeks in you would only gain another two. Surprisingly we ended up with a full month on top anyway. Passport pickup was the day after.

name: Caotinha
description: Beautiful coastline and large cliffs.

name: Bush camp wild beach
description: The rough Atlantic is pounding against this wild beach with high cliffs raising on the other side. There is also a small cave/canyon. A perfect spot to while away a few days.

name: Mucuio
description: A small fishing village at a beautiful bay. There are remains of a large colonial building here. You can probably set up camp right at the ocean if you can communicate with the relaxed locals.

name: Lake Arco / Rock arches
description: A substantial lake in the Namibe desert that sometimes carries water. Take a stroll and don't miss the large rock arch.

name: Viewpoint Serra da Leba pass
description: Brilliant view over the impressive Serra da Leba pass.

name: Tundavala
description: The plateau drops 1000m straight down here. Beautiful place.

name: Bush camp Tundavala
description: Beautiful place to camp inbetween rock boulders, very quiet, no view into the valley.

name: Jesus Christ statue
description: A smaller copy of the original in Rio de Janeiro. It has been partly restored but you can still see bullet holes on the face of the statue. Nice view over Lubango from up here.

name: Bush camp scrubs
description: Just a spot to hide away for the night between the bushes. There are a lot of cattle tracks so risk of land mines should be slim.

name: Abandoned graveyard
description: Not really a tourist attraction but an eerie place. The desert sands are claiming back this small graveyard an chapel.

name: Bush camp Namibe
description: A spot on a little hill in a rocky part of the Namibe desert.

name: Bush camp desert
description: You can camp pretty much anywhere here.

name: Bush camp Cunene river
description: An amazing spot at the Cunene river with the sand dunes of the Namib desert rising on the Namibian side.

name: Bush camp Himba country
description: One of a thousand perfect bush camps along this rough 4x4 route.

name: Shankara
description: A very nice spot run by friendly owners Terrance and Empie

name: Border Post Of Calueque
description:
Easy and friendly border crossing. If your visa has expired, you have to pay KW15.000 per exceeded day - or sign a form stating you could not pay. The last option results in being put on a black list: you will not be able to enter Angola again unless you pay the fine anyway. 

Borders close at 19h Namibia time / 18h Angola time.

name: Quarry Wildcamp, South Mbanza Congo, Angola
description: Good quarry site near main road but well out of view. (16/08/15) Handy spot if crossing from or into DRC. We were able to get to The Catholic Mission in Lwozi from here in a day. Liza & Jason

name: Farm Camp, Humpata, Angola
description: Handy campsite on outskirts of Humpata, located not to far from Lubango to explore the sights in the area. The camp hand changed management when we visited so although they didn't want to charge us we gave them 1000Kwanzas. There is a good sheltered area with a sink & fridge & there is hot water (Geiger) available to shower. Drive north into village of Humpata from main road & once you find the irrigation canal, follow it westbound. The farm entrance gate is at -15.016124 , 13.356228. Liza & Jason

name: My Beach, Bushcamp, Namibe, Angola
description: Bush camp between the cliffs close to the beach. The was a fishing shelter located on the beach but it was deserted when we visited. Turn off main road at S14.801407, E12.435662 & turn left at S14.772102, E12.388504. The rocky rough 'road' follows the canyon down to the beach. There is one steep section that would not be reckoned for large vehicles or inexperienced drivers or in the wet, when we visited. Liza & Jason

name: Congo Hotel
description: Double room for 12750Kw per night with breakfast. Lovely new rooms with A/C and warm showers. European standards.

name: Luvo
description: Took about 2 hours but is aggressive

name: Kwanza Lodge
description: Very convenient chalets at Angolan prices

name: Police station
description: We stayed at the parking behind the police station. Beautiful seaview

name: praia do Santiago, shipwreck beach
description:
for beautiful pictures, many ships on the beach.  

See also below remark

name: Angola Customs - Luvo
description:
Entry. CdP NOT stamped... but next day our Swiss mates got their CdP stamped. Our guy was the boss and said they'll accept CdP when Angola is accepted into the CdP system. He clearly knew what the CdP was and refused to stamp it. Temporary Import cost:
3,168 Kz for motorbike
6,336 Kz for 4WD 
Pay at bank nextdoor. Legit documentation + receipt given. This seems like a new thing so good chance you can get CdP stamped... we just lined up with the boss.
BRING HARD CURRENCY. We exchanged US$100 note @ XE rate at bank nextdoor to pay for motorbikes entry... then found out later that blackmarket rate is THREE TIMES BETTER.

name: Cell tower camp
description: Close to highway and tucked away well out of sight. Good spot EXCEPT that mozzie onslaught after sundown was INTENSE... seriously take a pee bottle to bed. Maybe time of year?... don't know.

name: Wild Camp River Bed
description: A good place for a night on the way to Ruacana. Himbas might visit you. Friendly people.

name: Restaurant Boa Viagem
description:
Bloody good spot considering other roadside Cafe options on this stretch of road.
1800 Kz for a big plate of food 
200 Kz for proper espresso

name: Beach of Lucira
description:
In Lucira next to police tentet camp; police will check your documents.

The beach is surrounded by houses and next to the - small - harbour.

name: Alfa Bar
description: A chill bar and restaurant on the the beach.  camping, toilets, electricity.

name: Mayombe Hotel
description: Nice place to get a meal for around $8-10USD, coffee in the cafe downstairs also. Has WiFi available, good place to sit and ponder how to get your vehicle to mainland Angola lol...

name: Casablanca Hotel
description: Don't know the actual name of the hotel, cheap place to stay if arriving after border closure. Very basic room with a/c, double bed and bathroom with bucket shower is 3500kw ($7 USD black market rate). Short walk to cheap restaurant at the gas station.

name: Cabinda military plane
description:
User reports: "I paid 25000, me and my small Vespa. What I suggest, it's contact Venacio /dacosta /paisino. Phone: 935217674 940539847 You can find them in FappA neighbors (close to military airport)"

We ran out of options to get our bikes to Soyo. We went to the gate and just asked to fly our motorcycles to Luanda. The military plane carries pretty much everything, locals were moving furniture etc. They first wanted 100,000kw per bike but we negotiated down to 140,000kw for two bikes and three people. 140,000 was $250usd black market rate ($1usd = 550kw at the time). The plane runs almost every day, you can probably get a 4x4 on the plane without too much hassle but negotiate a good price, don't let them know you have USD or are changing at black market rate as they will probably want more. At the time, a man named Alfonz was running the show, he was about 26 years old and organized everything. He did have a chief who came later and wanted more money but Alfonz smoothed it over. No customs checks or anything, just ride into the plane. No seats, not much to hold on to, takes about an hour to get to Luanda.

name: Ibeme RORO shipping
description: Official shipping company Ibeme have a RORO vessel to Luanda which leaves a couple of times per week. They also have a small boat to Soyo which probably could not take a 4x4. Do not know price, we used military plane instead, which I recommend over a ship.

name: Cafe Del Mar
description: Really nice restaurant at fast food prices (if you're getting black market exchange rate), highly recommended.

name: on the Oncocua Road
description: bush camp near the river

name: Near Moinba on the way to Iona.
description: Next to the road from Moinba to Iona. On a hill.

name: near the road from Virrei to Caraculo
description: behind a big stones

name: Pensao Pedras Soltas
description: Hostel with simple rooms with and without bath. A big space for tents. overlanders welcome. double room without bath 5000 kwz. With bath 8000. campsite 2000 tent.

name: just at the footprint
description: An excellent spot to camp for the night. Beautiful sunset with only the sound of a running water stream. One of the nicest spots that we have wild camped on our over 40k km journey through east and southern Africa.

name: quipungo
description: near a track from Quipungo

name: On the road from Xangongo to Naulila
description: huge place in the middle of nowhere.

name: Carpe Diem Lodge
description:
They love Overlanders, let you camp for free on their parking lot. Shower, toilet for free and good. You can use pool, beach etc. Even did our laundry (2 large bags) on you give what you want basis. Internet very  slow but Unitel good reception if you have your personal SIM card. 
The very friendly owner invited us for breakfast. One of the best beaches in Angola.

name: Pousada do Wembele
description: Camping possible at their premises on the beach, very quite, nice view. Beach is clean. Good toilets available. Restaurant has good price worthy food. Camping Euro 3 PP, fresh fish Euro 5.

name: flat area at the riverbank
description:
Flat area between trees direct at the Hangumbi river. Himbas might pass by as this is all Himba area. 

About 5-6 hour drive to the Ruacana border.

name: Camp between hills
description: Camp on white gravel between bushes and a beautiful view over the surrounding hills.

name: Foz do Cunene
description: A strange place where the sand desert meets the stone desert and the river meets the ocean.

name: money exchange
description:
Guys are sitting around here. Drive past slowly and look at them, they will signal with their fingers "money".
They preferably take USD

name: Honda mechanic
description: Cutie the friendly owner will fix any Honda/Vespa/2wheelers for a great price and value call +244 923 473 196 or just show up

name: Residence Cilofer
description: chap but clean, basic but newish, ok for a night esp. if you're on a bike. cars have to park on the street but bikes fit inside the small gate, 7500/night which was about usd16 in jan'17 , big shopping centre 5min walk

name: Hotel Perola D'Zeto
description: Nice hotel, warm showers, AC, no wifi. 10.900 for a double room, 13,200 for a larger twin. Good Unitel reception if you need 3G.

name: quicama lodge
description: complete lodge in the middle of the parc - offers safari tours (4000 kwanza per person: girafe, zebra, kudu,...) Camp ground was 6000 per tent (2p) with our own tents. dinner was 6000pp and breakfast was 2000pp. Pool was not in use, use of showers would have been chargered as a room...

name: aquapark mussolo
description: the aquapark lies an hour drive near the end of the palm peninsula with a terroble road to get there... THE AQUAPARK IS CLOSED - permanently from the looks of it - but road signs are still in place along the road...

name: Beach near Baia des Pipas
description: Drive past Baia des Pipas on the beach and head towards the point. Great, quiet beach. Good fishing and mussels on the rocks

name: Beach Camp
description: Awesome beach outside of Luanda

name: Open Beach near Lucira
description: Beautiful open beach, beating turtles, good fishing, massive mussels on the rocks

name: Abandoned Sonangol station
description: Excellent place if you don't have time to go to the beach and/or raining. No facilities open. We gave small gifts to the night guards.

name: Camping among baobab trees
description: There is a good dirt track from the coordinates above which passes small valleyw of baobab trees. A village is nearby but the place is not frequented, and there are good spots where the car is not visible from the road. Beautiful and calm area.

name: Sassa caves
description: The coordinates above indicate where a rocky piste turns from the main road to the parking spot - it is possible to spend the night here. The coordinates of the cave: - 11.25863,13.892101. There is a crossroad at the bottom of the hill coming down from the parking spot, the left path goes to the more accessible entry of the cave. Go in the morning to see the blue light beam. Beautiful scenery.

name: Arch oasis
description: It is possible to camp at the parking lot to the Arch oasis. The fee is a matter of negotiation, we payed 2000 kwanza for the entry and camping together.

name: Catholic mission
description: We were allowed to camp for free at the mission. One of the priests spoke French, an other spoke English. They were very nice.

name: Tank wrecks
description: Tank and other military vehicle  wreckages are around.

name: Isfinia Hotel & Restaurant
description: Basic room but clean, with aa, bathroom. 9000kwz. Has also a good Restaurant with buffet 1500kwz per person.

name: wild camp at beach
description: beautiful place direct at the sandy beach. not so far away from an restaurant so you also can eat there something (walking 2 min)

name: Shipwreck Beach Wild Camp - Foot Access only
description:
There are two 'steps' or plateaus where you can camp. There are some dongas/ditches so it's best to have 4x4. 
Great views of the ocean and Shipwreck Beach. 
The military is in the area and come to check passports from time to time. Otherwise isolated and private enough to spend a couple of days in peace.

name: restaurante español
description: it is a very good place for travellers.  you have to speak with the boss Rafa, he is a very friendly spanish man. The food is very good. It is highly recommended! !

name: camp at a stone
description:
Very nice view from here when the sun goes down
a small waterfall is close to here so you see him and can walk to it (50m)

name: wild camp in a quarry
description: you can hide here from the street. In this area are some old tanks standing around. Hard to find so better ask some locals.

name: Pousada Calandula
description:
point is on the road to the other side of the waterfall. so you have to drive further on. All is tare road and at the end there is a hotel. In the moment it is in building process but the friendly owner said it should be ready in 4 month.
From here there is a nice footpath down to the river and you have an amazing view from here.
Also here you should have the possibility to camp. Ask for it!

name: wild camp on a hill
description:
nice view from here over a lot of green hills.
A way is going up to here and fields are around. Very quite spot

name: Aldeamento Turistico Meholy
description: Very nice place to stay, about 15km out if Lubango. Spacious cabins available from 5125 Kwanza. Includes breakfast.  Cold showers but you can ask for a bucket of hot water. very quiet at night. Friendly staff and lots of interesting animals (Ostrich, Emu, Rabbits, Peacocks). Definitely stay here again.

name: Hot spring
description:
hot spring. water goes in a congret basin where you can take a bath. Some locals hanging around here so no privacy. 
you also can camp here.

name: canyon
description: A scenic canyon. I parked just south of the bridge, and followed some concrete stairs and then a trail into the canyon for some minutes to get a better view.

name: Beach Camp (Plaja)
description: Nice white beach next to a very small fishers house (200m). Take the right way at the split.

name: Landrover
description: Didn't visit them, just saw and knew it's hard to find Landrover parts & service in Westafrica.

name: Wild camp
description: nice spot for one night. Very peaceful..........

name: wild camp at a field
description: peaceful spot near a small track that goes to a remote village. People are very friendly

name: pharmacy
description: There are 2 pharmacy here on this place

name: camp at a small church
description:
lovely church up on a hill with an beautiful view over the region
The friendly caplan alowed us to stay here at the parking lot.

name: wild camp
description: quite place near the railway. To sleep one night is ok.

name: Bank with good rates
description:
coordinates are approximate as forgot to take them at the time. 

Bank on left hand side in modern portacabin. cash point outside charges,  but go inside and they will change dollars for a good rate without hassle. got 1380 to dollar.  xe rate was 1403.

name: wild camp
description:
Www.dieda-unterwegs.net 
flat quite spot away from the main road

name: Border crossing Angola
description:
Angola side open: 8 AM to 5 PM
DRCongo side open: 8.30 AM to 5 PM

Easy going border crossing, it takes it's time like all border crossings. DRC went faster then Angola. We used our Carnet de Passage as well on the DRC side no problems at all, no money asked. 

TIP available on this border as well: see CMSMJ below.

name: Old quarry site
description: Just past town on the main road but still fairly quiet and private. Would be very muddy in the rainy season. The locals also dump rubbish in one corner.

name: doce hotel
description: Nice hotel, clean, air con. Internet but not working currently. very helpful staff. most comfortable mattress. paid 7k, advertised for 8k. parking is undercover by the entrance - it's open to the street, but overlooked by the reception and probably a guardian. feels safe

name: Garage
description: Dinis Auto. car repair place. took my bike their with a cracked frame. They really know what they are doing. stripped the bike back to the frame, used a gas Torch to heat the frame so it could be bent back into shape in a controlled way.  used 2 different types of Welding to first seal the crack then attach a brace over the top. They place is full of accident damaged cars they are fixing. I'd suggest they're brilliant for anything structural, not sure they would fix anything mechanical though.

name: wild camp in hills
description: Quiet spot  near the road so you don't have to drive too far away from it.

name: Camp in a dry water bed
description:
Beautiful and lonesome to camp here.
Even if it would rain there is no danger at all as long as you don't stay in the biggest water bed or in the middle of one. No worry😉

name: Giant Welwitschia Mirabilis
description:
Hidden in a valley is a really big welwitschia plant. Just follow the tracks.
There is a huge rock pile near the junction.

name: Wild camp in wild rocky area
description: It is hard NOT to find a beautiful place to sleep here. But I add this anyway 😉. Amazing sunset pictures are posible here.

name: Rock carvings and paintings
description:
Lots of carvings on the rock and at the 2 cliffs (position) here are paintings.
Take water and good shoes with you!

name: wild camp in a shade riverbed
description: Nice sandy riverbed with some huge shady trees direct at the piste but no one comes here.

name: Hot spring Bero
description: After 6 km on a bumpy road you arrive at a river (mostly dry). Walk to the other side of the river and you will see the spring.

name: Hot spring Pediva
description: Hot spring near a small village. Friendly tribe people here. There are two basin of the hot spring and a river here.

name: Waterfall do Binga
description:
Beautiful waterfalls directly near the road. You can have a look from above and below. Costs 300 kw entrance, but it is worth it.

Camping possible (10000kw for 2 people in a Campervan, see check-in for details).

name: Another wild camp at tunda valla
description:
Another nice place to sleep at the valley. remote and far away from people
for a tent it is a bit stoney here

name: Wild camp next to road
description: Unmarked sandy track leads to an open area just back from the road. Not too noisy and can't be seen from the road. Nobody and nothing passed by and the road traffic all but ceased after 6pm. Amazing star gazing on a clear night.

name: Alto Bimbe and waterfall
description:
Very nice spot here. A have to go.
waterfall and gorge

name: Le Chalet - Cheese&Yoghurt
description:
ADMIN: location has been updated.

Small shop owned by Swiss people where you can buy proper cheese and yoghurt. Highly recommended!

name: wild camp in a quarry
description:
We did not find tonis camp so we did it here. Maybe he did not exist anymore.
Here it is also nice between all the Granit blocks

name: wild camp
description: wild camp between trees. peaceful place....nothing else to say

name: Last fuel station
description: Here is the last fuel station near that border. It is in a container so if you do not find ask for it.

name: Very nice viewpoint
description: Nice viewpoint for a small stop. View from the cliffs and beach

name: Santa Clara border crossing Nam-Ang
description:
Border crossing is not too difficult. In and out of Namibia is fast. Into Angola will take a bit longer, but going out is fast.

This is currently the only Nam-Ang border that accepts Angola e-visa entry. 

Namibia side open from 8am to 7pm
Angola side open from 8am to 6 pm (Note: Angola time)

name: Hospedaria Weyidina
description:
Nice family run pension, very clean and confortable.  Around 10,000 Kwanza per room—breakfast and lunch/snack included.  Private safe parking. No sign—easy to find, nice wood gate/fence. AC, private bathroom, TV, small fridge/no smoking. 
I find the people in Mbanza Congo very friendly, best in Angola.

name: Mirador da Leba
description:
Very nice spot over looking the Leba pass. This restaurant and hospedaria has camping facilities and some rooms. It is run by a friendly family, they will cook your dinner and breakfast if you want. 
They charge 5000 Kwanza p/p per room. 
Highly recommend it. 

Camping is free but we used the restaurant in return.

name: Wild Camp at Beach
description: Wild Camp directly at the beach on a Sand-Mining Area. Nothing special but quiet and okay for one Night.

name: Roadside
description: wild camping on the new construction road from Nande to the zambian border, very deep sand

name: catholic Mission.
description:
catholic Mission on the road to saurimo,
englisch speaking priest, feels you welcome

name: Malundu border post Angola
description: Angola border post for entry and exit.  We came from Zambia, very deep sand in this area, relaxing border, no hassels, Zambian border post in Sikongo

name: catholic Mission
description: catholic Mission let us camp in their compound, very friendly, no facilities, only water, secure

name: wild camping
description: wild camping next to the road in an old quarry, one of very rare places in the area

name: Money Changer
description: There are several Money Changers at the Center of this Square. We got a good Rate here (375 Kz for 1 USD). Always check www.kinguilahoje.com for the latest Black Market Rate before you change. Another Tip: send a Local first to ask for the Rate, if they see white Skin it immediately drops.

name: catholic Mission
description: Parking in the compound of the church. Very hospitable padre from India, English speaking

name: Savanna Bush Camp
description: On the Way between Pediva (Hot Spring) and Cacolopopo (Rock Paintings). Another Bush Camp although you can literally camp everywhere here and almost every Place is beautiful. This Spot is hidden between rocky Hills with beautiful Views on the Savanna. A good Place for making a Campfire as there is plenty of Firewood around. No People or Villages nearby.

name: Capenda Camulemba Police station
description:
camping behind 
of the Police Station after asking the friendly Police, lots of space, coordinates are no exactly,

name: camping at the church
description: camping next to the evangelien church in quessao, nw from malanje, opposite a Police post, very friendly locals and police

name: Wild camp
description: Great spot for wild camp in some open area. Nice sunset. Coming from Virei take a small road to the left.

name: Customs - AGT - Servicio Regional
description: You can extend your passavant here. It is the same price as at the border. Around 6300 kz for 30 days. Take your original passavant, passport and driver's license. Don't pass your original passavant due date, otherwise they also need a letter of explanation. Very friendly officers though.

name: wild camping
description: wild camping not visible from the road in nice bush with baobabs

name: Wild camp at the beach
description: Wild camp along the beach near cliffs. Not so clean but quiet. Impressive waves !

name: Ensa insurance
description: You can get the third party insurance for your car here at the Ensa office; blue logo with a red star

name: Fazenda Rio Uiri
description: Coffee plantation in the hills; beautiful views, nice dinner, outside swimming pool we could use. We camped on the parking lot

name: Immigration
description:
Immigration office, big pink building. You can park inside the gates.

We wanted to extend our visa. We entered Angola by car via D.R. Congo and left into Namibia. Apparently the issued visa we had was valid for 60 days and not 30 days which was written on the visa itself, they confirmed it at the immigration office. But for all immigration matters this is the place.

name: Sonangol
description: Just before you enter the village, there is a container with one fuel tank inside it. There is a guy sitting in the container, it is legit and they had diesel :)

name: Near an old graveyard
description: We went off road between trees, no houses or locals here. We came across an old graveyard, nothing special but still kind of nice to see it middle of nowhere. We slept 100m from it, didn't see any ghosts... in the evening you won't hear many cars passing. good enough for a night.

name: Change money here
description: We changed our Kwanzaas for Namibian dollars here, after reading in Ioverlander in Namibia the kz is not valued as much. There are many who walk around at the roundabout to change money. 1 nambian dollar was 29kz.

name: Casper lodge
description: Quite fancy hotel with a restaurant, but they also have a small, quiet campsite, nice gardens and a few animals. Cold shower, toilet and kitchen/fridge available. Not cheap, 5000 Kwanza per person

name: Nice waterfall and area
description: Small waterfall with a rocky riverbed. Very beautiful place and just 50m from the pass road. I came from Namibe so after you made it to the top and are on the straight road, there is a big sign and an old hut on your left. About 100m later there is just a small rockroad on the right. You can drive in and go always left and then you reach a "bigger" place to park and turn.

name: Nossosuper
description: Supermarket with basic food, but helpful!

name: LoreLo
description:
Its an small restaurant climbing up some stairs with a few plates but very well prepared and not expensive.

Beef on black pepper sauce 3000Kz, skrimps 2500Kz and pica pau 2300Kz.

name: market / money change
description: This market, apart from getting fresh fruit  and outmarket things, it is the best place in Cabinda to change money.

name: Walter Silva Motorbike mechanic
description:
This guy has raced in Europe, he worked as mechanic there as well and now he has a really small street mechanic store. 

He works really well and he is traveler friendly as he has traveled himself as well.

name: Fragas Estação Servicio e Bar
description: Service station where you can get your car cleaned. There is a small bar where you can eat a hamburger (700 kwanzas), soup or sandwich. They have good WiFi connection and a small shop and a hairdresser.

name: Praia Caotinha
description:
Nice place to stay one night. We didn’t go down until the end cause the last track is a bit difficult with our car (due to our cellule), but with a 4WD could be done. Access to the beach by walking following a small path. Beautiful beach! Perfect spot to fish. Nobody disturb us. 
If you didn’t find the place, just follow the path to the antenna and then choose the track between an abandoned house and the track that goes to the “village”.

name: Binga Bay
description: Very quiet and beautiful bay with white sand and crystal water. Ideal for swimming. The turtels come here for nesting. To get here you have to pass an informal campsite/lodge, go down a steep road and pass the fisherman house.

name: Lookout over Cabo de Santa Maria
description: Close to Meva, on the plateau, overlooking the fisherman village of Santa Maria and the Cabo de Santa Maria.

name: Meva
description: Quiet bay of abaut km 1.5. On the east side there is a very small fisherman village, in the middle a space which probably is a bushcamp (without infrastructure except "gazebos" and rubbish bins, and in the west site you are alone.

name: Lookout over Mucuio
description: From Baias das Pipas there is a track that follow the coastline with a lot of isolated place to stop and where you can go for swimming. Further you will find this place that has a wonderful view over Mucuio (which you might be able to reach by foot).

name: Tundavala wild camp
description: Better views than the other spots. Nobody disturbed us!

name: Loja Academica
description:
They sell country "emblemas"/parches for bikers.

1000-1500 kawanzas per sticker.

name: Novi Peças
description: motorbike and car oil, filters, and in general anything for maintenance

name: near by huambo
description: Quiet Place Next to a little military Base. Good for one Night.

name: south of Porto Amboim
description: Quiet Location on a  little hill with a Great view over the Sea and the landscape. Close to the big road.

name: In the Namibe Desert
description: A rocky place a little bit away from the main road. Very quiet with a nice view.

name: Road to DRC
description: The road splits here. Go left if you want to reach the DRC! If you go right you'll end up in Beú and never reach the border, despite what Google maps and maps.me indicate. The road to the right it also very poor. The road left is paved all the way to the border.

name: Gabon Embassy
description:
Gabon Embassy—extremely friendly and helpful. Aussie, French, US and Japan passports, 1 photo, 2 copies of (passport & yellow fever & hotel booking, Carnet or Letter from your Embassy or Flight ticket), 35,000 Kwanza for express Visa—done in 2 hours. Fill out application form in office. 
27,000 Kwanza for 1 week delivery. 
Street parking available. 

UPDATE 07-2022: 
Payments to be made in USD (cash):
3-4 working days - 100 USD
24 hrs - 150 USD
same day - 200 USD

name: Motorcycle parts store
description: I picked up a spare tube for the bike. They had other bits and pieces, but doubt they'll carry anything specific.

name: Post office
description: The central post office. They sell postcards if you are still into that...

name: Republic of Congo (Brazzaville)
description: Embassy is on the first floor of the Zimbo building. I was told I could get an emergency visa valid for 30days issues same day for 200USD.

name: Embassy of Namibia
description: Very friendly Staff. We applied for 30 days visa  ($60) , dosent matter if you apply for  shorter time visa the price is the same. We applied on Friday and supposed to get visas on Monday but we explained our emergency situation so we got them after few hours wihout extra fees.

name: Anjos Bantu President Pad
description: Disillusioned and dejected wallowing at KFC, we met a member of the Anjos Bantu motorcycle club. Before long, we were taken in by the Anjos Bantu and we were pool partying with beers in hand and meat in the belly. Their incredible president (Carlos) solved our problems and regularly puts up bikers in his beautiful home. He has a standing invitation for any bikers/travellers to go stay with him, or call for help if in trouble or in need of assistance. I highly recommend you take him up on it... (+244 938 941 080)

name: Lodge Vila Doroteia, Praia Amelia
description:
Great camping spot on the beach. Nice location, away from the hussle of town.  Fascilities slightly tired so don't come with high expectations and you will be pleasantly surprised. Camping Kwz2500ppn. Also Has chalets on the beach (Kwz15000)
Simple restaurant and bar on the beach. Restaurant menu starts at Kwz2000 to Kwz6000. Breakfast for Kwz2000.

name: 4WD shop
description: Lots of customised 4WDs in parking lot. I came to buy a tyre gauge for the bike. 4x4 accessories for sale.

name: Soyo boats
description: The boats from Soyo arrived here. I didn't get the opportunity to mark where they left in Soyo. We paid about 32,500 Kw for each bike, plus 10,000 to load then. Then we flew over for 10,000 Kw. They wanted extra to unload the boat, but my mate chipped in himself, so they did it for free. You wouldn't be able to get a car on the boats.

name: Mirage hotel
description: manager let us sleep in the parking area. No mention of payment yet. used WC in lobby and kept things discreet and simple.

name: Cameroon Consulate
description: Can get a visa, 101.000 cfa, but had to be sent away to Brazz. Usually 2 weeks but can be done express in 5 days. But you pay ($18USD). We decided to do in Libreville.

name: Small tyre shop
description: I stopped here to change into knobblies for the road to Gabon. Small tyre shop by the side of the road with a compressor. Might be good if you've let your tyres down coming through the mud from Gabon.

name: hotel dellaz
description: nice hotel. Good WiFi and fascilities. List price is Kwz 19k to 25k. Parking can be a problem. Negotiated to leave my Pajero in the entrance courtyard inside the property.

name: supermarket Pomobel
description: small supermarket with a lot choice. many products with discount. very close to club naval

name: Parc Nationale de Iona
description:
park fees
driver 2000 kw of / pessenger 1500 kw

name: Ship wreck Independencia
description: View point of the Independencia ship wreck

name: Praia Azul swimming
description: Access to beach. Long Beach and nice water to cool down

name: Go Tech
description:
Mechanical workshop for auto car repair & motorbike. About 5 klms out of Luanda CBD .
Welding available gas & electric. Friendly guys & some speak English.
Located at the end of the building.

name: Egito Beach
description:
Very informal camp. Next to some fisher boats. The beach is only frequented by locals. The cows come in the morning to stay around ur tent. Very nice and beautiful setting. There is a fort when u drive down to Egito. 
To reach the beach, drive down to the village and at bottom take a sharp left before the first house. It leads u to a even surface where you can camp

name: Wild camp
description:
Wild camp on the road from Lobito to Lubango approx 250 kms south from Lobito.
Turn off the road right ( from Lobito) down a track just before the telecommunications tower and it is approx 2 kms off the main road . No facilities just a quiet & peaceful wild camp.
Cattle roaming around and small long tail monkeys. Suitable for over landers in big rigs &  4WD cars with rooftop tents.

name: The Giant Baobab Tree
description:
Wild camping by the side of a giant Baobab tree approx 8 kms off the main road, peaceful & quiet location. Cattle & goats around and a few  friendly locals passing by. 
No facilities  but great for a nights camp. The road takes you past the old tank & military wrecks then continue until you see the giant Baobab tree  - you will not miss it. Also many other camping possibilities  close by.

name: Surfers beach
description: Small beach close to carpe diem. Small but nice waves. Very busy on weekends. There are no toilets no showers. At night ppl do bbq or Braai. U can’t camp on beach but there is plenty space for any car

name: Gravelpit
description: Good small place to put up your tent or park your car.

name: Keu Motors
description: Toyota repairs, I hd my LR Defenders oil and filters changed here

name: Assurances generales du congo
description: Small little shop to be found in second row off main road. The sell the Carte Rose for Congo Gabon Cameron. 45.000.- for one Month. On right side when driving nortg

name: hotel residence eden
description:
very nice clean hotel near the beach. good beds, hot shower, wifi and airco.
7kw for single or 10kw for double room. you get towels soap toilet paper and bottle of water in the room and a good breakfast is included! parking is in front. but its a very big street. also suitable for big trucks. save neighboorhood with nightguards in front also.

name: Wildcamp at Ruacana Dam
description: Nice and quiet spot directly at the Ruacana dam, not far from the Ruacana border. Fire wood around and also our fire stone circle. This spot is perfect for early or late border crossings. We stopped here at 5 pm, after we crossed over from Namibia. We had a good night sleep here. The whole time we were there no one came by or disturbed us. Really peaceful place! You still have MTC Namibia reception here.

name: Wildcamp in the dessert in between rocks
description:
Nice wild camping spot in the middle of many little, monolithic rocks near the road from Namibe to Virei. 
Coming from Namibe just turn right from the main road into the service road and continue for about 600 m, then turn left towards the rocks. Our spot was near some of rocks, that formed a little half circle so we had a bit of wind protection. Fire wood around and velvetia also :)
We had a nice and sound sleep here. No one around and no one disturbed us.
Coming from Namibe this is the first place, where you have bushes and rocks to hide a bit from the street. When you are heading the other direction there are lots of nice places before this point.

name: 5 star wildcamp on a flat rock in the mountains
description:
Great place to stay! You have beautiful views on the surrounding mountains. Spot is near the street, but not visible from the street. You stand directly on a flat and even rock. The site consists of a huge rock, that has 2 platforms. Campspot is on the lower platform. You have to drive onto the upper platform ( which you can see from the road) and from there down to the lower part. It's steep, but not slippery at all and no problem. 4x4 not needed to get here, but high clearance is advisable. 
We had a nice and sound sleep here and no one came by or disturbed us in the evening and night. Only the next morning some friendly locals came by, but no problems at all. 
Great sunset pictures are possible here also.

name: Beach access north of Cabinda
description: There is a rather ok beach north of Cabinda. 20km from city center. When coming from Cabinda you have to do a loooong u turn at the end of the bay. Coming from the north it’s easy accessible

name: Pensao Nelsal
description:
Good hotel with clean rooms, comfortable beds, friendly staff (only little bit of English) and nice central location. 

We paid for 2 nights 23.500kwanza for a double room and a single room. Rooms have AC, breakfast is included.

Parking on the street in front. But there is a guard all night.

name: Custom Luanda
description: To extend the Nota de Desalfandegamento ( Passavant ). Need A view copies and a Letter way you want to extend.

name: Restaurante Kanawa
description: Local Moto Club Restaurant, good food and correct prize . After five a clock  PM or on the weekend there are always bikers.

name: Mountain Wild Camp
description: Follow the good side road with a sign for 'police training' which takes you to the base of the mountain. No people around, and it's far from the main road so quiet at night. The police training camp is perhaps further on the other side of the mountain; I didn't meet any police. You can park out of sight of the access road on a nice flat piste. Beautiful nature but the mosquitoes were extremely ferocious after dark.

name: Wild camp
description: A small access road for the power lines leaves the main road just next to a guardrail. One fork leads into a quarry and the other goes behind it towards the power lines. After a while you are out of sight of the road and it was a decent spot for a night. One person walked past at 5:45 otherwise quiet and no people around. Overall, the road to Soyo was pretty boring.

name: large open field
description:
very large open grass field where cows coming in the afternoon and leave you alone in the evening.
very quiet at night

name: jumbo supermatket
description: big supermarket. food and other stuff and  lots of discount.  big parking lot in front

name: Gasstation Pumangol
description: It's hard to find a good spot for wild camping near the road from Luanda to Calendula. We ended up camping at this gasstation. Very friendly manager who speaks French and allowed us to stay for a night. it's open 24/7. Toilet available and in the shop relatively cheap, and cold beer. Also croissants and coffee. We had to pay the guard 1000 kwz.

name: Wildcamp that rocks!! :))
description: Beautiful spot with on one side a view on the magnificent rocks and on the other side on the valley. No hard lava ground like the other places nearby but gravel and a rocky flat plateau. Turn left from the main road on the gravel track and drive about 300/400 meters even through there is much grass on the road. Eventually you will find a plateau on your left hand were you can camp. Maybe vissible from the main road but since there is no traffic in the evening everything is really calm and quit. We had the best sunset here :)

name: Bush camp with view on the ocean
description: Just a little bit further on the road you can find a spot just aside the main road, like a small parking spot. It's up the hill, flat, and you have a fantastic view on the ocean and the hills. In the afternoon the sun colours the ocean orange. It is really deserted here so no problem to camp aside the road. To come here from Lobito the road is tarmac until Dombe Grande. Soon after that city it turns into an off road track which is good doable during dry season. We drove it with 2x4. Excellent road for light motorbike also. Sunset is beautiful if you arrive here in the afternoon.

name: Pumangol
description: Modern gas station. Also gasoil available!

name: Elli Elli lavandaria
description:
Laundery with prices per item. Close between 12h-14h30.
Nice ladies, agreed to make a price for 1 load (between 4-5kg) for 2.500KW for washing only and ready within 3h.
When we came back, clothes were ready and dry, so we gave them 3.000KW although they didn't ask for a tip.
Clothes very clean and very dry, and none missing.

name: Wild Camp
description: An access road leads to the power lines, and a depression before the lines makes a decent flat spot out of sight of the road or any buildings. Far enough from the road to be quiet. No people around. Some mosquitoes around ;)

name: Public water tap
description: Water tap with free access. Locals said water is potable. Indeed, it is crystal clear water from a drilling.

name: Padaria
description: Bakery with fresh bread (baguettes), and other delicacies. Almost in front of the road leading to Calandula Falls. By the way, the road to there is paved and in very good state. 50 kwanza the baguette, 50kw the brioche.

name: lake near Negage
description:
very nice lake with great view.
easy access. 1km from Negage-Damba main road to the lake
very quiet, nobody around
a bit dirty, probably people from Negage come to drink beer on the week-end

name: Cuatir Game Reserve
description: Campsite on the banks of the Cuatir River, situated under Teak and Rosewood trees. Home of the Sitatunga, wild dog, Roan, to name a few of our neighbours.

name: Villa Menongue
description: Campsite and guesthouse next to Luauca river outside Menongue.

name: Restaurante Bar Amboim
description: Seafood restaurant next to the beach. Well managed, and good food!

name: Casper Lodge Hotel
description: Upmarket boutique hotel and restaurant. Good value for money. Best in Huila province

name: Reedbuck Campsite
description:
Situated next to the floodplains of the Cuatir river in the Cuando Cubango province of Angola.
As part of the Cuatir Game Reserve it is a wilderness campsite under teak and rosewood trees. Experience one of the last wilderness areas in Africa.
Visitors should pre book at: stefvanwyk@yahoo.com

name: Ferry Cuatir Game Reserve
description:
Ferry across Rio Cubango. Only access to Cuatir Game Reserve (Reedbuck Campsite and other places on the property)
Pre booking should be done on stefvanwyk@yahoo.com

name: CV Lodge&Spa
description:
Completed in 2018. The lodge is nestle in front of a hill on the road to Baia Farta outside Benguela. Comfortable bungalows, with a top class restaurant, a snack bar, swimming pools, gaming centre. Clean and well managed.

No camping only bungalows. Cheapest listed was 25000. Reception speaks limited english. Its very posh. Gate is hight  restricted.

name: hotel viana
description: good acomodation with piscine and restaurant price is 12400AKZ(nearly 40 usd)

name: Inter Market
description: Supermarket with quite nice hot food deli. Pretty good grocery selection and personal care items.

name: Hotel Por de Sol
description:
Very nice modern, super comfortable and very westernized. Quite nice pool and lounge and good WiFi. Restaurant I didn't try. Secure parking 

Nice supermarket with good  hot deli across the street. 

Single Kwz20k that I got for 18k and paid black market rate $50. Good value for the area and what you get if you want to relax in great comfort for a bit (change)

name: EL-AD Condominio
description:
Really nice apartment, 2 bedrooms (both queen size beds) and 2 bathrooms. A/C, full kitchen, guarded parking lot, walking distance to the beach and several restaurants. Fast WiFi. I paid 15.000 kwanza per night. Staff is very friendly and speaks English.

telephone +244 926 327 020

name: GDT Auto Zone
description: Good place for quick maintenance like oil change, wheel alignment, shock absorbers, battery etc. Professionally equipped, good mechanics.

name: Black market money changers
description: left to the movistar shop there are a couple of guys selling phone credit and they change dollars. They gave me a good rate.

name: Iona Park picnic and camping
description: Newly build camp and picnic area with brick building for shade, long drops and braai. Very new and might not be finished. Good place to overnight halfway to Iona town.

name: Camp on Cliff near Carbo Ledo
description: This is a beautiful place for people who need no care. You have a nice view over the Atlantic and the surfers bay. It"s 3 km (2 miles) to the beach and restaurants. The pist to the spot is a little rough. I did it with a 11 t truck. Unitel provides call and data (~40 kB/s).

name: flat area next to old quarry next to road
description: Nice flat area next to road. Its a bit elavated from the road and between villages. So you might get a friendly Bon dia. We did not sleep here, but it would have been our first choice if we knew about it.

name: money changer
description: next to the pharmacy there are sitting some people under a red umbrella, who change dollars.

name: place to stay over next to the road.
description: Since there are no campsites around we pulled off under a tree just infront of the rusty wreck of a burned out bus.  It was a bit noisy during the night as a few (I know of 5)trucks passed us, but it is Okey for one night. We could make a fire for a braai/Barbeque. A few locals did pass, but they were all friendly.

name: Quarry next to road, 47km north of Luena
description: Old quarry, 50 m away from the road, which is good for the noise factor. Unfortunately people started to use it as a garbage dump site, but the quarry is still big enough to find a good clean spot. The area was not smelly and did have a lot of flies that you associate with a garbage dump. There were not too much traffic at night and nobody came to say hallo. So in a area where campsites are not really a feature, this is a nice stay over place. Internet reception was good.

name: Camp site at Espinheira Office too Park Iona
description: A few campsite next too the office where you pay too enter the park. Shade and sandy sites. No facilities but the camping was free.

name: Foz de Cunnene a few km. from sea
description: Wild camp behind the rocks next too road. It was very windy and this was a spot with less wind. We made a fire place for you.  We parked on a incline. It is not flat but manageable.

name: Wild camp on the road from Tombuo too Espinheira gate. Iona national park.
description: On flat grassy plain, next too the road. Beautiful veiw over the plain. Westerly wind when we where here. Road is very quiet. Noone in sight and Noone came past. We arrived around 4 pm and left 8 Am. Great place too stop as the road is very slow going.

name: Camp on road to Pedras Negras heading north
description: We camp on a little hill next too derelict house and barn. Asked permission from Alberto the caretaker. It right next too the road, but there was not traffic at night. No one came past. As it was raining we pulled our vehicle into the barn. Thank you Alberto for the hospitality.

name: Wild camp 200km from Chavuma borderpost
description: Good wildcamp 200m from the road under  a tree. Take the road north of the main road. Look for existing fireplace on the left. Great sunset from here. We could hear a village in the distance but did not see anyone. Quite a bit of insect in the day, but much better after sunset. Road was very quiete. Only 2 vehicles during our time there.

name: No crossing rivers at Lumbala in rain season
description: Please note there are no ferry or bridge over Zambezi at Lumbala. You can ask at the village they can show you a water crossing but we turned back the Zambezi was too high.

name: 25 Km south of Lumbala on the way too Ninde
description: Wild Camp on gravel good for a night stop over. Patrick Masongo and a few people checked in on who we where. They where friendly. Road is new tar till Ninde with parts that is still gravel if you come from Lucusse.

name: Road from Ninde to Angola/Zambia border.
description: When travel from Ninde take the left hand narrow road Northern side you are in a normal 4x4. Big rigs must use the right hand wide road.  The wide road has extremely deep sand

name: Toyota de Angola
description:
Toyota dealer—very welcoming.
Didn’t charge for (3 hour) examination of Troopy noises. No mechanical faults, no charge!! Wished us well in our journey :-)
Btw, like many bigger Toyota dealerships, free WiFi along with clean toilets and ac :-)

name: Hospedaria F C
description:
Cost: single/double 9,900kwanza, 2 beds 14,859k, 3 beds 19,900k
AC, attached bathroom, TV, small fridge—ok room
Friendly staff (made copies for border crossing)
Restaurant but ate at Espanol (almost next door). 
Secure inside parking for maybe 2 or 3 LC size cars

name: Market
description: Useful market, a bit hidden from the main road, where you can buy fruit and vegetables and all sorts of other stuff. Wider selection than available elsewhere in N’Zeto which can otherwise feel a bit dead.

name: ENSA Insurance Office
description: We didn’t manage to buy insurance in Mbanza Congo so bought it here instead (the police didn’t ask us for it on the way down but we didn’t want to push our luck). There are other ENSA offices around the country that you can find on their website. We bought Fronteira insurance which is valid for 90 days. It cost us 8,000 Kwanza for a small 4x4. The office was friendly with one person who spoke English although the paperwork took almost an hour. Theoretically they only accept card payments with an Angolan card but they let me pay cash when I said this was impossible for me.

name: Kissama Lodge
description:
This is the actual location of the lodge. You access it via the park entry gate to the west, about 40km away on a good dirt road (30-40 mins). It costs 2,500 Kwanza per person to enter the park. Then you pay the lodge for a guide which is 2,000 Kwanza per person if taking your own vehicle or 4,000 Kwanza per person if using their vehicle. We just turned up in the early morning and got a guide on the spot, no need to book. We saw Zebra, a giraffe, some monkeys, antelope and various other kinds of deer. Definitely worth it. Best time to go is apparently early morning at 6am. We got there just before 7am and it was still good. Much later in the day is probably too hot but maybe evening is good.

You can stay at the lodge by the way. The price list said 23,000 Kwanza per person for a bungalow for two people. Maybe it’s negotiable. Camping might also be possible but we camped at Carpe Diem instead which was super nice and near enough.

name: Restaurant 120 NA Braza
description: Restaurant on the side of the road with good food; 2,300 kwanza for burger, chips and a beer.

name: Complex Turistico TGV
description:
Nice hotel on beach. Rooms are nicely outfitted private cabins with big bathrooms, although our hot water wasn’t working. They initially quoted 18,000 Kwanza for a double room but they reduced that to 13,500 Kwanza when we said we didn’t need a TV and reduced it further to 12,000 Kwanza without much negotiation. Price includes a decent breakfast. Friendly staff including some that speak English (e.g. the manager drove me to a place to change money on the street).

They have a fairly large secure car park. We didn’t ask about camping but I’m guessing they’d let you camp in a van in here, perhaps for a bit of money.

name: ambassade REPUBLIC DEMOCRATIC CONGO
description:
DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC CONGO embassy in 
luanda. monday to friday 9 am till 3 pm

name: Cantinho de Tia Gia
description: Decent hotel if waiting at the border. 9,000 Kwanza for a double with AC, breakfast, secure parking etc. There’s also a restaurant.

name: Cazombo Catholic Mission
description: A small house for volunteers into the Mission with 2 rooms, shared bathroom and kitchen.

name: Massibi Police Station
description: Possibility to camp or park inside the perimeter of the police station. Drinking water at 5 minutes walk in a stream, also a pool to take a bath. Traditional open shelter available.

name: Luau Catholic Mission
description: Rooms with 2 beds and private bathroom. You can eat with the community.

name: Pumangol
description: We asked at gas station in city center for the quality of their diesel. The staff sent us to Pumangol if we want good quality. Take fuel here even though queue is endless.

name: SBHOT Burgers and Sandwiches
description: Ok Burgers for cheap 1000 kw, soft drink 250 kw. Good for a quick lunch or dinner.

name: Cazungas Bar
description:
Fantastic place, great people, draught beer, amazing food and amazing value.

I am travelling on a motorcycle and the people I met here have been such great help with all things, especially funding parts for my KTM motorcycle. They cannot do enough. Best place to land up!

name: Immigration Checkpoint
description: Does what it says on the tin. No hassles.

name: The Diner - Koolpark
description: The diner is inside the Koolpark, it has great burgers, steaks etc. starts at 3.500 kwanza. Fast internet. You don’t have to pay the entry fee for the water park. If you have kids you can park them there lol.

name: Filipe Motoshow
description: Sales and parts of high end European bikes like Ducati, MV Agusta, KTM, etc. and a few enduro bikes. Limited tyre range, too. Didn’t have 21/18 tyres for big bikes, only enduro/MX but good range for 17/19.

name: Sleeping spot
description: A place in a flat querry. It seemed to us to be unused . We slept here on a saturday night. Leave the Dondo-Huambo road where a small vegetable market is and a sign to a fazienda (20km). Travel this gravel road untill you see the entrance road to the querry. Opposite of the company compound we turned right on a hugh flat site. No one can see you from the road.

name: Emigration department
description: Renew visas and emigration issues.

name: Exhaust Repair
description: Good shop with a lot of equipment including gas welder and pipe benders. Don’t carry OEM stock but can fabricate a lot. Owned by Portuguese guy who is very skilled. Did a complex repair for me from scrap.

name: Hotel Infotur
description:
high class hotel. everything new and clean in very good condition. Internet is open and fast enough... Double/twin costs 15000 KZ including breakfast.
Parking is safe on their enclosed parkground.
Recommended to relax after a series of wildcamps...

name: Entrance into the canyon
description: Place to drive into the gorge to find the parking and entrance to visit the arch and sacred place. Amazing location with hundreds of picture motivs.

name: Turnoff omahua lodge
description: Here is the sign to turn off to Omahua Lodge. Call Álvaro Baptiste in advance +244 923 452 748

name: Mecanic
description: There is no sign at the entrance. The gate is painted brown.

name: Porto de Kimbumba
description: The place where my motorcycle arrived by small boat from Cabinda. If you want to transport from Soyo to Cabinda your bike is the right place. I paid 50 000 Kz to ship a motorcycle. The price includes loading and unloading. I had to fly from Cabinda for 13,300 Kz (SonAir).

name: Euligois restaurant
description: Good clean and cheap place! I was here a couple of times and the food was always good. Omelet start at 1350kw, they also make beef and other meals.

name: Hotel Maria Teresa
description: Cheap hotel close to the airport. Clean rooms with air conditioning, private bathroom. Breakfast included. The price starts at over 10,000kw. On angol cheap!

name: Wild camp behind hill
description: Take the track of the Virei road over the hill on the right. Then continue over the hill and down the south eastern side. The campsite is mostly obscured from the road, but if you went further around the hill you would not be visible at all. There were very few cars on the road , and no people on foot.

name: Motorbike mechanic by the boat yard
description: They fix large motorbikes.  The location is here next to the sea as they also fix jet ski.

name: Road to Mount Moco Impassable When Wet
description: Here start the road to Mount Moco (15 km). It was not passable with our Landcruiser due to heavy rain and mud. We were there end of February.

name: Wild camp not visible from EN 230
description: Next to old building there is enough space for a good stop over if you can’t make it to Luanda. We asked permission to the security guard of the building which was fine.

name: MPD KAMPS
description: Motorcycle parts & tyres etc available here. Good shop with good mechanics.

name: Restaurante Mamita
description: Excellent family run restaurant, got rice, beans and grilled fish for 1000 kw, cold small cuca beer for 150 kw. Boa petite!

name: Resort at a wonderful beach
description: In this resort I was able to pitch the tent for free (!), restaurant available and food more pricy but wonderful location. Shower and toilets. They also rent bungalows.

name: Hotel Aguia Verde
description:
Large hotel with great restaurant and cold beer.  
Overpriced at 15,000kwz for a single and 18,000 for a double but the rooms are pretty good.  
The evening meal was a all you can eat buffet which was well worth it for 5,000! Great choice and plenty of it.  
Good stop near the border.

name: Near Bocoio
description: Track of the main road towards the power lines, then turn left. Small cleared area off the track. It was quiet at night, some friendly locals passed in the morning. Spot is far enough from the main road that you don't hear much traffic.

name: Grilled chicken and skewers
description: Everything grilled in this market at the roadside. Got chicken and fries for 500 kw, tasty! Also fruit, beers, spirits and cigarettes are sold.

name: Kimbo do Soba
description: Nice lodge with bungalows. Very clean & well kept hot shower nice comfy bed. Breakfast included I paid 12,000 kwanza for double room. Had a discount from Amigos Da Picada bike club.

name: Carpe Diem Ecosurf Camp
description: A huge eco project is going to be ready here in few months, possibility to camp, surf, rent bungalows with a beautiful view on the surfers bay, restaurant, barbecues and so on... overlanders-friendly

name: Fuel station Sonangol
description:
Fuel and small shop with water, food and Unitel credit.

We checked with the staff and we were able to spend a night. Everyone was very friendly, helpful and came to introduce themselves. A great overnight option on a bad section of pot holed road. Many trucks also spend the night here. We paid 1000kw.

name: Restaurant & Rooms at the fuel station
description: There is a small restaurant here, I got a bitok for 2000 kw, cold beers for 250 and it's also possible to rent a room for 24h at 8000. The fuel station is currently under construction

name: Fontoura e irmão
description: Excellent garage for big bikes, fast and very professional. Every member of the local moto club "Amigos da Picada" comes to this garage.

name: Wild camp with bay view
description:
Nice view over the cliffs and sea.

Unfortunately in plain view of the 2 nearby villages and lots of garbage around from nearby fishfactories. There are 2 ‘quarrys’ where you can camp, but your still visible and you won’t have a view then. Wouldn’t recommend camping here.

Just enjoy the view and move on.

name: Vikuku Churrascaria
description: Great fast food at the roadside. Soup, chicken, chourizo, fries and salads available.

name: AML bikes and cars mechanic
description: Skilled and fast mechanic with 25+ years of experience, he fixes big bikes and cars/4wd.

name: Cubango River Wild Camp
description: There is a good gravel track about 400 metres long, down to the river from the main track, it looks like it was built by the road builders some years ago, and isn't used much. We didn't camp, but stopped for lunch. It has good access to the river. There is a village back on the main road. A couple of locals came by but didn't disturb us. There are not many safe camping spots along this road, and this seems a good one.

name: Old Road Quarry
description: Disused road building quarry near the road. We found this on someone elses trip report, so it has been used before by multiple vehicles. It is near a village, but we were only visited by friendly villagers in the morning. You get some road noise, but its not a very busy road. Flat, open, lots of room.

name: Old Road Sand Quarry
description: Disused sand quarry for road building. We found this on someone elses trip report, so it has been used before by multiple vehicles. Just off the road, but away from villages. Not many cars passed, as its a quiet road, and at the back of the quarry you are not very obvious. Lots of room, sandy base. We did get visited by lots of bees, especially in the morning looking for moisture from condensation overnight.

name: Rough Road south of Caiundo
description: The road deteriorates badly south of Caiundo. There was an attempt to rebuild the road in 2013, but the road works have been abandoned for many years. It took us one and a half days to cover 225km south of Caiundo to the border crossing at Katwitwi. No fuel south of Menongue. We did the road in the wet season and it was passable, however there are some sections of the road are so eroded that a bad flood could close the road. There are very few vehicles on the road. There are villages, but almost no shops or services.

name: Katwitwi Border Crossing
description: Border crossing between Angola and Namibia. There is a new Angola immigration building, but they were not using it, they used the old building on the right (coming from the north).  It is a very quiet crossing.  The Angolan customs searched our vehicle extensively when leaving Angola (don't know what they were looking for). There were money changers that would take your Angolan kwanzas and give you Namibian dollars.

name: water pools
description:
nice spot right on the edge of the streams and pools that flow into the waterfall. unlike the reservoir,  I didn't see any crocodiles in the water.
cell reception from Namibia still good here

name: Angola Immigration
description:
Easy immigration and friendly staff. Takes some time because they have to go in the closest village to make photocopies.
Road coming here from Dolisie is in decent conditions (April '19), except for some muddy kms, but is possible to arrive without big issues. 
Last kilometers on Congo side before the border, and down to Cabinda are paved.
I slept at congolese border in Pangui as immigration closes at 5 p.m.

name: Hamburgueria Nurchel
description: Big delicious burgers! No seating but can hang out on the street. 1000 for a big burger, 1500 for double and 2000 for triple. Only a savage would even dare to try the triple!

name: Pizzabyte
description:
A variety of food is available, such as salads, pizzas, rice and beans, burgers etc. for a reasonable price.

I was introduced to the Big Burger by two other bikers. Costs 2,000 Kz and it was very tasty!

name: Cheap Restaurant
description: Served chicken and plantain with small salad for 1,000 Kz. Initially requested 2,500 Kz, but I explained I was looking for something cheaper. Seems popular with the locals.

name: Pharmacy
description: Very clean and tidy pharmacy. A local guy said he only goes to this pharmacy and one other because they are run by Portugese. Polite and helpful staff.

name: SonAir Aeroplane Tickets
description: Purchase airplane tickets here for Cabinda to Soya. Price was 13,300 Kz with 30 Kg luggage. I think flights are daily, but I'm unsure about weekends. Flight departed at 12:00 with check in from 10:00-11:00. One guy arrived at 11:50. Flight duration is 15 minutes. No issues with security when I was carrying motorcycle helmet, motorcycle tools, spare phone batteries etc. Plane had two propellers and holds about 15-20 people. Was not allowed to take motorcycle helmet inside cabin, but otherwise I traveled in my full riding gear.

name: Paperwork for Vehicle Shipping to Soyo
description: This is where the paperwork is arranged for shipping a motorcycle to Soyo. They needed to see my passport, they took the importation document issued at the border, and needed to know the weight of the motorcycle. The cost was 9,000 Kz to prepare the paperwork. The original copy of the importation document is handed over at the port along with the motorcycle, and you are given a photocopy of the importation document. The original copy is returned with the motorcycle in Soyo.

name: Large area next to EN100
description: Leave the main road at the GPS coordinates. The track leaving the main road is a bit hidden and overgrown. This is a large space that could accommodate a small festival! Easy to position vehicles so they're out of sight of traffic. Flat land, but be careful of large ruts hidden by 1-2 foot high grass. No options for sun shade unless you venture into very long grass to the trees (careful of landmines?). Little wind protection. No Unitel mobile phone signal. Didn't see anyone whilst there.

name: Liquids for vehicles
description:
They sell: engine oil for cars, lubricants, WD40, carb cleaner, anti-freeze, fuel injector cleaner, and more.

They also have a small selection of crash helmets, plastic and metal jerry cans (10L and 20L), and a few other items.

Friendly guys.

name: Parts for vehicles
description: They sell a wide variety of parts for vehicles. They also have large cans of WD40.

name: Open Field
description: Leave the road at -11.06606,13.97130 and follow the track heading North. The site is located through an opening on the left and up a slight hill. Flat ground and lots of space. Well hidden from the road. Can hear the traffic. I was in a tent and I'm certain I could hear mosquitoes. Unitel mobile phone signal was weak. Saw people in the morning who were friendly :)

name: Residencial Dumas
description: Very nice family run guesthouse in good central location. No gated parking but in front of reception safe enough with security. Single 8500, double 10500, twin 12000. AC, hot water, Wifi, nice bed. tv and breakfast and dinner on request for a very reasonable rate.

name: Pensao SOS Tropical
description: Nice hotel despite the name. Large spacious rooms, ac, hot water, breakfast, and secure parking. 7000kwz

name: TKS Motorcycle Workshop
description:
Bruno and Amando did a fabulous work on my DRZ400.
Bruno Rosa is Portuguese, he has a very modern workshop and multi-brand experience. He is the mechanic of the leading moto GP team in Angola, with training at Ten Kate Holland.
I came for what I thought were small engine issues, he overhauled it completely, now it's 100% perfect.
By far the best mechanic I've met in Africa. Highly highly recommended.
don't hesitate to contact him by WhatsApp 
+244 993 011 750

name: Lupauto Moto Angola
description: Expensive tires and some reinforced tire tubes of unknown brand are 9,500kwz. Quite a lot of spare parts.

name: SME visa extension
description:
to extend visa :
letter to explain you want to extend (they write it for you in Portuguese at the photocopy shop nearby (1000kwz)
2 photos
1 copy : visa + passport
12,000 kwz

they said it's 2 weeks processing time :(
I cried a bit and they said since I am tourist they may be able to do in 7 days. eventually it did take 2 weeks...
they give you a paper so you can go around in the cou try anyways but you have to go back to luanda to fetch your passport

name: Nancy’s Guest House
description: Small guest house with inexpensive rooms and secure parking. Rooms are between 6000-8000 for two people. Rooms have option of shared or en-suite bathrooms. Clean and friendly and within walking distance of the beach.

name: Rock Plain
description: Large open area on a rock formation, some coverage from the road. Far from villages.

name: Abandoned Logging Camp
description: Logging area abandoned in 2018. Lots of flat, open space, far from the road and villages. Old logs and plenty of firewood.

name: Poste Policial
description: Police checkpoint, looks relatively permanent. Police were very friendly.

name: Pousada Calandula
description: hotel with amazing views of the second tallest water fall in Africa. 2000 Kz for entry plus 5000 to camp in paved parking lot. restaurant and excellent bar. friendly hosts, excited to see overlanders. toilet in restaurant. also attached shower and toilet not quite finished outside.

name: unused road to gravel pit in Baobab trees
description: quite road used during road construction but now no cars on it. gravel pit at one of road. Easy on off. A few locals went by on foot or scooter. great spot with trees surrounding but no shade.  Decent 4g data with local simm. Room for many vehicles. you can occasionally hear trucks yet this is a quite spot.

name: Old Road Quarry
description: Abandoned, cleaned area. As you come off the road you can drive further into the back and behind the hill so that you're hidden from the road. Far enough from villages, the only noise came from trucks during the night.

name: Pirates Bar
description:
Pirates Bar is a snack bar, with a nice environment, very good and fast service. A good place to relax in the end of the day. 
Open on: 
- Tuesday : 05:00 pm to 00:00 
- Wednesday : 05:00 pm to 00:00
- Thursday : 05:00 pm to 00:00
- Friday : 05:00 pm to 02:00 am 
- Saturday : 11:00 am to 02:00 am 
- Sunday : 11:00 am to 00:00

name: Sonagalp
description: At this gas station, you can find all types of fuel, open 24 hours.

name: Sangano beach
description: Nice beach where you can pass the night. It's possible camp but have a little hotel near and a fine restaurant

name: Hand Pump
