description: Hand pump with water. The water is slightly salty although we believe it is potable. However, it would be best to boil the water just in case.

name: Quiet place near the road
description: Big place near to the road. Nobody can see you from the road. Ok for one night

name: Jose custom workshop
description: Here Jose's father makes and repairs wheel hubs, springs and pretty much anything.  Jose speaks English, call him on +244 923622876

name: Next to green waterhole
description: Camp between big stones, next to a green waterhole. You go around 1 km of the main road on small road between bush. At evening we met just one friendly local with his cows. In the morning few motocycles drove but no issues. Everybody friendly. Good for 1 night.

name: Amazing view over Fenda do Bimbe cliff
description: Road wasn't easy but worth it. You are all by yourself here. Incredible sunset on the clif.

name: Next to stone mine
description: Just for overnight stay, nothing special. But hidden by big stones from the main road. You drive through dry river, after crossing railway. Nobody came and disturb but you are not 100% hidden. Maybe it's better to drive more west and you should find more wild places.

name: border police camp
description:
for people with tent it's good spot to camp. in the mountains around there are Lions and leopards.
in the Iona village nearby they sell Gasolina for motorcycle from the bottle.

name: Sanzala ABC
description:
Very nice place!
12 000 kwaza for double room for members of Amigo da Picada and other travellers.
Air condition and tv in rooms. Small restaurant.
Nice place to sit outside or inside.
Artur and Anna are lovely owners!

name: On the hill
description:
From the hill is beautiful view on baobab valley. This space in close to the road but only few cars passed by.
If you wanna hide you can go down into the valley. No houses... no people. Only me :)

name: `Baobab forest
description:
You drive through a huge baobab forest, milions of trees around
road is tarmac in good condition

name: ATM
description: ATM next to the customs. MasterCard accepted.

name: Wild camp near graves
description: East of road. A small track leads into forest. Graves to left after about 100 meters. Proceed up track and to right is a clearing. Friendly waves from local people and no disturbance. I add this spot as we had difficulty finding the other gravesite camp on iOverlander just to south.

name: AUTO PASSARINHO
description: Great garage ... for all kinds of cars. Also know a lot about bikes. The owner Paulo is a great guy. His staff is very helpfull. I really can recomend this place ... WhatsApp number : +244923470242

name: Restaurant Tadi Dya Ntenxa
description: This is a restaurant beside the junction of town. The manager of here is very friendly, allowed me to camp in the park, and use republic shower room, toilet... and gave me the local meal for local price (1000 kz)... I stayed here one night.

name: Complexo Mar Sol
description: Seafood restaurant on the beach in Sumbe. Friendly owner, good food!

name: Cliff camp - Leba Viewponit
description: Amazing spot right on the edge of a cliff. Passing the viewpoint and restaurant the track continues but was blocked with a little rope. There is a guy living in the little hut, he wanted something to smoke and opened for us... the first spot to the right offers more views of the pass, however, we continued a bit further and camped on a bigger flat spot, right on the edge. Awesome.

name: O Forno - Restaurant
description: Sonia and her family were unbelievably friendly. Although O Forno is off a busy highway, it's quiet where you camp , you forget you're in Luanda! Unfortunately no toilets or showers yet, but there are plans to have them made. The restaurant has friendly staff, it's clean and popular! Sonia the Manager and owner is very kind, welcoming and helpful! She used to be a vet, so loves animals dearly and helped us a lot with our dog and cat!

name: Bush camp in-between rocks
description:
Not far from the track leading to the IOverlander wild camp named Bush Camp Tundavala(and visible from this track but nobody passed in 20 hours) We went there first, it's great but lots of locals collected wood at the time and we didn't feel like staying.
This point marks the entrance to this litte open spot in-between rocks. Nobody visited us. After the 2 recent robberies we didn't wanna stay close to the viewpoint either.

name: Offroad Camp
description: 4X4 only !! About 2 km east of the tar road ( turn off before the road climbs the plateau going south) At the end of a small "canyon"  It's slow going in 4x4, crossing a number of ravines. Towards the end we had to lower the tire pressure. Assuming it's not suitable during the wet season. Surrounded by cliffs, beautiful and very quiet.

name: Bush Camp
description: Quiet spot (even though there are lots of livestock tracks we had no "visitors" at all) Drive through a rather large quarry that leads to a small "valley" close to lovely hills covered with rocks, about 300 to 400 m off the main road and not visible.

name: Rock Boulders
description: In our opinion this spot is nicer than the bush camp a few km further south , open views (and more camping possibilities around) turn off is behind an old, small building that T4A describes as "Lanchonete Cafe or Dinner" , we didn't see anyone other than a few cows passing in the distance....

name: Amigos da Picada
description:
You get help here for the transfer from Cabinda to Soyo. Julio Silva knows many people in town and is very helpful.
If you go by motorbike it is sent by boat (price 2019 is 40.000KZ from Cabinda to Soyo, the other way up to 100.000KZ). Persons are not allowed and cars are not possible. Paperwork at the customs cost additional time and money (6.500KZ). Plan one business day to get everything. The flight for a person from Cabinda to Soyo is difficult to get, because the plane is small. Calculate 2 - 3 days to wait! Cost 13.500KZ.
Take minimum of 4 copies of every paper and passport (1st page and valid visa). At every checkpoint you have to give a copy and it is very annoying and time consuming if you need to search for a shop.

name: Hotel Mpampa
description: Very nice hotel, built by an oil company for visitors and guests. Western standard and helpful and friendly staff. The price is fair with 35.000KZ for two persons in one room.

name: Bush Camp
description:
bush camp for a night with views of small but nice erosions, about 2 km from the main road, not hidden from a track but only a handful of motorbikes passed before dark,
turn off the main road at S12.844523 E013183293, Turn right again at S12845417 E013195648 , track leads to a animal water pit with blue tanks, we camped 100 to 150 m before that on a "hill" to the right , very quiet

name: Beach wild camp
description: lovely place to camp, surprisingly quiet bay close to Sumbe, the river mouth turned into a lagoon when we visited due to pretty high waves, cliffs on both sides, unfortunately you will encounter the usual trash so we camped on the cliff ( short track turns off to the left on the way down to the beach) and tried to get as close to the edge as possible with the Cruiser,  a couple of other tracks on the plateau take you to other spots on the cliffs, during rain it might be a bit tricky to go down due to washouts...

name: Nando Passos garage
description:
Garage of Nando, important person in Amigos da Picada club, Amigos family :) He has an experienced garage with a good equipment. We had problems with bearings and air condition.
Good person, good work. Highly recommended.

name: europe bottles filling
description:
We refill our 3kg bottle here (italian adapter). It wasn't easy, we had some stuff. They figured out how to use it and refilled. It tooks quite time but very friendly and helpful people. 
For 3 kg they wanted only 500 kwanza!

name: intermarket big
description: big market with big car parking. You can buy cheese, meat, a lot of vege, cosmetics and many other things

name: big spare parts shop
description: a lot of spare parts for ex shock apsorbers, lamps, oils, seels, batteries, etc

name: next to the ferry
description: We missed last ferry so we stayed here until next day. Many curious kids and locals around but rather friendly. Night was quiet until 5.30 when village woke up.

name: Moonlandscape bush camp
description: Beautiful spot right on the edge of the cliffs. Incredible views of the colorful erosions, ocean and the baobab dotted landscape in-between. Leave the main road towards Praia da Onca ( track is on Google maps, Maps.me and T4A), shortly after passing the fish market building find a more offroad-like track leading towards the cliff and make your way to the GPS location stated... for us this is just an incredible place to stay, it's possible to walk along the edge of this small "Bryce Canyon"

name: Money Changer Street
description:
Actually I struggled to change money on a weekend in Luanda, however, close to the airport it seems to be a 24/7 business, they will spot you on the main road to/from the airport, just before/after the bridge right outside the airport, straightforward, show the rate. 

I prefer https://angolaforex.com/

It has all the rates, every day updated in the morning.
In my experience the rate one gets is somewhere in-between the Kinguilas and private deals rate...

name: cleared spot next to road
description: nothing special but it's tricky to find a Bushcamp along this road due to dense vegetation, cleared space, visible from the road but it's not busy at all,

name: bush camp on rock
description:
another great possibility, beautiful view (the pic gives you a good idea), similar to the one close by but on a large stone platform completely hidden from the road, approaching the Black Rocks this spot will be on the left hand side and part of the platform is visible from the road, continue another 100 to 150 m and turn into a track next to a powerline mast, after 20 m take the left track, I camped next to a tree on the right hand side of the platform going down a bit, the rocks there allow leveled parking, 
since all the possibilities are so beautiful and close it's a good idea to check them out before deciding

name: Under the boabab
description: Nice shady spot a few km from main road. A few friendly locals walked by, also one motorcycle and a truck. We spent the afternoon relaxing there, and slept the night.

name: Mountain top next to abandoned church
description: 350 m above the town, next to an abandoned church, with a stunning view (unfortunately a bit of rubbish as well but wasn't  bad considering what one might experience elsewhere in Angola), it's on T4A, track up has a couple of rough but very short sections but no prob with 4x4, spent a pretty quiet night

name: Wild camp over the sea
description:
Very nice place to camp with amazing view.
Quiet. Limited edge reception for mobile internet(unitel)

name: Little Lake Bush Camp
description: Nice little lake if you travel the gravel roads of the forest reserve. I camped right on the dam, some locals around but very friendly.

name: Camabatela Church
description: A slightly different church in a small village. Worth the visit inside

name: Club Nautic Restaurant
description:
nice place and very good restaurant.
in front the sea.

name: Pensao Gigi
description: Double room with ensuite 12,000 kwanzaa, single with shared bath 10,000. Breakfast and wifi (although it isn't working at the moment) are included.  Restaurant with good food and good prices. Street parking with a guardian. Plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance.

name: Bad Road
description: Terrible road from this point north to Malange. Deteriorated tarmac and massive potholes. Took me six hours to go 230km from Malange to here on a motorbike, taking it easy. Nothing too intense, just slow going. From this point south to Kuito it gets better with a mix of good tarmac and good dirt piste.

name: Hotel Vungikita
description: Hotel, 9000 for single, higher from there. Not bad, pretty clean. Doce Hotel next to this was full so I came here.

name: Fazenda (Farm) Tchitogo
description:
This is a working farm with a area for accommodation, restaurants and Bar. The owmer Mr Panda gave us a empty chalet to use the shower and toilet. We camped right outsife the chalet and it nice to have a hot shower. There are roving security so it is very safe and secure. Thid farm has Lions, Zebra, Kudu Impala and even bycicles to ride or atv's if you like to explore the 800 hectar farm.
The generator runs at night till midnight but when they have many guests it runs all night. The bar music is loud but stopped around 21:00 but I think weekends will be till late.
Contact Pamda the owner for more info on +244 923 293 761

name: Wild spot
description: Perfect hidden spot with flat ground. Not far from road easy accessible. Better then in Espenierra.

name: Water pump
description: New water pump. At the moment when we passed it it was closed.

name: Omahua lodge
description:
Nice lodge! All amenities are here. Bookings in advance are required. Alvaro R F Baptista
+244923452748
varito@omauha.com

name: Ricardo Gomes
description: Nice service with modern equipment. Doing all repairs and car washing. There is a bar here. Contact +244 923 521 185 Ricardo.

name: Trentyre Luanda
description: Very well stocked tyre repair and replace workshop that also do alignment and balancing. Owner speak fluent English and very helpful. He is also a keen overlander with a wealth of info. Call Paul at +244938023421

name: Mini Bar
description: Nice food and possible to camp behind the kitchen. There is also rooms behind the restaurant which looks good. When it is busy (around 10 people), a simple hamburger will take an hour.

name: Bodona Restaurant Car Park
description: Quiet carpark adjacent to a nice beach and next to Bodena restaurant. Restaurant closes at 18:00 weekdays, open and more lively at weekends. Not necessary to eat at restaurant, but we did. KZ4000 pp for calamari, chips, salad and a beer.

name: Two old forts.
description:
Two old forts adjacent to each other on a hill overlooking town and the new and old bridges.

Dates from 1846. No much information.

name: Two old steam engines
description: Two old steam engines adjacent to main road

name: Parking Bay Adjacent to Beach
description:
There are plenty of opportunities to park up in the road along the strip without having to pay Alfa or Zulu bars.

This spot is at end of strip, in a parking bay, adjacent to the beach. 

it's not idyllic, but has access to beach and nearby bars, which of course may be noisy on some nights.

There is a mobile police point up the road.

Note that there is a 3.5t weight restriction on the bridge to the spit.

name: Near Street
description: Near the street / behind a tree. Quiet place. Follow the track from the street until the curve. Hidden from the street. Sometimes cows, pigs and sheperds around, but peaceful. Not that much flies. We had a silent and good night on the way to Lubango. There are many places in iOverlander, but having a choice is always better, especially with big trucks like ours.

name: Near baobabs
description: Nice place hidden from the street for the night. Just some locals walking through. Unfortunately some power lines, but ok for one stop. The entrance is at the GPS data, then 50 m behind the grass on the left side. Good 3G signal.

name: Bango Football Pitch
description:
After the long steep climb to Bango, this football pitch is just the other side of the village. It is in sight of the road, but only just. Nice views over surrounding hills.

Neither heard or saw anybody. Lovely birdsong.

name: Mariscoal, Lda
description: Simple hostel with single or twin rooms. Nothing else to stay around. Single 6000 kwz, twin 10000 kwz

name: Pomarbel Supermercado
description: Very clean well stocked supermarket with friendly staff.

name: Residential Nazare
description: Nice, clean, reasonably priced hotel. Price: 19000 kwz single, 275000 double with breakfast. City center close to the ocean!

name: Edson restaurant
description: Small friendly restaurant where Edson allowed us to spend the night on his parking lot.

name: Pretty Town
description: Very pretty town by Angolan standards with picturesque church alongside river with fort on hill.

name: Wild camp on EN372
description:
We camped here on our way from Ondjiva to Menongue. The area west of here is quite populated (lots of fenced off areas & villages along the road). Around this spot no fences and an old disused track to the south leads into the woods. We stayed 350m from the road. Quiet and no visitors.

The road is decent but slow going, we took about 3,5 hours from Ondjiva to this point. Most of the way it’s a well used sand road, doable with a 2wd. But from here towards Caiundo the roads turns into a deep sand track; only 4x4!

name: Near the street on a grassy area
description: For one night on the way south we found this really nice place near the street. It is not compleatly hidden from the street, but far away and it is quiet at night. The area is nice with trees around and a lot of space to park. The entrance at the road is a bit more in the north/east.

name: Beside the River
description:
Wonderful campsite. Surrounded on three sides by water. Easy access providing you take correct exit from new main road at -9.746829, 14.51649.

Warning: Lots of bugs!

name: Tank wreck loop
description: If you want to see some tank wrecks from the ‘87-‘88 battle: take the bridge across the river and keep left to Sanmarina. There’s a new graded sandroad, specially made, which leads to tank wrecks and former outposts from the civil war. This point marks ‘tanque 3’, and the end of the road.

name: Wild camp around Masseca
description:
Around here there are several sandy tracks from the main road into the woods. After a few hundred meters there are some faint side-tracks you can use to park on. You’re completely invisible from the road.

Quiet, no people, just the aound of loggers in the distance in the morning.

Between Menongue and Longa it’s quite busy and more difficult to find a campspot.

name: Shoprite
description: Similar to shoprites in Namibia and Zambia. Just a little bit more expensive and a little bit less products.

name: Wild camp
description: Follow a small tuktuk-track to the west. There are some villages further along the track. We parked after about 300m. Nice and quiet, some friendly bypassers in the morning.

name: Kwanza Falls
description:
Impressive falls, even in dry season. Between January and April it should be huge.

There’s a rough road/track through the village towards the falls - from the northern part of the river. Park your car at the picnic sites, it’s a 5 minute walk to the falls. Kids will guide you towards the best viewpoint.

name: Palanca hotel
description:
Decent hotel with good sized rooms, pool, secure parking, wifi. Also fantastic views over Maranje and surroundings.

We paid 27.000 kwanza for a double including breakfast. The dinner buffet was 5000, or 1000 if you only take garnish (as a vegetarian).

name: King Mandume's Memorial
description: Memorial is 12km off main road and located within a conference centre. visitors are expected to lay a mopani leaf.

name: California
description: Chic restaurant. Nice location facing beach. Omelette, salad and chips KZ2000.

name: Museum of Slavery
description:
This is the national museum for slavery. Its in a small chapel just of the road. Entrance is free.

The old Benfica souvenir market seems to be moved to the next-door market.

name: Foz do Onzo
description: WIld camp on the beach. You can swim on the river and sea. Reach Yembe from EN100. Better if you ask permision in Yembe, to Sabo, for camping on the beach

name: Shoprite Namibe
description: All you need for a couple of days in the desert.

name: Bakery
description: Small bakery with fresh buns and cakes. Only one we found in town.

name: Praia do Soba
description: Luxury campsite with ablution facilities, with lodging also available. Situated on top of the cliffs along the Namibe coastline, you can expect breathtaking views, fishing opportunities, swimming and snorkeling locations, and a restaurant with fresh prepared food from the ocean. Call Andrea +244 922 502 665 Whatsapp

name: Queiroz Point
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

Camp site sea front 
Abolotion  security power supply 
Lounge bar&restauraunt
Surf & fishing Point
www.queirozpoint.com

name: Unitel Agent
description:
Unitel Office where you can buy SIM cards and internet packages. 25GB package cost 25.000kw. One of the ladies in the shop spoke good english.

You can also buy the SIM cards at the small unitel places (the yellow cages that look like an old phone booth) but for internet packages you have to go to an official unitel agent. SIM cards cost 1.000kw.

name: Caluquembe
description: Petrol Station with large carpark, very quiet, some food available, night guard, we gave him 1000kw We came from Huambo. All really good road except for about 50 km dirt track. still making new road.

name: Confianca Insurance
description: Got insurance for moto, 3 months was the shortest. 5k kwanza. Friendly service.

name: Old Farm
description:
Old Farm about 200m away from the road. Big level ground for parking. We met two people here and asked them if we could stay the night. It seemed like they get visitors from time to time. There is a reliable but slow (E) mobile internet signal here.
Advice for big rigs trying to drive this road: the road gets narrower to the north to the point where the track is about 2.5m wide. We have a 17 ton 6x6 and barely made it. The bridge over the Cuanza River is strong enough though.

name: Cazombo
description: Wild camped at police station. Very friendly and safe and helpful.

name: Forest camp on track
description: Forest wild camp on track alongside main road

name: Wild camp next to road
description: Open space next to road. Safe. Used by truckers and me to sleep over whilst on the most awful road in Africa.

name: Miami Beach
description:
Nice and chilled place on the beach with the usual great views on the ocean, excellent food, friendly owner and staff.
Lunch menu 5500 kw including drink and dessert. 
It's also possible to pitch your tent on the beach there.

name: Namibian Consulate
description: Did my visa in Luanda, but they said it should be the same process here. $60 for 30 day visa.

name: RiJo
description: Overlander and LandCruiser specialist workshop where Ricardo the owner takes special care of his customers and their vehicles. Great on all overland vehicles and specialist with LandCruiser

name: Cliffs of  Bentiaba
description: When you see the old light house turn in on road. Go past the house and find many options. The main road is far off. We chose this place because of the awesome bay below. Nobody came around. We were at the river bed location south of this but didn’t feel comfortable sleeping in a river bed so this was a close choice after spending some time on the beach.

name: Flat field close to the ocean
description:
Leave the tarmac and follow the road, when you turn left, a gate will come up.
You are allowed to pass (some locals told me)

Nice camping spot, lots of firewood and some nice trees for shade. The ocean is very close but we didn‘t find a road to it yet.

name: Fishing resort Spyker & Marina
description: Found this place by accident, we were looking for good fishing spot at the estuary/ocean. Nice (still small) resort run by lovely couple Spyker and Marina from Namibia. There's camping spots for tent/ 4x4 (10.000pp) with acces to clean shower and toilet (also chalets available). We had our own fishing gear but they have lot of gear and experience here. Boat brings you to the beach where you can beach and river fish. They're on Facebook so if you want to know prices etc guess just message them..

name: Jungle boogie
description: Just over 1km in the track shown on OSM/maps.me, you reach this large grassyclearing in the jungle, surrounded by baobabs and other trees. You could even protrude deeper into the bush here, but not really necessary, as you're already sheltered from the track by a hill and trees. Beautiful place. Access track a bit narrow for big rigs. 3 bars unitel 2g.

name: Nigerian Embassy
description:
German Passports
Open Tue-Thurs, 10-13h
Had a chat with the officer about our travels and why we couldn't apply for a visa in our homecountry. He said he'd issue a visa. Back at the front counter the lady gave us the bank account number in which we had to deposit USD140 each.
We came back 2 hours later with bank slips, 2 passport photos (52*52mm) and a photocopy of our passports, filled in the form the lady handed us and submitted everything. She disappeared and 10 minutes later, we had the passports with visa valid for 3 months in our hands. Not overly friendly but easier than expected!

name: River crossing
description: When we came through in early January there was a river crossing here, not too deep (around knee height at the deepest) but quite tricky as the bottom is soft sand. OK in 4x4, tough but doable on motorbike if you keep the speed up..

name: money exhange Best rates
description: After asking around we found the guys at this pumangol to have the best rates. They prefer ZAR over Nam dollar

name: Old construction camp
description: An old Chinese road construction camp. I camped here with the guard and his dogs. Friendly guy, even cooked food for me. Good for one night.

name: Beach camp
description: Awesome camp spot in front of a resort which was not open. A guard let me camp without problems. Amazing view and nobody came by. Cleaned myself in the ocean, but watch the strong current.

name: Beautiful beach camp
description:
A good(ish) dirt road will take you to this campsite with beautiful ocean views. The map shows a river but it has very limited flow and is blocked from entering the ocean by the beach. Suggest camping above the beach as during a big tide the waves do spill over the beach in places (and fill the lagoon behind). You can camp on either side of the river but can not drive over the beach.

Sangano is only about a km to the south and can be accessed on foot at low tide by waking beneath the cliffs.

name: Wild camp site behind the golf course
description:
Take the wide dirt road before the Mangais golf course and head inland. There are lots of wild camping opportunities in this area but the further you go the better they get. This area is sparsely inhabited and has lots of options with shade from the big baobabs. The tracks are quite sandy in places but there are loads of options. 

If staying near a village it's always a good idea to check in with the Soba (chief).

name: Restaurante Paradouro Bica D’agua
description: On the way down to Waku Kongo (from Dondo) small restaurant on the right. Ask to access the area at the back. At the top of a small hill there is a nice piece of grass land where you can stay. There is a house being turned into a small guesthouse but not finished. Possible to access the bathroom but not in good condition.

name: Grassed area
description: 5 min from the main road. Follow the tracks. Very quiet grassed area.

name: Hidden wild camping on sandy road
description: Hidden wild camping on an old sandy road parallel to the main road. Very quiet.

name: Bicycle shop
description: The name of the shop is Clawana and run by Igor. He has race and mountain bikes, and fixed my tourbike. I had problems with the hydraulic Maguira brakes. He fixed one brake, and replaced the other with mechanical. He only charged money for the new parts, but I gave him a little extra. Nice guy and professional. Fixed my bike the same day. You can contact him on +244923525446.

name: Tchincombe
description:
Very beautiful and shady spot under some very big trees. 
Wonderful shower and bathroom building. 
On a very big farm, so privately owned and operated. But full welcome to all overlanders and travelers. 
It’s about 2-3 hours off the main road, but road goes through to national park. Please close cattle gates after you.  GPS location will lead you to the main house and you will be directed from there. Roads are on tracks4africa or google maps. 
Owners are very nice and welcoming but not always here, but someone will be.  
10 US dollars a night.

name: Ritz Sumbe
description: We stayed in January. Good and big room. Single room 14500 kz. Don’t have restaurant, but very good seafood restaurant near hotel. We travel by motorbike.

name: Motel and Restaurant camp
description: I was able to camp behind the restaurant under a roof for free. I ordered some food and drinks in exchange. There are also rooms. I was able to have a warm shower in the shared bathroom of the hotel. Place is owned by a Portuguese guy. In the evening there is noise and light, but it will shut down around 11 or 12 pm.

name: Sadasa official BMW service
description: Keep away from here! The worst BMW service I have ever experienced. They misunderstood completely what I wanted to explain. They can hardly communicate in English. And super expensive: basic inspection costs (oil change, oil filter, air filter: 300€).

name: Camp in traditional house
description: I was able to set up my tent inside one of the many houses in this compound. The houses have red roofs, you can see them from the road. Armando speaks good English, but he is not always around. They even let me cook my own meal. Nice people and a nice experience. Good place to camp under a roof in an area where there are not many (decent) places to do so.

name: Farm camp
description: A farm where I could pitch my tent inside the building. Nice people. They also have a big tank with ground water for shower and drinking. You can see the farm from the road.

name: Fila
description:
Basic room, double bed, no electric or running water, wash via bucket. but room pretty clean with en-suite.
3000 Kwanza for a double room for one night.

Plenty of secure parking inside. There is a bar onsite but no food served.

name: Beachcamp between bushes
description: Nice quiet place even for big rigs - a lot of Space and grassy spots to camp, mostly hidden from the main road

name: Catholic Mission "Do Libolo"
description: nice and helpful italian padre who offered us to camp at the mission after we were robbed at the church were it is said to be save. Even the Police showed up before and told us that everything is save here!

name: camping hidden from road
description:
nice quiet place - rain prooved, not muddy and very relaxed for a night stop over.
small road is a little bit washed out - just 150 m!

name: No Bridge
description:
There is no bridge to cross the river. 
Not possible to drive around or through the river. 
They build a new bridge

name: Old Road - Hilltop
description: As the name describes, there is a short loop of old tar road that has been replaced by a new road. This is only accessible from one end (dirt area at the top of the hill). Not totally hidden but out of direct view of the road and no one came. The other places nearby felt very overlooked to us and the hotel/bar carpark listed just a public carpark.

name: Ombissi Dive centre
description:
PADI certified dive instruction, with 4 ensuite rooms and small garden/ secure parking for camping possible.

Marco (the owner) speaks brilliant English  is a certified PADI instructor. He is sometimes in Portugal with family so prebooking is (almost) essential!

A dive is 18,000K (we paid $30 based on current black market rate).

There is a small house with 4 ensuite (fan only) rooms (10,000 per room). The rooms are very clean andhouse comfortable,  with a nice living room area. There is a kitchen available to cook your own food and fridge to cool your Cuca!

Camping is also possible on the driveway (behind a wall) with access to a shower and the outdoor kitchen/BBQ area (3000K).

The diving is very good, there is a ship wreck and reef right on the doorstep (literally). There is a variety of fish and coral and the equipment is excellent and very well maintained (and new- felt completely safe!) The beach is lovely and perfect for swimming, again right on the doorstep. Snorkeling is also possible (and very very good) using their equipment.

We would strongly recommend this place but you need to phone Marco beforehand. Marco is on WhatsApp. His number is (+244)941288300.

name: Dive centre
description: See dive centre description for details...

name: Chines Garage
description: Good Chinese Garage. They do good work! Not expensive! They now what they do!

name: Hospedaria Cacuso, Cacuso
description: Nice and clean Hotel with a big Restaurant. Rooms from Kwaza 10.000 to 14.000 including breakfast. Staff is very friendly. Big and save parking lot.

name: Hospedaria e Restaurante OLIVEIRA, Dondo
description: Nice and clean Hotel. Double Room Kwanza 10.000 and suites 15.000, including breakfast. Rooms are nicely furnished and have A/C and TV. Staff is very friendly and restaurant/bar with terrace and view over the Kwanza river. Street parking with night guard.

name: Misinga Hotel, Benguela
description:
New and small boutique hotel (European Standard). Beautiful rooms for Kwanza 17.000 including a nice breakfast. In the city Centre and closed to the beach. 
Benguela is an interesting town, with many good restaurants, bars and old Portuguese buildings and a very special cinema from an architectural point of view. We stayed for 2 nights and can recommend the place. Street parking in front of the hotel with day and night guard.

name: place in a  village  close to the border
description: because of the late border crossing we had to stay one  night in the village. the people where very friendly and welcoming use. before we stayed we asked several people for permission. they contacted the chef of the village who came later on. a very  nice guy that speaks proper English. in the  night there is a lot of military surveillance what gave us a safe feeling.

name: Road to Tomboco
description:
Short cut to Tomboco. 
It is 125 km shorter then going via Mbanza Congo, so a nice short cut to make some fun with your 4x4. 

Maps me doesn't show the right exit in the beginning coming from Congo. At the y-crossing on maps me, go right after the airport at the street lights. If you are not sure where to go right, ask the locals. They will help you. 

There are only some small buts: you need some 4x4 experience to drive this route, don't mind that you probably get some small scratches on your car and get stuck when you drive during heavy rainfall. It takes around 7 hours from the start to the end. Including a few beautiful stops and lunch.

name: iu Hotel, Namibe
description:
You will find these hotels all over Angola (big buildings, painted in pink).
Price varies apparently and we paid Kwanza 27000 for one double room, breakfast included. We stayed here, because we arrived late from a long day trip and were looking for a hot shower and some comfort. Normally business- and npo - organizations people stay here.

name: Big open field
description: We camped here for the night. Peaceful and calm. Beautiful scenery. It does get quite cold up in the mountains so its wear warm clothes. None of the villagers came to bother us. We parked on the flat surface near the stones.

name: Mil Cidades
description: The main dishes were very tasty with big portion. A bit expensive for budget travellers but one portion was good enough for two persons. They are known for the indian food but we didn’t try it. The restaurant belong to the aparthotel but we didn’t stay here. So, we don’t know the price.

name: Pensaõ NB
description: Clean and very comfortable place to crash. Norberto the owner is very nice guy. He help us a lot, included to get our visa extension easier. The price is between 11k to 15k, a simple breakfast is included.

name: Chibemwa
description: pensao or simple cheap hôtel with only a gate and banjo or bathroom on the corridor

name: Hospedaria Angequisu
description: Nice hotel with a courtyard to park your motorbike. Single room 9000 Kwanza (clean, ac, on suite shower and toilet). All good :)

name: Refugio at Ferry
description: Refugio to wait for Ferry, status open at night. Toilet and water available. Beautiful view and súper quiet.

name: CYMOT
description: Carparts, 4x4 accessory and outdoor gear. Famous Chain Store from South Africa. Well equipped.

name: Sangol
description: Fuel Station with small store and Restaurant

name: Sanangol
description: Fuel and shop on this long road in the National Park

name: Morros Vermelos
description: Beautiful red stones! Follow the sign "Colinas" and you will find it. Nobody was there and we could take beautiful pictures in this quiet atmosphere!

name: Comauto Mercedes
description: Mercedes workshop that repaired our Unimog, very professional although parts are limited but sourced good second hand bits. Parked and stayed in driveway for a few days for repair. Access to water and staff ablutions (do not expect too much for the ablutions). Also services Suzuki cars and others.

name: SME Angola Immigration
description: SME Angola Immigration for extension of visas.

name: Village wild camp
description:
Stopped at big tree nearby but village chief (soba in Portuguese) insisted we stay closer to the village. Very friendly and left alone mostly. Gave them some food in thanks. 

Road from Matala broken asphalt and annoying. South from Folgares road becomes sandy track. So far no issues but will see how test of road pans out.

name: Village wild camp
description:
Camped the night at a village south of Bicuar Nat Park. Asked permission to sleep, small audience until after dark but no bother. Audience again in the morning as usual. Many dogs so own pets may be an issue. No cell reception since Folgares. Large village water tank adjacent and they will probably give you water if you ask but it is a precious resource. 

Road from Mulondo narrow sandy track with vegetation on both sides. Will scratch big rig sides but mostly soft branches. Road from Folgares to Mulondo is also a sandy track with narrow parts (bushes) and deep sand parts. Will be more challenging in the wet with many dips that will fill with water. 

A really beautiful drive through the countryside.

name: Kakuako Lodge
description:
A practical and quiet campsite close to Luanda ( 9 KMS.) the owner is also an Overlander and know the needs of someone's that is traveling by car.
Accommodation is  in cabin containers with toilet ,wi-fi , air conditioning, with security, car parking, gym, barber,  swimming pool, bar, horse riding, with a hotel for pets, the owner is also an overlander, and is possible to make small repairs or maintenance of the Overlanders vehicles if necessary.
If a guest doesn't want to use the rooms he can mount his ground or roof rack tent , and use the facilities .

name: Mundo às Fatias
description: Restaurant/ Bar good pizza pasta grilled chicken and vegetarian dishes owners speak English and mingle well with clients. Clean toilets

name: Rest Stop
description: Well-lit, good place for a overnight rest area. Quiet. Port-a-John for restroom.

name: Café do Monte
description: Very nice South african owned restaurant with good food burger , nachos , wings and pizza with various cold beer on tap .

name: Hungueria Waterfall
description: Beautiful waterfall inside a cave. It worth the visit but the road is hard, only for 4x4.

name: Café do Monte Namibe
description: What a wicked discovery!! South African standards and dishes in Lubango.  Friendly owners,  fantastic food and reasonable prices. Clientele a nice mix of locals, expats and the odd confused tourist (like us). Good times!

name: Trentyre- Goodyear
description: Good guys, repaired motorcycle tube and changed tyre. 1000kwz for tube change and repair.

name: wild camping next to locals
description: Wild camping in a big area hidden from the main road. Next to this place two families live, before camp ask them if you can pass the night there.

name: Wild camp next to the road
description: Wild camp between the road from Oncocua to Otchinjau. Good for a stopover of one night. Next to the road but with a wide space for parking and semi-hidden. Some people passed before sunset but they were very nice. Quiet night.

name: New Road (no rainy season)
description:
Beginning/end of the road that it doesn't appear on maps.me or Google maps that goes to Oncocua. It's shorter way (one hour less) from the other way. 

ATTENTION: only drive in this road when it's not the rainy season. If it's the rainy season use the other one.

name: Vulcan Mack (Tyres)
description: Good places for repair the tyres or to buy new ones for your car.  The boss Arsene and Elsa are very good and they will help with anything that you need. 24hours -7 days a week.

name: Farol do Piambo
description: Piambo lighthouse. Good views and different paths for walking. In the way you will found  indicated the place as "Farol".  From the last indication, it's 15km.

name: Piambo natural pools
description:
Natural pools next to the sea. You can reach the place by car turning left from the lighthouse. There are stairs to go down. Some people camp here. 
CAUTION: beware of the waves! if the sea it's a little brave, don't swim there!

name: direcção provincial da saude
description:
Here you have to pay your test for crossing the border. They only accept multicaixa, so no cash or Visa accepted. You need to ask to someone that pay for you and give them the amount by cash. The test cost 11.278'18 Kwanzas. First you have to come here to do the payment, and after with the receipt and one copy of your passport, you need to go to the school (marked in the app) to do the test. Finally, you need to come back here to pick up the results and validate the test with the panabios sistem (they do it here). 
they open at 8-13.30h but they have a maximum test per day, so you need to come early.

name: Escola antiga da saúde
description:
Here you have to come to do the COVID test after doing the payment on the other place of the health ministry (marked in ioverlander). They last 3 hours to have the results, so come early (8h) to avoid the queue. 

After testing, when you have the results, you need to validate on the Panabios System. On the Health ministry they could help you for doing this process.

name: Wild Camping
description: We stopped here for one night. Flat and hidden from from road. The security guard from the factory 500m away came and greeted us. Quiet night.

name: Villa Okapale
description: Hotel just outside of Ondjiva. We were allowed to sleep in our car in the parking lot and use the toilet and shower of one of the rooms, paid 5000 kwanza to stay the night. Had dinner at the restaurant for 5000 Kwanzas each. Friendly people at the reception, restaurant and bar. Perfect stop if you had a long day at the border, as we did

name: UNITEL Ondjiva
description: Here you can buy SIM card for UNITEL. Cost is kz 350 and

name: Complexo Hoteleiro Rosa Tchilepa
description: Relatively inexpensive hotel in Wako Kungo. Bungalow with double bed for kz 16.000, breakfast included. Secure parking, pool, bar and restaurant. The restaurant serves a proper Indian curry. By far our best meal in Angola!

name: Frescos
description: Very well supermarket. Next door is also a Do-it-Yourself store.

name: Girassol
description: They have a water tap on the right side of the building and let you fill up your water tanks.

name: Immigration Airport Luanda
description: I entered Angola through Luvo with the Evisa. As they don't issue Evisas they stamped my printed Evisa and said to go this place to get the visa. It is 120$ and you need to pay in $ or €.

name: Bush Camp
description: Direction Lubango, left side of the road. Behind the row of trees, there is a wide open, sandy strip, running parallel to the road. Close to the road, but one is completely shielded. The road is not busy at all during the night. Could hear people’s voices in the distance, but did not see anyone. We enjoyed the spot.

name: Estr. de Catete
description: A nice spot in an old quarry on the way to Luanda. While there is some traffic noise from the road, the place is completely obscured and we did not see anyone.

name: Praya de Sangano
description: A nice campsite on the beach at a Lodge with many rooms. There are however no facilities other than a toilet at the main lodge. We were charged Kw10 000 for 2 people per night. They were not willing to negotiate and as it was relatively late in the afternoon, we decided to stay for the night. A nice position but too expensive for what you get.

name: Impassable road
description: Hello all that are daring to go this route to Zambia, take my advice and dont take it. The sand is so fine that if you are on 2 wheel (like me) it is simply impossible. It took me 12 hours to cover 60km. Might be possible on 2 wheels but I doubt it as the train services most of these small villages. Head south to Namibia and then head East that way. Safe travels, Tom

name: EN280 Bushcamp
description: A quiet and secluded place in the bushveld some distance from the main road. The access road is a jeep track on the right side just before a bridge, approximately 67 km before Humpata, traveling in that direction. After about a km on the track the bush starts opening up and then there is ample place to camp off the track. We did not see or hear any vehicles and had a perfect wild camp experience. It would even be possible to spend more than one day here.

name: Old gravel place
description: Big area with gravel surface. It seems is an old quarry from road construcción. Perfectly hidden from the road. Nice view in top of a hill

name: Tundavale Dry Pan
description: A dry pan on the left side of the road, approaching the main viewing area. Turn left onto the sandy jeep track across from the 1st parking area on the right. About 500m down this track turn left into a sunken, level and clean area. A vehicle is not visible from the main road and one is also shielded from the wind. No view over the valley, but we shared a very peaceful night here with two big owls. Not sure whether it would be accessible during the rainy season.

name: OLD LIGHHOUSE and fortress
description: Old lighhouse and fortress from portuguese times. There is anything special , but a beautiful view of the beach and seashore. Amazing sunset.

name: TUDAOPNEU
description: Tyre and wheel alignment workshop. Well equipped. CONTINENTAL flagged. Lionel, the owner help us to repair our Hilux front bumper after crashing a goat.

name: KERO HIPERMERCADO
description: New and spectacular shopping centro. Western style. Supermarket, fusión cloth, furniture, food supermarket. Modern style. Expensive. Heigh entry limit at 2.5 m.

name: MIRADOIRO DA LUA
description: Wonderful sea view from the top of the cliff. Tourist Information point.

name: MONEY EXCHANGE.
description: KINGUILA, Street exchange money. In front of MAZDA Dealer. Exchange rate today: 460 kw per U.S. dollar.

name: GIRASSOL Fuel Station
description: After refuelling we could refill our 100 litre water tank. For free

name: Bush Mechanic
description: Not a proper service centre, but I was told that both the other places have closed down. Johnny did a minor repair job on the vehicle’s suspension, but he seemed to try and do a good job.

name: DHL Courier. Aeroporto.
description: Here you can sent or receive your shipment from Europe. We picked up here our new Carnet de Passage sent from Spain. Expensive service. Many people waiting for service. You have to be patient, it takes long. Poor service.

name: Avenida Shopping. Morro Bento
description: New and spectacular shopping center with supermarket, fast food, cinema and shops. European Style. Expensive

name: MERCADO DE ARTESANATO. Handycraft
description: Real handcraft market. Cloth, timber. Hand made souvenir

name: SONANGOL GAS STATION
description: Here we could fill up our water tank. Diésel also available

name: KERO Shopping center
description: New and spectacukar shopping center. European style. Supermarket, cinema, fashion. Expensive

name: Chibemba
description: Fuel pump in a blue container as you enter town on the right. Nice Cafe for food and beer too.

name: lekker Eka Valley
description:
Didn't camp here, but beautiful valley with birdlife (limited, but we saw a few :)
Potential wild camping too

name: Iona town water point
description: Big blue container with water. Not great tasting, a bit brak. Drink at your own discretion.

name: Terminal Marítimo De Passageiros
description:
Since April 2022, a ferry service connects the cities of Cabinda and Soyo in 3 hours.
Price: AKZ 15.000

name: Water Point
description: Hand water pump at small village.  Water is clear, not brak and tastes great. Beautiful green area with lots of trees.

name: Terminal fluvial de Passageiros
description:
Ferries (catamarã) from Soyo to Cabinda and vice versa. For passengers and luggage only.
Departures: 3 times a week
Duration: 3 hours
Price: KZ 15.000 
More info: www.secilmaritima.co.ao

name: Rocky Meander
description: From the school in the village head through a little bit grass on to the closest rock slabs. Great views from walking around and exploring

name: AMF AUTO SHOP VIANA (Luanda) land rover
description:
Here you can find all the spare parts you want and original ones, Miguel have a partnership with land rover
Number:+244949366691

name: AN Hotel
description: Only hotel in the village. double rooms are 12000 kz. We stayed in the car in the guarded parking in the back. Didnt have to pay anything, but we did have dinner in their restaurant (large beef main for 3200). Its very noisy due to generator next to the wall, switches off between 12 and 5am. Acces to parking is height limited (approx. 2.5 m)

name: Foto Ngufo
description: Foto studio for visum pictures (Nigeria embassy mimics US and needs very specific picture dimensions 52×52 mm). quick service, 3000 kwanzas for 6 pictures

name: Restaurante Lana
description: Great Lebanese/Angolan restaurant with vegetarian options. Around 1500-2000kw for a plate (generous portion) and fresh fruit juices from 900kw. Has some outdoor seating

name: catholic mission Landana
description: We asked for permission to stay, the father was a very friendly young man who let us park behind the guest house without charge. upon request later that night they opened a bathroom for us(no running water but buckets). unfortunately there was not much sleep: all through the night (litteraly from 10pm untill the mass at 6:30 in the morning, which we attended) there was singing in the hall and people walking in and out right past our car where we slept inside, chatting in groups. everyone extremely friendly

name: Art Doce
description: Good place for breakfast and lunch, or a coffee with pastel de nata. Full with locals. Reasonable prices.

name: Nossa Seguros Insurance
description: Got 3rd party insurance here for 3 months for 11000kwz (26€). Took me 15 minutes.

name: Pastelaria Auria
description: Great place for coffee and breakfast. And cheap, 350kwz for espresso.

name: Hotel Ritz Capital
description: Great value for Luanda, best booked online on Hotels.com. Ensuite double with aircon, free breakfast, hot water and wifi for approx £35 per night. Centrally located but entrance is not marked (first floor in a residential building).

name: Hotel Mirage
description: Probably one of the best (though not the cheapest option in Mbanza Congo). Ensuite double with warm water, aircon and free breakfast for 16k Kw. Clean and secure, centrally located.

name: GET Hotel
description: Decent option for Huambo. A hotel with a nice courtyard and a swimming pool. Wifi normally available but not working when we were there. Double ensuite with hot water, aircon and free breakfast (very poor: no coffee!!) for 13k Kw.

name: In2angolaventures2 guesthouse
description: Guesthouse with 9 rooms and camping site

name: Lighthouse at the end of the peninsula
description: Nice place to rest. Some local restaurants to eat inside or on the beach. Big burger 1.000 Kz.

name: Luandina Food
description: Local restaurant with good Angolana dishes for fair prices. Cuamba, calulu, feijoada - they have everything. 1000 a plate.

name: Terrible road
description: Most terrible tar road I’ve ridden in 10 months Africa. Potholes, faded tar and deep ditches that are hard to dodge, will be very challenging for big rigs. Kalandula to this point took me 2hrs.

name: Tito’s
description: Hotel & restaurant, basic double rooms 5000kwz with bucket shower. Could ask for camping too as they have large garden/parking. I didn’t as it was late already..

name: Cafafa
description: Located on the EN 100 sense Sumbe - Lobito

name: Grande Hotel Do Uige
description:
Descent city hotel with safe parking. Big city hotel. Mu room was quite and comfortable. No wifi tonight. 
12.000 kwanza for me including breakfast.

name: Basic Guesthouse
description:
A bed, electricity, light, bathroom with bucket of water for shower and for the toilet. No wifi. Parked my motorcycle inside the gate. Very basic but ok for 1 night. Classic Angolan guesthouse. Paid 5000 kwanza for the room. Friendly but shy host. Very little English, but want to learn. Took me to a little restaurant for dinner. Fish and Funge for 1000 kwanza. Bank, Pharmacy, Unitel and small supermarkets around the corner. Safe atmosphere.
I am sure they would let you put up your tent, but I didn't ask. Very nice petrol station in Mussende as well. Nicest I have seen in Angola. The road here from Malanje is insanely potholed after the Kwanza river - More potholes than road. Must be nightmare in the wet season. 
The locals go on their all Indian bikes and busses. I don't know how they manage.

name: Petrol Pumangol
description: Nice petrol station. They even serve good coffee. They might day no to motorcycles, but just ask again. I think it's the small Indian bikes they don't want. Don't ask me why!

name: Museo dos Reis do Congo
description: A small, well maintained museum that is worth the visit. Garcia is very eager to give you a tour based on donation. Speaks portuguese and a little bit french. Don’t miss the Church built in 1491 opposite of the museum.

name: Ferme Touristique Bandrekaz
description: Hotel & restaurant attached to a plantation, offers camping as well. Official rate was 20$, but they let me stay for 10$. Shower with hot water available. Good food for reasonable price as well.

name: Total station
description: New Total Station. Small bar and restaurant too.

name: Amazing place right on the beach
description:
Amazing place right on the beach with very friendly local people. You are in the village, in front of destroyed houses. You are at 5 meters of the ocean, very clean and long beach and very clean water to swim. We slept here 3 nights and nobody disturb us. We could buy fishes directly to the numerous fishermen. Very very quiet by night.
We saw dolphins from here!!!!
Tap water in the village, cold drinks and basic food too. We loved this place !!!

name: Hidden Fuel Station
description: Hidden fuel station, only one in town with fuel. With fuel prices so cheap in Angola but high everywhere else nearly all fuel station close to the borders have sold out due to smugglers.

name: Seal to Gravel heading south
description: Tar seal ends and goes to gravel heading south, couple of good hill climbs then corrugations for 50 odd km

name: Praia de São Brás
description:
Long beach with a nice place for wild camping. Very good for fishing, you can catch big Pungo fish (with more than 30 kg if you’re lucky). 
You can find some people during weekends trying to fish them.

name: Hotel Diaspora/Jardin Bresilien
description: Large area at the beach with little charm but free wifi and pool, can get loud when tourist buses arrive, 6000CFA/night (9,15€) for two people

name: Chez Monique
description: Camping in calm location between trees and many wood carvings, a little bit run down, low key tours to a fetish market or voodoo village can be organized, 6000CFA/night (9,15€) for two people

name: Awalé Plage, Grand Popo, Benin
description: 5000 CFA per night. Camped at the back off the hotel with beautiful view of the beach. The place used to get more campers but now mainly caters to hotel clients. Use of large pool area with showers & toilets adjacent to pool. Nice seafood meals available at the restaurant. Liza & Jason

name: Chez Theo, Possotome, Benin
description: 6000cfa per night for 2 people. Located on Lac Aheme. Parked between the hotel & water front restaurant( on stilts) with plenty of shade. No shower facilities for campers but we set up shower tent near car. Tap near by so water readily accessible.

name: Benin (Kétou) Border Crossing
description:
Very relaxed border crossing with Nigeria. Customs & immigration stamps at the same place. Their is also Benin customs at Ketou but they stamped our Carnet at the border

Carnet at this moment only possible to be stamped at customs in Ketou (14km from the border)

name: Auberge de Grand Popo
description: Right on the beach. Bungalows and camping. Pool and WiFi are good. Ablutions are adequate, but a bit of a walk from the Campsite. Camping is 3,000cfa per person per night.

name: Chez Rada
description: Sandy compound. run by a lovely lady, Rada. it has a swimming pool and a restaurant with draught beer, cold drinks and nice food. Very friendly workers. adequate ablutions and there are a few rooms to stay in. Camping is in the small car park (3,000cfa pppn). 12km away from Cotonou on a rough sandy road.

name: Hotel Baobab
description: Hotel with big parking space, camping possible, 1500 CFA per person (negotiated), shower and toilet inside bungalow, nice restaurant with limited menu, local restaurants nearby, very friendly staff.

name: Victor's Place
description: Little Rasta Bar with bungalows and a little area for camping. right on the beach. toilet and bucket shower available. paid 3000 CFA for the vehicle. cool drinks, nice music, very small menu.

name: Ambassade De La Republique Democratique Du Congo
description:
It's behind the Bar/Restaurant Livingstone.
1 month, single for 50 000 CFA. 2 forms, 2 photos and proof of funds. Very helpful and friendly staff. Usually it takes one week. We had it on spot. Transit of 7 days also possible for 16.000, this one is always instantly.

name: Chez Papa Poochy
description: Hostel / Guesthouse on a sandy road. I was allowed to camp on the terrace with a very nice view for 3.000 CFA pp/pn

name: Hotel Vainqueur
description:
Found this place late at night. Basic clean room, nice bed with mosquito net. They fixed up a great omelette meal for us with cold beer. Gated compound with guy on watch outside, could possibly fit a 4x4 inside. Ecobank ATM directly outside. 

Double bed room = 7000CFA (though they said that was down from 8000)

name: Guesthouse Haie Vive
description:
Lovely hotel/hostel run by a Swiss man. Dorm beds available for 5000CFA per night, private rooms also available. Dorm beds have mosquito nets. Kitchen also available for dorm use. Breakfast available every morning for 1500CFA. Inside locked compound with night guard, walking distance to DRC and Gabon consulate.

Brush up on your French as the local woman working reception doesn't want to know you if you don't speak French.

name: Le Livingstone
description: Restaurant with many expats, the Livingstone pizza is one of the best woodfire pizzas I have eaten. I went back multiple times for it!

name: Garage St Emmanuel
description: I made no experience with it but it seems to be a good place if you need a bigger garage to repair your car.

name: wild camp
description:
Not easy to find a place to sleep in this area. 
This is not far from the street but behind bushes on a bigger footpath. nobody can see you from the street.

name: Numi Camp and Mechanic shop!!!!
description:
Campground/Auberge 1km before the entrance to the Pendjari Nationalpark
owned by a German Alfred Schmutz who is amazingly friendly.
Also Bungalows available. 
Small pool and shade area for camping.
Very familiar here. We felt like at home.
++++!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!+++
Alfred is a German educated car mechanic (are there existing better ones anywhere?) and has also a garage here. So if you have problems with care or motorbike THIS is your adress
+++!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!+++

name: Pendgjari national park
description:
entrance 10000 pp/PD. car 3000.
if you stay 3 days or longer you have to pay 25000 CFA
3000 Cfa pppn for camping
2 hotels are in the park where you also can camp.
Pendjari Hotel is very noisy because of the generator running all the night.
wild camp is not allowed without a guide. They caught us and asked us to pay a huge fine.....!There is only one official place where it is allowed to camp by your own. No showers there.
I try to saved the position of this campground here in the park near mare yangouali. (is not exactly the point, sorry) This does not mean it is a campground! But a nice place on a lake. Hippos here and a group of baboons. so be careful. We saw some lions also some km from here..no fence around!
Park itself is great! We saw a lots of elephant,  hippos and lions. mass of different Antelope,  krokos and and and.......

name: Benin/Togo border
description:
Leaving Togo. Easy enough. Passport stamped. My Carnet wasn't stamped on the way in. Explained and showed. Let me go

Entering Benin. Show passport to enter border. Immigration on right hand side. Vehicle registration opposite in a shack. Customs little further down. Stamped Carnet no problems

On arrival Benin visas, on 5th of July 2018:
TRANSIT VISA: 2 days - 32.000 CFA
TOURIST VISA: 8 days - 10.000 CFA

name: Clinique
description:
Little but complete Clinic for classical health problems in Africa, (Malaria and so)
Kind staff and really proffesional

name: wild camp in a cashew plantage
description:
nice quite place unter cashew trees. people are very friendly here. Just ask if they alow you to stay for the night.
There is also a watchman 😉

name: Garage Redjos, Rémi and his team
description:
Simple but clean garage for cars, can do simple works for 4x4s.
+22997069148

name: Three boarders junction
description: Benin's army camp. You can sleep here and you can walk on the other side of river 1km to restaurant in Burkina Faso for beer. Restaurant is in hotel.

name: Parking next to stadium.
description: There is space for couple cars. Could be a bit noisy in the evenings because of two bars next to it. But people in bars surprisingly quiet. Close to ethnographic museum and city.

name: Boukombe
description:
Here is Custom Benin
Immigration in Natitingou
Paid 1.500CFA pppn camping fee

name: Cotonou Apartements
description:
Quite far from de centre and not easy to find. It's opposite to the West African University. 
Rooms for about 6000xof, if it isn't overbooked you will get a private room with a fan and a nice clean bathroom. Very nice standart and a meal of the day for 2000xof. There's a swimming pool on the site although it wasn't really usable when I stayed there. Anyways a good value for money

name: Entry Stamp Benin
description: Long line of trucks parked to the right but we just rode past and pulled it this location on the left hand side. simple process of getting stamped in with the visa we had obtained in Mali. Nothing here for the vehicle.

name: Douane
description: Stop here for vehicle import. We paid 6000 cfa per motorcycle.

name: Mosa Hotel (Avoid)
description:
Very uncomfortable hard bed, I normally don't get up for anything during the night but at about 3am I'd had enough and went out to get our sleeping mattress. The room is much hotter than the outside so uncomfortable in this regard too. At 7am our phone rang, we ignored it and then someone knocked on the door, again we ignored it but were awake by then so decided to just get up and leave, at 8 we got another knock, it was just ti do with payment.

Very expensive even if it were nice.
Fan rooms
Single - 8,500cfa
Double - 10,000cfa
AC rooms
Single - 13,500cfa
Double - 15,000cfa

name: MTN Connect
description: Get an MTN SIM for 250cfa and credit from 1Gb for 7,000cfa to unlimited for 25,000cfa. Passport needed and they will photograph you. Otherwise very easy.

name: Benin Checkout
description:
The border is not obvious as you arrive but if you go the wrong way plenty of helpers will guide you through at a cost. If you head to this location you can avoid the need for their assistance. The main road that looks like it should be used for the border crossing is not, but it is not too far from there.

Corrupt officials asked for 10,000cfa per bike to allow them to exit, this is false, just wait it out and get the stamp.

name: Auberge le Bonheur
description: Cheap little hostel, clean room with shower for 7000 cfa. Ideal for those crossing the border with Nigeria the next day.

name: Super U Erevan (supermarket)
description: Very big supermarket, sells all different foods (European). Also break cleaner, chain oil and more stuff for motorcycle or car etc.

name: Hotel l'entente
description: Rooms with AC for 20000 CFA. Secure parking for 2 or 3 motorcycles. Central Cotonou close to embassies and restaurants.

name: Benin-Nigeria
description: easy bordercrossing. they issue 30 days visas without hassle. which seemed to be the problem at the more northern and southern border crossing.

name: Python Temple
description:
Small Temple with some sleeping Pythons. Honestly there is not much to see, feels like a touristic ripp-off.
Entrance 1.000 CFA pP. Camera 2.000 CFA. Not worth it...

name: Ganvie Stilt Village
description:
Ganvie is a Town built on Stilt Huts 8 km out on the Lake. You can't reach the Village by Road, it's a Boat only Tour. On Arrival they wanted us to pay 20.100 CFA for two People... The official Sign says 5.050 CFA pP "including all services". We negogiated hard and ended up with the 5.050 Transport pP plus a Guide for 2.000 (thy won't let you go without). Parking was 1.000.

To sum it up: we paid 13.100 CFA for 2 People on a 1,5 Hours Tour out on the Lake to the Village and back. It was very nice and definitely worth it.

name: Bush Camp
description: Quite Place in the Bushes, some 100 m away from the Street. Some friendly Locals passed by, all relaxed.

name: Bush Camp
description: Take the Dirt Track leading away from the Main Street. It's hidden behind some Trees. Only two friendly Locals passed, no Problem.

name: Benin Border
description: Friendly Border, no Money. Waited until 10.30 and called several times until  Customs got up and arrived at the Office to stamp the Carnet. By the Way: it's a nice and almost perfect paved Road from Cotonou up to Nikki and until the Border.

name: Nigeria Border
description: Nice and friendly, no Money. Carnet got stamped without Problems.

name: Confidence hotel
description: We stayed at the parking lot of this hotel for 3000CFA with our 4x4. We could use the shower and toilet in a room. The hotel was once really nice but is a bit deserted now but good enough for a place to stay before crossing the border of Nigeria. The manager and his wife are also really nice.

name: Customs
description: Let your carnet stamp here! At the border it is not possible because there is no custom.

name: Big Bike Mechanic "Faustin"
description: A good big bike mechanic who got lots of parts in stock. Also helmets, gloves etc. He is also the coordinator of the west african biker club, so he can link you up with people all over west Africa. Basically THE guy to talk to if you need anything for your bike in Benin.

name: La guesthouse
description:
Nice and quiet place, safe parking.  8500 p/p or 12000 for 2, communal showers with cold water. Free basic breakfast.
Chantal will cook you a meal in the evening.  The owner is very helpful and it is well located.
Highly recommended.

name: Consulat du Togo
description: New address for the consulat. You can get 1 or 2 months visa here.

name: La guesthouse
description:
Very nice and friendly. You can park your bike or your car safely. 
8500 per person, 12500 for 2 with breakfast.  Communal toilet and shower, meal available.

name: Hotel Le Soleil
description: Clean, spacious rooms with bathroom in a quiet side street. We paid 17.000 franc per night. Very friendly and professional staff. TV and internet worked fine. Occasional power cuts because of the rain. We got to park in the locked garage which fit our Land Rover with tent and all sorts of things on the roof like a glove.

name: Hotel Grillardin
description: Nice hotel with restaurant and pool (although not sure if the water is realy clean to swim in), near busy road. Very vriendly staff. We stayed here for one night and were allowed to camp on the parkinglot in our camper for 5000 cfa. Shower and toilet in a room with even warm water. Very clean! Good priced restaurant too.

name: Chez John
description: Hotel in Niki close to the border of Nigeria, with rooms for 5000, 10000 or 15000 cfa. More expensive rooms have king sized beds (at least really big). No restaurant but the staff will help you with every request and can deliver dinner. We had the cheapest room with toilet and bucket shower. The owner of the hotel, John, can help to change cfa for niara. Ask for him by the staff.

name: Dantokpa market
description:
Very authentic African market. 

They sell absolutely everything here. Has a voodoo/fetish part aswell (bigger than the one in Togo and more authentic). 
Just ask the locals where to find it, the place is a labyrinth so we don't remember where. 

However they still want money if you take photos...

name: Hotel Oscar & Henriette
description:
Rooms from 5000-15000.
10 000 for double room. Typical cheap african hotel room. However the parking is very secure and they let us dry our rooftent (which got wet after leaving the door open in rain). 

Rooms have shower and toilet, not very clean but okay for one night if leaving for Nigeria next day.

name: Route des pêches
description: Very beautiful road linking Ouidah and Fidjrosse (Cotonou). Many wild camp possibilities along this route as well.

name: Cascade Tanagou
description: A campement at the cascade parking. Friendly people and they said camping would be 3000 cfa/tent. They have a restaurant and the cascades are great for swimming. There is also a 1000/cfa/person ticket to visit the cascades.

name: Chutes de Kota
description: There is a sort of campement here but it was completely closed and no person around the whole night into the morning. The parking lot made a great campsite and it was nice and cool up here. Pit toilets. Also the cascade is nice to visit, but not too special. There's a sign saying it's 500cfa to visit the falls but so far no one to collect any money from us. Some security a few km back on the road wanted a gift though.

name: Benin Immigration for entrance AND exit
description: Come here to get your immigration services for Benin as well as your exit stamp when leaving the country.

name: Kloto Land
description: I visited Mt Kloto in the morning after spending the night camped at Auberge Nectar (also good and 3000 for 2). There is a campement at the very top of the mountain with some nicely painted bungalows for 5000 and they said camping would be 2500. Great views from a flat area with some shade shelters. You can make a fire. The guys were friendly. They have drinks and a kitchen so probably they can cook for you if you want. I would have stayed here if I had known about it. Phone number is 97886421 for the camp and 99609118 for Edmond the manager.

name: Consulat Cameroun
description:
This is the official representive of cameroun in Cotonou Benin. It’s close to Saint Luc hospital, it’s located on a dirtroad on the first floor. You’ll see the flag. The phone nr is.
+229 97 91 3712 or +229 66 93 82 59. Do never listen to somebody named Alain, he is a fake representend and is not working for them. Even if the people at the Nigeria tell you to call Alain.

name: Nigerian Embassy
description: Note this could not work out for you so at your own risk. After filing in the online visa application on www.immigration.gov.ng and did the online payment. Watch out your visacard or mastercard must have the same name as the visa application. Otherwise you can’t complete the payment. Print out everything. Make sure you have your Cameroun visa we got ours in Cotonou as well. Copy all your passport pages and add to the application. Make a travelplan where you have been so far and where you go. Print out as well and add. The payment online is different for each country and there was a extra fee of $20 so we paid $108 for a 30day tourist visa. Bring everything to the embassy when you completed everything and hope for the best.

name: hotel de la Diaspora
description:
Hotel nad bungalows on the beach. Prices from 13000 to 36000 CFA.
Restaurant, swimming pool. Rooms are clean. TV, Wi-Fi, AC or fan. Near to the "Gate of no return" and the museum. Few local bars, and souvenir shops.

name: prestige plazza
description:
Quite clean hotel. Rooms from 11000 CFA
TV, Wi-Fi - yes, but didn't work. AC or fan, clean bathroom. Restaurant.
There is another, cheaper hotel next to plazza (rooms from 7000) but more in african standard.

name: Hotel Les Relais du Soleil
description:
Beautiful hotel complex with gardens towards the end of the town, very well kept and maintained.
We stayed overnight in a clean, friendly double room in a bungalow with bathroom and TV for 19.000 CAF. There is ample parking space inside the compound, as well as a bar and restaurant. There was not much business when we were there; people were very friendly; maybe you could also sleep in the car or roof tent, but we did not ask. In the morning, chicken and ducks came waddling by.

name: Motorcycle mechanic
description:
I am seeing him tomorrow after my motorcycle broke. It is probably the water pump that needs changing.

He seemed experienced with big bikes. Mobile number +229 97476556.

name: Tata Koubetti hôtel et restaurant
description:
Nice tata house style hotel with fanned and AC rooms. They have a restaurant too. Big room clean room with 3-4 beds and AC for 15000XFO.
Family owned. Very friendly.

name: Gabon Embassy
description:
Easy process. 55,000 for next day service 65,000 for the same day service. For one month single entry. We could pick the date start date. Very friendly. Speak English well. 

2 photos, 
Vehicle registration 
Asked if we had yellow fever 

Very easy. We chose same day. It was done in an hour.

name: CFAO Auto - Big Toyota and Yamaha dealer
description:
Very modern service center with proper diagnostic equipment. Great for Toyota’s. There is a yamaha dealer there too and mechanics. They sell and service WR400s so they probably know about big bikes too. 

They helped us get a new battery for one of our KLRs. Very nice people, they called around and found a new battery for us even though we weren’t using them for service. Speak English well.

name: Republic of Congo Consulate
description: Got our congo-brazza visa here. 1 photo and a hotel booking. Took less than an our. Visa price list attached in photo.

name: Anonyme Bar
description: Cheap and good African maquis bar, healthy portion of rice and vegetables starting from 500cfa

name: Otammari ecolodge & Tour
description:
Traditionnal tatastyle ecolodge. Rooms with fan, electricity and private bathroom. Price from 9.000 CFA - 15.000 CFA.
Restaurant and bar with cool drinks.
Local guides for traditionnal tata houses visits. Bikes renting (5.000 CFA/ day) and other touristic activities avaliable on request. (from 1hour to 1day)
Friendly staff. 
contact: +229 97 35 02 86 (Mr Parfait, local association president)
+229 67 46 78 01 (ecolodge) Reservation recommended.
www.ecobenin.org/koussoukoingou
laperledelatacora@yahoo.fr

name: Pendjari Camping
description: Official camping spot for the park. View point on the lake and hippo company during the night.

name: Allianz Benin Assurances SUUN
description: Here I was able to get a new Cedeao insurance for my bike, I just needed 15 days to cross Nigeria. price 12.000 cfa, cheaper if longer.

name: La galette a sucre
description: Very good coffee shop at a very good price in what is an expensive area. Popular with the locals too. Recommend trying this place!

name: Open space in bush
description: Leave track at 10.14875, 2.26840 and follow the footpath into the bush for about 100m. Leave the footpath and turn right. It's a bit tight between the trees and rocks, but possible. You'll find an open space of flat land with some small rocks at 10.15036, 2.26889. Enough space for 10-15 motorcycles with tents! Well hidden from track, but can here traffic (not much passing through). Possible to be seen from footpath; however, position camp spot closer to track and the bush is more dense providing natural cover. Only suitable for motorcycles or smaller. No MTN signal here. Lots of small flies.

name: Centre Pastoral Guy Riobe
description: Religious center that provides accommodation. Travelling with motorcycle, 5500 CFA per night, one room, two beds (with mosquito nets), wardrobe, table and chair, ensuite bathroom, cold shower that works well, bucket, sink with mirror and light, toilet (flushes), single ceiling fan. Security guard very close to motorcycle and car parking. Lots of space for parking. Internet was slow. Good value for money. There is a restaurant but not sure if it's open. I ate at the many street vendors near the round about.

name: Auberge de l’union
description: Nice hotel! A room for 2 people with fan; CFA 7000. Also available VIP rooms with aircon  for CFA 15.000.

name: chez Vincent
description:
Vincent is Italian and prepares real and delicious Italian pizzas. We do not choose, we taste everything he prepares. And for the payment, we leave what we want.
Open Saturday evening and Sunday lunch only

name: Saveurs d'Afrique, Grand Popo, Benin
description:
- delicious restaurant facing the ocean, feet in the sand, under the large hut. Average price of the meal 5000 fcfa
  - some rooms with personalized decoration
- camping at the edge of the water under the coconut trees. Price 5000 fcfa / night

name: Auberge d'Abomey
description:
hotel, restaurant and shady campsite in its park.
- hotel, rooms between 13000 and 21000 fcfa, with air conditioning
- restaurant, average price between 2000 and 5000 fcfa for a complete and hearty dish
- camping 5000 fcfa night for 2 with his vehicle
- for the Abomey visit, contact Victorien Ahonha, good English / French / Spanish speaking guide, competent and available at 95 10 00 92 or on WhatsApp 97 64 74 60

name: bivouac en bord du fleuve Oumé
description:
Wild camp, very quiet, overlooking the Oueme river
Very friendly visit of the family living in front.

name: Centre SONGHAI, Porto Novo,. proche Cotonou
description:
Industrial farm created by a Franciscan father. (several daily tours offered)
With rooms, restaurant, sale of the products of the farm.
Secure parking.
Possibility of parking for self contained vehicles
Very reasonable prices are available but not guaranteed.

name: Eco Ferme Maktub, chez Armand, Dassa Zoume
description:
Farm inn in a small paradise of greenery
Armand and his wife welcome you warmly.
