Bungalows from 10000 fcfa
Dormitories at 5000 fcfa
Delicious meal with farm products.
Small secure parking.
Ability to bivouac in his vehicle.

name: Marial, Dassa Zoumé
description:
possible accommodation in rooms
possibility of to camp in the park (ask permission to Father Abbot)

name: Mahouna clinique
description:
Descent small Clinique for medical tests. Malaria blood tests for example.
15,000 cfa / consultation.
the laboratory is next to the Clinique, so it's rather fast : 15,000 additional for various blood tests.

name: benin visa customs nigeria visa on arrival customs
description: at this location 2 buildings on opposite sides of street we checked out of Benin and checked into Nigeria. This is also where nigeria visa on arrival person will escort you to the airport for your visa. we were here on a sunday so very slow had to tell people what to do. escort guy rides in your vehicle and you pay for his taxi back. not sure what the other ioverlander locations are about.

name: Loving hut - vegetarian restaurant
description: Nice little vegetarian restaurant near the Toyota mechanics also marked on ioverlander. We had charwarma goldenage (veggies and seitan) + 2x salads and a pineapple juice for 5,000 CFA (large meal for two for £6).

name: restaurant BIERGARTEN sur la plage, Cotonou, Benin
description:
Restaurant on a Cotonou beach
Tables on a dune, overlooking the ocean and the harbor.
Grilled fish and meat.
Pizza.
Doris (finally a woman entrepreneur) welcomes us very pleasantly.
She knows her country and Europe well and we must encourage discussion because she is really very interesting.
---
Restaurant sur une plage de Cotonou
Tables sur une dune, avec vue sur l'océan et sur le port.
Grillades de poisson et de viandes.
Pizza.
Doris (enfin une femme chef d''entreprise) nous accueille très agréablement.
Elle connait bien son pays et l'europe et il faut susciter la discussion car elle est vraiment très intéressante.

name: Atelier d'Arolando et Soniart
description: Chez Arolando et Soniart. A young family of artists who have escaped a life in the street, in the bad sense of the term, taking their responsibility intelligently. Extremely friendly and united, they can guide you in the city and on various tourist sites of the surroundings. They are ready to welcome you on the ground of their workshop in the bush. Even if the equipment is more than rudimentary. It is possible to plant your tent or park your vehicle there to spend the night. They intend to develop the site but it will take time. It is certainly more comfortable to stay at l'Auberge d'Abomey or Chez Monique not far away, but a visit to Arolando, Soniart and their two children, Toto and Marie is worth it. And help them in their social activities for street children.

name: Embassy of Ivory Coast
description:
You can get a visa to Ivory Coast here.
44 000 Cfa
Ready next day by 4 pm.
You need:
- 2 photos
- copy of documents of the car (instead of flight ticket)
- passport
- copy of reservations of the hotel

name: Baila restaurant
description:
Very good shawarma for 2000 cfa.
They also have pizzas (5-6000), burgers etc.
Good quality for the price.

name: Ghana Embassy
description:
You can easily get transit visa here.
10 000 cfa for 48h visa.
You have to enter within one month since the date of issue.
Ready in 2 days, but we asked and we got it the next day.
You need:
- 4 photos
- 4 forms
- Copy of passport
- Copy of benin visa
- Explanation letter that you drive by car, where you transit to and why you don't have visa to ivory coast yet
- Copy of documents of the car, just in case.

You can apply Mon-Thur 9.00-12.00 am
Picking up documents only 2-2.30 pm

You enter Ghana on this transit visa but if you want to stay longer you will pay a fine 80 cedi, which is 15 euro when exit. Official price from Ghanian website (attached photo).

If you need photocopy I put it on ioverlander.

name: Craft centre
description: Center of local artists with many souvenirs.

name: Local cheese
description:
Local white cow milk cheese, recommended by our friend who is living in the village since many years. We tried it fresh and fried with spices. Both delicious. Mhhhmm!
2000 cfa for 4 really big pieces.
The place is on the private property. You have to leave car and take short walk. When you'll enter the gate you will see how they make it.

name: Maquis le tata
description: Great local restaurant, bit like western style but with African food. Inexpensive food. Close to Cameroon embassy

name: Hôtel Sabou
description:
Hotel next to a bar/restaurant. Rooms are very clean and nice. You can park in the compound.

Double (same sex): 7500 CFA
Single: 5000 CFA

name: Ktv Hotel
description:
Huge complex with a lot of space, looks like it‘s made for camping. looks a little bit rundown from outside, but rooms look nice although no windows, clean, calm. There is also a bar/restaurant

double room with fan is 7500 CFA

name: Hibiscus
description:
Relatively big hotel with a nice garden, even some good places for camping. Simple but clean rooms with balcony. When I left in the morning somebody cleaned my car.

Rooms with fan 10‘500 CFA (but I could haggle down to 8‘500 CFA for a double room).
13‘500 for a room with AC.

name: Paradis du Soleil
description:
Camping right at the beach. Lovely place with a lot of trees. Very nice owner and family. He is called "Blacky“ and he is rastafari. He can provide you with everything.
There is a kitchen with a cool place for bbq. We just went to the fishermen to buy fresh fish for dinner.

No fixed price for camping. Electricity available. 
Telephone number: +22966779161

name: Lion's Bar
description: Really nice, chilled place right on the beach. Run by a Rasta. double rooms with fan and mosquito net are 5000. Shared shower and toilet and camping 2500. Food is 2500. Good place to relax for a few days. The owner keeps the place really clean.

name: Guide for voodoo villages and ceremonies
description: Possibly the most hardworking guide in West Africa, Marc managed to pack into 1 day more than we usually manage in a month! Marc speaks English and French. He charged 5000 per person for full day for groups, 10,000 for single person. It really is a full day, we started at 9.30 and finished at 5.30pm (he was still going strong, we had to say we needed a rest!) There are also entrance fees to pay, for priest was 2000 pp (possibly more if not in a group), for church 2000 pp, fetish market free but if you want to take photos expect to pay around  2000, underground village (think around 2000 but don’t recall exactly). We also paid 2000 pp to the voodoo priest for attending the ceremony, it is more if you want to take photos, we decided not to. He can be contacted on whatsapp 00 229 96 36 1158 or his number for calls is 00 229 95 76 4642 or ask in auberge abomey.

name: Hotel La Joie
description: Seems like a fairly recently built hotel. A small room with a double bed and fan, with ensuite 6000cfa. Clean room, friendly people. There is a restaurant, but I went out for food. Secure parking.

name: Chez M
description: Great affordable accommodation next to the Ganvie stilt village. The patron, Boulot, knows everyone there is to know who works in the local tourism sector and so can hook you up with a great deal to visit the local area. Rooms start from 5000. Highly recommended.

name: Hotel Tropicana
description: Traditional yet very clean and modern bungalows. Rooms with AC (17.000cfa) or fan (12.000cfa). Super nice staff. Ask for Zita (+229-97457666). Restaurant and bar, beach very close to the hotel.

name: Near Road
description: Next to the road you will see a big rock surface. Go past the surface on the right side, go down a little and you see a rock sticking out of the ground 0,5 m, a perfect place to sit. Behind this plateau there are some trees, I went around them on the right side, and there was a nice grass spot. I heard some voices, but never saw anyone here till I was back on the road. Great place between lavendel. Have fun!

name: Auberge La Joie de Livre
description: Cheapest room is 5500 CFA with fan and cold shower. Not the most beautiful room, but it's quiet. There is a nice restaurant next to the auberge, run by a French couple, which is open in morning till evening and have good prices and good standard food.

name: KTM Benin
description:
A French run business. 
Joris is in charge, very friendly French guy, fluently with English and Chinese. 
Many new KTMs here. Also many accessories include cloths, helmets and protection. 
Synthetic oil, clean spray, Oil filter ...etc. 
It’s definitely a MUST stop place if you are on a long haul journey from Europe. Professional workshop is onsite. 
Motul synthetic oil is available: 5w30 , 10w40, 10w50, 15w50, 15w60

name: Motel
description: A decent motel with friendly owner. Room with double bed, fan and bucket shower for 5000 CFA. There is a bar with drinks, but food must be get in the village, to which the owner will take you with his motor.

name: Visa extension
description:
Here is where get your Benin visa extension .
See Picture.

name: Museum
description: This is a museum about the Abomey history, it's inside one of the many palaces around, but here they artifacts of former kings and explain the different compartments in the complex, including a few voodoo related burials. There is an English guide. Entrance fee is removed, but they ask for a gift to clean the place. I paid 1500 CFA as gift and another 2000 CFA for the guide as a tip.

name: Voodoo church
description: This Voodoo church is a huge chameleon, symbol of one of the former kings. You can go here for 2000 CFA, but can't enter the church. To make pictures, you need to pay 500 CFA. You pay to a person from the priest house, with the leopard statues, which is also nice to see.  There are no guides here, but when you are in Abomey you can find one who will take you here and to other places.

name: Auberge
description: I paid 5000 CFA for one person, one night in room with fan, shower, toilet and double bed. Tiny, clean place and could store bicycle inside. There is a bar and restaurant next to the auberge, but food was not so much, so I went for another big meal across the big road on the right side.

name: Chinese massage
description: 20000 per hour. Good one for long haul journey.

name: Museum of Ouidah
description:
The museum is currently closed and undergoing renovation... we were not told when it will be open again.

Entrance is free, but they expect a fee. Good guide and interesting things to see about slave trade, voodoo and the link between Benin and Brazil. It's inside the formal Portuguese fort. I was guided by Oscar, who speaks English well.

name: Place to eat dog meat
description: If you dare- this is the place to eat dog-meat. Enjoy it!

name: Centre de Formation Liweitari CFL
description: This is a swiss aid project that trains young people in various professions (car mechanic, polymechanic, metal worker, electrician, carpenter). This is the reason why they have very good machines and specialist knowledge on the spot. So it is a good address if you have something to repair.

name: Voodoo Market
description: Location of the main Voodoo stalls within massive market- pretty disgusting!

name: Tour Eiffel Hotel
description: Paid 13500 cfa for room with AC and private bathroom. Extra large bed. Very clean. 1 breakfast included. Perfect for one night before passing the Nigeria border. Easy in/out town. Wi fi. Has a large covered garage/car port so perfectly secure for bikes. Can fit a couple of cars too. Quiet area.

name: Notre Dame & Librairie Notre Dame
description: Check out the cool red and white Notre Dame cathedral. Just next door is a well stocked French bookstore. A great place to find some Benin literature. The employees are very friendly and helpful. The place also sells a wide variety of stationary/school and office supplies.

name: El Dorado Beach Club
description: They created a cove so that you can swim in the ocean without eating pounded by the huge waves. There is a very large sandy beach with little bamboo hut things you can sit under for shade. If you want one in the first row you have to pay (don’t bother!) but the rest are free. The swimming is lovely. Entry is 1,500 francs per person. There is a pool but you have to pay an additional 500 to use it. There is a restaurant and bar as well but we brought our own snacks and water. Really lovely place to spend a day relaxing! Bring your book.

name: UBA ATM
description: A good place to pull out cash here in Ouidah. This is also a lovely area to walk around!

name: Carved tree
description: There is a huge old carved tree in this square. This is in the heart of downtown Ouidah and a great place to walk around. The ATM is right here (only 2 in town) and you can buy all kinds of food and also water. There is a fruit vendor in this square with everything under the sun, and if you walk to the bank and look around that corner you will see tons of other vendors. It is a lovely walk from here to the sacred garden.

name: Sacred Forest
description: Very small but beautiful. It’s 1100 francs each for entry, an extra 2,000 if you want to take photos. There are guides available. The French guide was super kind, he said guides are free but it is recommended that you donate what you can. We asked for the English guide, but he was demanding 2,000 francs for his services. He began guiding us before this was fully established and we didn’t enjoy his services. The park is pretty small, he was telling us about the sculptures in it but it didn’t seem necessary. It was nice to amble around ourselves. The trees are so beautiful. I recommend using this as a starting point, then walking directly down the street in front of the entrance and into town. A lovely walk.

name: Book market
description: Tons of vendors selling books. English, French, educational, anything.

name: Market
description: Nice place to walk around and haggle for some fresh food.

name: Vegan restaurant
description: Totally plant based delicious food! We came in the evening and had a weird experience at first... they tried to give us the “VIP menu” where everything is considerable marked up, but we were lucky enough to have glimpses the other one so we insisted on looking at that (it’s green). The lighting is crazy weird! Just a blue light- so hard to see. The staff was quite rude and unhelpful, we had so many questions about the menu which went unanswered. We persevered, however, and the food was great! We got the charwama (1,200) and riz à la salade with added vegan meat (1,500) and loved them. We came back the next day for lunch. The atmosphere was much nicer for lunch, we didn’t interact with the staff as much so I’m not sure if that changes. 4 stars only because of how weird the atmosphere and customer service was last night.

name: Black River & Vagnon Village tour
description: Come check out the cute village of Adjarre and hop on a small river boat to another village where local women produce palm wine. We paid 4,000 francs for the boat and 2,000 to the local women.

name: Town of Adjarra
description: We paid 1000 francs for two of us to ride a moto here from Porto Novo. This cute little town is known for its production of tam-yams. You can tour a facility and learn about the process of making them, take a drumming lesson, and also take a boat onto the small black river to an even smaller village where women produce different varieties of palm wine. A local approaches us in the village and led us down to the river where his friend gave us the boat trip for 4000 francs. We paid the women in the village 2,000 francs because they talked to us for a while, let us try the wine and let us take pictures. Super nice!

name: Abomey central market
description: Abomey central market. Browse food, drinks, fabrics and everything else under the sun.

name: Grille Tarifaire
description: Amazingly cheap restaurant! The food is tasty and so affordable. They serve breakfast lunch and dinner. We were able to eat a totally plant based meal no problem, they have a very tasty tomato sauce for rice and pasta. Check out the photo of the menu.

name: Climb one of Dassa’s Hills
description: To get to the base ask for directions to the Palais Royale. Follow the path through the village up the mountain, keep to the left to stay on the path and avoid walking into people’s homes. You will need to climb up some slippery rocks. We had no problem whatsoever and did it in sandals, but good footwear would help. We sat on the well shaded roof of an abandoned structure at the top by the baobab tree for hours- even took a nap. It was lovely. You do NOT need a guide, you do not need to pay anything. Apparently you can also climb the other hill across the road, but we didn’t.

name: Auberge BK hotel
description: We (a couple) got a very nice room for 6,000 per night. When we first arrived, the manager told us 8,000 but when we tried to leave to look for somewhere cheaper she gave us the room for 6,000. We did not eels hotel meals because they were too expensive instead we took a moto to town for 400 and ate at the main roundabout. The last night we were here they let us use their kitchen to cook our own dinner. They sell large bottles of water (ask for fifa) for the usual price of 500, so you can get your water here.

name: Dody’s Pizza & Lebanese
description: We were looking for some decent vegetarian food and we hit the jackpot! This place has tons of salads, pizzas, pastas, meat dishes, a Lebanese menu and a ton of desserts. Comfortable atmosphere too. Not cheap, but not outrageous. Tonight we ate pizza and salad, tomorrow we’re coming back for fattoush and falafel wraps.

name: Chez Guillaume
description: A little watery recommended by our hotel. We were impressed by all of the veg/vegan options on their menu, including veggie tagine, various pizzas and pounded yam with peanut sauce. We both got the tagine with couscous and potato’s on the side, it was nice. Prices are pretty average for this type of place- we paid 2,500 each. Portions are large- we could have ordered half as much food and been fine.

name: Chutes de Kota
description: Lovely waterfall and swimming hole. It’s 500 per person to enter. You can hike around, chill by the pool, swim and even jump/swing off the cliff. We spent a lovely afternoon here. Paid our motos (we took one each) 1,500 to bring us here from town, wait for us and bring us back.

name: Pendjari Lodge
description: Main hotel in the park, and for now the only one. Rooms (tents) are pretty steep at 70,000 per night, but we managed to convince them to allow us to have 4 people in one. Super nice spot, very comfortable and relaxing. We saw elephants, warthogs, multiple types of antelopes and a ton of baboons from our tent during the day between safari outings.

name: Pendjari National Park Main Gate
description: This is where you enter the park and pay your fees. I will update this description with everything you need to know about visiting Pendjari.

name: Hotel Kantaborifa
description: Cheap and cheerful. We paid 6,500 for a room. We had to negotiate only a bit to get this price. Stayed here before and after visiting Pendjari. They have food but we didn’t eat there because there are so many better cheaper options near by. They offer laundry services which we did use, and they fixed both of my partners pairs of shoes. The location is so, so good. They also helped us find our guide for Pendjari. Definitely would recommend if you are looking for a cheap, very simple place to stay.  Clean room, double bed, cold shower but they will heat water on the stove if you ask, nice internal courtyard to sit in, always someone at the front desk.

name: Chez Sabine
description: Perfect little peaceful B&B with a lovely owner. After a long day on the motorcycle Sabine drove us around town with her car, organized a English speaking guide who took us to a voodoo festival in the evening. She cooks good food, takes care about everything. Speaks only French though. Highly recommend! Gated Safe parking inside right in front of the rooms.

name: Che Edith
description: Basic but lovely warm and friendly hostess is Edith and her welcoming family. No WiFi and basic clean room with fan. 7k CFA. The energy is good. Authentic warm vibe and cold beer and restaurant.

name: take care
description:
Warning: We stopped here to enjoy the lake, at some meters of the it. Nice view, but really dirty, full of plastic and rubbish. At the beginning everything was ok. But later 3 men came: if we wanted to sleep here we had to pay. We didn't want to sleep here, but we really thought first they must clean the place, and after ask money for sleep.
But later, when we were ready to go, I took my camera to take some pictures of the lake. They shouted us and became very aggressive because they said that we could not take pictures of the lake. Crazy. We discussed a little bit and after we went to another place.

name: Saar Assurances
description: Price for 2 month, Toyota LC, 4,2liters, brown card: 32.000CFA

name: Casa del Papa
description:
Really we were very disappointed. By phone they told us that on Sunday they had a super free buffet for 10.000. We arrived and they offered us a small piece of chicken, one sausage and one small piece of fish. With some rice and chips. And only this. No buffet. We declined everything and only paid the beer (3.000) and a bottle of water (1.500). 
The rooms were a little bit old. Very exepensive in our opinion.
We will never come back.

name: Taneka Beri commune de Copargo
description:
Taneka Beri is a Foundation to protect Taneka people way of life. You can visit the vilage for 3000CFA pp. We camp here for free, after doing the visit, and they open us a bungalow for bucket shower. You can also stay at the bungalows for 5.500 each room. Food available, but ask for price.
For contact: Latif (Fundation Manager) +229 97 05 50 70. He can meet you at Copargo.

name: Camp
description: New Camp at Pendjari National Park. Cost 10.000 cfa pppn. Dificult to find the way . toilet and shower

name: Hotel Les Canaris
description: Nice family run long established hotel. Friendly people. Cold beers available. Simple rooms with a fan for 6.000 CFA per night. Reasonable clean and parking on the compound. If you like a descent meal you can walk to the nearby Hotel Majestic. Probably the best restaurant in town, but not cheap; main course 4.000 CFA.

name: Villa Karo
description: A small gallery paying tribute to Mami Wata (vodun mother of water) with many beautiful old sculptures in her image. Free entry it seems when we visited.

name: Musee du Vodoun de Porto-Novo
description:
Privately owned museum that displays a large range of artefacts related mostly to vodoun but also slavery and other historical aspects of Benin and neighbouring countries. Owner, Youssoufou is a passionate collector and gave a very detailed guide through the displays. Without any government support he relies on foot traffic to finance the museum. 

Cost is 2000cfa for an adult. 

He is looking to open a guest house in a very grand space upstairs but this is likely for mid 2020. Contact them first at yousadekp@gmail.com or 97134956.

name: Garage : Alex Casse (pièces détachées)
description: For Mitsubishi, Peugeot... Plenty of secondhand pieces.

name: Visit stilt village Aguégués by boat
description: Here you can rent a boat for CFA 15.000 to visit the stilt village. You can call Mr. Marcel at +22996346935

name: Musée Ethnographique de Porto Novo
description: Interesting museum with lots of ceremonial masks and showing traditions around birth, life and death. Salif, really good English speaking guide available. No entrance fee, but a small tip is expected.

name: Hotel Tahití
description: A very nice place, price of 50e per night and two people, closed and secure parking. The owner's name is Marcos, he is very friendly and has helped us in everything he could. good place and good restaurant

name: Sun City Hotel
description: Comfortable hotel in nice and quiet compound, AC rooms, cold water, I paid 12k CFA for one person occupying a double room on the second floor. Asking price was 15k but I negotiated it down. First floor could be even cheaper.

name: Fondation Zinsou
description: Just visited the foundation today. The museum has been closed since December 2019 and is not planning to be opened anytime soon in Cotonou. The staff here says that there's a museum in Ouida that’s currently open. What’s left of the museum here is just a shop of books and textiles. It also acts as a cafe, although the cafe staff is not very friendly. When I asked if there’s a book about the museum history (since the museum is closed and I came all the way), they pointed me to a book. However, to sit down and read it, they demanded me to buy something to drink at the cafe. Or I could not use the chairs and had to stand. There was no other customer and all seats were empty. In the end, I had to stand there glancing through the book. This experience left a rather bad taste in the mouth and in my few contradictory to what the foundation is about - advocating the art of Africa. For future visitors, it may best visit the museum in Ouida.

name: Zone 5 House
description: New Hostel in Cotonou, Fidjrossé, managed by young people.  We are located in the center of Fidjrossé. We have private room and dormitory for the night, and also a bar for the week end 300 meters from home. A good place to meet local and travelers.

name: Zone 5 House
description: New Hostel in the center of Fidjrossè managed by two young guys  . We have private rooms and dormitory for the night .and also a bar located 300 meters from home. Best place to meet people, locals and travelers .

name: Dantokpa to Ganvie
description:
This moto boat is for locals who wanna go and return between Djidje(Dantokpa) and Ganvie.
15-20 persons a boat, 500cf pp.
the manager is a 23yo boy, called Omo Gogo.
two boats per day.
departure time:
1st around 12-13pm,
2nd around 16-17pm.
1 hour on the way.

if wanna return Dantokpa from Ganvie, should be in the morning, 8-9am.that's meaning should stay a night in Ganvie.

if wanna leave Ganvie to Calavi, before night even 17pm have the moto boat which have taken tourist from Calavi and will return. 500-1000cf pp, depend on how many persons on the boat.

i stayed a night in Ganvie, next day 17pm took a moto boat to calavi, 1000cf.

locals always 500cf.

name: Bar le pantheon
description:
the owner was so nice, allowed me camping in her Bar for free, but here without bathroom or any place for shower.
could charge phone and enjoyed the whole night after 11pm.
NOT BAD

name: Lebanon Restaurant
description: camped in the restaurant for a night, free and good location, owners were friendly.

name: Chez Houssou
description:
here has the best roasted pork in Benin!!!
local and delicious..
yum..yum..yum

name: Local ferry through Black river
description:
only 500cf for go and return.
and is the way to Wamon village.

name: Yam Pile
description: This was my favourite restaurant for Yam pile, they open every morning, have lamb, pork, chicken meat. For me it was more delicious than the other one which so called the best in Natitingou.

name: Ets OTD & Co.
description: Beautiful surprise this restaurant. We came for dinner and was great.. Rise chicken vegetables and yam chips 1500 fca. They also have cold beer. Staff very nice. If you stay in this village for the night it's better to order two hours in advance.. It's take time to prepare. Very recommended!

name: cafeteria au soir di 14 fevrier
description: Nice place for breakfast but not too early in the morning!! We had omelette and coffe for 600 fca. Good! Nice staff..

name: cafeteria
description: Nice place along the way.. There aren't a lot open for breakfast. The lady was very nice and prepared eggs with bread and coffee. A lot of tables and clean restaurant.. The kitchen is open air.. Maybe it's better not to look inside too much

name: Chez Maman Benin
description: Good tradicional restaurant with tradicional food. They have small buffet and you could choose what you want in your dish. meal around  7000 CFA and beer beninoise 1200CFA

name: Manneken Beach
description:
Nice place, good vibe. I am with motorbike, rooms available for 8000 cfa. nice bar, lounge and good food and beer.. next to see. the owners are from Belgium.  parking inside the gate, so secure. 
Also possibilities for camping.

name: le zion
description: simple guesthouse with 9 rooms,, nice courtyard and small terrace, bar, restaurant, ablutionblock ok, double room 4400 cfa pn, 6400 cfa with shower

name: Pavillon Vert
description: They said 9.900 cfa wıth fan and share bathroom. 14.900 cfa with private bathroom. Parking is so narrow, not for camper. Mosquitos are crazy here. They have wifi but so slow. Food is ok and start price 1500 for sandwichs. Anyway good and safe location to stat one or two days

name: Campement Kegnigohi, Lac Tengrela, Banfora, Burkina Faso
description:
Canoe trips currently cancelled. see other notes

Camping 2500CFA per night, friendly staff that can arrange boat trips on the lake.Meals available in restaurant. Running water/shower & electricity. They also have rondavels /vcottages on site. Liza & Jason

name: Campement Des Cascade, Banfora, Burkina Faso
description: 3000cfa but I think they make the price up as they go. Tried for 10,000 at first. Pretty spot &5 minute walk to Cascades de Karfiguéla

name: Auberge Awadi, Bobo-Dioulasso, Burkina Faso
description: Camped in the large, shady carpark area with use of a room for use Shower & Toilet. 5000cfa per night. (Room 7500cfa) Owner is extremely friendly & helpful & the Auberge is very neat & clean.. Large covered outdoor area to hang out on. Liza & Jason

name: Camping le Pharaon
description: 12km outside of Ouagadougou. they sometimes serve food, but definitely nice cold drinks. it's a bit run down, but once known as Ouaga camping. 5,000cfa for 4 in our overland truck (December 2015).

name: Ghana Embassy
description: it's not easy as they place obstacles in your way.

name: Le Pasha
description: Friendly with space for a couple of cars for camping and rooms. Goods toilets and showers. Excellent pizza. 2500 per person.

name: campsite
description: a small campsite and local campment

name: Hotel Villa Rose
description: Lovely spacious hotel that allows camping in there lovely shaded ground, Restaurant & slow wifi. Great staff. Rooms priced from 16000cfa

name: wild camp near Sindou peaks
description:
from here is a nice track you can go by foot to the peaks
Not easy to get to this place. But here we had a sound sleep with direkt view to some of the peaks.
place is on a way for bikes and here it ends.. We did it in the morning. very nice! get to get to this plas with a big truck  is a bit work but possible. Only some pedestrian passed. We asked them and no problem at all to sleep here. very friendly people here!

name: campment de Niansogoni (Dogon village)
description:
from here a footpath is going to the old town in the mountain.  calculate 2 to 3h for it. It's Not a flipflop walk as the 1.5km long path is going to the top of the hill. Visit the old town cost 1000cfa pp.
Mr parfait (a rasta) who is one of the stuff gave us a well guide to the old town. give him what you think it's ok.
Some huts without vent are avaliable for 4000 cfa
we were aloud to camp in our van for 2000cfa for 2 person.
food available for 1000cfa pp witch is very cheap and breakfast for also 1000 cfa witch was to expensive for what we get.
also coke and beer available!
bucket shower and basic toilet.

name: lac Tengrela, Banfora (HIPPOS)
description:
SEE OTHER COMMENTS. CURRENTLY NO CANOE TRIPS



you have to pay 2000cfa pp to visit the lake. The price includes a pirogen drive along the sea with a great chance to see hippos here. Best is early in the morning. We saw some and they were really close to us.
The let us sleep in our van at the sea for free. The night was amazing as some hippos came out of the water in the night. so we hear them that they were really close to our car. Amazing!

name: cascades de karfiguiela
description:
nice to swim here. 
beautiful area. 

pay for entrance and parking

name: auberge niceo
description:
auberge is just new built and not open yet. But the owner let us camp here for free! So we eat here and gave here some money extra.
Very nice and clean place!

name: Nasinga NP
description:
Very expensive entrance fee.
1000 CFA for the car
10000 CFA per person
and 2000 CFA for a camera!

A. safari cost 5000 CFA for 2h and with your own car because they do not have one. That means that they earn money with the car you have to pay before to come in. 
You have to take a guide!
We did not see elefant.  but we were here in November.  Not the best season .

a bungalow cost 15000 CFA and the switch off the power (fan) at 10pm. no mosquito net at the bed!

Also a restaurant is here but also very expensive.
A brakina beer cost here 1400. on other places we payed 600 to 800......
All over I think to expensive for what you get.

They do not allow to camp here in the car. After a 2h discussion they let us sleep in the van but it cost us 5000 CFA.

name: Hotel Unité
description:
Hotel - nothing special. Clean enough room with fan 7,000CFA.
Friendly guy running it let me camp in the big fenced in area for 5,000CFA and let me use a shower and toilet. Not much shade, loud dance music nearby. Cold beer at restaurant, but no food (?)

name: Entente Visa Passport office
description: Got my Visa de entente here! Went there in the morning and got the Visa at 3pm same day. Don't remember what I brought and payed for it, but there was no special need and not expensive. French and a Burkina sim helps a lot! I've used it for Togo and Benin without problems.

name: campament de Sindou
description: Camping was 3000 for 2 and the bungalows are 5000. Great outdoor showers. Plenty of shade. Nice people who left us alone. They can cook for you if you want and cold drinks are available. It's easy to walk to the peaks from here - 10-15 minutes to the entrance.

name: petrol station
description: the petrol they have is just 91 octanes. But still it works well...

name: ATM Societe Generale
description: if you need cash...   this is the place.

name: Burkina Faso Border
description:
Stamped into immigration no problem. didnt want to stamp my Carnet

cheif officer not in uniform and helpful so be careful with potential hustlers. may be officials

name: Hotel de la Liberte
description:
Same French sparking owner (English speaking)

Rooms are from 10k CFA
Camping is possible on the roof for 3k CFA.

Owner very helpful.

name: Auberge Laafia
description:
Very clean and good rooms with bathroom for 5000CFA
You can park the car inside
kind staf

name: Consulate Mali
description: Visa one entry 30.000 cfa. 2 photos and nothing more. Helpfull staff.

name: Casa Africa
description: Is 100 m from the old Casa Africa place. It was a classic overlanders place years ago. The new place is not like the old but is not nice also. Rooms no bathroom for 6000 cfa. Camping permited too. Nice staff.

name: Campament
description:
Lovely campament just in the lake. There are some afican bungallows and overlander are wellcome. 2000 Cfa per Camping Car. You can use toilets and sower. Meals and fresh beer also avaible.
Good place to see Hippos

name: Big Bike Mechanic
description:
Recommended by an expat. Mechanic who deals with big bikes. Clearly knew his business. spoke perfect English

couldn't get steering bearings. but took apart. cleaned and greased them.

did have an oik filter for my bmw though. had a stock of other service items for random bikes and maybe 20 or so big bikes of all makes acting as donor bikes by the looks of it

+226 76 66 64 21

number of the guy

name: Restaurant Dankan
description:
Nice proper restaurant with a varied menu. Rice and sauce 1000 cfa. Meat dishes 4-5000. Good salads too. 

Staff attentive and friendly

name: Pics de Sindou
description:
Very beautiful peaks. Like in western movies. Road from Banfora a tarmac. Take a right as you approach the town. Marked on maps.me

1000 CFA entry
1000 photist
1000 guide for 45minutes

Probably could not bother with a guide. We walked the exact track from maps.me

Location checked in is the parking and ticket booth (shack)

name: Domes - Ticket booth
description:
Ticket booth for the Domes

1000 CFA for a person
I didn't take a guide. You can climb one set that leads away from the covered rest area

150 CFA for parking moto. 300 for cars
Said I couldn't park at the domes. But others did

Could also walk here from cascades. Other wise follow the road through the sugar cane circles. Track is on maps.me

name: McDonald's (not that one)
description:
Luckily (or sadly) just a rip off of the name. Excellent little restaurant. Great menu

Hamburger frites for 1500 cfa and was up there for best burgers I've ever had

Big glass of bissap juice for 400
Cold beers for 800 
Other mains from 1000


I ate here both nights in Banfora. Very recommended

name: Burkina Faso Border
description:
I was exiting Burkina

Took vehicle details again having done so a few km earlier. stamped passport bi fuss. all pretty easy

customs was a little before and obvious. entering Burkina they didn't want to stamp my Carnet so I simply rode slowly around the barricade

name: Mali Immigration
description: I was entering Mali. Easy enough. Vehicle registration and passport stamp on opposite sides of he road. everyone friendly

name: Auberge Thangba Thimii
description:
Its an Auberge but dont come straight here because the owner has one boutique in the town and he is not here waiting for people.

2500sefas the double room per night. Clean enough to sleep. But here there is nothing else.

name: Guigui Family House
description:
We stoped in Guigui and asked for overnight there.

They brought us to the Chief of the Village, to ask for permision and they settled us in a family house.

name: Chez Nassa
description:
Double rooms in 4000 or 6000 sefas. the cheap ones they dont have toilet inside the room.

nothing special, but clean and calm.

name: Nigerian Embassy
description:
without problem, very nice guys.

Polish and spanish passport, 45.000sefas each one. 48h.


You need to bring passport, two photos and a passport photocopy. You can complete the form there.

name: Burkina Custom Office
description:
Nice people. Our passports got stamped without problem.

The custom that does the vehicule administration are located in the same place, at the other side of the hall. The guy didn't know how to fill out the 'Carnet de passage' so I had to tell him. They didn't even ask for the motorbike papers.

Have to look for Togo (yes , Togo) police office somewhere in same compound —get border exit paper. 

Caution : I was asked for driving license And Insurance 3 times —douane, Togo police (on Burkina side of border!) and Burkina police. They wrote info In ledgers. January ‘19.

name: Togo Custom office
description:
We came in to Togo from Boukombé where we were unable to purchase our visa, we were told to buy it here in Cinkassé. This is the place to get your exit stamp and Togo visa, even if you are heading into Ghana. We had a really hard time dealing with the officials here. We wanted to confirm the price they were charging us for the visa and all hell broke loose. All the men in this tiny matchbox office started screaming at us. We were there for over an hour, but in the end we paid 20,000 CFA each, got our visas stamped and headed out on our way to the much more friendly Ghanaian border. I think that if we hadn’t asked any questions at all things wouldn’t have been so unpleasant, we had no idea that these dudes would be so triggered.

If you want to extend it, you can do it in the police in Kara or Lomé. There you will have to pay 2000 sefa more and bring 2 photos.

name: Customs (duane) Burkina Faso.
description: Here is final custom control before you leave Burkina Faso. The passport control is 17 km on East on the border with Niger

name: Douane
description: Police check point first then you come a few hundred meters to this Douane. The police record vehicle, check visa and stamp passport. No money. The Douane is here and we paid 5000cfa per motorbike and its all legitimate, quick and easy. you get a receipt.

name: Le Motel Orodara
description:
Very nice hotel with option to camp. Friendly owner who built himself. Not really english speaking but tries very to understand and accomodate.  Short walk to shops, restaurants and bar (nice town to stay 2 nights). Wifi wasn't working while we stayed. Running water and electricity. They let us have our dogs in the room.
Great location for day trip to Sindou Pics, Domes and Cascadas near Banfora (expect poor roads, best route is to and from Banfora)
Air conditioning single 15000 cfa, double 16000 cfa. Fan single 7000, double 8000. Don't know prices for camping. 
Ph 73468060

name: Pneumata Tyre Shop
description: Wheel balancing, be careful- to expensive

name: Auberge Du Gourma
description:
Chambers,  restaurant, bar, pool. Big rooms with option of fan (8000cfa) or air conditioning (12,000 cfa). Nice facilities and friendly staff. Pool was half fulk but went swimming anyway. Menu is very reasonably priced (see photos). would stay here again. No wifi but tv in restaurant. We were allowed our 2 dogs in the room. 

When leaving through town we noticed any other hotels that might also be worth checking out and could be cheaper.

name: Burkina Exit
description: Simple exit stamp although there was a bit of a blockade of the road just before but with a bypass for motos so we were fine, not sure how cars where getting around but it certainly was possible. About 10kms beforehand was a military checkpoint where they searched our stuff but seemed unrelated to the checkout process. There was a sign stating 24,000CFA for entry visa, this was a surprise to us as we thought it was only available though a embassy or consultant.

name: Hotel Villa Rose
description: Cozy ecohotel near the city center with a beautiful garden where it's possible to camp under the trees. One of the best campings in West Africa until now, with clean facilities and kind staff. The lovely owner Franka helped me a lot and gave me plenty of informations. Price for camping is 3500 cfa but from the 2nd night is 2500 cfa. Super recommended!!!

name: n'ice cream
description: This place is a gem. It's high quality ice cream (and sorbet for you vegans) with lots of flavors and reasonable prices. Definitely better ice cream than at le verdoyant restaurant (which was recommended in lonely planet for their ice cream). However, I think the best ice cream in West Africa is at the french guys pizza restaurant in Grand Bassam, Cote d'Ivoire. He had less flavors but it was richer and served with real whipped cream. There's also another N'ice Cream on Lumley beach road in Sierra Leone. Hopefully it's a franchise and they open more locations.

name: Douane
description: Very easy to get a passavant. 5,000 CFA, 10 minutes, no funny business.

name: Villa Ouedraogo
description: Clean hotel with a cafetaria on site and a convenience store accross the street. Single room for 12,500 CFA, Double for 15,000 CFA, they also have studios. We stayed in a double, it was clean and confortable, equiped with AC, fan and Cable TV. Daily housekeeping. They let us park our 2 bikes in a small court inside the hotel. The place is guarded day and night.

name: centre ecotouristique de barge
description:
Closed
run down place. cheapest room 5000cfa. put car in front of door and slept in it. no problem.
on lake, nice for the doggie.

name: Brittish Honorary Consulate
description:
Incase you're applying for a Ghana visa and are a UK citizen, I had to come here to receive a letter or recommendation/Introduction

Speak to Mr Patrick De La Lande
(+226) 25 30 88 60

name: Alpha-YaYa
description:
Small Hôtel, 6000f single with fan, commun shower, super clean. Nice staff.  Parking inside with Gardien 24/24. 
You Can go to thé other hôtel just close for breakfast for 700f.

name: Wildcamp in front of the Domes de Fabedougou
description: New dirt road leading up to a Picknick area and the domes... here we camped directly in front of the domes on a rocky, but even platform. We arrived past 6 pm, so nobody was around for tickets. We paid the next morning. Absolutely great spot with amazing view! From here you can perfectly explore the domes

name: Tiebele Royal Court
description: A pleasant stop. we had heard bad reviews from some friends but we enjoyed the tour and the guide spoke English fairly well. Costs 2000/person plus 5000 for the guide and expect a hard sell of souvenirs at the end!

name: Chez Ablo
description: A good and honest mechanic with a fairly busy garage. I had a good experience here and if you need a mechanic in Ouagadougou this is a good option. Was recommended to me by the owner of Pavillion Vert.

name: Town restaurant
description: Busy town restaurant across the street from the petrol station with tables on a shady terrace facing the road where a lot of locals eat and drink. They are continuously cooking new pots, and the sauce arachide and sauce feuilles were delicious.

name: Sama Camp
description:
A traditional rondable compound with rooms and place to camp. A bit difficult to find, not far off the main road in western direction, but one has to meander in between houses, dumps and water channels, better ask in the town center. We stayed overnight with our Land Rover with roof tent and payed 4000 for the two of us. Friendly people, one of them spoke a bit of English. For showers, they brought water for us from the nearby hand-pumped well (they would even have heated it for us!) and pumpkin bowls to scoop the water. Inside the compound, they run a small shop with cold drinks etc. Very authentic and quiet at night.
Some images here:
http://www.burkinafaso-cotedazur.org/documents/documents/BF_pratique/sama-camp-boromo.pdf

name: Hotel La Rose des Sables
description: Quite ok hotel in a "normal" neighborhood, with a few shops, workshops and food stalls around . We parked our Land Rover outside the hotel, there are a few guarded parking slots for guests. Internet was not working, but air condition and TV were. For a double room with shower, we paid 20.000.

name: WIFI at Residence Tang Zugu
description: We did not stay at this residence, but used their wifi in the lobby/restaurant in exchange for buying drinks and breakfast. They have good filter coffee! Internet connection worked fine most of the time, the good thing is they are open also on weekends and holidays.

name: Cybercafe Azawa
description:
Busy, large cybercafe with lots of workstations. Connection works well, you buy vouchers with login for 1/2 hour which does not have to be consumed all in one. 
Next door: two supermarkets, a tailor, a shop selling cloth and a "marquis" for coffee, drinks and sandwiches.

name: Cybercafe
description:
Small cyberoffice with a couple of computers, next to bus station closed on Sundays. We came here from the Camping Faraon for internet. Connectivity is good, but they have no backup generator for blackouts.
Good bar/restaurant with sandwiches, riz-sauce, coffee, tea, drinks right across the street.

name: Auberge Diana
description: Basic standard. Quite clean. Double room for 9000CFA. TV, fan, shower, WC, Wi-Fi. No restaurant but the breakfast included (but better go to the near restaurant 20 meters from the hotel). No private parking, only small space for one car.

name: Le Samaritan
description: Small hotel with great rooms from 7,500CFA for a fan, 12,000 for A/C and a little more for a small suite.  Central location, parking outside and they'll organise security for vehicles.  Stayed here many times over 12 years and still enjoy it.  Cold drinks, food available.  However, keep your bags locked in your rooms if Mamadou is working here again (keeps getting fired and re-hired, a bit of a snake!)

name: La Belle Etoile
description: Gorgeous cheap little hotel, basic but clean with great breakfasts.  From 4,000CFA from memory

name: Präge Toll pay Point
description: When driving north you need to pay peage here

name: Les Lauriers
description: This is the Catholic Mission Guest house. It's inside the grounds of the Cathedral near the centre of town. 20 rooms. Room with AC is 12 000 for 1 and 15 000 for 2. Room with fan is 6000 for 1 and 8000 for 2. All rooms have a shower inside but the toilets are in 2 common bathrooms. Huge secure compound for parking. They are not keen on camping due to the security situation. Very clean and great location. For bookings you can call +22671082818

name: Bobo Retreat
description: Private house with four double-bed rooms and camping possibility in the garden. Possible for Troopy to enter, but can’t use rooftop tent or pop top tent. Delicious breakfast and dinner available, tasty and reasonably priced. BYOB from bar across the street—cheap big beers! Great local yogurt at shop next door. ATM and good pizza within walking distance. MiFi on request.

name: custom burkina faso
description: It seems, that he hadn't seen a carnet passage before, but it was no problem and he stamped it.

name: nature spot near city
description: All around just nature and a lot of space, you can buy salad and vegetables directly from the fields, very quiet. Hard ground, so you can stand here also when it's raining. good to stay here for a few days if you have to wait for your Visa.

name: Missionary center of Notre dame de lorette hotel
description: Hotel in this missionary center, big rooms with fans and hot water, ventilated rooms for 7000CFA for non missionary, 11,000cfa for 2 p. It’s a quiet place free of street hassle, train station is 200 meters away. They have WiFi  here but slow.

name: Honorary Consulate of Benin in Burkina Faso
description: The actual location of the Benin High Commission, Google maps takes you to a police checkpoint instead.

name: Camping in a village house
description: It's possible to camp in the garden of the guide of Tiebele, ask for Bernard, you can offer what you feel.

name: Camping Sabou
description: camping and auberge, for tent 2000CFA. Not the cleanest but still good. Also restaurant here, but food probably only during the day.

name: boulangerie wend barka
description:
if you want fresh bread between ouayigouyah and kongoussi, this is the place. 
also petrol station opposite of the street

name: SIAO village artisanal / SIAO handcraft village
description:
If you are looking for traditionnal art and handcrafts, this is the place !
Parking fee, but entrance is free. Many different booths with craftsmen working on the spot.
Friendly and quiet place, quite big though, may requier the full day !
Note that there is the huge Internationnal Handcraft Fair here (end of Oct/ beginning of Nov.), every 2 years (last session was 2018).

name: Home Market Supermarket
description:
Biggest supermarket we found in town. Open everyday from 8h-20h except on sunday (close earlier).
Big range of western products depending on arrival of containers ... Anyway you can buy real Tomme de Savoie or Roquefort here ! Quite expensive, but the quality and gourmet prices ...
Small and secured parking for customers that can fit big riggs.
You can pay with CFA or €.

name: Kokologo Kings' palace
description:
Nice fortress in sudanese's style with high mud fences.
Unfortunately closed since 2011 and seems abandonned.
However, nice place for a picnic, easy access and plenty space to park.

name: Mare aux crocodiles de Sabou / crocodile sacred lake of Sabou
description:
Sacred lake with many crocodiles easy to spot. Possible guided visit (1.500 CFA /p)
Campsite/restaurant and handycraft village.
Many different local traditional workers (bronze, ebony wood, batik, etc ...)
Quiet and friendly people, no harassment.

name: large flat quarry
description:
laterite quarry beside the local road. not much visible, nobody came to see us. 
super quiet in the night and morning.
good spot between Ouaga and Bobo

name: Hotel Boudou
description:
Clean place with garden. Rooms with climo 15000cfa, with fan 7500cfa.
 No restaurant.

name: bush camp
description:
nice isolated bush camp on ouaga-bobo road
very quiet, well hidden from the road, many bush trees offer shade

name: Dirt road to Sindou Peaks
description:
Alternative road to reach the Sindou Peaks (approx. 2h) if you are coming from Mali with nice landscapes of savana and forests
Dirt road easy in dry season (no need for a 4x4), worst part is between Kangala and Foloni.
Expect some nice pools in rainy season, might be sleepery though.
Tons of possibilities for quiet overnight stay.

name: Immigration
description: Passport stamped here at the police station. friendly guys. Took 10 minutes.

name: Customs
description: Big parking area, Duoane building to the far right. Get your TIP here, takes 5 minutes, 5000 CFA for motorbike. Friendly guys, one speaks a little English.

name: Chez Vincent
description:
This is a two bedroom apartment in a quiet, safe neighborhood, owned by Vincent, a Canadian who lives in Ouaga. There are bars, restaurants, and shops within walking distance. There are two double beds, a couch, and plenty of floor space for sleeping bags. The bathroom has a hot shower, and there is a full kitchen with fridge, stove/oven, some pots and pans and crockery. Each room has a fan and AC. There is secure parking for at least two 4x4s, and many bikes. Big rigs may have to park on the street, but it should not be a problem, the neighbor parks his work truck on the street every night. Vincent went out of his way to make my stay enjoyable. Price is 15,000 per night, highly recommended. 

Must call ahead +226 72 82 39 89.
or email vgonthier@ftedrilling.com

name: Cybercafe Aziz
description: Aziz is very friendly, and can help with printing, scanning, and photocopies. There are a few workstations, and good WiFi.

name: Grocery Store
description: Mid sized grocery store with the basics.

name: Dedougou
description: Here have a private room. Have a fan and WiFi. Only 5000cf per night. It's a good price.   And it is near the main road.

name: Hotel "Village Nong Taaba"
description: Very close to the road to Po, it's an excellent place to stay in Ouagadougou. A nice hotel with paillotes, a big Swimmingpool, a real very big garden, a good restaurant and helpful owner (French) and a nice stuff. The hotel is in a quite residential area. Very good security with 24 hours security stuff. A/C Rooms from 20000 CFA. Camping is 3000 CFA. Yust around the corner there is a very cheap restaurant.  More local bars and magasins you reach in a five minutes walk.

name: Niger consulate general
description:
11 BP 1015 CMS Ouagadougou 11, 
Ave. Charles Bila KABORE
Porte No 1192
(226) 50 30 53 59
N 12* 18.992'  W 1* 31.036

NEW location for consular du Niger
1 to 3 days to get visa
20,000 CFA , you fill out 1 application, and give 1 photo.

name: Aha Dancing Place
description: We crossed at the Dobe border crossing from Namibia to Botswana and from the border we headed south and found the Aha place. No facilities, but a nice clearing in the forest. We went looking for the sinkholes, but did not find them. We only found remains of some San huts.  free

name: Island Safari Lodge
description: Camping on sand next to the river. Braii places and some of the sites have power. Water is river water so we did not fill it on our tank. Toilet and shower is ok with hot water (when there are not too many people that will shower at the same time). WIFI in the restaurant is good. Restaurant, bar and two swimming pools that we did not try because the weather was too cold. P80pppn

name: Bush camp before the south gate
description: A small road took off from the main road and along this road we found the place for our bush camp. After eating dinner we could hear the roar of a lion that must have been pretty close by, but we never saw it.  free

name: Moremi National Park - Third Bridge Campsite
description: The campsites at third bridge are all under a large tree with a braai place and water tap. Toilet and shower block was nice and clean, should have hot water in the showers, but we did not try them. There are no fences around the camp and animals walk through the area, we had an elephant 1 ½ meter from the car at night (we saw the tracks in the morning).  472 pula + 290 pula entrance fee to the Moremi park.

name: Bush camp along the road to Savuti
description: There was not any places to get off the road so we bush camped in an area where the road was a bit wider. Four cars passed us right after sunset and then there was no more traffic on the road that nigh. We had a really good and quiet night sleep.  free

name: Xere Motel
description: A motel next to the road that lets people camp in the back of the property. Access to toilet and shower. Quiet over night as there is not much traffic on the road.  140 pula

name: Kalahari N.P. - CKKOR-03
description: Nice basic campsite with a bit of a view. Braai place. Pit toilet and a shower shelter with a bucket for your shower, but you have to bring your own water.  60 pula + 290 pula National Park fee

name: Sunday campsite 1
description: Nice little clearing in the bushes with a braai place. Pit toilet and a shower shelter with a bucket as a shower, but you have to bring your own water. Sunday camp 1 is next to the Leopard Pan and we were joking about how some places are named to make them more interesting, but as we got into the campsite it was a leopard there. We got a couple of minute’s view of it, before it disappeared into the bushes.  60 pula + 290 pula National Park fee

name: Bush camp on the east side of the Rysana Pan
description: Nice place to bush camp not too far of the road on the east side of the Rysana Pan. No facilities.  free

name: Kukonje Island
description: Amazing camping on Kukonje Island on the east side of the Sua Salt Pan. A few campsites on the island and some of them have a pit toilet. We camped underneath a large Baobab tree. Accessible in dry season only! To get out to the island you have to pass through a veterinary fence, no sign, sometimes register at the gate, here they do also sell fire wood.  100ppp if staff around.

name: Limpopo River Lodge
description: Really nice campsites at the Limpopo River front in a private reserve that did not cost us any extra since we camped there. The reception area is some kilometers away from the campsites. Nice braai places, water and nice toilet and shower block with hot water when there is fire under the boiler. In the morning we saw hippo, antelopes, warthogs and baboons at the river. Plenty of elephant dungs in the camping area, none of them visited us, but we saw elephants on our drive out of the reserve again.  236 pula

name: Marang Hotel Campsite & Hotel
description: Spacious campsite. Pool. Nice ablutions.*Electricity is P33 per night. Bar and restaurant at the hotel, and pool bar. Free wifi.

name: Lekhubu Island Camp
description:
Fantastic location on "island" with boababs and other large trees in salt lake. Large spots, far apart. No facilities. Expensive.
Prices are very clear. oct 2021 :
Internationals pay in Pulas: 256 and Sadc 173, including  camping, entrance fee, viewing deck, 
tourism levy 
+ 14% Vat.

name: Deception Camp 3
description:
Nice camp in the bush.

Site does not have the best view. Must be booked in advance through DWNP. Price is 30 Pula per person per night.

name: Drifters Maun Camp
description: Nice location next to the river. Plenty of shady spots available. Quiet when we were there but could get busy with Overland trucks. 150 pulas pppn (April 2022).

name: Etsha 13 - Guma Lagoon Camp
description:
Very nice place at large lagoon, pitches have braai area, water and private ablutions, huge communal kitchen where charging of appliances is possible, restaurant, bar, deck overlooking the lagoon, free coffee and tea, getting there takes a while even in the dry season on the very sandy tracks
180 Pula pppn
Check with the campsite before driving to site, a lot of the road is underwater and you may need an escort to find your way - 4x4 required.

name: Drotsky's Cabins and Campsites
description: Great campground next to the river. Sites are huge and spread out. Camping area is separate from lodge, but you can use the lodge facilities and internet. Camping area has own reception and bar and lounge over the river. Every site has water, electric and fire area. Hot showers and flush toilets. They offer boat tours per hour. Nearby town of Shakawe has petrol, ATM and a supermarket. P250

name: Ngamiland Basket Weavers Trust
description:
Amazing baskets at great prices. 95% of all proceeds go back to the artists. Worth a stop! Call +267 74 468 633 and talk to katenya if the store is not open, she will open for you 
+267 74 468 633 or +267 72 930 565
Ngamilandbadkets@gmail.com
https://www.facebook.com/ngamiland.baskests/

name: Planet Baobab
description:
Huge Baobabs, worth every visit. Great campsites, each with shelter, power, fire pit, Braai area and parking space. Only thing missing is a water at the sites. There is a dishes area next to the showers and bathrooms. The amazing pool has plenty of shady spots to hide from the blazing sun. The bar is well stocked and the only place the wifi reaches. Good restaurant. 2019: Camping 100Ppp. Or overlander camping for 75Ppp. Internet is not free, one day costs 100Pula, 30 minutes - 30Pula. 2019: Welcoming staff. Gweta lodge offers free Wifi, but is less spectacular and in town. It appears that Planet B is going for a more upmarket crowd now... but campers are still very welcome.
Dec 2021: BWP 105 per person for overlander camping (no discount for children).

name: Pelican Lodge and Campsite
description: Campground behind lodge. Sites have water and Braai areas. Some have shade. Communal area with covered thatch. Several small ablution blocks with sink, showers and toilets. Wifi in bar/restaurant area. We paid P80 per person.

name: Camp Itumela
description:
Basic campsite near town, used by overlanding trucks. Free Wifi . Plenty of space, outdoor type ablutions. Restaurant and bar.
Pitches have electricity, light and braai area. Overland trucks use the site from Thursday till Monday night but place should be large enough to not get affected by that.
The passing trains blasting their horn is limited but notiable

name: Khama Rhino Sanctuary Campground
description: Great Rhino Sanctuary. Nice camping plots in the woods. 480 P Entrance Fee and Camping per Day (2 Persons with Car).

name: Elephant Sands Lodge & Camp
description: Nice campsite near a waterhole that is frequently visited by elephants. If you're lucky you can watch the elephants from the swimming pool. Price is 150 Pula per person (camp). Free WiFi at the lodge/bar.

name: el-fari
description: simple campsites with tab &  braai, toilett-/showerblock ok, sink, 70-90 pula pp, perfect overnightstay going/coming from windhoek/chobe np

name: On The Way To Kubu Island
description: 40 km south of Kubu Island in the bushland. Free wild camp.

name: Wild Camp At Baobab
description: Spot at the rim of the pan next to a big Baobab tree. Some 70 km North and for us 4 hours of driving north of Kubu Island. A nice opportunity to break the journey.

name: Nata Bird Sanctuary
description: Wild Camp Next To Bird Hide. Very peaceful. We paid 230 Pula for 2 persons.

name: Touch Of Africa
description: Simple campsite next to the lodge. Waterhole to watch the wildlife in dry season specially. Nice owners

name: Senyati Safari Camp
description:
Very nice camp next to a water whole. Every site has its own private ablution. Well run with observation deck, underground observation extremely close to the water whole, laundry service. 210 Pula per person (oct 2021) . WiFi only from 5-9pm.
They do not accept payment with credit cards.

name: Maun - Sedia Riverside Hotel
description: This lovely yellow hotel has great camping facilities in the grounds and you’re also able to use the hotel bar & pool. There is free wifi in the restaurant. Ablutions very old, not too clean as is the swimming pool. Price is P100 pp.

name: Chobe Safari Lodge
description:
An amazing lodge, with a beautiful pool deck overlooking the Chobe River. Camping facilities are just next door, but you’re able to make full use of lodge facilities. Perfect way to relax and recover after ‘being bush’ for a week! (UPDATED again 120pula pp) Campsite itself is very popular and thus busy, even in low season, and we didn’t like the pitches that much. (in fact oy a few are anywhere near level) Although every site is private and trees do separate one site from another, it was all very near to each other (very near!!!). After being in the wild one week being with all the space and quietness, it was not very nice here. Too many people, too much noise, too little space. Also you don’t get to choose your own spot. Even if you book a spot well in advance they will mess up your booking. Twice this happened to us.  
If you can ask for Site 3 lots of headroom for RTT shade and near abolition block.

name: Tati River Lodge
description: Big lawn of  lodge with grass and high trees. 75 pula, well maintained.

name: Nata Lodge
description: Sandy terrain under palms. Ablutions well maintained. Nice pool. Bird feeding area on compound with lots of birds. (P95 pp march 2019)

name: Sunday 03 and Sunday 04
description: Large private and secluded stand (unfenced) with fire place. Shade. Shower cubicle with bucket. Bring everything.  Cost:ZAR250

name: Passarge CKPAS-02
description: Large private and secluded stand (unfenced) with fire place. Shade. Shower cubicle with bucket. Bring everything.  Cost:ZAR250

name: Khumaga
description: Sandy campsite with braai and water. Central ablutions. Unfenced.  Cost:ZAR250

name: Thamalakane River Lodge
description: NO CAMPING ! Small camping area next to luxury lodge. Shade, braai, stand pipe, light. Central ablutions. Restaurant, bar, internet at the lodge. Beautiful view of the river from the bar deck.  Cost:ZAR280

name: Khwai North Gate
description: Campsite with nicely spread stands. Unfenced. Braai and stand pipe. Central ablutions.  Cost:ZAR350 / US$50 pppn.

name: Savuti Campsite
description:
Campsite with nicely spread stands. Unfenced. Braai and stand pipe. Central ablutions.  Cost:250 Pula, USD 51 per person per night for international guests.
Generator on all day for electricity.

name: Ihaha Camp
description: Campsite with stands spread along the Chobe river. Braai and fire pit. Central ablutions. Unfenced.  Run by kwalate.

name: Letiahau Public Campsite - CKWIL-06
description: No facilities compared to the others, good shade and limited view

name: Pipers Pan Public Campsite Number 2
description: Has basic facilities, great location, trees for shade.

name: Sunday Pan Public Campsite Number 2
description: Has basic facilities, great location, trees for shade.

name: Nxai Pans South Camp
description: Excellent facilities. Now US$38 pppn + park fees.

name: Pan Edge On Way To Kubu Island
description: Wild camping spot with a view over the pan about 35kms from Kubu Island. No facilities. Free.

name: Thakadu Camp
description:
Good overnight stop coming from or going to Namibia, restaurant and bar with lit waterhole, free wifi, cold pool, pitches have braai area, light, electricity and water, ablutions okay, they sell game meat and sausages as well as biltong at the entrance gate
120Pula pp (10€)

Directions: navigation can send you on a back road in Ghanzi but the entrance is on the main road south of Ghanzi

name: Kubu Lodge
description:
Do not offer camping any longer (as of Jan 2020).
Large sandy places with trees close to the Zambesi. Braais, taps and electricity at most sites. Reservation system messy. Swimming pool, guarded at night, no credit cards.
BWP 174 (2 adults, camper)
www.kubulodge.net
+267 6250312
kubu@botsnet.bw

name: Big 5 Lodge (former Toro Lodge)
description: Accommodation and campsite at the river, private ablutions at campsite, price 130 pula, restaurant . About 1 km from ferry to Zambia. Private ablutions, with braai and washing up facilities, electricity etc.

name: Khwai - Magotho Campsite
description:
Superb location at  Khwai river in Okavango Delta. Grassy with a few trees. Large spaces (you don't see other campers). Good ablutions and water. Payment can be made at the Khwai Community Bush office at campsite 4. Deep sand access road.
BWP 350 per person per night.

name: Moremi National Park - Xakanaxa Campsite
description:
Large spaces, sand with some grass and trees between marshland. We saw elephants on the campsite. Well maintained ablutions. Campsite is not fenced.
BWP 540 (2 adults, camper).

name: Maun - Viking Gas
description: Bright blue and red iron fence and large sign that reads "Viking Gas".  Fills bottles of LPG while you wait.

name: Maun - The Old Bridge Backpackers Lodge
description:
Main business is lodge, but they have a few camping places next to the lodge. The lodge terrace is directly at the Thamalakane River (or pond when dry), the camping places are not BigRig friendly. Camping P100pp. 
Bar area is nice and the campsite you have a few spots to put op your RTT but if it's busy you'll probably get stuck between other tents. They cramp 3 vehicles in one campsite so not much privacy. Open air showers which is not so nice in rainy weather (we loved it in the rain). Communal kitchen is half open air and not very well equipped. WiFi was OK.

name: Rakops - Rakops Riverside Lodge
description:
Small, sandy site with one tree for camping between lodges and fireplaces for conference centre. Close to river. Provisions for electric light and hot showers were available, but didn't work when we visited.
BWP 180 

09.05.2019. Price up to 130 pula pp. Nice place to spent a night going to or coming from CKGR

22.04.2022 showers still don't work

name: Kalahari N.P. - CKMAT
description:
Campsite with four places next to park gate. Sandy terrain. Ablutions poorly maintained. Can be booked at the gate.
BWP 60 (2 adults, camper). No second day park fee if you leave the park before 11 am.

name: Kalahari N.P. - CKWIL-08 - Kukana
description:
Isolated campground under trees with lots of birds and great view. No facilities, no water. Can be booked at the Matwane gate.
BWP 60 (2 adults, camper)

name: Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park - Rooiputs
description:
Six widely spaced sites with view over the desert. Two sites share one ablution unit. Access through deep sand, 4x4 only. Canope on concrete floor. No fences, so risk of wild animals. No reception, so advance booking or booking at park entry required. Situated in Botswana site of park.
BWP 64 (2 adults, camper)

name: Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park - Two Rivers Botswana
description:
Four well separated pitches in sand, each with own pinnacle and braai area. Reception with Vodacom. Booking is required. Booking can be done at park gate.
BWP 104 (2 adults, CAMPER and Park fees )
Ablutions are in very poor condition and need serious maintenance - cold showers only and the toilets aren't working at all. There was water all over the floor and very dirty. The campsites are outside the park but number 4 has a nice view and is very quiet. We walked to the Twee Rivieren shop from our campsite.

name: Swamp Stop Rest Camp (Swamp Stop)
description: Riverside campsite overlooking Okavango reed beds.  Sand campsite with some tree shade, fire pits/bricks, 220V connection, stand pipes and ablution block(s).  Restaurant/bar and slipway for boating trips etc.  flyers also claim to have chalets and a houseboat available.  Price 220 pula pppn for camping.  Appears to be a stopping place for overland trucks too, but these are accommodated away from the river frontage. Wifi costs additional 50p.

name: Kori 4
description: Very nice spot. Must be booked in advance through DWNP. Price is 30 Pula per person per night.

name: Tautona Lodge
description: 145ppn. basic campsite. fare away from the lodge. not worth the money. and yes there are lions in very small caches.

name: Kalahari Rest
description:
Nice partly fenced Campsites with basic ablution (donkey for hot water). Although basic we really liked this place.

Price update Febr 2020: P160 pp.

name: Khiding Campsite
description: Campsite frequently visited by lions. Must be booked in advance through DWNP. Price 30 Pula per person per night.

name: Monamodi 1 Campsite
description: Not the best view, but it has a tap with running water (may not be working in dry season). Must be booked in advance through DWNP. Price 30 Pula per person per night.

name: Mpaaya 2 Campsite
description: Site with amazing view. Especially after the wet season when the flowers bloom. Site has running water (maybe not in dry season). Must be booked in advance. Mpaaya 1 is ofted visited by lions. Price 30 Pula per person per night.

name: Sedudu Gate Chobe NP
description: Kasane, Sedudu Gate Chobe NP. There is also an office to book for campings

name: DWNP booking office
description: You can also book Central Kalahari and Kgalagadi here.

name: Mabuasehube Gate
description:
Kgalagadi NP, Mabuasehube Gate and campsites.

There are 3 campsites. Bring your own water as ablutions not working.

name: Gate to Tautona Lodge
description: Tourist Attraction - Gate to Tautona lodge near Ghanzi

name: Bush camp Towards Kubu
description: Just one of the many clear spot to spend the night alone. It took us another 3,5 hours to reach Kubu Island (and a lot of scratches on the truck)

name: Bushcamp On Way To South
description: Just after Mmashoro. Apart from cows and a few cars this is a quiet spot just to spend the night.

name: Nata Bird Sanctuary
description:
The Nata Bird Sanctuary is run by the local community / Nata Conservation Trust. 
Near the entrance there is a campsite with warm showers, sandy camp spots and braai facilities, flush loo's.

name: Bushcamp
description: Just in the wild

name: Bushcamp Off The Road
description: Just an invisible spot off the A2

name: Audi Camp
description:
Little oasis just outside the city. Beautiful pool/restaurant/bar area with lots of nice seat areas in a lush green environment. 
Good food/drinks and fast Wi-Fi. 

The people are super friendly and the camp is well maintained with clean facilities. Lots of trees and sand ground. Some of the spots have braai stands, a table and electricity.

Tours can be booked here as well, defenitly recommend the helicopter ride over the Delta (no doors for the best views) 
A place where you can easily stay longer then planned.

name: Start of Kwai River game drive
description: Head south here until you hit the river and then turn right. There are fantastic game viewing tracks along the Kwai River here which you can drive free of charge. We saw plenty of game very close up.

name: South Gate Campsite
description: Run by the national park authorities this campsite is located just inside Moremi and a good base to explore the newly opened Black Pools area from, sites have braai stands, there are sinks for dish washing but no taps and ablution blocks which are okay and have cold showers, we had elephants coming through camp at night, as all national park campsites terribly overpriced at 270Pula pp (22€)

name: Bushcamp Kalahari scrubs
description: Good bush camping area along this road without fences and just cattle tracks

name: Bushcamp near Maun
description: Little clearing in the bushes in the cattle land south of Maun, you will hear cow bells and the road but not much else

name: Pizza Plus Coffee and Curry
description: Unexpectedly great Indian restaurant with delicious curries for about 75P (6€) and very good service. Thoroughly enjoyed our meal.

name: Bush camp near river bed
description: A little clearing in the woodland after a dry river bed crossing, very quiet at night

name: Lookout platform
description: A wooden platform overlooking the surrounding bush land and salt pan, some people we met camped here and it should be good for a ground tent

name: DWNP Office Ghanzi
description: Here you can arrange, book and pay for the CKGR and KTP. Probably all DWNP permits can be arranged here. Very friendly, patient and helpful staff. Open mon-fri. Credit card payment possible.

name: Ghanzi Trail Blazers
description: Lovely place few km. before Ghanzi. All basics like light,water and fireplace available at campsites which are on sandy grounds. Wood is available at no extra charge! Place is being renovated with already new acces road and new/extra showers and toilets. Also a small bar/restaurant Very cosy place and friendly staff. We loved this place much better than Thakadu Camp. WiFi 100 Pula pp/pn

name: Lesedi Motors (Land Rover)
description: We've stopped by Lesedi a few times with problems and they're always happy to help, usually the same day for small jobs! Brought in a new manager and their service improved even more. Really your only option in the North if you drive a LR.

name: Kaziikini Community Campsite
description: Community campsite in the bush south of Moremi with its own game drives, solar heated showers and clean sites. Unfortunately they charge a ridicilous 290Pula (24€) pp or 210Pula (17€) pp if you are South African so we did not stay.

name: Makgadikgadi Adventure Camp
description: Community campsite in the pan area with European showers and ablutions and braai stands on sites but in an awkward location and very dusty. Reception by staff was very strange and we were ignored and private conversations continued until someone attended to us. We normally support community initiatives but don't really see a future in this particular place especially as there are ample opportunities for bush camping so did not stay. Hope our first impression was wrong and someone will revise it. 100Pula (8€) pp

name: Shorobe Baskets Co-op
description: A cooperative-run shop selling traditional woven baskets at cheaper prices than you'll find anywhere else. Buy straight from the artisans!! Usually open, but if not phone Doris on 73231197 or 76666554.

name: Tshaa Community Camp
description:
Lovely community owned campsite on the river. Lots of wildlife and elephants roaming through camp. Six sites with some facilities including fire pits and hot outdoor showers! Beautiful views from the flush toilets. Luxury compared with next door Djara and Khwai. No fences. Campsites very spread out. P220 pppn, but we negotiated P200 pppn for four. Good value compared with Moremi / Savuti! Roads can be rough and muddy during rainy season so 4x4 advised.

Edit: now they ask for 350 pula, but you can negotiate to 200/250

name: Vet Fence
description: You can bring meat in to the park, but not meat or animal products out. Must stop to have wheels sprayed and to walk in solution for foot and mouth disease.

name: Modipane Guest Lodge
description: Site at the back of a lodge. Gravel floor. Facilities are nice, a basic kitchen there, no cooking equipment but will light a fire if needed. P90pppn. Room is 400 pula. Bar is well equipped, do not serve food.  Owner is very friendly as are the staff.

name: Khutse
description: Entrance to the Khutse game park. Last 100 km to get these is piste. 120pula per person per day, 50 per car per day. Camping is 250pula per person per night.
