You can buy wood, 30 pula for a bundle. There is a tap at the entrance you can use. Roads aren't in the best condition, lots of corrugations

name: Cresta Hotel
description: You can sleep on in your car but can't camp. No camp sites in the area. Double rooms are 1400 pula - expensive but in line with the rest of the area. Really nice rooms, bath, double bed, tea and coffee plus breakfast.

name: Bush Camp Nata Road
description: A turn off leads to a large open area with plenty of space for bush camping. We had kudus, impalas and stenboks as visitors. (Turn off is hard to see in 7/2022.)

name: Boteti River camp
description:
Old name: Tiaan's Camp
Great campsite - reasonable sized spaces with awnings, power, water and fireplace in a secure compound. Chalets also available. Very nice ablutions - big, hot showers. Bar and viewing saloon above overlooking the river. Firewood available 25pula a bundle. Oct 2021 : 200 Pula p.P.

name: Ntwetwe Pan
description: in the middle of the pan

name: Gabarone, Hail Selasie Road, plot 1248
description:
Small repair shops and spray and panel beaters together on one plot. Millennium is a general machining shop and also good for manufacturing hydraulic hoses. They made and installed new bushes for the hings of the cabin.
The panel beaters welded the cracks of the front stud of the cabine and did some paint jobs for a reasonable price

name: Kang Ultra Stop
description: 3 sites on a sandy area behind the petrol station. Private ablutions for each site. Small shop, tourist information, bar and restaurant with Wifi. 260 Pula for 2 incl. car and electricity.

name: Gweta Lodge
description: Stayed here one night on route into the pans, the road from here to Kubu island is better than the one from Nata - allegedly. It is 170km from here to the island and only fuel in Nata, or on the Mopipi road south. You can buy fuel here from a local guy off the main road if you really need ( we will put a pin up and his name is Tony).  The lodge is basic but fairly priced, the rooms are clean with open aired bathrooms. Campsite is      ok with ablutions etc. Restaurant available and nice bar. Wifi available free. Shop in town only sells basics so bring food from francistown or maon. Owners are very friendly and will help you with route advice, petrol and so on. Staff are also great! Great big pool too.

name: Goo-Moremi Campsite
description:
nicely settled camping spots at the entrance to Moremi Gorge Conservation Trust; very spacious places. Very large plots, private braai stand, sink and ablutions (also warm water).
 BWP 120p.p plus BWP 50 for car, incl. 60 BWP entrance for the hike 
Short drive to the mouth of the gorge, and there is also a walking trail leading here. Entrance to the gorge only with a guide.

name: Oasis Lodge
description:
Campground near Limpopo river, ablution run down, only good for a stop over 
normal rate BWP 200 (!) p.p. we were offered BWP 100 p.p. too much for what they offer 
wifi at the main lodge

name: Cornwall Safari Lodge & Campsite
description: Lovely place, quiet, good food, price 125 pula for camping in bushcamp. P 195 near      house.

name: Sizatswe
description:
Sandy spot at the Sizatswe Pan. No toilets, showers or water! 
If you love the simple life in a very remote and quiet area then you will love this camp. 

Park permit pp/day 20 Pula (2 USD) 
Camping pp/night 30 Pula (3 USD)

name: Puma
description: puma fuel station and shopping center next door

name: Ukhwi community camp
description: One single site on the top of a hill. Nice view over the pan and the bush.

name: Mwandi View
description: Very nice spot outside the parks. Friendly owner and fantastic food. 120/pp pula campsite. Close to parks and beautiful view on the Chobe.

name: Sitatunga camp
description:
Price is 140 Pula pppn

The campsite is good and 12 generous sites are available. Badic sand ground with grass and trees that provide shade. Ablutions are good. Food at the bar (110-120 pula for a pizza). WLAN at bar with reception at neighbouring campsites.

name: Tuuthebe Lodge
description: Good place to stay a night. Nice ablutions and very clean. 100 Pula pp/n. Braai stands on every camp including water tab. Free braai wood

name: Kalahari Arms Hotel
description: Newly renovated hotel in the centre of town with pool, restaurant and free WiFi.

name: Woodlands Stop Over Camp & Lodge
description: This is the place to stay in Francistown area. Well worth the 7 kn off main road on a very good gravel road . They have a bush camp area & a grass campsite. They also have cabins & very nice river side rooms. Ablusions spotless with lots of hot water. Wash up area . Small shop with ready meals , cold drinks, beer & fire wood / charcoal. Braais, water taps . Electric hook up extra charge .A very clean swimming pool. A great place to relax. Staff very welcoming & helpful .price 85P pp in bush camp area.

name: Éléphant pond
description: Plenty of places to camp. Few elephants were coming at night but the pond was dry. And lions were roaring at night around our camp place

name: Near river
description: Nice and quiet spot to bivouac off the road. With a little river and really interesting for bird

name: In bush
description: Lake was muddy so we stay in this nice and shady area. We've got some quick visit from local

name: Kwalape Safari Lodge
description:
Camping is 90 pula pppn (€8). 
Tents available.
Pool, bar, restaurant, and free WiFi.
Locals and tourists come here, staff are very friendly and easy going.
loud traffic noise at night

name: Mokolodi Backpackers
description: Lovely Backpackers and Campsite a bit South from Gaborone. Different Huts, Bungalows and permanent Tents arranged around a Swimming Pool. Lovely Garden with lots of Animals (Birds, Cats, Peacock, Pig, Dog). Camping possible in the sandy Car Park in front of Reception or 10 m further and next to Pool. Big Rig and Roof Top Tent friendly. Nice open Kitchen and perfect Ablutions. Braai Area with Open Fire Pit. Free and fast Wifi. Very relaxed Atmosphere, we really enjoyed it. Camping costs 150 pppn, different prices on chalets and dorms. Discounts possible if you stay longer and negotiate.

name: Tire center
description: We got new spring leafs here. Good service, good price.

name: Supa Tyres
description: Excelent service, good price! We got them to replace our broken leaf springs.

name: Bushcamp
description: Nice and shady spot right next to the river.

name: Tantebane Clubhouse
description: I have never stayed in such a beautiful place before. The camp site overlooks a lake and there are zebra, giraffe and lots of herbivores that come to the campsite for water. Well prepated food in the restaurant, also for dinner.

name: Lotec
description:
Land Rover mechanic and also does conversions / fabrication. Good and reliable. Call Tim on 72734473

website: www.lotec . co

name: Kalahari Arms Hotel Campground
description: Kalahari Arms hotel has it's own campground, camping on nice grass, shower are hot and ablutions very well maintained, Braai, Free wifi. The camping prices was 125 pula ppn, cheapest place near ghanzi for camping, had a nice stay.

name: Next to road
description: Bush camp next to sand road about 5 km from park gate.

name: Aquarite Drinking Water
description: The place for refilling your tanks with filtered water in Maun. 18p for 10 litres.

name: Mohembo border
description:
Easiest border control, just 30 minutes for both sides with Carnet. Very friendly staff.

Open from 8:00 to 18:00h

Exit Namibia in 3 steps: Fill the exit form and get the stamp on passport, fill the car details on police notebook, deposit the Road tax paper on the box (only valid for one entry) and get your carnet stamped. No questions, no cheks.

Entry Botswana: Fill the entry form, get the stamp on the passport (up to 90days), pay 140p for Road tax (Rands, pounds and USD accepted), get the stamp on the carnet and show the papers to the police by crossing the gate. 
No questions, no checks, despite it should not be allowed to crossing the border with any uncooked meat, eggs, unprocessed milk, watermelon or oranges (fruit fly deseases).

Petrol in Botswana is cheaper, but make sure you have enouch for 150km, for us there was not diesel available in Shakawe

name: Dusty Donkey Cafe
description:
Nice coffee shop with a good selection of food, parking and good wifi.
they have also an small craft shop and a booking counter but we did not try.

name: Parking at Maun Airport
description:
Free parking at the airport, plenty of space, we felt safe. 
Quiet during the night, not sure if legal, but nobody complained.
Clean toilets inside the airport.
Perfect if you want an Cesna scenic fly next day early in the morning.

name: Motovac car parts
description:
Best spare part store in Kasane. Friendly staff who adviced us. Last chance to buy your needs for Zimbabwe: 2 white reflectors on the front of the car, 2 red reflectors for the back, 2 set of warning triangles, fire extingisher and a safety jacket. We bought these items including 2 jerrycans for 80 US Dollar. In Zimbabwe on our way from Hwange to Bulawayo at the first check-point they checked all these items to find a reason for a bribe. At the following 4 check-points we had no problem. So perhaps its cheaper to pay a small bribe and all these spare parts.
We didn’t needed the 2 jerry-cans because in Vic Falls and Bulawayo it was no problem to buy fuel (we succeeded to pay in US Dollar). In Vic Falls there where some queues at the petrol station.

name: Kazungula border: Botswana - Zambia
description:
From Botswana to Zambia... It was very quiet when we were here around lunch time. Some counters we not manned and we had to go to the "commercial" building. That's the building for the trucks. When you drive over the bridge you can overtake the trucks. Sometimes the road only had one lane, so take care you don't get stuck in between trucks. Both the Botswana and Zambian border are in the same building, but some things you have to do outside this building. Exiting Botswana is easy. It's free. 1. Immigration will check your passport. 2. Customs will stamp your Carnet de Passages. Entering Zambia is more challenging but you don't need an fixer. 1. The health counter will check and register your Covid PCR-test. No costs involved. A PCR test can be taken near the weight bridge in Kasane. Read the instructions how to do that in iOverlander. 2. The next counter is the road police. Nobody there, so we skipped it. 3. Pay the road tax at the RTSA counter. We paid US$20. 4. The next counter is called "Immigration extensions". This counter can be skipped. 5. The next counter is called "Immigration". Buy your KAZA visa for US$50 per person. Children are free for Zambia. Beware that you need a visa for the children when you also want to enter Zimbabwe (US$30 for a single entry). 6. Then there is the "Customs" counter. If you have an Carnet de Passage they will send you to Interpol in another building. It's called "Car inspection". No signs from Interpol. Some questions were asked, some things registers in their computer and we got an stamp on the back of the slip of the Carnet. No costs involved. 7. Back to the "Customs" counter and they will stamp the Carnet de Passage. No costs involved. 8. At the last counter you have to pay "Carbon tax" and "Bridge toll". Here is the "ugly fat" guy called Paul. The bridge toll is cheaper in US$ so we paid the US$20. Then Paul has some difficulty to understand that tourists also exit an country and because of that he wants to charge 660 kwatcha. When you only travel through the country (transit) and don't stay somewhere the carbon tax is 660 kwatcha. When you visit as a tourist and tell him you go to Livingstone (for example) then it's 330 kwatcha. If Paul doesn't want to cooperate, complain at the Customs office (previous counter) because they will correct him. There is an ATM outside with kwatchas. The fee for the ATM is 50 kwatcha. 9. Congratulations you passed all the counters. But there is more... 10.You have to buy third party liability insurance. I think there is only one building where you can buy this. It's next to the ATM. They don't have an COMESA insurance. We already got an insurance for all Africa so we took the gamble and skipped this. No one checked. We were not checked at one of the road blocks to Livingstone. 11. Now you can drive to the exit gate. Be prepared that at least three different officials will approach you at the same time. One will check the Carnet de Passage, bridge toll and carbon tax. Another will check the road toll. The last guy will ask for the council levy of 50 kwatcha. 12. ... and now you are really free to go. You can do it easily without touts. It can takes some time. Road tax: US$20 (KAZA UNI)VISA: US$50 per adult ( Carbon tax: US$20 for an 3.0 liter car Bridge toll: US$20 ATM charge: 50 kwatcha (or change at one of the touts) Road toll: 330 kwatcha for an 4x4 Council levy: 50 kwatcha

NOTE: KAZA Visa valid only for entry in the Vic Falls area. Any other border post you need to pay again.

name: Jaysant Investment Ltd
description:
Gas  filling, not far from the Itumela Campsite
Filling of a 5 kg Cadac bottle 160 Pula 
P120 for 4.5 kg bottle

name: Foot and mouth checkpoint
description: No red meat can pass from west to east because of the foot and mouth

name: Foot and mouth  Sanitary control
description: No fresh red meat after this point when heading south... going north you can have anything

name: Kaa  Campsite
description: Nice campsite with only 2 spots. Spot 1 with individual ablutions.  Very wild. Friendly staff.

name: Mpaaya 1 campsite
description: Nice view over the Pan. Simple ablutions. Sandy. Lot of space. We paid as private campsite, 350 pulas pp.

name: Muchenje Campsite & Cottages
description:
Nice place with lots of shade.
Large sandy spots with braai spot, fireplace and sink.
Ablutions nicely done.
Small pool.
Communal terrace for watching the sun go down. 
Good internet at reception only.
Email: bookings@muchenjecampsite.com 
220 pula pppn (April 2022).

name: Lesholoago camp 1
description:
Simple campsite with A-frame and pit toilet. Shade trees. Wonderful view of the pan. This side of the park is very wild and very dry - even in April. We saw much more wildlife on the South Africa side of the park where there are plenty of waterholes. The drive here and back from Nossob takes about 8 hours one way traveling at 25 km per hour. It's a gorgeous, peaceful drive over sand dunes in some parts. 
Lesholoago camp 2 across the pan has running water for a shower and sink!

name: Pontdrift
description:
Vehicle can only cross in dry season when Limpopo has not much water - in fact, it looks like there weren't any vehicles crossing for ages. 
Cable car is manly used from Tuli Lodge guests.

name: Pont Drift
description:
Vehicle can only cross in dry season when Limpopo has not much -  in fact, it looks like there weren't any vehicles crossing for ages. 
The cable card in mainly used by Tuli Lodge guests.

name: DWNP Headquarters
description: Department of Wildlife and Nationalparks - you can make bookings for Botswana parks and campsites.

name: Bushcamp near road
description: Quiet and hidden spot in the bush just off the (at the time of writing) unfinished and unused big road that crosses the 6201 road. Some donkeys and cows around but no people AFAICT. Watch out for acacia thorns.

name: Near Cgwihaba (Drotsky's) Cave
description:
Nice clearing under a big tree (with a yellow-billed hornbill's nest when I was there). Obviously it has been used as campsite frequently, judging by the fireplace with ashes, the small pile of firewood and plenty of tyre tracks. Access track is very sandy, but so are all tracks in the vicinity. As the site is somewhat away from the cave and not anywhere near the main track from Xai xai to the A35 it is very quiet and secluded. 
Note however that they are building a campsite, entrance gate and visitor center at the time of this writing and when I woke up the next morning some guardians arrived at my camp demanding that I pay for camping (80 p; no facilities at the moment!) and entrance to the area (210 p). Even though there was no sign at all at the entrance of the presumed park (coming from Xai xai). I had a big argument and paid them 100 p and than left. They were not happy...

name: vet checkpoint
description: Don't know if it's south or northbound but checkpoint is around here so watch out.

name: Entering Cgwihaba National Park
description: At the time of writing there is no sign coming from Xai xai (Cae cae) but from roughly this point you are entering Cgwihaba NP (going east). They are building a campsite and visitor center and an entrance gate coming from Tsau but there is no indication coming from Xai xai. Entrance fee is 210p (not sure if per person or per vehicle since I was alone). Camping 80p.

name: Meyer's Guesthouse
description: Perfect stop over on the way to Masuabehube. Very cozy and neat rooms, restaurant and bar. Secure parking.

name: Phone Signal
description: Inside Botswana but we picked up a 3G vodacom phone signal from South Africa at this spot, only roadside but if you need signal then this is good enough!

name: Kopong rock encravings bush camp
description: Access road to the encravings caves is about 7kms simple dirt. Turn off highway initially goes through two or three houses then into scrubland, lots of places to drive and camp in amongst the scrub.

name: In the pan
description:
Extremely quiet spot on the salt plain. No vegetation or animals except for an occasional fly or crow. No wind, no clouds so quite hot during the day. Also no water (when I visited).  About 1 km of the main north-south track. Awesome sunrise and sunset. Lots of stars at night.
Best wildcamp I had in a long time!

name: Nata River bed
description: At few kilometres from Nata. Quiet sandy spot with lot of shady places really close to Nata River. Plenty of birds to observe.

name: Veterinary checkpoint
description: Not entirely sure to which side it is not allowed to take fresh meat and the like, but I think going east to west. I was waved through going west to east.

name: Veterinary checkpoint
description: Not entirely sure in which direction it is not allowed to take fresh meat and the like, but I think west to east though I was waved through in this direction.

name: Kubu island office
description:
Buy your permit here. I paid 61 p for a day visit. Including camping it would have been 237 p.
Please note that there is a vet fence on route from here to the island. Supposedly it is not allowed to take fresh meat in both directions but when I arrived there was no one around.

name: In the pan, off the road
description: Just another of the many spots to choose from to wildcamp here. Of course no facilities but also no costs.

name: Vet fence
description: Not sure I'm which direction but I think going east to west. I only had to show drivers license going west to east.

name: Pebble beach towards Kukonje
description: Since Kukonje island is unreachable at the moment (there is at least 1 meter of water in the pan) I camped on the pebble beach on the shore of the pan/lake which was incredibly beautiful. Flamingos, pelicans, the most awesome sunset and not a human or building in sight all day. No facilities whatsoever of course but also no costs.

name: Dizhana campsite
description:
STATUS UNKNOWN

We found this place on our way from Savuti to Maun because there was a sign next to our road. The former campsite was closed. Nonone was in the staffhouses as well. A group of waterbucks was lying on the former campground 1, which we choosed to spend the night. We heard hippos from the nearby river, elephants and lions in the evening. We stayed two nights, because it was such a loveley calm place.
Be prepared to leave this place, if someone arrives and asks you to do so.
Don't destroy anything and don't leave any litter.

name: Vet checkpoint / police checkpoint
description: Usual rules regarding transport of fresh meat apply though I'm not sure in which direction.

name: Botswana
description: No meat allowed after this point traveling east. Checkpoint.

name: Police checkpoint
description: This is a normal Police checkpoint because of the province border.

name: Baines Baobabs Site 2
description: Rudimentary camping with your own long drop toilet and bucket shower. Bring your own water. No electricity. Booked through Xomae Group in Maun. Braai stand and fire pit. 50USD pppn. Each pitch is large enough for several vehicles. Each of 3 sites are over a mile as the crow flies from the Baines Baobab trees group but pitches 1 and 2 have their own Baobabs away from the tourists. Pitch is on the edge of the pan and you have to drive around the edge to get to it. Quiet and with nobody about. No other facilities, no cell service and no wifi. Long and sometimes deep sand drive to get here. Pan salt crust can be soft in places

name: Ghoha Gate
description:
Ghoha entrance gate of the Chobe national park.
You can't book any Campsites here

name: Mababe Gate
description:
Mababe gate to the Chobe national park. 
They sell firewood here.

name: Shakawe River Lodge
description: Campsites right on the river.  Well shaded, maybe enough sun for solar too. Braai and sink at each site. Restaurant and bar at the lodge, with wi-fi. A bit spendy atP200 pppn, but that seems the going rate.

name: Road A33
description:
Fenced sandy area guarded by 2 friendly men working shifts of 4 weeks. They are used to hosting bicyclists as there is no safe accommodation between Elephant Sands and Pandamatenga. Pit toilet, no shower, bring your own water as their supply comes only every 2 weeks. 
You can climb up the antenna for the view. Free

name: Bush camp
description:
around that area, a small foot path goes south leading 50m from the road to a large open area. Ground is hard, cannot access with car, we were on bicycles. lots of wood, no water, beautiful place to watch the stars.
We had the visit of a few zebras at dusk, otherwise very quiet.
This camp is not fenced, so the basic rules for bush camping applies; make a fire, no light in the tent, look around for shining eyes at night before getting out of the tent

name: Checkpoint Foot & Mouth (from Maun to Ghanzi)
description: Direction Maun-Ghanzi: Leave meat behind or cook it on the spot

name: Thebe River Safaris (Lodge and Campsite)
description: Big campsite. Friendly reception. Large sites. Electricity at sites. Slow Wifi at reception and restaurant. Catering for overlanders and big groups. Smaller groups/individuals also welcome. 135P pppn. no wifi at campsites

name: Bush Camp
description:
Wild camping 10 m off from the track to CKGR, 8 km away from the Tsau Gate. 
Location at the diversion to Great Tsau, which was obviously not often used. There are two short lines leading to the Great Tsau track and we simply blocked one of them with our car. Nice and calm place.

name: Kwagancinci
description: A delicious coffee shop serving full meals, coffee, tea, bubble tea, and preserves. Tasty food, delicious coffee, and superb service, with a smile.  Seating is on a lovely shaded patio. WiFi free.

name: Ngoma bridge border crossing
description:
We had slight problem exiting Namibia as we did not have the 'road permit', this should have been issued (and paid for!) on entry but we came in at MataMata border and they did not issue. Needed therefore to buy one now upon exit but police (who issue) were most obnoxious and attempted to fine us (up to 4000 !), they also insisted on cash only and in Namibian dollars. We did not pay any fine and eventually left after just purchasing the permit. My advice . . . . If you do not have permit issued on entry then go to the police station in Katima and request one there BEFORE attempting this border without.

For entry into Botswana . . . . . .. .  .reasonable easy formalities, pleasant enough staff, friendly and helpful, need to buy vehicle insurance and road permit, for under 3500kg this costs 100 + 221 (pula) (insurance valid for year, permit for 1 month). The talked about "entry tax" that was supposed to be implemented from June 1st 2017 has at this point in time been indefinitely postponed.
If this does get implemented then it will be 30 US$ per person.
Possible to make any payments with either card or any currency.
Foot and Mouth check here too. Disinfect shoes and an enquire of "do you have any meat ?". Though the inspector looked inside vehicle there was no actual checking inside any boxes or even the fridge, of course we had already told him we are vegetarian !

name: Bush camp Nata to Kasane road
description: Large open area well away from road but deep in bush, lots of game around. Very good spot about half way between the two main towns.

name: Ever Dry Clean & Laundry
description: At the Fresh Exclusive Night Club on the A3.  P120 for a large basket to be washed and dried, which they allowed me to fill and cram all our laundry into.

name: Botshelo Guest House
description: Motel with single (300p) double (300 or 350p) or family (600p) per room. Safe parking lot with area to sit (we put our stove there to cook).

name: Multiple Times Clothing
description: Tiny shop on the far side of a salon.  They make new clothes and do alterations.  Can be seen from the road.

name: Nxai Pan National Park Entrance Gate
description: Instead of paying the ridiculous 50USD pppn to stay at one of the national park campsites inside the Nxai Pan park, when we turned up late evening, the ranger very kindly allowed us to camp just inside the gate under the staff car port. They even kept the toilets open for us, though they weren't in great condition. We didn't have to pay a cent! Can't guarantee this will be allowed every time, but if you do arrive late in the day it's definitely worth the question.

name: Fresh Exclusive
description: Dry cleaner - 120pula for a reasonable large basket. Ready within the day of delivered in the morning

name: Kalahari Rest Lodge
description:
18 Chalet / Bungalow rooms
Excellent facilities Inc TV  and DSTV
Great for on route stop in Botswana

name: bushcamp near Orapa
description:
simple overnight spot.
Large unused dirt road about 1.5kms from highway.
Very quiet, saw nobody.
good overnight spot, approx 550kms from Gabarone.

name: Orapa Game Park
description:
This reserve is owned and operated by 'deveers'diamond company whom also of course operate the huge mine here.
You MUST obtain a permit to enter either the park or for that matter the actual town of Orapa.
permit must be obtained 48 (minimum) in advance and must be for a specific day.
permit is free and can be obtained by email.
Ompatile Galaletsang is lady responsible, her email is :

OGalaletsang@debswana.bw

She will need : full names of each person, copy of passport or id, date of birth.

Worth making the effort as you will almost certainly have whole park to yourselves.

name: Kwalate Safaris
description: Go upstairs by the currency exchange and in the back. For booking Ihaha campsite in Chobe NP, Xakanaxa and Southgate campsites in Moremi.

name: SKL
description: For booking Savuti or Linyati campsites in Chobe NP as well as Khwai in Moremi.

name: Mbudi camp site
description: Campsites along the river. Need to be fully self sufficient. Not as much game as at Magotho. 300pula pppn. Book via 73681757 or mbudicampkwai@gmail.com

name: Wild camp next to road
description: Tucked behind the back of the trees. Very quiet but the odd car does pass. Heaps of firewood. Saw a giraffe.

name: Motor parts sales and services
description: For motors and vehicles. They are open on a Sunday!

name: Delta 4x4
description: Best Toyota mechanic in town for the older vehicles. Where the dealer ship could not help me, he had all the parts. +267 686 4572 / +267 716 26 899

name: The Solar Zone
description: This is a solar / inverter / battery supply shop. We offer Victron equipment (inverters, charge controller, chargers). We also have a range of batteries (lead acid and lithium ion) for vehicles and solar systems as well as solid frame panels from 10W to 330W.

name: Mamuno Border Post
description: Leaving from Botswana to Namibia. Border open 7am to midnight.

name: Greens baobob
description: Looks like a good spot for camping. No facilities. Tree is famous as a waypoint for European travellers in the 1800s.

name: Wild camping just off the salt pan
description: On a grassy island off the salt pan. Has a bunch of small trees (no shade but a little bit of firewood). Private, can't be seen from the 'road'. Extremely quiet. Amazing stars at night. It's a bit too bumpy for a tent but could be done.

name: Viewing platform
description:
ADMIN NOTE: users report very dangerous and muddy roads on the salt pans. Stay on track and avoid any water on the path. Vehicles have been known to roll and get stuck.  After the rains 07/2018

Looking out over the pan. Would be a good spot to camp too, especially for tents. Nobody in attendance.

name: Phokoje Pan - DWNP site CKTAU03
description: Clearing in the grasslands between pans. One tree for shade. Still run by the DWNP so only P30 pppn. Pit toilet and firepit in good condition. Bucket shower has been destroyed. A great place to stay if you want to drive the full route around the northern CKGR. Took us about 6 hours to drive here from Leopard Pan in dry season, with stops on the way.

name: Motovac
description: Good place to get parts. Has the best selection

name: Mankwe bush lodge and campsite
description: Very nice private campsites in the middle of the bush. 250 pula per person they gave fire wood and there are flush toilets and bucket showers

name: zutshwa stop over
description: nice house with fence and facilities in little village. we did not sleep there but looks very nice.  150 pula per 2 persons per night.

name: wild camp at a pan
description:
Just a place in the wild. direkt at a dry lake. In rainy season for shure full of water.
horses and cows around and some earth pigs.

name: masethleng pan
description:
At our time the lake was try but a lot of wildlife her.
gnu, oryx, elan, valture, springbock
there is also a campground here but we did not go there.

name: western woodland forest wild camp
description:
Nice wildcamp in a nice forest without thorns.
remote area and hard to come from the south as they are small with a lot bushes. Rigs that are bigger than landcruiser will get scratches for shure😉
Realy remote area. Nobody will be hee by food and a car maybe only once a week will pass.

name: Western woodland
description:
Also called dreamland forest
nice open eared without a lot of bushes.
just gras and very old trees (akazien)
lot of wildlife here.
the whole area is like described 
easier access from the north or you make the loop but the way is than getting narrow.
very remote area here. We did not see anyone on the whole trip except in ngwatle.

name: wild camp on a side way
description:
It is a track to a farmhouse. We asked the farmers there and we were alowed to sleep near the track without any hassle.
Away from the A2 so nobody could see us

name: Land Cruiser parts and repair
description: A big Land Cruiser repair and parts shop. Specialized on Land Cruisers.

name: Taurus Batterie & electrics
description:
Best and cheapest place to buy a new batterie. Extremly huge storage of all kinds of batteries. They have also solar batteries, lots of other election things and also repair diesel Injektion pumps.
Very friendly and helpfull stuff

name: cape vulture wildlife office
description:
You have to register here. 
No entrance fee!
Saturday and Sunday is the office closed. So we had a look without registering. Only asked a local 😉
The volgure are far away living in rocks. You will need a good pinocular to see them.

name: Just a wildcamp
description: place in the bush. no peoples around and far away from the main road.

name: J&N Auto Electrical, Arthur Pots
description: A place to sort out car electrics/electronic issues. 250 Pula per hour. Phone number: 72262921.

name: Motsana
description:
Nice cafe restaurant good food
Close to audi camp special interor
Nice service and frendly owner
Wifi free

name: Capital guesthouse
description: Really nice place. Bit expensive at €80 per night for a double room including breakfast, but kids stayed for free and breakfast included. Staff is amazing and really really clean. Secure parking. In Gaborone it is one of the best places to stay

name: Delta Deli market
description: Sells wide variety of high quality vacuum-packed meats - valid for 30 days.

name: Masama Lodge
description:
Lodge (chalets & camping) is just off the main road, down a short dirt track.  Camping is out back.  Large, clean spaces, some with power points.  One water tap for all sites.  Flush toilets and hot shower (water pressure varied, but always hot) but no roof and lights went off sometime before 8:30, so needed flashlight for toilet. Ablutions fairly clean.
Restaurant/bar onsite, but they had no menu.  Said beer was cold.
Was a fine place for a one night stop over, would not want to spend more time here.  Felt like somewhere that used to be really nice and well kept, now a bit ragged around the edges.  The ladies that appeared to be in charge and doing all the cleaning were very nice.
Found this place on T4A, and write up does not match current facilities.
Paid P90pppn

Comment: Now they want money for the car too.185 Pula for>5t.

name: Hippo pool
description: We saw over 10 hippos bathing here. You can drive within 10 metres to the river.

name: Mokolodi Nature Reserve
description: The Reserve offers chalets and camping.  The receptionist told us campsites are 3.5km from reception and offer showers with donkey for hot shower, Fire pit, braai pit, toilets, no electricity.  P125pppn + P60 per vehicle

name: Nice open wild camp area
description: a open place without bushes. very hidden so nobody will see you

name: wild camp in a mopane forest
description:
Nice peaceful place in a mopane forest. Direkt at a gate to a small farm area. But nobody came and we staid here for the whole day.
internet available here (be tell sim)

name: wild camp
description:
Just near the road a bit hidden. It was dark when we decided to stay here. Now some sign says "no camping". It is from the kubu office and later on we saw a sign at the pan says 1000 pula fine if you do go there without paying entrance😦😡
It seems to be forbidden in the complete area to wildcamp so better hide from locals!

name: Ruin Mmakhama amazing view!
description:
Here is the junktion you have to get of the main road.
from here 2 km first sandy than rocky piste to the ruin. The last few metres you have to walk😉
-21.20471,25.98820 is the parking for the ruins.
Amazing view over the the pan from here! We loved the place.

name: wild camp at etge of the pan
description:
Nice view from here over the pan and an excellent sunrise.
when we were here a few wet spots are on the pan. so be careful😉

name: Nice spot in the pan
description:
Attention!
The area North of this point belongst to jacks camp an very exclusive (1500 usd pp pn) camp of "uncharted africa safaries"
So an employe told us that we have to leave the pan! All here is privat land and only the road is public. To leave the road is strictly forbitten. 
This place here was ok for him after long discussion. No idea if he will be think the same way in future! 
At least a very nice and peaceful spot. Pan here is very beautiful!

name: bushcamp
description: just an overnight bushcamp well back from road hidden out of sight, quiet. Did not hear or see anyone. bit sandy but I didn't need 4x4

name: wild camp on a field
description: Next to nata and no one around.  perfect flat spot near some farmlands. only donkeys and cows around us😉

name: wild camp with elefants
description:
Just a bit further on this pass road we stand for a night on the side.
Nobody here except a lot of elefants in the night 😉

name: Ken Webster
description: If you need a repair around Kasane, Ken is your man. He replaced our broken leaf spring for around 100 euros.

name: Khama Rhino Sanctuary
description: Relatively small but nice Rhino Sanctuary and the best place to see the endangered white and black rhinos in Botswana. Some other Game too (Zebra, Giraffe, Antelopes) and a lot of Birds. You can drive around in your own Car or book guided Game Drives. Dirt Tracks are Sandy, 4x4 definitely recommended. See Campground for up to date pricing Information as most of the People stay over Night at the nice Campground. Day Visits also possible. Entrance and Camping combined is 480 P per Day (2 Persons with Car).

name: The Remnants of Chapmann's Baobab
description: Chapmann's Baobab was one of the biggest and oldest Trees around and up to 2.500 Years old. It measured 25 m in Diameter. Unfortunately the whole Tree has collapsed :( We only saw the Tribes lying around at the Ground. We don't know what happend but it's really sad.

name: Mack Air (Scenic Flights)
description: We booked a scenic Flight over the Okavango Delta with this Company. They are located opposite the Airport. We've been a Group of six People and chartered a small Airplane. Cost was 4.485 P all inclusive (748 P or 63 Euro per Person) for a one Hour Flight. You can choose between starting in the Morning or Afternoon. It was an awesome Experience, beautiful Landscape and a lot of Game.

name: Monlek Lodge
description:
ADMIN NOTE: user reports Low trees prevented Big Rig from entering. 

Possibly only place to camp for a night in Sehithwa. Friendly staff who will allow one to camp in a tent or vehicle in the grounds of the lodge. Access with a key to a room for clean hot shower and toilet, electricity connection in room, no wifi. One big tree for shade. Rooms with bathrooms also available. 100 Pula pppn to camp.

name: Entrance Makgadikgadi Pans GR
description: Gate to enter the Makgadikgadi Pans Game Reserve.

name: Gate Makgadikgadi Pans GR
description:
We asked if we can sleep/camp at the parking, because there is no camping nearby.
After a little hassitation we can park at the "garage" on a concrete slap. Just perfect for the night and to enter the park at 6.00 h.

name: Koaza Spring
description:
Natural spring.
Mostly used for drinkingplace for catle, but we also saw Ostrich and a lost Flamingo.

name: Dumela Lodge
description:
Nice place but for camping just little facillities.
Campsite is a small circle with places for about 5 cars/tents. Almost no shade.
Pitches on sandy/small stones, but flat.
There is one braai and a fireplace in the centre of the site. So put all the meat together and share with each other. But take your garbage with you, because there are no bins around. Not even in ablusionblock.
Pitches has no light, no tap, no electricity. So, a good place to see the galaxy.
Ablusion is Oké and there is hot water, but no mirror.
Swimmingpool was not so clean, but because of the heat we went for a dip.
Wifi at reception/bar/pool and is average.
Price BP85 pp.
They have tents to sleep in. A restaurant and bar. And the staff is friendly.
Very quiet at night.

name: Mochaba Crossing
description: Mochaba Crossing offers a range of secure compound accomodation 15 minutes from Maun set in quiet well maintained gardens overlooking the Thamalakane river. Accomodation options range from private air conditioned chalets, permanent tents and shaded overlander camp sites with brai stands and well maintained ablutions.

name: Mababe trust Maun
description: Here you can book the Dizhana campsite; very friendly staff. There is no sign, so best to give a call if you can't find it. The office is right behind the Ncongo office, which you can see from the road. +26773129016

name: Sefalana Shopper
description: Well stocked supermarket in Tshabong Botswana. First town after the border fron South Africa

name: Speed controls
description: Just for info, beware of the speed control by the police. I saw at least 3 of them from Namibia border to Maun. Price is always 100p + 20p each km/h too fast...

name: Wild camp at water reservoir
description: After visiting the vulture park on my way to South Africa. Just an end of the road, at the water reservoir for the village. Some houses not far away but not really visible. Sometimes visited I think, but when I came here it was fine from 3pm to 8am next day. In the morning a rooster close by told me to leave Botswana ;)

name: Xomae group- book 3rd bridge camp moremi
description:
Only place you can book camping in 3rd bridge campsite in moremi. You can't get into moremi without a campsite booking.
500pula per person per night and also have to buy park entry.
Book early, it was booked out for ten days when we arrived

name: Tsodilo hill bush camp
description: Quiet spot with view of the hills, tire tracks leading in. Good wild camp near the main camp.

name: Side of road
description: Just off road. Plenty of firewood. Very quiet road, I'm sure you can camp anywhere no worries.

name: Gcwihaba  (Drotsky's) cave south entrance
description:
Entrance to the cave. 
Spectacular formations and huge!

Go in here and stay left and keep going, you can do about a 5 min loop underground that is great.
After going in here and the north entrance it seems going right through is possible though expect to get very dirty and some tricky sections. We did not go right through, only in a few hundred meters from each end.
Stalactites and stalagmites a bit more impressive at the north entrance, so check it out too.
Nobody around during our visit so all free. Hard to say if new development is continuing or abandoned.

name: Gravel pit
description:
A little close to the road but just out of sight below road and good enough in a pinch.
Herd of elephants walked past an hour after sunset. Cooooool.

name: Moriti Wa Selemo
description: Very well-run luxury campsite with large sites and cute thatched roof dome huts. Ablutions very clean and well built, lots of shade, bar and restaurant, creatively built furniture and roofed sitting areas throughout. Paid 85 pp including car. Braai facilities and free wood provided. Situated beside walking path to a natural spring, Mmakgama ruins and Makgaba Fossils, which took us two hours round trip and was a great way to get out of the car for a nice walk! A two hour drive round trip from an incredible panoramic viewpoint of the Makgadigadi Salt Pans. Adventure activities can be arranged including zip line, interactive marimba music, quad biking, beach buggy rides and land yacht trips. Great way to experience the central Botswana

name: Rock City camping
description: Better not go here! We arrived here at sunset, but it would have been better to find a place wild camping. The showers are not working, african toilets very dirty, lot of noise from the generator. Price 100 pula pppn. Owners are friendly..

name: Orapa mine entry
description: You need a permit to pass this road, it goes to the Orapa mine. We got one at the gate as we just wanted to go to the supermarket. You can get the permit at Makumuta lodge west of the city, or online as described in the description of the orapa game park.

name: ATM
description:
USER REPORTS ATM NOT AVAILABLE. 

ATM at Barclays bank and a branch of Choppies Superstore next to Barclays bank though we didn‘t use the supermarket.

name: Gidichaa Wildcamp
description:
If you’re tired of all the potholes, turn off the main road and find this beautiful bush camp. Expect wildlife and specially elefants but most probably no people.
We went until the end of this little track, but found nobody.
To find turn off the road at
19° 30' 45.3" S, 22° 07' 29.6" E and follow the narrow tracks.

name: Bananyana Backpackers Camp
description:
Real African Camp in probably continuously construction. Very nice place but quite small and crowded.
Our night was noisy due to music, dogs, ...
We payed just 50 Pula/p and nothing for our three kids.

name: Makumutu Safari Lodge & Camp
description: Surprisingly nice place to spend a night. They opened in the beginning of 2017 so everything is new. Very friendly staff, there’s a good bar, great food and nice, clean Bathrooms as well as two pools. The Campground is ready now, but there is little room for your own tent(between the safari tents). Price is P120pp.

name: GnusGnus
description: Single deep sand Campingspot in the middle of nowhere which could be nice but the place is behind a small hill so you can not look into the GnusGnus pan and the surrounding bush was very thick. In this part of the Kgalagadi Transfrontierpark you can take only one big loop which takes hours. You have thick thorn bushes close to the road so it´s hard to spot wildlife. We heard that all the other Campsites were booked but I doubt that because we didn't see anybody during two days. No facilities. Bring your own water.

name: Linyanti
description: Five separate and very spacious Campsites. Each of them with a big tree for shade and a fire place. You only see the next campsite in the distance so it is very quiet. No electricity but a clean ablution block with flush toilets. You have a beautiful view over the Linyanti swamps and a lot of elephants visit the camp. Unfortunately with 50 $ per person per night it is way too expensive (same as Savuti). The road between Linyanti and Savuti is really deep sand.

name: Webb’s Motors
description:
Workshop and parts in Tsabong. Handy if you need a repair after the Kgalagadi. Ask for mechanic Bimbo or Mr. Bothwell. They’re very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Negotiate about the price.
Tel. +2676540283

name: Xade Gate camp
description:
Camp next to the Xade gate from Central Kalahari. 
They have a few spots, but feels more like wild camping. 

There is an ablution block, but there is no running water because the elephants broke it. 
And know that the roads around here are very sandy! 

(The only 'down' part is the generator that is running most of the time for the rangers. )

name: Bape camp
description:
Camping is only allowed at designated campsites. So Bape we used one our way from Xade to Khutse. 
It's a beautiful wild place with no facilities. 
From Xade to Bape took us almost 6 hours.

name: Moreswe camp
description:
Around this pan there are 4 pitches. We stayed at number 2, here you have a nice view over the pan. And a tree for shade. 

Every spot has it's own longdrop toilet and bucket shower.  (you need to fill with your own water) 

It's worth to take the northern loop from Khutse gate to here. You're passing al the waterholes. So more chance to see animals. 
You can also do a nice game drive around the Moreswe pan with have it's one waterhole.

name: Motse Lodge
description:
Perfect cheap spot for a night.
80 pula pp. clean simple ablutions.
Free WiFi, pool. Secure place.

name: Motopi 1
description:
On the route from the Mabuasehube gate to Nossob camp this is a nice stop when your not in a hurry. Approximately 3 hours per 100km without a trailer. Sites can be booked at the Botswana reception at Twee Rivieren or at the other Botswana gates. 
P52 pppn and this include the gate, conservation and camp fees.
Unfenced camp with pit toilet.

name: prime health MEDICAL PRACTICE
description: Private Clinic. We went there because of a tonsillitis. Very fast help and very friendly staff and doctor. All in all it took us about 30 minutes. European standard. Opening hours see picture.

name: Builders Warehouse
description: We had our gasbottle filled at builders  warehouse

name: Ramokgwebana - Plumtree border post
description:
Border crossing from Botswana to Zimbabwe. Botswana side was easy; Zimbabwe carnet took about 2,5 hours. Paid USD 70 for Carbon tax, road tax and 3rd party package

DO NOT ENTER Zimbabwe without bringing in USD!  Current exchange rate is 1 USD to about 3.4-4 Bond Notes.  April 2019.
Update 2022: standard chartered banks have atm with USD redrawn so less need for the bundles of USD at the start of your trip.

name: Eselbe Camp
description:
Lovely campsite on the river, safe to swim, if there is water! During dry season the river is dry.
We did a canoe trip on the river and had a nice fire and braai with the owner under a stunning sky full of stars. A very pretty place with amazing birdlife. Ablution block with sinks, flushing toilets and warm showers. Accessible with a normal car. No electricity at the campsites. No official restaurant but there are dinner and breakfast options.

name: Laundry Service itenge
description:
Laundry cleaning Service for Clothes

Wash and dry and fold Pula 34 kg

name: Bush Camp near Road
description: It‘s good Place to stay for one night before you wanna go to the makgadikgadi. Nothing special. But it‘s for free and nobody was around.

name: Grassland Safari Lodge
description:
Very nice campground in the private game reserve of the lodge. Really in the bush. Lots of game around, including white rhinos. 4 Places, all with braai stand, and a sink. Hot water from the donkey. Big shady roof above a concrete platform in the middle. Big rigs may have a problem here, better ask. Very friendly and helpful managment. For more Information about the lodge refer to the website. 
grasslandlodge.com
240 Pula pp/ USD 20

We had a bushwalk with San people, very interesting. They show a lot about their life in the bush and how to survive here. Cost: 250 Pula pp

If you want to see the lions and other predators, the feeding of the lions, leopards and wild dogs take place  on Saturday and Wednesday. 150 pula pp

You can participate in rhino tracking where the San Bushmentrack down a rhino by reading the bush signs. 250 pula pp.

To get there follow the signs 37 km north of Ghanzi. The road is 60km on dirt tracks which get sandy in places.  Be prepared to open and close 17 gates.

name: Overnight spot with cactus
description: There are many fences along this road, and this is just an overnight spot which was good enough for us. The entrance is form -26.840973 21.59494. Even if it's close to the road, and you can hear the cars, you are hidden from the threes. Very few vehicles past after sunset.

name: Place to get the permit for Old Palapye
description: This is the private home where lives the cashier from the Conservation Trust. The price to enter in the Old Palapye area is P 20 pp and the permit to take photos it's P 150! We negotiate the price: 2 persons and photos for P 100.

name: Old Palapye Entrance
description: Old capital of Bangwato from 1889 to 1902. Very nice burnt-brick relic of the London Missionary Society church. To see also the Motetane Gorge, where Tswapong communities come to praise their ancestors. To go to the gorge it's a 20 minute walk from the parking (-22.63231 27.35419).

name: Old Palapye Church
description: Next to the Old Church it's possible to camp for free. Very quiet (we stay there several days and we have seen some locals only on Sunday). We only pay once for the permit and we don't know if this is correct or not. No one come to ask for more money. With btc there is a little signal.

name: Khama III Museum
description: The museum itself is in the house where Seretse Khama lived. It's simple but it has many photos which were brought to life from a very knowledgeable young lady. Entry fee: P 30 pp. The guided tour lasted more than one hour. We recommend the visit.

name: Leopard plains
description: Private game farm with restaurant and 10 rooms and lots of animals

name: Wildcamp next to the river
description: some locals will pass but no one will bother you

name: Wildcamp
description: wildcamp on the hill with a stunning view over the plaine,  if you are lucky you can see the hippo's in the river. Just underneath the big baobabtree there is a plateau

name: Gweshe Engineering
description:
Contact by cell or WhatsApp: 
+267 75094648
Joshua and his sons are top quality mechanics based in Ghanzi, who are also prepared to travel for breakdown recovery. Absolute heroes when we ran into difficulty - worked into the night to get us back on the road ASAP. They also work closely with an incredibly skilled panel beater who reshaped our front wing when we were sure it was going to be a write off! He’s a total perfectionist and the vehicle now looks better than it did before the crash! They went above and beyond and their price was more than reasonable for the work that they did. Cannot recommend highly enough.

name: Eagle Suites Accommodation
description:
Great little B&B if you need a night off from camping without the huge price tag that is so common in Botswana. Conveniently located on the edge of Ghanzi town. Staff lovely, friendly and helpful - even agreed to do our laundry for us (which is not a service the guesthouse offers).
Secure parking, clean and comfortable rooms, hot showers, TV in rooms and free (good) WiFi.
Breakfast was good, but no options - bread, tomato, eggs and livers served with tea or coffee. If that’s no good for you I’m sure they could accommodate, but do speak up otherwise you will get what you’re given!
765 pula for two people in a double room, one night, breakfast included.

name: Gcwihaba Caves (Drotsky’s)
description:
Driving from Tsau direction we reached the caves but found no sign of a campsite. We therefore pitched right outside the northern entrance. There’s a big flat grassy/sandy area.
The following morning we discovered a sign for an established campsite about 3km on from here. Might be more visible if you approach from Xai Xai direction. But we had no problem bush camping here anyway.

name: Tsodilo Hills (museum and bushmen paintings)
description: Incredible place to see lots of high quality fascinating bushmen paintings, as well as a beautiful landscape. Entrance to the site is 50 pula per person, but be aware that this will only allow you to visit the museum. Viewing the paintings is only possible with a guide, which will be further cost. The shortest walk (approx. 2.5hrs) costs 120 pula in total. Well worth every penny though. Our guide was fantastic and the tour far exceeded our expectations.

name: Engen filling station and mall
description: Stayed here one night next to Cashbuild. A bit noisy, but after 20.00 gets quiet. There is security of mall and filling station. Toilets of fuel station available.

name: Water tap in community center (+ camping)
description: You can fill your tank from public tap. it was the first time they see foreigners. around. Place to sleep in the bush.

name: in the bush
description:
another place in the bush as many other.
super quiet, safe, 1km sandy road to access but no problem

name: Jwaneng Bus Terminal
description: Stayed on the parking lot of the Bus Terminal. The camp site shown on Tracks4africa doesn't exist (anymore). In the evening a police officer came to check us out, we had a little friendly chat and he left us alone. Flush toilets available in the terminal, entry through side doors.

name: River Walk Mall
description: Stayed here for one night. Rather quite after the shops and restaurants are closed. Not sure about security no one was chasing us away. Lots of restaurants and shops. Toilets in the mall.

name: wild camp
description:
very quiet spot (as usual in Botswana) at the entrance of Francistown.
good dirt road to access

name: international airport with free wifi
description:
brand new airport with many facilitites:
- free internet access
- very clean toilets
- free potable water
- free parking
 and AC when it's too hot outside !

name: Picnic site
description: This is a picnic site next to the main access track from Tsabong to Kgalagadi TFP Mabuasehube gate. Not sure if camping is allowed here as it is in a wild live management area south of the TFP. Very quiet as after about 5 pm there is no more traffic on this track.

name: Struizendam Kgalagadi bird Song Campsite
description: Located just before entering Struizendam from the south on the right hand side 700 m from main road. If closed the very friendly owner lives in the city 2 houses behind the primary school on the left. His contact details are Fredrick Titus cell 0026773447631 or 0026775850373. When we were there the water tank was empty and there is no electricity. But nice secluded campsite with ablutions and 2 chalets. Seems not very busy. Has braai facilities and nice sunsets also suitable for big groups.

name: NSI Mechanics and Spares and Carwash
description: Good mechanics did a good job. We had a problem because of bad diesel in Namibia. You can also wash cars here.

name: Restaurant and little food store
description:
A small shop and nice little very clean Restaurant with typical lunch for 25 pula per person. For exemple: Beef with rice and cole slow.  Recommendable and typical.

Friendly owner also may allow you to camp on her property next door. Toilet and bucket shower. We made sure to thank her by purchasing items in shop or restaurant.

name: Discovery B&B
description:
Very nice place. Chalet made in african style, nice little swimmingpool nicely arranged to stay around, good wifi, very friendly dutch couple, very clean.
85Dollars for 2 with breakfast (was a special price last minute at the door). Save parking. Walk to the river possible

name: Njuca Hills
description: Basic campsite with 2 sites. Bring your own everything. One toilet and one bucket shower.

name: Open Pan Bushcamp
description: Just out in the pan next to the track  in a open area. Beautiful sunset and sunrise. Really quiet. Only one car past. Rabbits around. Good for a overnight stop.

name: Elephant Trail
description: They have rooms but they let us sleep in our rooftent (there is only room for a few cars). They asked for 100pp but we negotiated 50pp without trouble. Good free WiFi, kitchen area, outdoor donkey shower and nice garden and chillout area.

name: Kaa Pan
description: Awesome campsite (no facilities) in the game management area near Kaa Gate. Great view onto pan- lots of animals including lion at night and in the morning. Needs to be paid cash when entering into the GMA at Zutshwa (honesty box - please do pay, it’s a good system). 200 Pula per site (two sites at this location, but only one with a good view)

name: Mario’s Garage
description: Awesome Zambian/Italian mechanic, can sort out all Toyota and Land Rover issues. Came back twice for service. Fair pricing and good quality

name: Puma Fuel Station
description: Fuel station is open again after renovation.

name: Wildcamping near entry gate Khutse
description:
Its a nice please to stay overnight before you drive into the Khutse Game Reserve.
There are no facilities.

For this reserve you pay 250 pula per night per person for a basis camping with facilities.
Entrance fee 120 pula per person per day
Car fee 50 pula per day

A good reason to stay overnight at the wildcamping and start early in the morning.

name: Xade Campsite  CKXAD-02
description:
Update April 2022: the sandy patch is now completely overgrown with high grass & Devil's thorn. The big tree is mostly gone. Maybe doable in winter but not great in summer. Still good views though and very private, which is great.

By coordinates this should be Xade Campsite. A few km from the gate and airport. Its a spot with a nice view over 100m far. 

The campsite itself is nothing but a sandy spot under a big tree with a fire pit. Nothing else. 

Coming from the south the road is very sandy for the last 30 to 40 km before the campsite.

name: Little pan in the bush
description:
Wild camping. Beautiful area, on a little pan, there are cows walking on this area, quite and beautiful trees. 
In the night we heard a man riding his horse. I dont know if its good or bad. 

We stayed next to a old small waterhole what is used for people. Look under the next to the pan. Its covered with wood.

name: Motopi 2
description:
A secluded campside on the way from Nossib to Mabuasehube Gate. A few big trees give shade, there is a long drop and a firepit. The surrounding is very beautiful. In the morning we saw fresh tracks of lions and other cats. 

Price: 30 pppn
Entry park: 20 pppn and 4pcarpn

name: Sunday Pan Waterhole
description: It's a artificial waterhole where you can watch all kinds of animals and birds especially during the dry season.

name: ALI Boats & Yamaha Dealer
description: Yamaha dealer, got a lot of genuine motorbike parts and aftermarket stuff. Can order things you need.

name: Panda Rest Camp
description:
200km North of Nata, 100km south of Chobe - Kasane. Just 200metres off the main road.... "A perfect stopover for the tired traveler!

Lovely and friendly place. Nice camp setup, each site has braai, water and power and most of them have stone table and benches. Good and clean ablutions. Restaurant, bar, pool. We paid 80Pula pp.

name: Chilote Guest House
description: nice little guesthouse with 6 rooms. All with Wifi, TV, hot shower, reasonable price, safe parking

name: Thamalakane Guest House
description:
Very nice and brand new self Catering guest house. Very good rooms, bathrooms, garden, barbecue...
We payed for three persons in one room and two nights 1310,- Pula. Best offer we found in Maun.

name: Pholo Guest House
description:
Very new and clean BB. 
550 Pula for a double room without BF.
We did not find any cheaper in Ghanzi.
Very nice owner. When we arrived the whole town had no water because of a broken pipe. So we could not have a shower in the afternoon. Without asking for, our host offered us breakfast for free as compensation.

name: Wild camp at Zebra Waterhole
description: Nice and quiet place with view of the waterhole where zebras and wildbeests come to drink. There is a sandy area behind the small hill which is perfect for wild camping. We arrived around noon and only 3 cars (other travelers) passed by until night. Really nice place.

name: Boro Mokoro Launching Area
description:
At the end of the road where the tourist trips start and the people fetch there water. Elephants on the other side of the fence. Nice people, we did a small tour in the village with our guide and drank a beer in the local bar. 
You can park your car in the village for small money while you are on the (very recommendable) mokoro trip (booked at the OKMCT office in Maun). 
The night before the trip was free.

name: Mokoro Trip Camp
description:
One of the many places where the guides bring you for overnight mokoro trips from Boro (in dry season). Under small trees for shadow. Water only from the creek, so bring your own. Also the complete equipment and if possible a hammock. The guide will dig a hole and light a fire.
The trips can be booked in the OKMCT office in Maun (near the Airport) and are much, much cheaper than the one the agencies offer.
The best are the game walks in the morning and the evening, so bring good walking shoes.
We paid about 1.300.-P for a 3 days/2nights trips with tip and car parking, bringing the complete equipment and food.
Weak connection with mascom.

name: Tree Island Camp
description:
3 sites at a small pan in the grass savannah, lightly higher with some trees. Pit toilet and bucket shower, but no water. No firewood around.
Some animals to be seen from the site. No. 1 is the best!
Absolutely solitary and seldom visited (last visit 1 week ago).
To be booked in the DWNP office in Maun or Gabarone or at the gate. 
120.- pp entrance fee, 50.- for the car and 30.-P pp for camping.
Normally you can leave the park at any time on the next day.
No network with mascom.
Easy access via East gate.

name: Kori 1
description:
Huge area with some shade, in the quite open bush, but no view of the pan. Next site not to be seen or heard. Easy access from the gate.
Pit toilet quite full, shower bucket was missing. No firewood around.
No animals directly at the site, but in the pan below.
30.-P pp not including entrance fee (290.-P 2 person, 1 car).  
To be booked in the office of DWNP in Maun or Gabarone. At the gate only if there is electricity and the offices are open. At the time we were there it was fully booked.
No network with mascom.

name: BTC sim card
description: Buy a local sim card for P10 with your passport here

name: Bush camp
description: No fences on the right side of the road, nice and quiet

name: Waterlilly Lodge
description: All campsite were full, it was cold, we decided to find a b&b or hotel. Most of them were full... Waterlily had one room left. They agreed to make a price ( end afternoon) 770 instead if 978 Pula. Very nice place.

name: Police Checkpoint
description: Former Veterinary control, now the police check if light indicators and lights work properly. They say they stopped “randomly”, but we where the only ones they stopped.

name: Xade Campsite
description: This is where I was sent for Xade Campsite, big tree and quietness!! Clean up after yourself please as its littered with toilet paper (dig a hole and burn it) and aluminum foil (you know it doesn’t burn so take your crap).

name: CKMO3 Campsite
description: Nice site with lots of shade, not much view but nice and secluded

name: Deception 1
description: Pit toilet and bucket shower, shade and lots of birds, not much view, look out for the resident owl!

name: Puma petrol
description: Your last petrol stop before hitting the Central Kalahari, card payments or cash

name: Wild camp
description: Perfect spot with tall trees, lots of shade and firewood! The road towards Kukonje is freshly graded so easy driving

name: Vet check point
description: This is the turn off to Kukonje Island, no control at the moment

name: Rileys Garage and Autozone
description: Large selection of off road and camping needs as well as car parts and other handy goods. They helped me with my broken high lift jack

name: Smiles dentist
description: Consultation P200 and P150 for emergency appointment as I had a massive toothache to be looked at. Quick and professional service

name: Village water tap
description: Water tap which the villagers use so ask nicely and fill up!

name: Hippo Pool picnic spot
description: Picnic spot at the water with toilets and a raised platform to watch the hippos, kingfishers and Lechwe!

name: Water hole
description: A small detour from the main road with lots of hippo, fish eagles and buffalo! Last time I passed it had some elephants as well

name: Pizza + coffee & curry
description: Now serving Indian food under a different name, in the corner of Mathiba & Mophane streets (200 meters away from this old location, look for a wooden sign ”Indian restaurant”). Pretty bland food, Tqndurei is much better.

name: Road to Kasane direction
description: From the park turn left at Goha gate for 7 km and turn right towards Kasane, much better and easier road, still very sandy though but the guides recommended this road rather to the one straight out.

name: Continental Motors of engine New bridge Rd, Iveco Werkstatt
description:
This connected company of the filling station, the Continental of engine New bridge Rd, is to be recommended by no means!! The manager requires an Arbeits hourly price of 120€. On previous inquiry, he understands supposedly no word. We were disappointed very much!! No good company, unprincipled!. We were disappointed very much and discontented!! No good enterprise characterless and greedy for money boss.

-----

Diese angeschlossene Firma der Tankstelle, die Continental Motors New Bridge Rd, ist auf keinen Fall zu empfehlen!! Der Geschäftsführer verlangt einen Arbeits Stunden-Preis von 120€. Auf vorheriger Anfrage, versteht er angeblich kein Wort. Wir waren sehr enttäuscht!! Keine gute Firma, skrupellos!. Wir waren sehr  enttäuscht und unzufrieden !! Kein gutes Unternehmen charakterloser  und geldgieriger Chef.

name: Baskets direct from producer
description: A nice littla place - shop on the bad road where you can juy baskets directly from her who produces them. Good prices cheaper than in the shops

name: Nice game drive along the border
description: This road on the Botswana border is full of wildlife, elephants, buffalo and a free game drive!

name: Mopane  Elephant Forest
description:
Wild camp in the Mopane trees off the dirt road , drive in through the trees & you reach a clearing a perfect camp. Peaceful & quiet. Amazing sunset & stars. 
Lots of evidence that elephants are around. We woke early the next morning to 4 elephants very close to our Roof top tent !! All good.

name: Riley’s Autozone (And Camping Gear!)
description: Vehicle spares, tow ropes, straps, additives, jerry cans & more.

name: Mopipi Pan
description: the place is after the Pan. we stopped hiden by the très.

name: Mosomane
description: A place to stay when going the Mabusuahebe Trail. Nothing out here but nature and a look at the pan.

name: Mabua Cutline Camp
description: At the cellphone tower take the road around it and follow the double fence on the Cutline. Bush camping with Heyana and Jackal sounds all night. Good BTC mobile reception.

name: Bush Camp off A35 (near Tsodilo Hills and Mahango)
description:
Bush camp off the gravel road towards Tsodilo Hills. Not far after you have turned off the A35. On your left you will see a small overgrown sandy track, drive down that for about 100m and you will see an opening on your right. The track comes up on Maps.me and appears to be a dead end. 

Hidden from the road. Quiet. Lots of donkeys visited us. No issues. Only heard the cars on the main road.

name: Bush camp 60km from Maun
description: Small track going off A3 onto the Old Maun-Toteng Road. Road doesn’t look like it’s in use. Sandy but 4x4 not required. Hidden from the road. We didn’t see anyone at all. Just heard Cars on main road. Multiple spots along this road to camp. It runs parallel to A3 at certain times. The road is shown onMaps.me. Good one night stop before or after Maun.

name: Tilodi Victoria Falls Day Trip (Shuttle)
description:
Shuttle to Victoria falls and back. 350 Pula pp. We negotiated 300 Pula pp for a group of four. Visa for Zimbabwe and Falls entrance fee (USD $30) not included in this price. Their service, as with every other company, simply offers you the transport to and from Victoria Falls. We couldn’t find anything cheaper or better and we shopped around a fair bit. Definitely recommend that you don’t book the shuttle through your lodge or where you are staying as they will charge almost double and then use these companies! 

When we arrived at the border, there was a long queue, estimated waiting time of about two hours. Our driver said that if we wanted, we could pay USD$5 each as a bribe to the officials so that we could jump the queue. There is even a seperate entrance for people who pay this . We decided to do this. Waited 20 minutes instead and driver organised everything. Hassle free. Obviously you don’t have to do this if you don’t want, but be aware that is an option. Of course where the money actually goes is also unknown! 

Overall the service and shuttle was nothing out of the ordinary or special. But the driver made the border crossings easy. 

James the manager is super friendly and you can discuss with him what you want. They offer game drives and and boat cruises too. 

Their stand is located just outside the Chobe Safari Lodge. +267 76039813. 

* you can leave your vehicle at the chobe safari lodge parking which has a security guard. Safe. Free of charge :)

name: Gary’s Waterhole
description:
Waterhole off the beaten track in the bush! If coming from Kasane, at some point you will come to a fence/cattle grid. Just before the fence, you will see a track on your right (pretty much follows the fence line). Follow this for about 6km and then you will see another track on your right (If you arrive at the bend of the fence line, you have driven too far). Follow the track and it will eventually lead you to this waterhole. 

Located beautifully. We had a herd of 50 elephants come drink around 5.30pm and another 10 arrived about 7pm. We camped here for two nights. We also saw Zebra and Giraffe. And heard lions! Definitely worth a visit and stay :) free!! 

A local tour guide recommended this place. We visited at the end of July and there was a lot of water still.

name: Wild camp at Gary’s Waterhole
description:
This place was recommended to us by a local safari guide. He said that this location was our best and safest option to wild camp around the area as there is a lot of poaching and military activity going on in the Kasuma forest. 

We camped here for two nights and had an amazing time!! Nothing but wild animals and the bush. Not a single person came by. We made a big fire and felt very safe. Lots of firewood around. 

Beautiful setting. A Waterhole off the beaten track in the bush! If coming from Kasane, at some point you will come to a fence/cattle grid. Just before the fence, you will see a track on your right (pretty much follows the fence line). Follow this for about 6km and then you will see another track on your right (If you arrive at the bend of the fence line, you have driven too far). Follow the track and it will eventually lead you to this waterhole. 

On our first evening, we had a herd of 50 elephants come drink around 5.30pm and another 10 arrived at 7pm. We also saw Zebra and Giraffe.  And we heard lions too! 

One of our favourite wild camps :) even if you don’t camp here, it’s totally worth a visit, especially late afternoon.

name: Truly wild camp at Waterhole
description:
Seems like this is a permanent waterhole (as there is a solar set up, like in many national parks). Off the beaten track again and what feels like in the middle of no where. Easy to access though on good track conditions. Amongst all the wilderness with animals visiting the waterhole. 

We camped here for one night. Super peaceful. Didn’t see anyone. Beautiful sunset over the waterhole. Heard lions in the morning. 

Free and real :)

name: Another wild camp at a waterhole!
description:
Lovely waterhole located at the end of a dirt track. In the middle of the bush. Far away from anything! No people. There are so many wild bush camp options around this area. Lots of little waterholes around as well. Safe, free and peaceful. Always plenty of firewood around. Lots of trees which offer shade. Perfect place to sit with anticipation to see which animals come ;) 

We spent a few days exploring this bush area and didn’t see a single other car during this time. So it’s easy to find places to camp. Enjoy!!

name: Mechanic - Isago Wheel and Tyre
description:
Perfect place to sort any mechanical issues before or after going to the Central Kalahari via the Matswere Gate. 

We broke down outside the Makgadikgadi NP and Lulu drove 70km to come and help (around 11am). It turned out we needed parts from Maun so he also ended up driving us the 140km to Maun and back. We didn’t return back to the car until 8pm and he worked on the car until 11pm. He suggested we go back to his workshop in Raikops so that he could make sure the job was done properly the next morning. We were allowed to camp outside his workshop for the night. The next day he finished the job, sourced more parts from the area and also organised a welder and sorted out some further maintenance issues etc. etc. He did everything with a lot of care and knowledge. 

Truly genuine, helpful and the one of the most friendly mechanics we have met! Highly recommended. No crazy prices and unlike other mechanics doesn’t take advantage of tourists. 

Lulu : 7568 5078

name: Wild camp before Matswere Gate CKGR
description:
Flat hidden spot from dirt track behind some trees. Less than 5 minute drive from gate. Many wild camp options available before gate. Otherwise only other option is to pay 30 Pula pppn at the Matswere Gate informal camp. 

In the morning when we drove to the gate, there was another vehicle that had parked right outside the gate by the tires on the left. They said they had no issues other than a police officer asking if they were okay. No hassles. 

Gate didn’t open until 7am!!!!! Grrrr

name: Shell Fuel
description: Fuel station with petrol and diesel. Small shop attached with food. No engine oil for sale!

name: Isaac’s yard before Mokoro Trip
description:
If you are going on a Mokoro trip(whether it’s one day or multiple days) and you want to camp near the launching station the night before, give Isaac a call on 74407928. 

A friendly man from the village who will let you park your vehicle in his yard and sleep there for free. You can also leave your car parked there for the duration of your Mokoro trip. We went for two days one night Mokoro trip and at the end gave him 50 Pula for looking after our car. Perfect option. Car was safe and we felt totally comfortable not only sleeping there for the night but also leaving the car there. 

He will help you get a poler for your trip as well. His wife sells delicious bread down by the launching station as well :)

name: Kalahari Kanvas - Tent Hire
description:
Great place to hire a tent if you are going on an overnight Mokoro trip. Good quality and big size options available that can fit multiple people and still be suitable for the Mokoro. This place also sells everything related to camping!

Hire fee for tent is 60 Pula per night. Deposit of 500 Pula must be paid which will be refunded when you bring the tent back.

name: Mechanic in Serowe
description: So helpful and knowledgeable and didn’t even want anything for his time. A small garage and only one in town. No sign just off the road by builders world.

name: Harbor - boattrip Chobe
description: If you come to harbor and talk with the boat drivers, you can get the tour for 200pula park fee included. Obviously it's nothing official, but it's a good way to save money ;-) come 30min before the starting time

name: Marc’s Eatery
description: Marc’s Eatery open Monday to Friday 1030 am to 1500. Oman’s 1700 pm to late. This is a fantastic café serving incredibly good coffee and amazing food. It’s open Monday to Saturday for breakfast and lunch and Monday, Wednesday and Friday also for Dinner. Prices are very reasonable and the eating area is in an open but covered area which has a beautiful garden area. As part of the premise are a few very good quality curio shops to browse while you’re there. It is also open Wednesday and Friday night for dinner

name: Bushcamp along Okavango
description: Open area to camp, can walk to the river, lots of animal sounds at night and signs of elephants

name: Crocodile Safari Camp
description:
Perfect located at the river, newly renovated campsite, own ablution with warm water and kitchen block for each campsite, green lawn, good restaurant, bit pricey(220  pula pp adults and kids over 5 half price).
Fast reliable Wifi for free, pool.
Great stop to explore surrounding parks and stock up in Maun!

name: Shady Bushcamp
description: Beautiful meadow with shady trees, nothing else. Not far from the road but well hidden. Few locals passed, all very friendly, had a quiet night and is not far to Nxai NP.

name: The Old House B&B
description: Very nice B&b next to the river, beautiful view and beautiful accommodations. Breakfast is good, there is wifi and obviously hot water, parking safe. They have 10rooms with A/C. The managers, Luke and his wife Daniel, are very good person. Here the contact 6252562

name: Local people house
description:
For single traveler on motorcycle or bicycle.
You must phone before to arrive. 
its a house in the village, very close from the center, where they let me a bed for few days. I could let my stuff in all security. But you must understand that there are always people, children, who come and go. People are very nice, they cook me once a day, and gave me a room for me alone.
