The house is very small, only 2 rooms, and there are 2 others small houses on the land.
i paid what i wanted... 50 P/day. 
The hygiene is not the priority. The room is ok, i was taking shower inside the room in a plastic tray. The WC is outside, but not realy clean. I used WC in the Lodge around. 
No electicity, so no internet, no water inside, just outside in the garden.
This place is for 1 person, 2 max. 
Bicycle can let inside the room. The motorcycle outside in the garden, no problem. 
At 50m, there is a small place, where people use to come the night and drink. There is noise until....the morning. But no worry apparently.
I stayed 3 days. everything cool. Minimum confort.
You can let put the tent in the garden if you want.
Sarah 73201517
Nanky 73661947 
.....and say you come on behalf of Jean the biker (i was the first visitor)

name: Wild camp elephant trail
description: On this road there are several good spots to bushcamp. Sandy but also large trees for shade and bushes to hide. Lots of space, also for big rigs.The road which leads to the bushcamp is not sandy but hard gravel so no problem for 2x4 also. If you drive the whole 4 kilometers to the end, you have a really beautifull view on the river Boteti. Worth to pay a visit. Because of a few houses near the river we drove back 2 km and found a nice place to sleep. A lot of elephant walking around here, on the riverside and in the bushes, so also a great spot to watch this amazing animals.

name: Dobe border post
description: small border post between Namibia and Botswana. very friendly officials. crossing from Namibia to Botswana only took 15 min alltogether. The roads on both sides of the border were in good condition.

name: Wild camping on wide road 100 km south  of Chobe South Eastern entrance
description: We camped on the road it's very wide and in good condition. This is about 30km before gate entrance. No traffic in the 20 hours we spent here.

name: Thobolos eco lodge and campsite
description: Lodge with chalets and basic campsite. 1.5-2 hours before Ghoha Gate of Savuti. Great game viewing from the bar at night when the owner feels like keeping the gate unlocked. Price was 500 pula per person per night for camping. Very well maintained toilet and showers. No power or water at the campsites except for the one that is the closest to the water hole. Overpriced.

name: Kwai Community development trust Camp site no 7
description: Big site that is part of the Khwai community camp sites. Big tree and no facilities but lots of game around. We had elephant in our site one night. Great game drives on the Khwai River that is 1 km away. It is pricey at Pula 300 a night per person. It was worth it for us. Camp sites are far apart.. One of our top places in Botswana. Good to support the community. You have to pay in the town Khwai at the trust offices. Town is 17km away.

name: Gcwihaba caves official camp sites
description: These are the caves campsites about 3 km from the caves. 5 sites spread out. Some has running water and showers. Nice new layout but not used much.

name: Kayak X Trails
description:
We did a great 2 days Kayak trip with Carey and his team in the Okavango delta. Jardus is a experienced Kayak guide and took us through the most stunning landscape we have ever seen. Elephants, Buffalos and Hippos and luxury camping on a remote island awaits you. You dont have to bring anything, everything is provided and you are accompagnied by several mokoros who carry all the camping equipment.  All new equipment and all very professional. You can camp on the beautiful property with great facilities and own Hippo pool. 
More information on our website and on www.kayakxtrails.com. Please call Carey (+26771572527) or Jardus (+26775571377) ahead and do not approach without appointment as it takes time to prepare the trip.

name: plain a few hundred meters of the road
description: A flat plane, with nobody around. Only some cattle from time to time. A bit windy and no facilities.

name: CKT02 in CKGR - San Pan
description: Beautiful camping site still run by the DWNR (30 pula pppn, excl. entrance fee, paid at the office in Maun, Gaborone or Ghanzi). Bucket shower and toilet are working and the view over the pan is beautiful with giraff, oryx and springbok!

name: Sunrise Motors
description:
As per recommendation best workshop in town, owned by a dutch guy named Piet. Been told they have a consistent high standard. Piet is quite old already, so it's feared when he is going to retire. 
I was there with my old Toyota HJ60 and they seemed quite knowledgeable.
It's not far from Sedia Hotel.
---
Friendly Owner who knows his business. Good prices quick service. Good mechanic. All types of cars. We had to change our timingbelt on a Toyota Landcruiser. Highly recommend this garage.

name: Baobab Hunters Road
description:
Beautiful wildcamp under a  Baobab overlooking The Valley watching the zebras an elephants goes by. In the night the sound of Lions and hyenas.
Driving the Hunters Road. Free possibility to see a lot of wildlife. About 200km long. Lots of waterholes if there is water.
The conditions could be bad in wet season, advise is to do it in dry season.
Sometimes deep sand but mostly ok.
Free wild camping places everywhere.
It is a border road between Botswana and Zimbabwe. 
Parts deep sand. We ask advice by the owner of camping Elephant Sands. You can have a visit from the army or a people from the anti poaching company. Be nice.

name: Gweta
description: Most of the time fuel and diesel. Good between Nata and Maun.

name: wild camping near Linyanti
description: after we realized that there is no campsite in this area, and we didn't want to camp inside the park, we just went into the bush looking for a spot. nice place to camp outside the park, isolated and quiet. we heard alot of animals but none showed. road is a bit sandy but not too deep. just follow the tracks until you find a spot.

name: Bushcamp near Kang
description: Just a quick stop over on our way down the Trans Kalahari Highway

name: Wild Camp Near Khwai
description: This is a great little spot not far from the Khwai North Gate. We didn‘t think we would find a place so close to the village of Khwai that was hidden, but we turned off onto a little side road, and then onto a little tiny loop off of that, and came across a spot perfect for one vehicle, as well as hidden and protected. There is wildlife in the area, so be diligent.

name: Bush Camp, multiple possibilities
description: This camp is an old gravel quarry with multiple possibilties. The gravel road from A3 is good and big rig friendly. Sometimes elefants will pass. There is no traffic. You will find fire wood.

name: Bush Camp Giraffe
description: This camp is a clearing 6.3 km west of the Nxai NP. There is a waterhole in rain season. Around you may see some giraffes and elefants. The gravel road is in some parts narrow because of camelthorns. You can do it with  a truck, if you are not sensitive with the finish of it. It's a nice and quiet spot. The track guides you to the western edge of the NP.

name: Bush Camp A2/A3
description: This site is close to the junction A2/A3 near a wide sandy pist about 600 m off the main road. You will camp with cattles in bush savanna. Three rangers passed and ask for "gift for new year". It is a nice camp for overnight.

name: Bushcamp around the waterhole
description: Beautiful bush area around a natural waterhole. We stayed one night very quite. Just camp after the water so you avoid few cars during the night going around the farms. Some friendly workers in the morning.

name: Mogonye Mmamotshwane Gorge
description: We didn‘t camp here, but stopped at the gate and think it might be one of the nicer places in the area. My understanding is that the campground is fairly new. Camping is only 50 pula pppn plus entrance fee of 100 pula pppn (for international guests). You can hike into the gorge. The gate is only open until 16:30. +267 5350004

name: Bushcamp near River
description: Here you can finde a few nice places to camp. Not easy in this area comming from south. Nobody around and very quiet.

name: Calvin Gas
description: Good place to refill gas canisters. They seem to sell some as well but smalles is 9 kg.

name: Pipers Pan Campground No. 1
description: Official Campground. Long drop, basket shower all without water. Fireplace, some trees and bushes around - that's all! Bring everything. If you stay at the enterance near the driveway you have a spectecular view over big parts of the pan and it's wildlife. Better choice than CKPIP-2 (same standart, shady but no view).

name: Jack's Pan
description:
Camping on this place needs to be booked and payed at Kokotsha Kgotla

Beautiful camping spot on top of a high dune with trees above the pan. Spectacular view! Calm and peaceful. Still clean. Bring and take everything. Direction: 30 km south of Kang turn right behind a tower, cross two old roads, continue on the sandy pist and turn left after 400 m. Follow the fences to your right for about 20 km and then the cutline for about 80 km. At the sign turn right.

name: Dobe Border
description:
Exiting Namibia/entering Botswana
Easy border. 
On the Botswana side there is no Customs nor Immigration officers. You get stamped from a Policeman and he cannot give you more than 15 days. 
So if you want more than 15 days, you need to extend your visa at any Immigration Office in Botswana. We did it in Maun.

name: Tonota police station
description: A great place to camp for the night. 24 hour police station with access to the toilets. The police were really friendly

name: topisi school
description: This school allowed us to camp for 2 nights, they were very friendly and the school children were very funny

name: school
description: This school let us camp for the night, they have 24 hour security so you are safe

name: city bikes
description: A small bike shop. The guys are very friendly and helpful. We had many problems with our bikes and they fixed it for us at a great price. They also gave us great advice and tips for botswana. They are the only bike mechanics in francistown

name: Maun Administration Offices
description: Here there is an Immigration Office where you can extend your visa. We did it, cause we entered by Dobe border and they just gave us 15 days.

name: Dead Tree Island
description: Beautiful landscape, prime game viewing area

name: Shell
description: gas and diesel, Engen station across the street too. no atm. road from here to Namibia border is good but potholes, took us 2hr on motos. was told there is an atm (barclays) just inside this little town. credit accepted at gas station.

name: Ntwetwe Pan - Kaoza Spring
description: into the wild, we love it.water hole and ostriches nearby

name: Sowa Pan (nord)
description: into the wild in the pan, we love it. Very very Quiet.

name: Spar and Woolsworth grocery store
description: decent food selection with wine store/beer store next to it.

name: Lion Park Resort
description:
Small leisure park with a big grassy campground.
Several sites are shaded, each with a wastebin, braai and tap.
Directly closed to the s campground is a enclosure (11,500sqm) with 5 lions.
Campers can use all amenities in the park (big clean wave pool with water slides, some carousels, lions,...) WiFi only available at the office, not in the camp ground.

The park during the week visited only in the morning by a few pupils with their teachers. 
At weekend it might be different. 
All the staff are very friendly and helpful, the owner, too. 
120 pula pppn. 
Washing machine 20 pula. 
Everything is absolutely clean and well maintained. 
We definitely recommend!

name: Phokoje Bush Lodge, Selebi Phikwe
description: Lodge with separate campsite: shady places if your camper/ trailer is not too high. Sandy underground. Decent ablutions (showers were cold despite 2 handles). Braai. Wifi at the restaurant. 100 pula per night per person. Do take care where you put your camper: there are so many lights that it’s almost day light.  Convenient stop over.

name: Water Hole (wild camp)
description: Follow sandy 4x4 track off the road to the South Gate of the national park. A couple of nice water holes approximately 2 km off road. Lots of game and many nice wild camping spots.

name: Water Hole Bush Camp
description: Lovely little water hole in the middle of nowhere. Quiet. A few animals coming to drink. Lots of elephant signs. None came while I was here.

name: B334 road
description:
Very sandy road. 4x4 absolutely required. only low speeds possible.
Reduce tire  pressure to 1.5 bar and proceed at best pace, don't be shy hammer  thru the thick sand. Abundant wildlife! Lots of water after rain

name: Unused road
description: Camp on an unused road. The road was built some time long in the past but never used (except by cattle as a track). Turn off from the main road (at -22.104262, 26.586149) and head North for 1.3km along a sandy road (didn't need 4WD) until you reach an intersection then turn right. We went about 50m down, but you could go further if you wanted to be really hidden. Keep in mind what ever rig you have, you will be reversing out, because there isn't really enough room to turn around, its narrow. No one passed on the roads nearby, they don't seem used much.

name: Tsabong Camel Park
description: Nice campsite. Ablutions very clean. Sandy Terrain. Friendlly staff. Some camels around. Little noise from the road. Good overnight stay to border South Africa. 100 Pula p.P.

name: Driftwood Lodge
description: B&B Lodge that goes above and beyond what a normal B&B does. Great stopover to refresh and recoup after extended camping

name: No entry to CT11 private area
description:
ONLY coming from the northern side (Gweta to Mopipi) seems a problem!

 big sign which says 
"no entry Ct11 privately leased area 
no through road 
no camping 
no hunting ir shooting. 
tresspassers will be prosecuted."
I guess this sign is made by "Jack's camp" as many people wrote on coments down south. We didn't cross and went left.

P.S look out on big spiders between trees and ostriches :)

name: Bubble Laundry
description:
Service wash great service.
P100 per wash and dry

name: good place before/after Orapa game park
description: Good place to stay overnight. Hidden from the road, you can hear cars but it's not bad. Nobody came. We stayed for 2 nights with no problems.

name: Water tap
description: Next to the petrol station and some shop. Ask at the shop to the right. We filled up our water tank here. Locals said it's drinkable water.

name: Bush camp
description: Quiet place next to the road. Finish of fenced farms. You turn right from the road (direction to SA), then left and find your place in the bush. No cars, no people, no animals all night. 5 km further there was some kind of pan or water on the map but we didin't check. Around A2 road a lot of places to stay overnight. No problem. Good Orance service (which is not common in Botswana :)

name: Gate to Orapa city
description: You have to get permission to enter. All details on the east gate on iOverlander

name: Jwana Game Park
description:
You have to get the permit from debswana company with help of local people to get inside. It takes min. 48h. and you have to know some local guy.
Other options is get in with local who have a permit and drive inside together.
Inside is a lot of spieces like giraffe, rhino, impalas, kudu, zebras and others.

name: Stevensford game reserve
description: Private game reserve with beautiful, private camping by the river. There are private shower and toilet blocks, all with direct views of the river full of Crocs. Staff are very friendly. Price is 185 ppn for camping.

name: Mokoro trip camp (from Morutsa)
description: Our guide brought us here on the first night of a two night mokoro trip from the morutsa station (Boro was closed due to lack of water). Booked the trip at the OKMCT office in Maun. Shady trees but no facilities at all, bring everything in with you.

name: Mokoro Trip Camp 2 (from Morutsa)
description: Guide brought us here in the second night of a two night mokoro trip from Morutsa station. Very nice shady spot in a stand of trees. Booked the trip at the OKMCT offices in Maun.

name: NDM Travelagency
description:
Pumpkin Complex Office Nr. 10

NDM Travelagency

Office to book Dijara Campsite

name: Kaziikini Campsite Booking Office
description:
Booking office for Kaziikini Campsite

Rate or internationals 290 pppn
Cash rate

CC 5 % extra

name: BTC SHOP
description: Place to get a be mobile SIM card from BTC

name: Antenna with security guy
description: Good place for cyclist, it’s antenna and you can pitch your tent inside the fence area. Arround a lot of elephants. You are free to make fire and have some water. Friendly 2 security guy.

name: Large flat area for camp
description:
Place for camp near the city, nobody arround. Lot of wood. Nice and confortable small grass eat by cow. 
Maybe not easy by car or truck but by motorcycle and bike it s easy.
You have entrance easy to find near this point.

name: Kris' lions
description: Lion's interaction. There's a lion breeding program in here. Very interesting place. Mr Darlington is in charge and tells you everything about the program.

name: Wild Camp Western Woodlands
description: Beautiful wild camp next to big trees in the middle of Western Woodlands. Very remote area and a real feeling out of Africa. Wild animals and also Lions alround in the area

name: Chaixara Backpackers
description:
Here we found a beautiful affordable area with different types of accommodation between bwp50-bwp100. Camping and dormatory space. We found lovely clean ablutions and a bar area, with swimming pool. very peaceful natural area, fully run on solar power. Lovely hot water in the showers. 

Chaixarabackpackers@gmail.com
+267 75352134
+267 73262728
+267 73682528

name: Baobab Bushcamp
description: We drove from Gweta towards Kubu Island with tracks4africa and it lead us to this amazing wildcamp. The route will give you lots of scratches as there are many bushes and small trees but if you don't care like we do it will lead you to this beautiful Baobab tree, open land and nobody here except for some horses. There are some shoe prints and of course car tracks either from locals or other overlanders ;) had a fantastic quiet night. Beautiful sunrise/sunset and starry sky.

name: Permanent Watering Hole
description:
Year round water hole. Sand road leads through the park to this spot. Zebra, Giraffe, Ostrich, Impala, Wildebeest. 

Surprised not to see elephant (lots of scat).

name: Bushcamp before Chobe
description: The sandy road from the main road will lead you to an open field what looks a little bit like a scrapyard, just drive in further until you feel covered enough. had one quiet night before entering chobe.

name: Deep Sand Road
description: Try to avoid this whole section of the park. the road is very deep sand at most parts and at one point you won't go further without letting your tire pressure down. the whole road down is in a bad condition (thorns on the way, hard bushes that scratch your car from underneath in the middle of the sandy road etc.) not many animals either, saw a few elephants and game.

name: Morutsa Gate
description: if you book a Mokoro trip and choose this departing point, this is where the gate is (takes about 40 to 50mins from the main road when you turn left to Mochaba Crossing Lodge). the departing station is on the left after the gate.

name: Ross & Jess’ Wild Camp Extravaganza
description:
Just outside the park gates, we found a beautiful little spot to wild camp. Off a small and infrequently used dirt track, we tucked ourselves away behind the bushes and couldn’t be seen from the road. We had a great afternoon here, and set up our tent when it was dark. 
Amazing stars, animals around (hyena/elephant/cows), and we felt very safe here. 
Coming from the main gate, turn left down the dirt side road after the cattle gates, and it was on the right hand side behind some bushes about 2.4k down (exact coordinates are correct). 
We hope you have as much fun here as we did!!!!

name: Edge of Riverbed
description: Nice, grassy, wide place. In the dry season perfect on the way south or north for one night. People are friendly. Near a village but not a problem at all. Quiet, except the donkeys at night ;-). Saw an elephant.

name: Royal Tree Lodge
description: lodge where you can do horseriding safaris - 55 usd 1 hour, 95 usd 2 hours, 125 usd 3 hours. see zebra antelopes giraffe birds - was really lovely and the horses are well trained and quiet.

name: Vet Fence
description: Official vet fence, but no check for us in both directions at that time.

name: Polentswa / Transkalahari NP
description:
Probably the most beautiful (bush) campsite in the whole national park. 
There are only three campsites. NO fences and only basic toilets for each site. So very quiet and you are really in the Kalahari! If everything is fully booked you can try to get the "overflow place". This place is even some hundreds meter further in the bush....No facilities at all at this place -  just a nice spot in the nature. 😁
You can book it from the HQ in Twee Rivieren. It doesn't matter whether you come from RSA or Botswana. Both desks are in the same building. You can combine it also with eg Nossop or Mata Mata (RSA). 
The costs are BWP 30 pPn for the campsite, BWP 20 pPn for the park (the wildcard does not work here! - but in total it is much cheaper than the RSA campsites!!!) and BWP 4 for the car (also for our 7,5ton truck - we had to pay only the normal car tax).

name: Vet Fence
description: From East to West, but no control at that time. Just asking us from where we come.

name: Gravel Pit
description: There is a small gravel road to a big place hidden behind the bushes. Very quiet and good to stay for one night.

name: Atlas Service Centre
description:
We had some trouble with the diesel filters of our truck. The Indian owner family helped us very quickly to replace them (30 min only!). They were so kind and did not charge us for the labour (we provided our own new spare filters) !!! Also we had a very good impression by their mecanical skills (which has not happend very often to us in Africa). 
They do all kinds of vehicles....from normal Landrovers up to Trucks. The range of services which they provide reaches from mecanical to electronic repairs. 
For the worst case they offer a 24 hrs towing service (Phone: 3928833 / 3187483)

name: Bushcamp nearby dry riverbed
description:
Happy to find this place near the gravel road approx 3 km away from the village Mosolitsane and the B145. Along the B145 is everything fenced and along the gravel road you will find only very thick bushes. 
We drove behind a small empty kraal for cattle into the open bush (the dry river was was on our left side). Thanks to the open space you can go away from the gravel road for some hundreds meters. You will here the few cars from the gravel road, but not be seen. There are some simple farmers around, but we just heard the bells of the cattle in the distance bush
. It was very quiete.

name: Douglas Camp & Outdoors
description: Camping, Caravan Parking, Parties, Bon Fire, Outdoor Events, Chill Sessions.

name: Bushcamp close to the pan
description:
Another quiet place with great view to the  pan. We preferred to stay away a bit east from the other one nearby since that one is very close to a track which leads to a small settlement. 
To get to both places you have to cross the pan. Access is close before you enter the village (east side). Just follow one of the tracks the locals use. Generally it is very quiet and you have a great view on the pan. In the distance we saw some people, but nobody bothered us.

name: Bushcamp along the vet fence and Ntwetwe pan
description: We found this beautiful and quiet place when we passed the Phatshwanyane Gate (we came from Mopipi) and followed the good track along the vet fence for - 6 km. Here on the southern tip of the Ntwetwe Pan is next to the fence a small "green forest" of bushes. So we had the bushes in our back and the pan in our front for a nice view. Nobody around to disturb you here......only maybe some ostriches and (wild?) donkeys.

name: Vet Fence
description: Just waved us through at this time. Coming from North.

name: Daonara - Mokoro departure
description:
From here the Mokoro tour departs currently when you book via the trust. Departure place might change depending on water level. 
We camped here the night before the departure (for free) and shared the evening fire with some polers. You can buy fish (10p) from the local fisherman and prepare it on the fire. Very nice experience!
Self organizing is a lot cheaper than via an agency. Just go to the OKMC trust to pay the fees, rent a tent at Kalahari canvas and drive there yourself (4wd required).
Cost: 56p pppd trust fee
50p pppn camping fee
200p per poker pd (for 2p)

name: Route Mopipi to Gweta (Entry Point)
description:
If you want to use the track from Mopipi to Gweta than you might have problems to find the correct entry coodinates. There are many tracks going north.
1. Go to the north part of Mopipi to the shore of the pan (this point has the coodinates)...S 21* 12,029. E 24* 52,402 
2. There are several tracks into the pan ...try to take the middle one. At the point S21* 10,783. E24* 53,911 (-3,5km) you will leave the pan. After this you have made the start and you only follow the main track northwards.

Info: after this you will come in thick thorny bush - especially bigger vehicles will get scratches

3. After approx. 22,5 km you will reach the Phatshwenyane Gate. Instead of going straight (again into the bush) you can follow the fence to the left. The track leads to savanne and some smaller pans. Also there are many nice possibilities for a bushcamp. After -67 km total you have reached the Tjai gate where the big Ntwetwe  pan begins...

name: Bushcamp south of Semolale
description: Good and quiet place in the bush in this less populated area. One of the first possibilities when coming from the north. Between Selebi-Phikwe, Bobonong and Semolale is everything fenced, thick bush and farmers. We left here the gravel road and drove into the lighter bush for about 200 m (there is no path). Nice place and we could not be seen from the road (anyway only few cars and donkey cars). We heard only some goats in the distance but saw nobody.

name: Lekhubu Camp Central Kalahari
description: No facilities but great spot. Don’t miss the waterhole 12kms West

name: Kori bush  camp
description: next to CKKOR 04 suggested us by reception very good for big rig. Don't go there  according to the signs to Kori Campsite. From the main junction at the west side of Deception pan, go south about 1 km. The price is the same as all the other camps 30P per night.

name: next to Motopi on the Boteti riverside
description: Nice grassy aria on the Boteti riverside. get off the road after the bridge at the other side of Motopi.We didn't sleep here we stopped just for rest.  It was quite no body disturbed us.  Not so clean many broken bottles. People  come here to pump water.

name: Another nice spot on the pan
description: We passed a quiet night on the pan in our RTT. This spot is about 2.5km north of the Tjai vet control gate but you can camp anywhere on the giant pan. Beautiful sunset & sunrise. Amazing stars.

name: Kalwezi Waterhole.
description: Remote waterhole supplied by a bore hole and solar pump. Elephants and Sable Antelopes were seen. LOTS of deep sand on the road there!

name: Chisa Nyama (The BBQ Joint) & Pub
description:
Nothing fancy, but a great little restaurant ..  only been open a couple weeks. 

Owner/Chef Panga ... the magic ingredient. He is a trained Western-style chef and worked as a Chef at the Choba Marina Lodge for 5 years! 

BBQed (braai) pork ribs, chops, chicken, t-bone, beef sausage cooked perfectly for Western taste. Beer and soda. WiFi too!

Next door to Liquorama is a bonus !

name: Desert bush camp
description:
Just pull of the road where the sand is not too deep and enjoy the silence, you can just camp everywhere.
no mobile service.
The road leads you to the Mabusehube Gate. We pulled of the tarroad in Makopong. There is a sign for the Transfontier Park. Road is just sandy 100 km. On maps me it shows the track going north but it dissapears on the map. 

Update after driving the whole way:
We are not sure where we made the mistake, but we recognised that we missed the trail when we meet 3 guys on a "farm". They couldn't speak english but directed us the right way back to the real track. The beginning was a road but than it dissapeared. Check before going here!

name: Sefalana shopping center
description: supermarkt with vegetables, cheese, meat etc.

name: Access Gate/Road
description:
Gate to access public road.
Open to enter and close once in, one gate on each site.
Road used to drive from Pont Drift to Molema Campsite.

name: Jungle light restcamp
description:
Basic campsite with water, electricity and a braai on pit. Clean ablution. They don’t except Visa card. We were able to pay with pula and South African rand. 
Place doesn’t have much charm and are next to the main road. 

We paid 120 pula pr. person and 100 rand for two children (age 3 & 5). 
*Camping is now 150 pula per person (2022)

name: Check point
description: Stopped us and took fresh milk and red meet on the way from Maun to Ganzi

name: Phala Center
description: Phala Center and watering hole. Mine company party area and viewing platform

name: Gate to the park and Airport
description: Gate to the park actual location and Airport terminal

name: Riverside
description: About halfway to other wildcamp down same sandy access, which runs parallel to park fence. Once you descend down the Hill and reach mud hole, swing right and a good spot under a couple of big trees.

name: the golden leaf
description: Great curries and other Indian dishes! good price and nice people.

name: Sefalana supermarket
description: Sefalana supermarket - good selection. Veggies and meat are fresh.

name: Micro Water fast food
description: Cheap place with sandwich, hot dogs, chips, rice, beans , salad, cold drinks, etc. Owner is very nice and food is good. Comfortable tables inside, very calm. Perfect for a stop on the road.

name: Kutamogore conference room camp (for cyclists)
description: Ask for the police station or the Chief and they will allow cyclists to camp inside the conference room of the village. Water and toilet. No shower.

name: Bureau of Exchange
description: Currency exchange office in Hunters Africa Mall across from Hunters Pub & Grill. Good place to buy US dollars before going to Zimbabwe. Rate=11.14. Can also exchange at Choppies supermarket (rate unknown).

name: Border to CKNR
description: Here starts the NP. Behind this point wild camping is not allowed any more. So check before or there is a junction where you might find a wild camping spot around here. We did not check because we had a booking for Xade. We saw almost nobody on the way.

name: Mochaba Crossing - Turn off for Ditshiping and Morutsa starting points
description: here you have to turn left coming from Maun to reach the Starting points for Mokoro Trips. 4 x 4 recommended

name: Ngwatle Community Campsite
description:
Entrance to the community campsite. Your supposed to drive another 2km into town and get a permit and leave money in the honesty box (100 pula pp) but there were no permits left when I visited.
Campsite is on top of a hill, but no real view, fenced off bbq area, long drop and shower room with nothing in it. Was full of beer bottles and cans littered everywhere.

name: Deception camp 2.
description:
Deception Camp 2 Central Kalahari Game Reserve quite and remote. No facilities other than long drop latrien (no very deep, rather smelly) campsite  not well maintained but for P30/ppn  we are not expecting top much.  Bucket  shower (byo bucket) 
Friendly birds

name: Free camping at Engen service station
description: Nice spot for cyclists, the lady there is a real sweetheart and is happy for people to put up tents in the yard. There are toilets and running water, and cold beer for sale at the shop. There is WiFi at the service station, but the lady might need some persuading to give out the password.

name: Monamadi Camp 2
description: Unfenced camp, close to Monamadi Pans. Waterhole on pan, excellent for bird watching. Running water, shower, pit toilet, A-frame shelter with concrete slab and fire pit.

name: Shoprite & ATM
description: left from the main road where the shell station is, a bit further down the road on the right hand side is a big supermarket and an ATM (Barcleys). it's the first that we found after crossing the border in the north.

name: Palm Afrique Lodge
description: A little paradise with green grass and beautiful palm trees. They have very lovely accommodation and the camp site is also nice with clean and spacious abblutions. They have a small pool, bar and meals on request. The camp sites have taps with pottable water and electricity. Washing basins is also available. Hot water showers from a donkey that the friendly staff starts and manage. There is firewood at 25pula per bag. At 250pula per stand it is a excellent multiple day stopover location entering or existing Central Kalahari. Located approximately 15km from Ghanzi only 4km off the A3.

name: Heaven on A35
description:
take the turnoff on a gravel road towards Nxaunxau (can be found on maps me easily).
After about 2 km you can turn on a sandy track to your right. It is suitable for Sedan/2wheel drive as well! Find a peaceful spot on the site of that track to overnight away from the fairly busy mainroad. There are a few spots.
2 cars passed, but did not bother me at all! Other than that absolutely quiet!
There might be elephants, as dung is visible everywhere. I have not heard or seen any!
Quite a lot of mosquitos at this spot though.

name: Ghanzi Veterinary Department
description: This office is where you can get a permit to take meat across the vet line. Note they are closed from 12:45 till 14:30 for lunch and it is better to go in the morning.Week days only.  Closed public holidays and Weekends

name: Department of wildlife and national parks
description:
This is where you need to book any government run parks campsites and get permits to drive on roads that require them. 
Monday to Friday 07:30 to 12:45 and 13:45 to 16:39.

name: Letiahau waterhole
description: Best chances of watching Kalahari Lions very close! The night at Liteahau Camp (6kms away) is fascinating with the lions calls and they do come near!

name: Fridge air - car air conditioning
description: Recommended to us by a local. These guys are specialists in air conditioning and heating. Our air conditioning wasn’t working in our Toyota Landcruiser Prado 120 and these guys sorted it out immediately for a very reasonable price (600 pulas). The receptionist was extremely helpful and she organised for one of the guys to take us in one of their work cars to get money out from an ATM while they worked on our car (as we just arrived from Plumtree border). All staff super friendly and professional. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

name: Caracal World of Wildlife
description: Small animal sanctuary for rescued animals and education, poisonous snakes, Caracal, Owls, honey badgers etc. 35 pula for unguided walk around, well worth it. Tours at 11h, 13h and 15h. Open until 16h. Great for kids. Some animals can be touched.

name: abandonded riverside campsite
description:
This abandoned campsite is located right next to the mainroad. It can be quite noisy with all the lorries etc during night.
There are still green signboards on the fence and the gate is open.
Perfect area for cyclist who want to stay in the "bush"! On rainy days or when there is a lot moisture you can find shelter under the previous Lounge area of the campsite. 
There are several camp spots north of it as well, which are more quiet and further away from the Highway.
So it is worth to explore a bit and find a nice spot during  daylight. ;-)
Try to stay away from the river as there are many bugs/flies!
I saw 2 cars in the evening, but did not bother me!
Mascom 4G still available around here! ;-)

name: Wild Camping, many water holes
description:
Really nice free overnight places in many water holes. A lot of animals. To reach from the Hunter's Road or also from the A 33.
Super schöne freie Übernachtungsplätze an vielen Wasserlöchern. Sehr viele Tiere. Zu erreichen von der Hunter's Road oder auch von der A 33.

name: Deception Camp 4
description: Big open site with good shade and sand stand. Lots of birds. Pit toilet in usable condition and this site has a bucket shower. No water so bring along.

name: Aquarite Kazungula
description: Water refill shop in Kazungula; Aquarite. For 25 liter we payed 45 pula, so 5 liter is 9 pula.

name: Forest wildcamp
description: A good place to wildcamp for a night on your way to/from Moremi North Gate and Chobe Mabebe Gate. It’s in the forest with nobody around. Signs of elephants in the area (but we didn’t see any while camping) and we heard wild dogs howling in the evening. We tried the other “Kwai” wild camp listed on ioverlander but 3 vehicles past us while we were there and asked us if we were ok/camping there for the evening. Seemed a bit busy so we decided to find another spot. To get here (Moremi to Chobe direction), you drive on your way to Mabebe Gate on the main dirt road. Then turn left onto a smaller dirt road (you’ll see faint tyre tracks) and follow that winding path for about 5 minutes until you get to an open space on your left.

name: Scout Camp
description: This used to be a Parks camp for staff, but is now disused. We obtained permission at the entry gate to stay here

name: Lost Horizons Safaris
description: Travel agency located inside Mario’s Garage run by Mario’s wife Monique Mwape Minnozzi. Really lovely people! They organise safari drives, boat cruises, day trips to Victoria Falls and village walks. Tel: (+267) 72478018 or (+267) 6252294 or (+267) 6240033. Email: info@losthorizonssafaris.com

name: Burs
description:
Office of customs to renew insurance paid at the border, in case it expires, like happened to me!
Also renew CPD

name: Wild camp near Kasangula
description: A wildcamp spot about 50 km from Kasangula. We first went to the other spot nearby but it is very close to the road, so a lot of noise and visible too. We drove a little bit further south and found this spot in the forrest beside the dirt road which leads to it. Very relaxed. 2 nights and nobody around. Also no elephant or lions so we had a good sleep. Good doable with 2wheel drive and very dog friendly.

name: Waterfront Maun
description: Beautiful place near Maun city. Situated not far from the airport, it is a good starting point for the first and last night in Botswana if you fly in via Maun. The rooms offer a high African standard. Ppn was 900 Pula, 1600 Pula double bedroom. Parking is free. B&B only.

name: Old disused quarry
description: Disused quarry not far off the road, but deep enough that you cannot be seen from the road. Easy to get in, doesn't need 4wd. We had one vehicle go past in the evening then we had no cars the rest of the night. Halfway stop from Tshabong to Mabuasehube Game Reserve.

name: Peach Pan Campsite
description: We stayed one night at Peach Pan, after coming from the east from Jacks Pan. We were faced with warning signs (3!) warning us not to camp without a permit.from Zutshwa, which was 100km away in the opposite direction we had come from. The place had not been visited for a long time, maybe a couple of weeks. We camped anyway and the next day we arrived at Zutshwa to find the self permit station. We thought we could get a permit for the previous night, and pay for traveling on the road to Zutshwa. The result - the self-service permit station at Zutshwa had no permits. They couldn't even meet that basic requirements of providing the blank permits so you could pay for one. So take your chances if you want to camp. They can't keep the permits in stock, I really doubt they are out checking the campsites. No facilities other than space to camp, but lots of evidence of animals, however we didn't see many.

name: Kirk Motors
description: Kirk motors are suspension specialist and the agents for Tough Dog.

name: Dry season turn-off for Daunara Mokoro launching point
description:
Use the track that starts here towards Daunara in the dry. It is considerably shorter and quicker than using the track that starts a few k's north of here. Don't trust maps.me/osm on either of the tracks, as they change constantly.
Took us 1h from Daunara to this turn-off. Quite sandy in many places, so 4wd is a must. Enjoy your Mokoro ride! It is awesome!

name: Thato Canvas
description: They do any canvas work or repairs and they are very good. We had two items custom made here and very happy with the results.

name: Delta Spring
description: Here you can stock up with good clean filtered water. Need to have your own container though. About 7,75 pula for 5l refill and open Saturday till 13:00

name: Old Ghanzi Road wild camp
description: There are a lot of fences in this area and it was difficult for us to find a place to camp, so this is a good spot, especially for cyclists. There's a gate you have to go through and then take the right track which will take you to the old Ghanzi road (marked on maps.me as this). There's a small sandy clearing in the bush just next to the road we found, but there are probably lots of other places too. A car could come down here and park on the disused road if needed. a bit quieter than the main road. No water but lots of fire wood all around. Very peaceful.

name: Kuru Art
description: A really great community art project. You can see the artists at work and buy prints, paintings and jewelry. Many of the artists have exhibited all over the world and the art is beautiful. Also a small museum on site. Highly recommended.

name: Khwai Safari Grounds
description:
Relaxing and natural campsite with 10 spots directly on the border of a shallow river. We were surrounded by around 50 elephants at lunch time! Lots of herds came to drink and bathe. 

There are basic ablutions, with donkey fired hot showers (pressure not that good) and flush toilets. No further facilities, but who needs these anyway? 

Perfect for game drives in the area along the Khwai river. Lots of animals, loads of hippos, elephants, antilopes and even saw wild dogs.
2021 : 350 pulas pppn / 2 hours mokoro : 400 pulas pppn.

name: Ekori Lodge
description:
Lodge with chalets and camping. P110 to camp for 1 person and motorbike. The campsite is just the car park with a couple trees for shade. Braai area, electricity, and hot showers. Fenced, secure with guards. Good for a night, but not much more.

*price change as of January 2022: now 150 pula per person

name: Airport Road
description: There is often a police control. If you don‘t stop for some Seconds at the stop sign you have to pay 1‘000 Pula. This is only for foreigner drivers. Local drivers drive trough the stop signal and the police let them go. Attention!

name: BTC and Mascom telecom
description: BTC Telecom agency to buy a local Botswana SIM-kaart. Takes about 1/2 hour and a passport. 10 Pula for the SIM card and 70 Pula voor 500 MB data

name: DWNP Office Kang
description: Small office to do your government run national park campsites reservations.

name: Puma Fuel Station
description: Fuel Station between Francistown and Nata.

name: wild camping by the lake
description:
ADMIN NOTE: USERS BEWARE OF FLASH FLOODS. 

Only to be used in dry season as it is on wet land. great spot quiet in the middle of dead trees. surprising landscape.

name: Bush camp beetween Zanzibar and Martins Drift
description: Bush camp at 800 m from the road. Very quiet and nice. We spend 3 days without seeing anybody. We heard hippo at night and saw few monkeys far away. Trees for shade and enought space to move easily the car for charging sun energy. The place is at the crossing of 2 dirt roads. You don't need a 4X4. The Gps coordinates of the entrance trail are : S 22 37.749 E 028 15.598

name: Gifts of Kalahari Safaris
description:
Safari tours around Maun (Okawango, Kalahari etc.)
Were 3 days in the Okawango Delta. Lucky the guide has discovered the animals that we would never have noticed. In the evening we were always spoiled by the chef with a excelent three course menu. Everything was just great.
Quality has met the price. Let Gifts of the Kalahari Safari highly recommend.

name: Bosobogolo Pan Camp Site 2
description: Great site and view of the Pan. Only an A frame shelter no facilities. We ended up here as ran out of time to get to our booked site. We were told at Twee Riverein all these sites were booked but there was nobody here.

name: Mabasehube Pan Camp Site No 3
description: Beautiful location overlooking the Pan. There are four camp sites spaced around the Pan. There is a braii and long drop toilet and shower (bring your own water). Heard lions roar at night and a brown hyena wandered through the camp. Best to book in advance as it is popular. But can be booked from Twee Riverein Gate. Beware the tracks here are sometimes deep sand and very corrugated.

name: Bush camp
description: We stay 2 nights near a corral without cattle. There is a caban with a dog at 200 m. A car passed during the day. Nobody came to ask anything... Very quiet. Large space for several vehicles. The trail to acces is narrow and sandy. Our Mascom data have good reception

name: Stockpoort-Parr's Halt Border Post
description: Quiet border post with about 45 km of gravel on the way to the Gaborone-Francistown Highway. You can pay vehicle insurance/road tax in SA rand. Don't carry fresh meat, vegetables, fruit or dairy products. Batswana authorities will confiscate them. Tar on the SA side, but some potholes between Lephalale and the border. Open 6 am to 4.30 pm. About 15 minutes from the border heading into Botswana, there's a village where your satnav may tell you to turn right. Don't, Keep ''slight left'' and the stretch of gravel is shorter.

name: Shell gas station
description: Shell gas station. They also had diesel. Accept payement with creditcard.

name: Bush Camp near big pool
description: Lots of wild life near a huge pool (which looks like a river). We decided to sleep in the car. Nobody bothered us, peaceful sleep and beautiful sunrise

name: Wild camp on a sand track
description: On the way to Mabuasebube we stop for the night about 12 km from the tar road on the side of the sand track. Very quiet. We did not see anybody. No signal Mascom.

name: Bush camp on a small gravel road
description: Just for a stop for the night on a unused little gravel road. From the main road turn on the gravel road that go to the aerial and turn right just before the aerial. The gravel road became wider and you stop on the side. We saw nobody, but you hear the cars of the main road. Mascom signal

name: Perfectwater
description: Place to get purified water to fill up your tanks. Price is 1.20 Pula per liter. They use a 5 step purifying approach: 1. Sand filtration, 2. Activated Carbon filtration, 3. Element filtration, 4. Reverse osmosis and 5. Ozonation. Guys are also really nice.

name: Naledi Motors - Mercedes-Benz
description: Our Mercedes G needed to be serviced, so we ended up at Naledi Motors. They have a friendly and supportive workplace manager and fine mechanics. They did a good job, and had thorough knowldege. Real mechanics. Highly recomended if your Mercedes need to be serviced.

name: Mabolwe Border
description:
Small border between BOTS and ZIM. You have to drive through a riverbed, can be easily done when no water in the river. ZIM and BOTS officials are very nice, no problems at all. There is no customs at the BOTS side, so TIP or Carnet have to be done at another Botswana border post.

No problem for big rigs.

name: next to the river
description:
wild camping next to river (is dry at this time of year), very close to center of Maun if you do not want to pay for camping. we stayed 3 nights and had regular visits of the cows, donkeys and goats of the area. so this means a lot crap but no flies. the place is out of sight, but there are houses nearby wich means once in while people will pass. but nobody bothered. it is not that far from the main road, so sometimes you hear a car or in the weekend some music. but besides this, it is a quiet place. 
take the dirt road across sunrise garage, drive almost untill rhe end, you pass all the houses. then you see a small track on your left that goes to an open area. 
we found it a good solution to explore Maun.

name: Elephant havens
description:
Great guys who do a great job by saving orphan elephants. They just started 1year ago. 
They work really close with the community and educate children and farmers about elephants. The money they get from donations go to the center and the community to obtain a better relationship between the people and animals. 
It is founded by Americans.
We really recommend this place if you are interested in wildlife conservation. 

open 9-10am and 4-5pm daily. Pula 750 per person for foreigners.

name: Buy diesel from a local
description: There is no fuel station between Maun and Kasane. From Kwai to Kasane is another 280km. After a couple days in the Moremi area we did not have enough fuel anymore to drive to Kasane. There is a guy in the village who sells diesel, we bought 20l for 30USD. A lot more than at an official fuel station, but cheaper then driving back to Maun.

name: Tsau gate CkGR
description: The Stau gate is in renovation. We arrived at 6 am. There was nobody at the gate. Water at the old ablutions but not for drinking. Showers are working but not very clean. At 7 am somebody arrived to allow entrance.

name: Motopi waterhole
description: Big waterhole with solar pompe. We saw some vultures when we arrived at 10 am, some kudus and springboks.

name: so sleepy hotel airbnb
description: Great little home offering private bedrooms. Safe parking behind electric gate and security guard at night. Very clean bedroom and bathroom. Allowed us to hook up the electric s on camper. Pula 320 for 2 people including bfast. Cheaper then camping. Ideal if you are crossing the border at Martins drift or visiting khama Rhino for the day.

name: Lelani prestige guesthouse
description: Brand new guesthouse. Clean, tv, kettle, comfy bed and wifi. Rooms 790P and 690P. We took the smaller and it was spacious. Secure parking. Staff friendly. It is out of town with no other facilities around. Stock up supplies at Choppies before you arrive.

name: Baine’s Baobabs Campsite 1
description: Designated camping area looking across the salt pan at Baine’s Baobabs. Parking area is large enough for three or four vehicles. Fire pit, braai grid, long drop toilet and bucket shower at the site (you must bring your own water). Approach road from the main road is deep sand. 4wd and good ground clearance required.

name: Kamore Inn
description: Simple guesthouse off the Main Street. Very clean property with gated and guarded parking. Comfortable bed, ac, kettle, tv. No mosquito net but spray. We paid 650pula for double room. Breakfast 90pula each. They will prepare dinner as well. Pleasant staff. Good place to stop before or after the border crossing.

name: Choppies Supermarket
description: Well stocked shop, has everything one needs at reasonable prices.

name: Shell Nata
description: Shell fuel stop with Engen and Caltex within sight.

name: Shell petrol station
description: It is brand new. And they sell the precious Shell tourist map of Botswana, that is not easy to find.

name: Opearl holdings
description:
David knows a lot about cars (gearbox, electrical, panel beating). He repaired quickly and efficiently our double battery system. We warmly recommend him. 
Open on saturdays until 1pm.
Always avalaible at this number: 71463608 / 77487571.
Stands just behind Alfa Accommodation.
Email: davidroux@gmail.com.

name: Bandra electrical
description:
Bandra is making all the car electrical. He is very friendly and helpful. He came on a public holiday to rescue us. He is working with Piet from Sunrise Motors. We warmly recommend him if you have any electrical trouble on your car.
Number: 71 264 364.

name: Panda Engen
description: Gas station, Engen. In the middle way from Nata to Kasane. There is also an ATM.

name: Shell Kongola
description: Shell station with atm, bakery, ice and take away.

name: Cymat
description: In this place you can find the little campingaz bottles! The easy clic plus ones.

name: Waterfront Mall and Bureau De Change
description: Well stocked shop, has everything one needs at reasonable prices. Unimoni Bureau De Change inside too!

name: Shell fuel stop
description: Shell fuel station. Friendly service and conveniently in center of town.

name: Bush Camp
description: Very big free surface, with former gravel pit. Nice view about brushland. Very quiet, no people only some cows.

name: Samlea Fitment Centre
description: Very good and inexpensive tyre service. Our tyre had a small hole, it was repaired without problems.

name: clean drinking water
description: In Nata you can only find salt water (in gasstations, lodges,...). this is the only place around for clean filtered water. Bring your own bottle or container. 1P for 1L water. Even the locals come here to get drinking water.

name: Supermarket
description: This supermarket has a lot: vegetables, rice, pasta, soft drinks, etc and also non-food articles. Friendly staff.

name: Motswedi bakery
description: Its a small shop in the pink building. the bakery is behind the big building on your left side.

name: Easy access to Rysana Pan
description: From here you can reach/leave the Pan to the cutline/fence road Gweta/Mopipi! Easy access, good to explore the pan, you find nice remote camping spots everywhere around.

name: Tjai Vet Gate
description: Friendly lonely officer. Did not check (coming from south).

name: Engen fuel station
description: Takes card for fuel payment. 2 ATM's plus a small shop and small curio shop.

name: Thorn Tree Cafe
description: Great little coffee shop in a shady centre. safe parking. Free WiFi. Clean toilets. Very upmarket. Friendly staff, great coffee and food.

name: Clean Wash Laundromat
description: Next to the lovely Thorntree cafe. card payment preferred.  P20.7/kg wash only, P25.5/kg wash, dry, fold.

name: Mall with Pick n Pay, Woolworths, Clicks etc
description: Large mall and being upgraded when we passed. Did not stop in but looks good. A Debonairs and Spar Superstore just down the road (South) as well.

name: Super Spar, Woolworths, Pep mini mall
description: Didn't stop in but impressed with the shopping centre choices here. Cresta Hotel and another upmarket mall very nearby on the main road

name: Choppies mall with Woolworths, Pep, Shoprite etc
description: Didn't stop but upmarket shoppong centre, FNB Barclays etc-

name: Total fuel stop with Wimpy
description: Upmarket fuel stop with a new Wimpy. Didn't stop here but looks to be newest and most modern fuel station in the town.

name: Filling station
description: Small fuel station with spacious parking lot which is used by truck drivers. Spent a very quiet and tranquil night. It closes at 9:00 and security staff remains in the premises. Good resting place, safe and quiet.

name: Place by the Okavango
description:
An einem Nebenfluss des Okavango. Vogelparadies, Elefanten, Pferde und Kühe. Sehr ruhig, keine Häuser in der Nähe. Unscheinbare Einfahrt von der Straße.
GPS   S 18°38'44,1" E 22°15'1,0"
On a secondary of the Okavango. Bird's paradise, elephant, horses and cows. Very quietly, no houses nearby. Little one insignificant seaway. Entrance of the street. GPS   S 18°38'44,1" E 22°15'1,0"

name: place at the okavanko
description: Directly in the Okavango. Bird's paradise, elephant, horses and cows. Very quietly, no houses nearby. wonderful place. Entrance is not for very big vehicles. S 18°26'38,0" E 22°4'25,1"

name: African Ranches River Place
description: Very good wild camping experience. Their price is 200 Pulas per person. Very over priced compared to other campsites in Botswana.

name: Place for permit for Old Palapye visit (Dec 2019)
description: We went to this house to pay for the visit and pick up the guide, after some searching around in the village. It may not be always at the same place

name: Crossroads restaurant
description: Large choice of freshly cooked foods inside, for take-away or to eat on a plate on the shady terrace. Meat, pap, dumplings, meat pies, all very tasty.

name: Foodstall under tree
description: Next to the bus station (position approximate), we ate very tasty spicy meat stew and fresh bread rolls (5 P per serving of the meat, 1 P for a bread roll), very friendly stopover.

name: Food from the pots
description: Two women cooking lots of food in pots under a big tree (position approximate) with tables and everything. For 25 Pula, we got a large plate of pap, setswa and spinach (morro?). Very friendly cooks, they explained all the foods to us and remembered us, when we came for the second time.

name: Bushy bush camp
description: A clearing in the bush. Can hear the traffic on the A3 but secure and safe. Good for one night

name: ditshipi village water tap
description:
locals say safe to drink.
filter or boil and will be fine.

name: Ditshipi Village
description:
go through Morutsa gate, turn left after the gate and follow the road for another 10km.  you will pass the base camp at roughly 4km. 

locals are very friendly.

from the village is another 7km to the morongo launch point.

name: ditshipi village wild camping
description:
showed up before dark, a friendly local greeted us and asked where we're going. we had booked a mokoro for the following day, they said to go past the village to the launch site a guide is required. but we can wild camp at the edge of the village next to two big trees, between the toilets and water tap, which we can use.  no charge.  locals will come by to talk. 

squating toilet, very basic. 

mascom = no cell service

name: Staymorr Boutique Hotel
description: A very nice and clean little hotel in the middle of ordinary people’s homes. Only three rooms, very tidy, looks like a big hotel. Affordable prices and you get value for your money. Friendly and helpful staff.

name: DHL
description: A DHL point in Kasane were you can pick deliveries

name: FNB Bank no fee visa/mastercard
description: Bank near the border, no fee, visa and mastercard

name: Kazungula tyres & spares
description: Good shop for any parts for your car. helpful staff

name: Supa Quick
description: A very good tyre center. they can help you to find the right one

name: P G Glass Maun
description: We fixed here a broken window in our truck

name: Paje River Camp
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner.  

Paje River Camp is a very unique campsite with spectacular landscapes,clean camp grounds,ablutions etc.located in an outskirt highland.It offers camping facilities in the form of tents,caravan space,etc.A very fantastic place and affordable.

name: Paje River Camp
description: Paje River Camp is a unique campsite with a very spectacular landscape. It is very quite, has clean camping grounds, caravan spaces, clean ablutions with showers and flush toilets, etc. It is located approximately 400m from main road in an outskirt highland. Very fantastic and affordable.

name: Behind Shell Petrol Station
description:
Behind the petrol station there is a lodge. When we arrived it was closed but the guys from the station gave us the phone of the owner. We asked if we can pinch the tents on the grass and he told us Ok! For free... maybe he can charge 80P (as the guys told us). 
You can use toilets, water and shower (warm water) from the station. You can ask charge phones in the shop

name: Tyre World
description: A good tire center they also do welding jobs

name: Kavango Engineering
description: They do any job for fixing adapting your truck to the off roads,  they did a welding job for us great job very professional

name: Kuminda Farm
description: Kuminda Farm has a campsite and other types of accommodation including traditional huts, rondavels and a 2 bed chalet. Meals can be provided with at least 24 hours notice

name: Camphill Botswana
description:
This is a camp/workshop/school for physically and mentally challenged individuals.
We had lunch there on our way to Garborone and were pleasantly 
surprised  how well functioning it was and how good the food!
A great place to rest and support the local community!

name: Lodge not open yet
description:
We pulled in here on our bicycles and found a restaurant and a soon-to-be-open lodge.
We asked to set up our tent and they didn’t quite know what to do with us, but agreed and said we need to pay for camping.
They seemed unsure and the guy asked for 450 p. I told him that that was ridiculous (there is no running water here because the pump is broken).
I told him 200p and they agreed.
We camped behind the restaurant and had a peaceful night. 
Dinner and breakfast was excellent! 
The people friendly!

name: view on Sowa Pan
description: nice overnight stay with beautiful View in pan

name: Butterfly Guest House
description:
small Guesthouse next to the main road.
A little bit noisy.
We camped on the clean and safe fenced  parking area and could use their restroom.
After negotiating we paid 200 P for 2 people sleeping in the car.

name: At Boteti River beside Drifters camping
description:
small place between shady trees directly at the river. Sandy road from A3 - last 50 mtrs. in-between two fences of private properties down to river.
nobody bothered us, very friendly staff at neighbourhood. space for one car.

name: Rusty's motor repair
description: Rusty runs a autoshop for general repairs. helped me out with a small job and knew his stuff. Very passionate about his cars. He was stripping his land cruiser engine in a Saturday night!

name: crossroads wildcamp
description: nice shady spot well back from farm track just off back road to kgalaghdi  park in otherwise thick bush. sandy but firm ground. lots of birds and flowers with just distant noise of main road in distance. perfect for a stop over. mascon signal fluctuates... sometimes has 3G

name: Department of Wildlife and National Parks
description: Here you get the reservation for park entrance and camp sites! There are private camp sites as well as govermental camp sites in the parks. They cost much more ( 350 Paula pppn) the govermental camp sites (30pula pppn). You have to make the reservation in advance because Weekends are usualy crowded.

name: Reserve Campsite Mpayathutlwa Pan
description: This is a reserve campsite run by the government. It is not officially open but the view to the waterhole is fantastic. It has no facilities at all except for a braai place. Due to the waterhole there are always animals to be seen.

name: Palm Afrique
description:
Ghanzi area. Well equipped shaded camp site with power points and hot showers. Bar and restaurant with traditional food. Rooms also available.
We had a wonderful stay. 
Contact Bertie +267 7214 2221

name: Red Marple
description:
Nice place to have your laundry quickly. 
We payed 50 pula for one basket (wash and dry). The owner, Susan, is very friendly and do a very good job. 
Warning: The location is in a personal house.

name: White City Hotel
description: Basic clean, ensuite double bedroom. Negotiated a room for 350p. Very loud bar next door that played music until late. WiFi was average.

name: Chasmiru
description: Wonderfull overnight campsite just past the border from South Africa into Botswana at the town of Lobatsi. à1

name: Stent Drift Liquor Restaurant
description: Rice and beef, next door is a grocery, on the road junction, clean and good set up.

name: Crocodile Pools campsite
description:
Very spacious campsite with several pitches (flat spots and level). You can use the shower/electricity of the cottage (a few meters from your pitch). Clean shower, hot water and even a wash drying line. Also there is fast WiFi (not common in Bots and compared to other campsites in the area very welcoming). 

They have 5 friendly cats and 3 dogs all very kind.

Please contact Jennifer (owner of the compound) via Crocodile_pools@protonmail.com before you head out there. 

Price pppn is P90.

name: Edhgeways
description:
Specialises in canvas, wood and leather works. Tents, bedrolls, canopy covers, directors chairs, wooden decks.
Talk to Edward Chigumbu +26773711803

name: Open spot wildcamp
description: Might be that the other wildcamp spot closeby is the same but we could not find that one. If you are on the main road there is a good road to the left. Take this road and after a few kilometers on your left hand you will see a nice open space.

name: Ngoma Gate, Chobe NP
description:
Gate for Chobe NP.
We exited here and entered Sedudu Gate (Kasane) at 4 pm and wanted to leave the next day at midday. We had to pay for 2 days, even if it was less than 24hours. 
Paid 580 pula for 2 people, 1 car, 2 days.
120 pula per person per day
50 pula for a    foreign-registered car per day

name: Okavango Wildcamp
description: Lots of opportunities to wild camp in the bush here. Sandy road, good to drive when it's dry. Calm place, no people around, but animals like cattle and elephants may appear.

name: Cafe Dijo
description: Great cafe serving Breakfast (salmon and scrambled egg), lunch (burgers, wraps, ciabatta, salads), coffee and cakes. Great find, our 3rd visit

name: J F Engineering
description: General engineering works, Johan makes trailers and can do welding and fabrication. His guys are friendly and did a good job on my caravan.

name: BURS Botswana United Revenue Services
description: You’ll need to come here to get your substitute Carnet stamped. Very helpful staff. Go in the small entrance about 20m to the right of the main entrance.

name: Matsieng footprints
description: Footprints in the sandstone rock from the first man or maybe engravings of feet by the Bushmen. Maria will show you around. Signposted off the A1, then follow signs. Slide open entrance gate

name: Phuthadikobo Museum
description: Open Monday to Friday 08h00 to 17h00. Saturday and Sunday according to Google 14h00 to 18h00, best to phone first to book and appointment. When we visited on Saturday we had to phone to get the gate opened, 71620775 or 72494790. Interesting bit of local history, although rather dilapidated. Entry P50 for oversea visitors.

name: Laundry Dynamics
description: Good full laundry service, if rather expensive and slow. Wash, dry and fold P25/kg, wash, dry and iron P30/kg. They SMS you in 2 to 3 days. Use the main mall entrance and turn left. Tel: 72582890, 72117866

name: Oasis
description: Filter water disinfected with ozone. Fill your own containers around P1.5/l. Friendlier staff at Acacia Mall and water P1.0/l!

name: Kuminda Farm and Cultural Village
description: Kuminda Farm and Cultural Village is off the beaten track and ideal for those who would like to discover the least explored areas of Botswana’s rural landscape and experience some of its culture. We don’t have a restaurant but can cook for groups, dinner, lunch and breakfast... booking for cooking at least 1 week in advance as we have to make sure the food is traditional and yummy.  We use solar and solar lanterns and we will provide solar lights at campsites

name: African Casa/African Aces
description:
Very nice campsite set in the bush with lots of birds and jackals calling at night. Amazing when you think how close to Gaborone you are. 2 or 3 camp sites amongst ready erected tents. Pool (and bar at weekends), also breakfast served (we didn’t check it out), no other meals. Use Google maps or map.me to enter from Phakalane (don’t believe the directions from other starting points). Some dirt road but mainly tarred. Can be noisy at weekends. Good supermarkets etc in Phakalane. We paid P300 per night with Land Rover and Caravan. Call or WhatsApp 
+267 72 113 854

name: Hollandia Café and Restaurant
description: An absolutely wonderful place for coffee and food. Certainly the best coffee place since Maun, arguably the best cappuccino I had in all of Africa!

name: Food Stall
description: Cute little food stall next to street. We took the turn off just before, coming from the east, and drove up the dirt track next to the food stall. Had BBQd chicken with a dumpling and some nicely spiced veggies for 25 Pula. Would definitely recommend!

name: Unused Road - Start
description: Our tiny car didn't like the sand track, so we just stopped at the side of the track right after it started. Pitched our tent in the Bush. You can hear the cars from the main street, but no one came by or bothered us.

name: Builders Mart
description: Hardware shop. Went here to get some tape to fix our broken tent poles.

name: Near border
description: Nice dry (not muddy!) place at layby hidden from road by bushes, very quiet, just a few cars passed by.

name: Tap's Home Away From Home (Plot 58082)
description: This is not a hotel or a hostel (no suitable category here so I choose hostel), but its more to AirBnB concept. Very comfy & spotless private room at affordable price with A/C, attached shower, TV, fridge, kettle etc. The price is P250 per room (only 2 rooms available). Very friendly owner who happens to be a lady biker. Secured parking space for 1 car & few motorbikes. Very close to Gaborone Airport (less than 5kms).

name: Sego Steak House
description: Nice Restaurant with Wifi. Very fast service. Cool Staff and alot of parking space arround the place.

name: Shell Gas Station
description: Gas Station with Jacobs Coffee Shop, Butcher Shop, Restaurant with local food and Store to buy bread and packaged ice cream. One Coffee is 25 pula.

name: Molose Campsite KHMOS02
description: Good size campground with long drop toilet, bucket shower and fire ring. Good view over pan. Only downside is the whole site is on a slope and the water hole is km away.

name: Moreswa Pan - waterhole
description: Artificial waterhole with water at present, not sure if its working. Large herds of Gemsbok and a Springbok.

name: Molose Campsite KHMOS01
description: Usual facilities, although shower bucket allegedly stolen by the elephants who have also wrecked the nearby solar panel and water supply to the waterhole. Large level site with some shade. Can just see parts of the pan but not the waterhole. Very convenient for game drives around the pan.

name: Khutse Campsite KHKHU09
description:
This is a fairly large site with plenty of space for the Land Rover and Caravan. Usual toilet and shower on the main site. Plenty of lion calls at night!
The campground comprises 10 sites set on a horseshoe layout well spaced out. The lions appear to visit Campsite 01 fairly regularly, great if you don’t want to site out at night. In fact the lions use the campground access road as a route to their hunting ground. Note some of the sites have ablutions 20m away from the cleared campsite, not great when you know lions are around. We were the only people at the campground 5 of the 6 nights we stayed. MASCOM GRPS available here.

name: Bush/Pan Camp
description: Nice, remote spot to wild camp. Track to here is not sandy at all, there at bushes either side, which was no problem with our tiny car. There is an awesome dead tree to take pictures at sunset.

name: Local Food Street Stall
description: Lady with lots of pots and nice food around lunch time. Plate was 27 Pula.

name: ULTIMATE Cycle Base
description: Best bike shop I have seen in whole of Africa. Has all major brands and parts. As well - bike racks for cars. If you need a new bike or just parts this is the place to go to.

name: Camphill Community Trust Restaurant
description: Small school for children with Restaurant. Free Wifi, Steak, Milkshakes, Chips and more. Everthing you need for a break in the beautiful garden setting. Playground for kids available next to the little community garden.

name: GFS Gas
description: Filled 3kg CADAC cylinder for P90. Directed me to Viking Gas to fill fixed caravan tanks.

name: Aqua Bella
description: Water seller working from VW bus outside Delta Pharmacy. Filtered water 20l for 30P.

name: Motopi CKMO02
description: Usual facilities with distant view across pan (not Motopi), room for 2 campers. Some shade. Excellent sunsets. Track easy but rather overgrown and challenge with large caravan. NOTE maps.me shows this as campground 01.

name: Passarge CKPAS 01
description: Site with usual facilities and very good shade, limited view of valley. Reasonable access for Land Rover and large caravan.

name: DHL Gaborone
description:
We used this office to receive a replacement carnet and to return the old one. It worked well in both directions.

We also imported some spares for the caravan, the goods arrived on time on the Sunday, all documents were submitted to customs and duty paid on the Monday. We eventually managed to extract the goods from customs on the Thursday and collected them on the Friday morning. DHL appear to be the only courier with an office at the airport, which we visited on the Thursday and were told the goods had just been released by customs and were on there way to the collection office. Mmmm. The DHL staff were very helpful and friendly but had no influence over customs.

A week later I received a call from DHL saying customs wanted more duty to release the goods, i asked them to email me and haven’t heard anything since. 

We used the DHL office as the delivery address.

name: Nari Gas
description: This is basically a cylinder filling facility, however the manager, Saju, cell 71 22 7446, knows the original owner, Jan, cell 73008243, who built the facility and has an extension filler pipe and ACME filling nozzle. This enabled Saju to fill our caravan fixed propane tanks. They don’t have a meter to measure the propane delivered, so you’ll pay an estimate, in their favour, in  kg. Very helpful guys. Jan may also be worth contacting if you have gas appliance problems.

name: Terrains Mechanic and Delta Recovery
description: Mr Hokkan did an oil change on my Discovery 4. Specialises in Land Rover other makes no problem. Has workshop with basic tools. Recommend to me by Rileys. Also will provide recovery in the Delta and CKGR.

name: Beef Boys - Butcher
description: Good range of vacuum packed meat, will advise what products you can take across the vet fences. Also nice selection of fresh green vegetables (excluding the green potatoes).

name: The Health Hut
description: The usual supplements, including Solgar products. Helpful staff.

name: PE Waters
description: Filtered Water p1/litre. Easy parking for big rigs. Very helpful owner.

name: Malokwane Entrance Gate
description: This entrance gate is rarely visited, staff very confused by Covid regulations for overseas visitors in lockdown, but very helpful. Drinking water at the rangers residence if you were desperate. See photo for map of park.

name: Pumped waterhole
description: Not pumped at present! Therefore no animals.

name: Pumped waterhole
description: Working solar powered waterhole. Large herd of wildebeest, some zebra, springboks and a jackal.

name: Pumped waterhole
description: Junction to waterhole, lots of elephants using it.

name: Kaitshe Escarpment
description: A beautiful spot, about 150 m above the Sowa pan. Amazing views. We hiked down to the Baobabs in the pan. It's a Botswana Museum site.

name: Sable alley
description: Safari lodge near Kwai river, adjacent to Moremi game reserve

name: Sexhebe Guest House
description: This is a newly build guest house, nice and clean.

name: Bushcamp Selinda
description: Bushcamp just about 3 km after the Selinda river crossing

name: Bush Camp at waterhole
description: Nice and open spot next to the road, plenty of firewood

name: Bushcamp at the Kwhai river
description: Beautiful place on a river bend. Got visited by Hippos and Elephants in the evening and scared by a pair of glowing eyes a bit later.

name: Wildcamp Phuduhudu
description: This looks like it could have been an old camp site but there are only ruins remaining. A bit close to the road but an ideal starting / ending point to visit Nxai National Park.

name: Bushcamp at the Boteti river
description: There's a sandy track right next to the Boteti, parallel to the B300 leading up to the entrance gate in Khumaga. You could camp anywhere there.

name: Bushcamp next to pan
description: Very beautiful spot on the edge of a pan. We stayed for 2 nights, nobody around.

name: Makadikadi flamingo camp
description: This camp has a huge amount of potential, the views are stunning, when we were there it was in need of some maintenance as so many other places after the lockdown. So much better and cheaper than the run down place at Lekhubu Island.

name: Bushcamp in a pan
description: Just another beautiful wild camp right outside the Nata Bird Sanctuary.

name: Banks Mechanic
description: Mr. Banks replaced my Defenders leaking brake pipe that was bent badly by a wooden branch. 100 BWP. He's working efficiently and seems knowledgeable. Highly recommended.

name: Khumaga Gate
description: West entrance to  Makgadikgadi NP. Helpful staff. For best game viewing just head straight on. Very scenic when the river is high. See map attached to East entrance check-in.

name: Ferry, when river is high.
description: If the river is high you’ll need to take the ferry here. Call +267 7715 2753. Plenty of room for a 4x4 and medium size trailer. Operated by Boteti River Camp, if you’re staying there you get a discount, 75p each way.

name: Maako Rest Camp
description: Scorched earth at this time of year, with little shade. No water in ‘river’, so not much game at present. Shower not working. Easy 2WD access, fine with 2.2t caravan. B mobil E coverage. 100BWP pppn.  Contact Shoes 73 564 952. Or Maun office 686 2353, info@nagasafaris.com

name: Mr Veg
description: Reasonable selection of fresh vegetables and fruit, not a huge selection or very fresh on the day we visited. Very helpful staff.

name: Eden Drops Water
description: Filtered water. Self service and all set up so you don’t touch anything during Covid restrictions.

name: Stretch Point 4
description: You’re allowed to leave the car here. Great place for a picnic under a large tree or, alternatively about 50m further on, to sit on the riverbank and watch the hippo, but no shade.

name: RP Motors
description: A mechanic from Zim, fixed my starter motor (well, he took 2 broken ones and made them one working one). Highly recommended!

name: Akacia Cafe
description:
Small Café / Restaurant where you sit outside but covered by a roof. Delicious food, great juices and very friendly stuff.
We got here just before 7pm on a Sunday.  Usually they would close at 6pm but the chef didn't mind still cooking dinner for us. The menu isn't big (see pics attached) but what we got was a good portion and really delicious. The beef is local from Botswana and the taste is great. Love the fesh juices (seasonal availability).
WiFi also worked pretty good.
Would come back here for sure.

name: Pangolin Photo Safaris (departure point)
description:
