Instead of just doing a boat ride on the Chobe River we can highly recommend this Photo Safari. It's been one of the most remarkable experiences during our trip through several African countries. 
Anyone who is into photography will be happy to finally get a lower and therefore better perspective on the animals compared to usual safari tours in a car or the other boats on the Chobe River.
Here you can expect really good conditions for great pictures. You can still use your own camera equipment but what they provide you with is also great to get good shots. 
If you're new to photography this is as well a nice tour as you will be guided and they teach you as much as you like about wildlife photography. Or you just use the camera to get to see more details of the animals you're looking at thanks to the zoom. And there is sooo much to see at the Chobe River! 
The guides are not just very knowledgeable when it comes to photography but also the animals you get to see.
At the end you get to take the memory card with the pictures you took.
We had a wonderful experience!

name: Entrance to park
description: We were sent here to enter the Park by the Ranger at Ngoma Gate. He said the road from the gate towards Sidudu was very deep sand and then a section washed out by rain. Best just enter here and pay as you exit at Sidudu.

name: LandMark (camping store)
description: Well stocked store selling everything from tents to gas burners.

name: Landy Parts (Land Rover)
description:
As it says on the box, parts for Land Rovers. Contact Pearl +267 74 444 994. Some consumables in stock, many other parts in 3-5 days from South Africa. They got me Discovery 2 Terrafirma shocks for my caravan! Will deliver throughout Botswana using Sprint Couriers.

Landline 3160180.

name: Rest and Digest
description:
P400 for two people in a lovely clean room with en-suite, aircon and TV. Cheaper than camping in some lodges. 

Lovely woman who owns the guesthouse.

We took a room and stayed for a week.

name: Passarge campsite CKPAS 03
description: Three kilometres after the passage valley in the Bush on a little hill with toilet and bucket shower. Would go to number one or better two next time. Two trees for shade but only for 2-4 people.

name: Mogotlho Safari Lodge
description: Beautiful lodge on the Khwai River. Game drives. Luxury Tents. Friendly staff.

name: diagnofirm
description: Easy pcr corona test for 850 PPP. Could collect the results in Lobatse next day for border crossing.

name: Stwalos Campsite
description: Enchanting gardens with small cabins to sleep in. also space for ground tents. Cars with rooftop tents have to stay in the carpark. Basic ablutions but clean. 100pppn+50 for the car. Spent a much quieter night here than at Cronje se Plot, which was lovely but very noisy due to the nearby road.

name: diagnofirm corona test
description: Test for 850 pulla, test done till next day as they sent it to Gabarone, they just collect the tests. When we where there they could not print out the results because it was broken and they had no Internet. So better ask that as well beforehand.

name: Shopping Mall
description: Shopping Mall including Puma fuel station, supermarket (Choppies, Shoprite), ATM (FNB) and few smaller shops

name: Midas Shop
description: Midas Shop. They sell tools and car parts. Additionally they do have a section with camping gear incl. pots, chairs, lights, jerry cans and further outdoor stuff.

name: Serolo Safari Camp
description: Serolo Safari Camp offers tented accomodation and is linked to the nearby Molema Bush Camp, which offers budget campingsites and Cabins. The guided game drive that we were offered started from Serolo Camp, picking us up at Molema Bush Camp (we stayed there as camping guests). Game drive was well worth it. reasonably priced. Although we did not stay here as guests, they offered us to come for dinner (at extra costs) and we were lucky enough to use their amenities incl. swimming pool, nearby waterhole for game spotting and honesty bar. Beautiful spot on earth on a very hot summer day.

name: Engen Station
description: Engen Fuel Station as usual. We did not stop here to refuel, only passed by.

name: Herma Auto Service
description: Herma Auto Service helped us with spontaneously fixing our breathing system on the car. Very helpful. We would recommend him.

name: gozone Water
description: Purified water for 1 pula/liter when you bring your own container. Otherwise 5l containers available with water for 18pula. Highly recommended.

name: Military Checkpoint
description: Military Checkpoint. No one stopped us for questions.

name: Name Pan
description: This campsite is operated by Zutshwa community. Permits to camp here can be bought in Zutshwa, where Zutshwa Stop Over is located. Camping 100 P/person. No facilities. Beautiful view over the pan.

name: Swartpan Campsite No 2
description:
Swartpan Campsite No.2. You can book via DWNP office or at the gate.
Camping fees are 30p/person +  park entrance fee (20 pula/person) + car fee (4 pula)
No facilities available. Nice open spot.
There is another campsite (No.1) available with a water tap.

name: Swartpan Campsite No.1
description:
Swartpan Campsite No.1. You can book via DWNP office or at the gate.
Camping fees are 30p/person +  park entrance fee (20 pula/person) + car fee (4 pula)
No facilities available. There is a water tap but by the time that we visited, it did not work.
There is another campsite (No.2) close by which we think is a bit nicer as you have a better view over the pan.

name: Robot Auto Electrical
description:
Sale of Auto-Electrical parts, 4x4 specialist.
We went here to ask for assistance with our highlift jack and they were very nice and helpful. 
Very impressive showroom for whatever you may need for 4x4s.
Contact +267 3902680

name: Mahurushele 03 (KHMAH-03)
description: Campsite Mahurushele No 03. Nice open place, but very limited shade. Bucket Shower and pit toilet, as well as braai stand available. Bring own water. Close to Mahurushele Pan. Non-residents prices are at the moment 350 Pula/night/person + park entrance fees (120 pula/person/night + 50 Pula car fee)

name: SaveRite Supermarket
description: Saverite Supermarket. Not the biggest shop, but daily supplies available.

name: Central Kalahari CKKOR-02
description:
Kori Campsite No 2.

Close to Deception Valley

name: MMA Dinare
description:
Beautiful lodge.
No campsites. Only chalet tents. Nice service. Not so nice food. Very expensive. And the best game drives ever. Mr anT as our driver was awesome.

name: Paje Bush Hotel
description: small clean comfortable hotel alongside the main road  between Orapa and Serowe

name: On the way to Sheshawa
description: About 400m from main road to Sheshawa. Very quiet. Perfect overnight spot.

name: BGH lodge
description: Small place with few rooms. Very noisy and not really clean. Can't recommend even for such a good price.

name: Rbnb Didsala
description:
It’s an Rbnb place very large, à house with big kitchen, two rooms with two long size beds, big living room 
No fan, no air con

name: Ice World
description: A cool shop that sells blocks and cubes of ice! Good to stock up here before going to Chobe/Moremi so you can enjoy your pina coladas in the bush!

name: Bezelda Investments Yours Cash & Carry
description:
Update June 2022:
It’s now called Bezelda Investments Yours Cash & Carry. Surprisingly well stocked small supermarket! 

Old Post:
Bottle store in town owned by the most lovely people... sells anything you need for a good old party!!!!!!  (Including ice blocks and ice cubes)

name: Semo Guest House
description: Quiet local guesthouse.  P450 for double room with hot shower, TV, WIFI. Covid prices.   Clean and quiet.  Secure parking with guard at night.  Breakfast extra.  Small restaurant although we didn't eat there. Friendly owner.  Very pleasant stopover.

name: Nxabii Cottages
description: 7 cottages in the Kazungula community about 10km from Kasane. The rooms are well appointed and clean. The beds are very comfortable. There is wifi and satellite tv. There is a central area for preparing food. We paid P600 a night for two adults and two children in one large room...

name: Former border road
description:
On Botswana side, take the shortcut whuch meander along the border.
place is hidden from the main Botswanian road, but visible from SA track, on the other side.
Many tracks of cattle and donkeys.
spent one night there and no one passed.
heard Jackals and Hyenas at night! 
No phone network

name: Last chance option
description:
on our way to Ramatlaba border, we had to overnight and found this place.
Not visible from the road but you can hear both trucks on highway and trains when passing as it was curfew period, the noise stopped around 10 PM.
grassy floor.
good Orange connexion

name: Multigrowth Filling Station Tshootsha
description: Nearest filling station from Kang on the direct route to the Namibian Buitepos Border Post, it is approximately 800m off the road into the village of Tshootsha. Mainly used by Cross Border Transporters however they do have 95 unleaded available always. Cards can be used however have cash available in Pula to be certain. For Adventure bikers this is your nearest stop from Kang to Buitepos and your first stop from Buitepos direction Kang

name: Kendor Dry Cleaners
description: We cannot recommend enough - did a massive load of laundry for us and washed it three times as it was so dirty from our recent camping trip.

name: The Red Kitchen
description:
Had a good lunch here - worth a visit.

Friendly staff.

name: Engen fuel station
description: Can fill up with fuel here when travelling between Francistown and Tuli Block. Can pay by card. There is also an Engen and Puma fuel station in Bobolong. They are the last ones before Tuli.

name: Bush canp
description: From the picnic spot on the main road there is a small track. The trees are tall enough so that after about 200m you are hidden from view. There were no recent tyre tracks and no one passed by overnight. There is some road noise but it's not exactly a busy road at night. We got our Unimog down without difficulty, larger rigs should be ok too.

name: Supermarkets
description: Whilst Chippies is being refurbished, there are a couple of small supermarkets here where you can get most basics plus more

name: Ntshe Clinic
description:
This is the place where you can have a PCR covid test. 500 pulas.
you have to pay first at Nyangabwe Hospital and then come here for being tested. Results in 1, 2 or 3 days depending on the amount of work for the lab.

name: Kwhai Community office
description: This is where you should buy a campsite permit for Magotho but nobody around and the office can be found at the campsite itself now apparently so no need for the extra drive all the way here...changing the signage would help.

name: Salt pan
description: On the edge of the salt pan, no shade but total silence and open space around you.

name: Along the cutline.
description: The unused cutline track with the electricity masts running over it, small clearing next to the track, one side is fenced, thorny and rocky ground but ok for a night to just sleep and move on.

name: Nyangabwe hospital Covid payment
description: The main hospital where you pay for your Covid test, enter administration and turn right where you pay 500P per person and then go to Ntshe Clinic also marked on the map.

name: Chobe Mopani Forest Lodge
description: 9 camp sites with private ablution and limited power as they are on solar.

name: Laureate Enterprises
description: Key Cutting - here we got a copy of our engine key.

name: Weather Hawk
description: Key cutting - they have a better machine than Laureate, they managed to duplicate our broken key.

name: African Bush Lovers Hide Inn Camp
description: Very nice new Camp 4 km north of Maun. They have 5 safari tents and place for 3-4 campers (big rigs would squeeze in). Ablution new and clean, hot water, braai stands. Safe place. Super nice people! P P150 for 2, 350 for a big serviced tent. Hard to find, no signs yet.

name: Maun Auto Centre
description:
Professional Service for cars and trucks.
Martin the owner was very helpfull to us, to fix our problem.

name: Kazungula PCR-test
description:
Covid-Test station at ‘Weighbridge for trucks’.

Before testing you have to pay P 500 pp elsewhere.
- the ‘Immigration’ building closed to the bridge/border Zambia
- the BURS office in Kasane

name: Khwai Guest House
description: This place is a guest house. We asked kindly to fill our water. It's borhole water but locals drink it. Pretty clean water

name: Bush camp between kasane and savuti
description: Coordinattes are exact. Just off the road turn into the bush. Had a quiet night, only 2 car passed before  dark. Also couldn't hear close by animals around.

name: Fire and Ice
description:
This place sells good quality meat packed in vacuum. We bought nice ribeye. They also sell frozen meat and some sauces. 
Access after the Motovac at the left corner of a parking lot

name: BTC tech center and shop
description: BTC tech center and shop. Near the builders world.

name: Fourie Butchery
description:
Very good meat. Ask Yster or his wife Belinda which meat they have.
Oxtail, boerewors, billtong, beef and game.

Opening hours Monday to Friday 08:30 to 17:30; Saturday 08:30 to 14:30; Sunday 08:30 to 12:30. Phone: Yster +267 764 75232

name: Mascom shop
description: Shop of Mascom (one of the main mobile operator in Bots). You can get a sim card with airtime and data.

name: ATM
description: ABSA bank with external ATM. It is the only ATM in Nata and for the nearby villages (like Gweta, Sepako...). Expect to queue on payday/month ends.

name: Tsodilo Hills Campground
description:
The camp is now beside the Museum. Surrounded by the rocks of the hill. Basic facilities but a lot of space surrounded by the bush. Toilets are not very clean. We are the only camper at this time. From the gate and  reception drive down the fence a few km and turn right following the track and you will end up on the campsite. 

We payed:
--Entry fee 50 pp
--Camping fee 130 pppn 
--Rhino walk 120 pp

name: Khwai Development Trust
description: This is the new booking office for the Khwai Development Trust camps e.g. Magotho Camp.

name: Barbara’s bistro
description:
A good option for lunch and dinner, the restaurant is in the Francistown Club, with a big parking lot. 
German and continental cuisine.

Telephone number 71603486.

name: BURS/Home Affairs PCR Test
description:
Here you can do the PCR test for traveling.
You pay at the BURS office and they do the test directly here outside. Costs are 500P, much cheaper than Diagnofirm. You have to pick up the results at the next day, approx. 24 hours later.

name: Road to a disused gravel quarry (250/300m) wrong highway! Should read A2 not A3
description: As you are traveling south bound on A just south of a small village “Lakone” a narrow road on your right will lead and end at a abandoned quarry. Not advisable to try to go into quarry. Just before the hill leading into the quarry, there is a bush track on the right which is relatively level and stable. Entrance road and track suitable for two and four wheel drive vehicles. You will hear vehicles on the A3 but will not be seen. Had no visitors of two or four legged variety. Good for overnight.

name: shell gas station
description: shell gas station with diesel and petrol

name: Nkisi Upperdeck Boskos
description: Restaurant attached to the Nkisi Guesthouse.

name: The Duck Café Bar
description: Prime location with excellent food and atmosphere. Quick and friendly service, free WiFi, good selection of drinks including local beer on tap. They also sell a large range of curios and art all made in Maun

name: Bushcamp beyond the A1
description:
Along the A1 is almost everything fenced. 
We found a remote and very nice bushcamp about 12 km away from the A1. 
To get to this place one must left on the monument for Tropic of Capricon into the earth road in direction of Buffels Drift / RSA.
After the 12 km a power line is crossing the road. Along the line leads also a kind of service path in both directions which might be also used sometimes from some local farmers (we have not seen anybody, only traces). 
We used the left one and followed the path. After some hundreds meters we used a small track to get deeper into the bush. Only signs of cattle footprints. Anywhere in the (far) distance might be local farmers. We were completely alone and had a perfect bush night.
When following the path along the power line further one comes to a bigger dry river bed. There might be even more/bigger places (we not tried out).

name: Vet check point
description: Vet Check point. They have not check us (coming from South)

name: Halfway Toyota Chobe
description: This is an official Toyota dealer and mechanic. Quite efficient and modern.

name: Symponia Lodge and Campsite
description: 6 Campsites, all covered with grass, all have a built braai and grid, 220V electricity and water. Very neat ablution facilities and an amazing swimming pool. Poor cellphone reception is the only downside however lodge wifi is great at the restaurant.

name: Camp Roi
description:
Small camp directly at the edge to Okawango River swamps. Not luxury but all what you need. The camp is private, running by a Wife and her daughter. There are also cabins available. The Price was P 150 pppn and we offer P 100 pppn at the end is was ok with the P100 pppn. Very quiet we was the only guest here. For a overnight stop before pass to Namibia quite OK.

Not easy to find no signs on the way you will pass some housing areas than you see a greater open space like soccer field, go around and shortly you find a sign Camp Roi to the left. We used our GPS to find this place.

name: Trakker dogs
description: There is a new camp site directly at the river from trakker dogs. At the moment this is more a wild camp without any toilet or water, but they will  build absolution soon. They also offer Mokoro Trips. We paid 250 Pula ppn. This point is the entry where you have to drive left to the Mokoro station and the guys will bring you to the camp site in the bush. See the picture for contact details.

name: Tatra Camp
description: Very quiet and nice place near the main road.  There is a lot of fire wood around.  during the rainy season it may be impassable.

name: welding
description: Here you all welding on cars. Let my exaust pipe weld here

name: no entry to the north west
description: no entry to the north west, CT11 area leased to Jack's camp. But one understands it is possible to self drive around the pans on the east of the North-South main road.

name: Pan's rim.
description: ...where the savanna ends and the immensity of the pan starts. We stayed 20 meters before, on the little hill, to get view on both.

name: Boteti River Bushcamp
description: Quiet bushcamp at Boteti River with many elefant and hippo tracks, but in the river we saw only cows and heard thousands of frogs in the night. Far away from the main road and local houses. Very weak Orange-signal.

name: Boteti River Bushcamp
description: Great bushcamp directly at the Boteti River. Easy acces from the tarred road: take the cutline road (in Maps.me) to the Boteti River Road, go a bit north, then follow a sandy track 200 m down to the river. Accessible for big rigs. No Orange-signal.

name: Ntwetwe Pan Bushcamp
description: Camping in the middle of Ntwetwe Pan. No people, no trees, no shade, no mosquitos, just nature, the stars at night and really a lot of wind. Easy access to the pan from A3. Take the track to the south west of the pan. You find plenty of space on the edge of the pan. Be careful driving on the pan. Don´t try when i´s wet. H+ Orange signal.

name: Makoro Bar
description:
There is almost no possibility to overnight along the A1 … but Moshe, the very kind owner or Makoro Bar allowed us to stay for the night in his nicely maintained backyard, There is a grassy area to sit and relax and a few old trees to provide shade.
Moshe and his son Wanano have plans to make this place into a rest place with a wider range of facilities. At the moment, there is water, electricity and Wifi available, toilet/shower is planned to be available soon.
BBQ/braai can be offered if pre-arranged by phone
Moshe: +267 72639271
Wanano: +267 72607572
Moshe and his family also run a chicken farm 3km from the A1, they are very nice people and most interesting to talk to.

name: Coffee Buzz
description: Open until about 4pm. restaurant and coffee shop. Serves good breakfasts and has free wi-fi. Some tour operators based in the same garden. Decent coffee hard to find in Kasane, so this was a welcome find.

name: DO NOT enter Sua Pan/ Kukonje Island with a heavy vehicle!
description:
@ HEAVY VEHICLES – BE WARNED, DO NOT TRY!
The person at the vet check point gave us ok, all looked fine … 2km into the pan we got stuck very badly … this in mid-October after months of dry season.

name: Bush camp
description:
nice bush camp.
there are a lot of Elephant signs.
and the cows are walking here. 
you can hear the road, but you are not seen from the road

name: Roadside
description:
just down a sandy road, is there a great place to camp for one night.
we talked to some rangers, and they said that we should be careful for Elephants in this area. Big rig friendly

name: Off road
description:
nice place, we just turn off A3, and drove behind the trees.
you can heer the road, but they cannot see you.

name: Feral Auto Works
description:
Feral Auto Works was for us a lucky strike! We needed some serious repairs done and found Bashi Shubani and his team to be of outstanding support: reliable, diligent, trustworthy, precise, innovative, very friendly and fair in pricing.
Bashi sets high standards and has high ethics. We are most thankful and parted as friends.
We highly recommend this place not only for their core business of car body works but possibly also for other related work.

name: Gibby‘s Diesel Services
description: Brendan Gibson is a very experienced guy in all about Diesel engines. He has testing Stations for injectors. And also Tests Diesel pumps and does axles. He knows everything and saved our ass as our car was not running anymore.

name: Lake at Rysana Pan
description: Beautiful and easy accessible bushcamp at a small lake in the westernmost edge of Ryasana Pan. Easy 2WD access. A lokal house is 500 m away, some locals passed by, nobody bothered us. H+-Orange signal.

name: The Plot
description:
Our campsite at The Plot is ideally situated as it is in striking distance of Lekhubu (Kubu) Island, Orapa Game Park and Diamond Museum and Central Kalahari Game Reserve, or CKGR as it’s also commonly known.

Just outside of Letlhakane camping allows for tranquility away from the bustle of this vibrant village, and it is just off the road to Lekhubu (Kubu) Island.

The campsite has an outdoor bathroom with flush toilet, basin and shower. Hot water is available through a donkey boiler.

A braai and bush oven makes cooking convenient and the firepit allows one to sit around the glow of a fire at night.

The small pond attracts a great diversity of birds and small animals.

Please contact us prior to arrival : +267 748 395 28 or stay@theplot.africa

name: Medical PCR–Test
description: Covid-19 Test in 24 Hours, costs 65 US$ per Person

name: Next to water channel
description: We could not drive over the bridge because it was too narrow at the broken section for our truck, but we turned right. Lovely spot! If the water level is rising I think it is not accessable.

name: Easi Gas
description: Place to refill gas canisters. 3kg canister topped up for 97 pula

name: Symponia Guesthouse
description: Beautiful spacious rooms with full en suite bathrooms, DSTV, wifi, fridge, tea and coffee facilities and all other amenities you will need.

name: Baobabs wildcamp
description: We didn't find the other baobab 9km from here, but there are two at this location that would be perfect to spend a night. Lovely location.

name: Spic & Span Laundry
description: Clean and cheap laundry and dry cleaning.

name: Okavango Kopano Community Trust
description:
New location to book walking, mokoro and village trips - www.okmct.org.be

We booked our mokoro trip, 200 per boat and 68 entrance fee pp

old location nearer the city centre is out of date.

we plan to stay overnight at Izaaks location just a 30min away and leave early morning.

name: Wild camp spot for cyclists
description: Perfect camp spot for cyclists. Abandoned huts and rooms available. Roofs are in good shape. Floors are decent and clean.

name: CT Diagnostic
description: This is a covid PCR testing place which cost $750 pula per person. We took the test at 4pm and got them back the next day at 11am. The people were nice enough to print the results for us but usually email. The staff was very nice.

name: Panthers boutique (restaurant)
description:
Tiny restaurant at the back of the Comesa markethall. She sells chips and fried t-bone steak for US$2.

At the back (another stall) you can get chicken.

name: Khawa Lodge
description: Khawa Lodge is a brand new lodge just outside Ghanzi that opened late 2021. They have a restaurant and also allow camping. The individual chalets are clean with en-suite, AC, hot water kettle, television, and comfortable beds. Standard rooms are more affordable than the places in town. The owner is very friendly! Camping for 170 pula, standard rooms around 500 but may be negotiable. We arrived on bicycles and they were very helpful.

name: TswanaFuel Truck Station - Camping Possibility for Cyclists
description: This is a large truck fuel station with a small shop at the back that sells food and beverages. We arrived on our bicycles before crossing the border and asked to camp. The supervisor had to approve it. He allowed us to camp in the back of the property and even opened the shower and toilet for us. Very nice and helpful staff and has everything a cyclist could need for camping.

name: Tony & Sons - Mechanic
description:
Toyota garage sent me here for repairs. Fantastic mechanics with great skills. Replaced my front bearings on the landcruiser for very reasonable price. Any vehicle can come here, diesel or petrol. 
Being a mechanic myself I can highly recommend them!

name: Gas Station & Supermarket Takeaway Bakery
description: Small supermarket with takeaway sandwiches and bakery. Good stop for drinks, snacks, food. Also a gas station.

name: NCI Service station
description:
Service Station
Toilets
Shower
Workers stay there permanently
They allow you pitching your tent and using their facilities

name: between Xade and Ghanzi
description: Nice place in a depression on the gravel, 50 m from the road. Very quiet. Place for 3 or 4 cars.

name: Bushcamp at a pan
description: Nice place to bushcamp with view over the pan. No water at the moment, but in some weeks maybe full of water. Cows and horses around.

name: Mokoka Rest Camp
description:
Nice Campsites with a lot of shady places (100Pula)
Few Tabs and Braais around free to use
There are also 5 private rooms for 400 Pula.
Abulotion is clean and there is nice hot water. 
Restaurant and Bar
No +267 7173 65 64 (WhatsApp)

name: Mechanic Maun - mr Wellington
description:
Mechanic how comes to your location. Proper mechanic with knowledge on landcruiser. He charges 300p  per hour. 
Name is Wellington: +26775661978

name: Tintech B&B
description:
Good value accommodation for an overnight in Francistown instead of camping. Quiet, clean, very pleasant, friendly staff. Spacious en-suite double room with TV, small fridge, air con and coffee/tea-making facilities. Breakfast included (toasted sandwich followed by omelette).

There was just about space for our bakkie to park inside the secure gate, but it was tight. Larger vehicles would probably struggle and might have to park outside (there’s plenty of space, but I can’t comment on security).

name: Deception Pan
description: The actual Deception Pan which could potentially have water if there has been rain. Probably dry most of the time.

name: Piper Pan Warerhole
description: Rhe pumped waterhole in vicinity of Piper Pans. Beautiful open grassy area. A lot of animals attracted to the water.

name: Motopi 2 CKMOT02
description: Campsite, Bucket shower, pit toilet. No water. Decent shade. Not much view in green season.

name: PCR Test
description: Private medical practice offering PCR test for P1000. At the time we passed through (Botswana - Namibia) the border had intermittent availablity of tests so best to do it in Ghanzi. 24hr turnaround with results by email.

name: Kasane Self-Catering
description:
Lovely little place set in lush gardens. Twin room. En-suite with well-equipped kitchenette and small lounge area (all in the same room). Lovely hot shower. Fridge, microwave/oven, electric kettle, toaster and two electric hobs, plus all the crockery/utensils/etc you need for a few nights. Free WiFi. Secure parking big enough for our bakkie with roof tent. Lovely friendly staff.
The best value place we found in Kasane if you’re not able to camp - 840 pula per night for the ‘cottage’.

name: Water well next to road to Kubu Island Office
description:
ADMIN NOTE: water is scarce for local population in these parts - please take water from wells only what you need for immediate/short-term use and not deplete scarce resources to fill large tanks.

Hidden between trees, not far from main road to Kubu Island office, little farm with water well…water is good to use for cooking & shower !  Very quiet - some cows and donkeys to keep you company - very friendly farmer.

name: Campspot in Cage close to antenna
description: Perfect for cyclists: Green cage close to antenna, no security guy around and the fenced area is not properly dense..some wholes in the fence. A maintainance worker told me its no problem to sleep here. You can close the green cage with your bikelocker but are perfectly save from animals in the night. Maintainance guy told me sometimes Lions come to the area

name: Humans Transport
description: Very good 4x4 mechanic servicing the surrounding farmers and adventurers passing by. We thought Jannie was a very capable all round mechanic.

name: A32 to Sua pan
description: Old track running next to A32, only used by cows and elephants…go a bit deeper in so you are hidden behind bushes

name: River front between Kasungula & Kadane
description: Open space close to the river, on the road between Kasungula and Kasane…very quiet , lovely views over river - a few people during the day to fish - at night be aware of wild animals

name: SIM-card - Selection Electronics
description: We got a SIM-card and 20GB here. The shop has no stand-out sign or name. Next to the Stanbic Bank.

name: Leopard Pan Loop
description: View point over the open grassland under trees with shade.  Saw 3 leopards hunting, lots of wildebeest and oryx.

name: Leopard Pan campsite (Sunday Camp 1)
description: Shaded campsite in the bush. Pit toilet. No water. Remote and quiet.

name: Sekoma Fuel
description: Fuel Station next to the road incl. a little shop with toast, noodles and such a stuff. No fresh products-no meat.

name: Side of the road - just before Chipata
description:
Side of the road - flat surface - ideal 
Not too much traffic at night - locals dont mind

name: Mascom
description: Shop to buy simcard. Payed 149 for 8.5 GB and 30 days. It seems to be the best Coverage in Bots but even though is mostly 3G and slow.

name: Great Airbnb
description:
We had a superb staying in Denise's house. Its super comfortable and absolutely clean house. The owners apparently are not here most of the times, but Gladys runs the house. The room we stayed was huge with even an Office only for us. The bed was amazing, good shower and also good wifi. The kitchen is extreme well equiped even with dozens of spices. Theres a washing machine you can use. Parking space only for 2 cars, our Defender fitted but not good for big rigs. There is also other 2 rooms in the house for guests with shared bathroom. Only thing is 10 km by City center. We payed 240 pula per night through Airbnb or 200 directly there. You can find it on Airbnb or contact Denise +33 643396642. 
https://abnb.me/CJN1Kl7wlpb

name: Tyre Repair
description:
Small tyre shop (very small) beside choppies. Fixed a flat. 60P.
nice guy.

name: Livingstone Kolobeng National Monument
description: The home of Livingstones and the Bakwena 1847 - 1852. This third mission of legendary overlander and explorer of antiquity David Livingstone displays the ruins of the first church in Botswana as well as his house and burial place of his daughter Elizabeth. No fee required, but a guide will ask to sign in and is very knowledgeable of the history in which he might proceed to tell one about it! The ruins themselves are a bit down the road and is self navigable with ones vehicle. Gave the guide BWP20 as a tip which is non mandatory. Excellent historial perspectives and well worth the 45 minutes spent here!

name: bush buck
description: private quilt campsite. pula 150 pp. owner's name is Scott

name: Wild bush camp off the road to Kubu Island
description: Wild camp off the road that leads South East to Kubu Island. Just go off the road to the East, through some thicker bush, onto a nice mixed sandy/grassy plain. Good sunset views, quiet. No view on the pan. Nice level parking.

name: Tropic of Capricorn
description: Interesting columnar joints depicting each of the worlds countries this line runs through. Stop for some pics and possible purchase of curios. There was a photographer who could take pictures if you want.

name: Alternative to unused road
description: The unused road access with the small gate looked locked and it was getting dark, so we drove about 800m on from the overgrown small gate to another gate with a triangle curvy road sign. At the end of the road there is a friendly farmer house, we asked him if his road leads to the unused road, and it doesn’t. We ended up taking one of the side roads from his main road into a decent clearing and camped here. Cowbells and faint farmer voices, but no one disturbed us. Road is slightly overgrown, high clearance good to have. It’s the only viable side track we saw, it used to go further but too overgrown. Invisible from the farmers road and main road. No cell signal

name: Petrol hyper with water
description: We topped up 100l of diesel and he let us fill water in our water tanks. Nice chap. He said it is portable but it’s not as good tasting as the water we got in both lesotho and SA

name: Hardware & Motor Spares
description: Convenient vehicle, bicycle and hardware spares shop along the A1 road. Got spare headlamp globes here. Sells bicycle parts, vehicle oils etc

name: Narrow path not suitable for big rigs
description: Road north to sowe town has narrow paths lined with thorny bushes. The path here is also more difficult and steeper at the dry river sections than the road leading into kukonje island. Had a tire puncture as well. 4x4 needed when wet

name: More than 10 half metre potholes
description: Don’t drive this road that is on maps me. There are more than 10 half metre potholes created by some animal, we fell into a few with our cruiser and had difficulty coming out

name: Sua Flamingo Pan
description: There’s several hundred flamingoes roosting here and hanging about. We camped at the edge of the pan, would suggest taking the maps me route out here but not further north (head back inland for north) as the route along the pan north has big potholes. Quiet night, some cows, jackals at night, pelicans and many other birds. 2 bar mascom 4g

name: Brewery Okavango
description: Craft brewery with tour options. Huge outside sitting area in the trees, decent craft beers and the usual stuff you'd expect from a micro brewery. Staff is super friendly:)

name: ct diagnostics laborarory
description: Covid-19 PCR tests done here for border crossings. Bring passport. Result within 1 hour. BWP750 via cash or card. For our child we requested a mouth swab which they did no problem. +267 77 408 424

name: Apical Guest House
description: Guest house with around 8 rooms. 6 are small basic rooms. 450 on booking.com 400 cash. larger rooms with fridge, microwave 550 booking.com 500 cash. considering we've been paying more then that for camping, it felt reasonable. They only accept cash. Has secure parking. Slow to average wifi. friendly staff. location is a bit weird in industrial area. Everything you'd expect from the cheapest hotel in Maun.

name: Fishing Supplies "PAAM"
description: Small fishing and ammo shop with basic but useful gear. Reccomend Rapela white body with red head for Tiger Fish.

name: Gusha Pan
description:
We had an amazing night at this little lake/waterhole under ‘Shade Tree’ as marked on Tracks for Africa. Beautiful spot with firewood for the braai, shade and a level spot. 

We had inquisitive herdsmen who were friendlyish and we heard a tour guide from Jack’s Camp stop at the nearby Baobab. 

We were visited by a herd of elephants at about 11pm who came down to drink.

name: Patrick Brown Khwai
description:
Pat is a very good mechanic, the best in Khwai according to people here.
He sells fuel, and can give you a place to camp in his place.
Great guy and very helpful!

name: Road to avoid water crossing
description: Take the turnoff 800m southwards from the waterhole camp turnoff on maps me and follow the obvious track to avoid the water (this water is signposted as a warning on the road itself). Slightly sandy but zero water crossing. The detour is about 3km. This detour follows maps me for a while, about 1 km or so and then branches off northwards from the maps me road

name: New water tap
description: We went to the old one and the community trust guys said it is not working anymore and led us to the new one here. Locals say it’s drinking water, runs pretty clear. Be careful when opening and closing it as the tap is tied with a waterproof tape and you need to tie it back so it doesnt leak

name: Community Center With Wifi
description: Community center with library and wifi. when other people are there, it's terrible. If it's just you, it's good enough to do a few things. slow but usable.

name: Agility Vehicle Repair
description: Godfrey and his mechanics can repair and rebuild pretty much everything. I was stuck in the  Nxia Pan with a blown motor and called Godfrey who came highly recommended. He drove the 150 km to pick me up with the car and rebuilt the damaged motor and got me back on the road within a week. The motor runs even better than it was before I couldn't have asked for a better mechanic. while waiting for the motor to be repaired I spoke to many locals who asked who was taking care of such a large job as potentially many things could go wrong and once I told him it was Godfrey they all agreed he was the best guy in town. while I wouldn't wish what happened to us on anybody at least I found Godfrey.

name: Covid PCR Test
description: Diagnofirm is a place to get a PCR test that seems to be the closest one next to Martin's drift border crossing. 850 Pula per test

name: Xanagas rest
description:
For cyclists in need of a safe place to stop for the night.
A church ran by Harvey and Dina.

name: Semowi Nature Farm
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.   

Semowi is ideally located between Maun and Moremi Game Reserve. We have two campsites with fireplace and access to common ablution area with hot water. We also have a main deck/restaurant/bar on the border of the Gomoti river where you can drink or eat. The campsites are $50.
To arrive at Semowi:
- Drive the Maun-shorobe-Moremi road
- Turn left at Mochaba Crossing
- Cross the bridge(s). About 800m after the bridge, you will find a sign, turn right.
- Follow the road 3-4km.
- After the concrete bridge, drive 1km and you will see a pink house on your right. The gate is right there.
- Honk the horn when you arrive.

name: Gas Refill 5kg and bigger
description:
5kg and bigger gas bottle refill. 3kg bottles at builders world in Kasangula up the road.
It's an old yellow trailer by the tyre shop

name: Builders World Gas/Propane
description: The only place around to fill 3kg gas bottle.  not to cheap. 135P for 3kg.

name: Food Stand. 25P Lunch
description:
Small food stand next to car wash selling beef stew with pap and chakalaka 25P.
also has simple sandwiches for 5P.
Pretty tasty.

name: Pannel Beater / Mechanic
description: Yard on the corner full of parts cars, alot of BMW. Mechanics as we as pannel beaters. Came here to get a dent fixed as well as all the scratches removed from our rental vehicle after going through the bushy Kalahari. Vehicle looked good after. Prices seemed reasonable. Not sure if the place has a name. Friendly:)

name: Bush camp at marketing wood road
description: As this is off the main road towards Matswere, traffic noise is muted. Turn off the sign that says marketing and wood, and right along the road on the left is a flat sandy clearing we used to camp. Zero people passed.

name: Viking gas for propane
description: 115 pula for 3 kg. They do not fill half bottles, all or nothing. GFS gas does not seem to exist, we could not find it, asked around and was directed here.

name: Bush camp further from highway
description: The reviews of other place and location looked too close to the highway, so we took this side road on maps me to come here. It’s just camping on the side of a not frequently used road. Only 1 cattle car passed in the evening and none in morning. Weak 4g mascom signal. Good for a night before border crossing without a big detour

name: Botswana Footprints Travel Agent Office
description:
This is the office of Botswana Footprints. They were able to help with the reservations for the parks, Kalahari, Chobe, Makgadigadi, Maremi... They do charge 550 P for the service (independent of number of people and length of trip), but trying to organize a route through all the parks with the limited availability and that many different agencies involved (park service, bigfoot, other private camps), we found it quite helpful.
Phone number 680 0745

name: Toyota Halfway dealer and service
description: One of my better experiences with Toyota dealerships worldwide. They were able to order a replacement part (bellhousing dust cover) for a Tacoma (US made only) within a week. When they entered my VIN, they actually could access all the schematics and parts for my vehicle whereas several other places it just didn't show anything.

name: Khwai River Village
description: The public water tap, ask nicely and you're allowed to top up.

name: No entry to the south - private land
description: Sign for the CT11 properly leased area. Sign says “no through road, no camping, no hunting or shooting.  Please respect our privacy, trespassers will be prosecuted”

name: Xirexara entrance gate to MPNP
description: Eastern entrance gate to Makgadigadi Pans National Park. Entry permits are NOT available here, you must obtain ahead of time.  Roads in this part of the park were in very good condition when we visited.

name: Kasane Health Point
description:
Free Covid vaccine on the spot!
To receive the official Vaccination Certificate (with QR code) you need to go to Kazungula Weight Bridge Health Point (at the weight bridge!)

name: Somewhere in the bush before Savuti
description: In The bush, no far from the road. High grass, ground ok. Nobody could see us. Very quiet night. One elephant passed not far from us. Two cars on the road when it was dark. Nobody else. A place just to help if you are too late for driving during the night.

name: Moae campsites
description: Campsite in the bush. 150 for the pitch . Ablution block with flush toilet and shower. 2 tented rooms for 2 with shower and flush toilet 350 P and 2 tented rooms with bathroom and washing area for 450 P. Nice place. 20 km from Kachikau and 42 km from Ghoha gate Savuti. Great place very quiet. Animals around.

name: Standard bank
description: Standard bank ATM. Very quiet and managed to get cash

name: FNB atm
description: FNB ATM to draw cash. This one was very quiet compared to the others we found

name: Chobe Crocodile Farm
description:
An excellent and well run attraction. Extremely educational visit learning everything about the importance of crocodiles in the ecosystem. They have baby crocodiles you can hold, through to very large specimens. Set in lovely gardens. Owner Sue is passionate about the environment.  Open for entry from 08-12h and 14-16h daily. Tours last about 90mins. Adults: BWP 50 for locals / BWP 100 for foreigners; 6-12 years BWP 10 gor locals/ BWP 40 for foreigners; under 5 free. 
Highly recommended.

name: Auto Take Panel Beaters
description:
I was sent here by the local genuine Toyota dealership in town. While reversing I hit a tree and the rear door was a bit bend. Toyota doesn’t do accident repairs. 

The guys at Auto Take fixed my damage in 45mins!

name: Kalahari Tours & Transfers
description: They offer a range of tours.  We shopped around and they offer transport to Victoria Falls for USD 42 pp (children half price). Most lodges charge at least double this amount.

name: Orange river mouth
description: A fallen over giant yellow picture frame plus so many birds at the sand bank on the edge. Pelicans, flamingoes, cape cormarant, etc. you can also drive down if you air down otherwise this is the spot to park. Also an estuary with lots of birds right here

name: Islands Avenue Inn
description: Nice small Guesthouse with clean and well equiped rooms. Double room is 450p. They also do laundry for 50p. No restaurant at site but there is a good one next to the Shell filling station called Palm Grove.

name: Shopright
description: Regular Shopright supermarket.  Moderately well stocked, we had to go to spar to get the last few things.

name: ATM at Chopies commercial center
description: ATM and Chopies Supermarket. You can find here all the proviants you will need for the bush.

name: Khwai shop
description: A little shop to stock up on essentials. Quite expensive so only if you’re desperate I would say. Got bread, eggs, chips, biscuits, tea, meat, juices and lots more

name: Khwai hippo pool
description: Nice little spot just off the road that leads to a hippo pool. We stopped for some lunch and was undisturbed and really enjoyed it

name: Paje river camp
description:
Great little spot.
200p for two and our rig.
Clean ablutions and a friendly host.

name: Local car mechanic, good price
description:
His name is Molepa and he was recommended to us by the guard at our camp site. He came to our hotel to check our problem out (tie rod end got loose), got the part for us and fixed it in his backyard workshop. Lovely guy and did a good job for a good price! 

You can reach him at (+267) 77856558

name: Mokolodi nature reserve
description:
Nice looking park close to gaborone.
Possible to bicycle here if you're two people and have helmets. 180P per person

name: Ruins
description: Correct place of the platform just beside of the ruins. Path leading up here from the main road is hard to find but you can see the platform from the distance already.

name: engen station
description:
engen Station, express mart and liquor. 
on the big road

name: Puma Station
description: Puma Petrol Station, just a few meters from the Engen Station

name: School
description: Nice place where you can pitch your tent. Very welcoming people. One teacher offered me to sleep in her garden (teachers' houses are next to the school). They also gave me the wifi password. As I came on Friday, I finally slept in a classroom. Toilets are available.

name: Road to/from Sua Pan Wildcamping
description: We came from the south and drove through Sowa to the Pan for a Wildcamp. From there we didn't wanted to drive all the way back so we took this sandy dirt road all along a fence and ended here to come back to the main road. The dirt track was in a good condition during this time of the year. Could change during rain!

name: Nguma Island Lodge
description: Wonderful place along the Okavango Delta. A perfect place when you drive from Mohembo border or Maun to Namibia. 5 huge campsites and 20 tents. Very nice bar and restaurant with free wifi. Very friendly owners. A must stay in Botswana. Boat trip and Mokoro trip available in a stunnning environment

name: Parking for Mmakama Ruins
description: Walking from the road follow the sandy path to the village. Keep going and the path curves around to the right. Turn right at the signpost and the track bears left and brings you around the back of the hill to the parking. From here follow the steep track up to the ruins and the viewing platform.

name: Hike to Gorge
description: End of vehicle track, pinic spot, future campsite and start of hike to the gorge

name: Motopi Laundry Services
description: Dry cleaner and laundry. Cold wash only. P25/kg weighed on scales.

name: Bonita Cafe
description: A very nice cafe serving burgers, ribs, fried chicken and good coffees. Lovely eating area in a garden. Reasonable prices. Good parking, but up an alley. Nice toilets. European vibe.

name: Polentswa Lodge
description:
This is the place of the former Polentswa Lodge. It burned down years ago and is currently abandoned. Only one tent is still standing the rest looks like a scrap yard.

They allow you to camp here though! All the other campsites nearby were fully booked hence be payed a hefty
1000 Pula/Night for 2 Persons to get the allowance to camp here. If you use the veranda of the remaining tent you have a beautiful view over the pan. Contact the Polentswa Lodge if you want to camp here. We wouldn’t do it again for the above mentioned price.

name: The Canvas Zone
description:
This is a little stitching factory where they make all kinds of canvas things like safari tents, covers for car seats, rooftop tents, etc. They are very well skilled and helped us immediately with repairing the cover of our rooftop tent. They know what they do and have most canvas types & colors on stock.
Charged us 100Pula to stitch 3 patches of canvas (1 hour of work). Highly recommended.

name: Elephants Pool
description:
Nice and quiet wild camp close to a pool where animals come. We have just seen some elephants in the evening. Under a camelthorn tree and well hidden from the road by a small mopanes woodland. Zero traffic on the road in night.
Caution, can be muddy in the rain season.

name: Savemore Supermarket
description: A new small supermarket (open for just two weeks on our visit) selling some fruit and veg, a good selection of good meat, including game. Dry goods, sauces,bread etc and soft drinks.

name: little groceries shop
description: Cute little grocery store with basic things like soda, pasta and bread. There is not much else on the road between Gweta and Maun so this is a nice stopover.

name: small restaurant and shop
description: small restaurant and shop. friendly staff. perfect stop between Maun and Sehitwa there is nothing else on the road.

name: Okavango view
description:
This is a wonderful quite place right in front of the Okavango. We parked our truck just some meters away from the river. You can hear the sound of nature during night.
The way to the spot is sandy so 4x4 required. It’s maybe impossible to reach this spot during flood season.

name: Hilary's
description: Not far from Main airport. Very nice restaurant owned by Hilary. Home made food. A lot to eat with only one dish. Very friendly. Shady sheltered terrace. 80 to 98 Pula's for one course. Open Monday to Friday for breakfast and lunch 8am to 4 pm. Resting pleasant place to be recommended.

name: open door exchange office
description: next to Wimpy. today they had only 130$ available.

name: Spar Supermarket and strip mall, FNB ATM
description: Small strip mall with Spar, cell stores, pharmacy, Pep, bank etc

name: bright futures
description:
all suspension repairs for all makes and other mechanical works.
71298409, 72930299

name: Elephant Valley Game Lodge
description:
Terrible! 
Campsites are in the valley. Dirty, unkempt. Ablutions have no water, power or running water. 
Don’t bother coming here.

name: Great mechanic
description:
Hermanus D Jansen was recommended by friends in Gaborone as the best local mechanic here.
Nice guy, nice team, basic facilities outside his house, but they know their stuff. Welded up a crack in my axle casing, plus shock mount, and roof rack. Used to rescuing people from the parks when they are broken down (the park staff also recommended him).
Paid 1500p for a full days labour from 4 of them, plus costs of red oxide paint and welding rods. Nice experience and good quality work. 
Call ahead, follow the sandy tracks towards all of the vehicles lying around.

Phone 75002464

name: Chedu Gas
description:
Small local entreprise where you can fill your gasbottle. The location is behind a small shopping centre, turn right at the Wenzi Hairsaloon en then right again. 

weekdays open from 8.00-19.00
weekends open from 8.30-18.00

1.4 kilogram for 50 Pula

name: Karera Beach Hotel
description: Garded and fenced yard next to proprietary postcard sand beach with palms.  We got the key of one of the bungalows for shower and toilet. Nice staff. We had a quick look at Saga beach,  but we didn't like it. It was dirty,  crowded and more expensive. .

name: Auberge Mgr Nterere
description: Auberge with restaurant, they let me stay and sleep in my rooftent. Price 10.000 francs, key from room but shower with bucket cold water

name: National Museum of Gitega
description: Small museum with random pieces from ancient years and things from the eary 20th century. Museum guard was asleep when we arrived. Costs 7000fr pp but i dont think that's the correct price. Guard also organised some banana-beer to try but eventually drank it himself. Not sure if this is worth a visit.

name: Tamotel
description: Nice Hotel outside of Gitega. They let us camp with rooftop tent in their garden for 5$ total. They offered toilet and shower.

name: Karera Falls
description:
Price is 20usd or 40,000bfr per person. I asked about camping and the guy selling tickets said no at first because there is no security.. I eventually made him agree and walked all around the nice falls. It's a nice spot and camping would be great but the longer I stayed the more and more people showed up to stare. Maybe it would have been fine overnight, but I didn't like the vibe, so I left without camping. 
I had asked about this "alimane" place which I think is a gorge or canyon..guy said same price to go there, but on the way out he tried to negotiate, say I g only 30,000bfr. I didn't go, still not certain what it is exactly. but there was a sign to it fro. the paved road and in the little village where you buy a ticket for the falls.

name: Hotel Umuco and Restaurant
description:
Hotel with adjoining big restaurant. 15,000bfr for a good rooms with hot shower. 10,000bfr for a just good enough room with cold shower. Both have flush toilet and mozzie net. Parking in good fenced compound. I asked about camping on car, but guy was really unsure and would have to ask manager, so I just got a room.
Perfectly adequate, nothing special.

name: Motel Au Coin De la Pyramide
description:
Big and once fancy hotel, owned or built by the ex President.
Decent room for 15,000bfr, nothing cheaper. A bit run down. cold showers not working for me so bucket shower.
Big courtyard for parking, too hard to ask if I could camp with my bad French.

name: Source du Nil
description: Burundi's claim to the source of the Nile River. Pyramid marking spot you can see for free. Actual source behind locked gate, guide wanted 5000each, we negotiated to 10000 for 4 people. Actual source not really worth it.

name: Crystal Motel
description: Good enough motel in city center. Walk to everything. Good secure parking lot with guard. 20,000bfr for big room, 15,000bfr for small room.

name: Palm beach hotel
description: Very nice large hotel right on lake t. 15,000bfr for nice room, have more expensive options. Really clean and New, everything works. Place goes right down to lake where you can swim (a bit rocky, but nice). Good guarded parking, didn't ask about camping in parking lot.

name: Muhweza Hotsprings
description:
Easily the best natural hotspring I have been to in Africa. Extremely beautiful setting on side of small river with trees and green grass. NO trash, plastic or glass. Natural pool is perfect soaking temperature. Men's pool is on right with green grass, ladies to the left.
A few friendly locals using hot pools.
I think you could camp here, but I didn't. I still don't feel good about wild camping in Burundi with the staring and begging

name: Mugara Hotspring
description:
Developed hotspring in the mountains. 10,000bfr per person. Very big tiled hot pool, small cold tub and small hot tub. Lots of hot water pouring from mountainside. Perfect on a cold rainy October day. Would be too hot I think on a hot day. They had just finished cleaning and were refilling pools at 10am, quiet time to visit. More people by 1pm, extremely friendly.
They are building a 'resort' on-site, will have hotel rooms when done. Place reminds me a lot of hot pools in Baños, Ecuador.
It's right next to town, no chance to wild camp here.

name: Maison Sifa
description: Hotel Maison Sifa is a great place! The rooms are as the should be up to western standard! Everything Wirkung, nice, neat and clean. 40 € for two is a very fair price.

name: Visa Extension
description:
Here you can have your visa extended.

As of November 2018, for extension of a transit visa :
- Bring your passport + photocopy of main page and entry stamp (you can do photocopies on site) + passport photo was not necessary, but better to have one just in case.
- You will also need the receipt of your visa payment if you got it on arrival. As mine was issued from the embassy in Kigali I didn't need to show it (and I actually don't have any...).
- Fill the form.
- 5 more days cost 10$, 10 days 20$, 15 days 30$ and so on. One month is 70$ or 90$ for multiple entries.
- Go to the Emmaus building 3 blocks away for payment. Long but well organized lines.
- Go back to the PAFE building where you started, ping-pong through 4-5 different offices and get out with your new stamp !

All together it took me one hour and a half for the whole process, starting at 8am.

name: No petrol / changing money
description: Pay attention in Burundi it's difficult to find gas at the petrol station! So it's better you enter here with your full tank. Another tip: the black market it is much better to change money, the rate is 30% better than the official one

name: Waka waka
description:
Amazing pizza. Burgers were good too.
Quite expensive but worth it.
Also has a Deli selling meat, cheeses, and even Lurpax butter. Again quite expensive.

name: Burundi Border
description: Very easy border. I was coming from Rwanda. They just check my passport. About my motorbike, they didn't ask anything. No registration, no carnet de Passaige. It was good: no police on the road ask me anything about my motorbike, the same to exit and coming back to Rwanda. Last: people in Burundi are very nice, it's a poor country, like to be again in west africa. Don't talk about politic and never take pictures to police man or some places (airport, police stations etc), and everything will be good. Sometimes police ask you for a tip, for a coke, I never paid, always smile. Ciao

name: Family lodge
description:
Very simple basic blue rooms, with toilet, shower, mosquito net for 10,000f. We slept in our camper in their secure  car park for 5,000f. They gave us a key and let us use a room for the toilet and shower. 

The whole province had no power so we could only have a cold bucket showers. 
Super friendly staff, speaks a little English. Helped us change some US$ (as there are no ATMs here, other than in the Bujumbura) We cooked dinner and shared it with him. He was excited to try some western food. 
Overall quite pleasant and safe.

name: Tourista restaurant.
description:
Simple food. 
We had 1 x rice and vegetables and another vegetables and chips. 
The chips were so good, they were more like roast potatoes and had sauce too. 
For 2 meals it was 4,000bfs

name: Hotel Phoenicia
description:
Double room with bathroom 10,000bfs.
Cold water only. 
Quite noisy till about 10/11pm with cars and people as there is an on-site restaurant and bar.
Reasonably clean, staff with little English, secure parking. 
Does the job for 1 night.

name: Genys Beach
description:
Super friendly owner, 
it’s a beach restaurant/bar, but she let us stay in the secure car park for free. 
We just had to buy some food or drinks. 
Downside- The bar next door played music till pretty late and there’s no showers here.
Unless you want to party, wouldn’t  recommend staying here at the weekend as this road is full of restaurant/bars.

name: ATM
description: One of the only ATMs we found that accepted our MasterCard.

name: Peace Lodge
description:
nice huge Hotel with secure parking.  prices for clean large rooms starts from 15000 to 35000 (like a suite) for 2 person.
they have a menu and also Pizza available.
As it is not in center, nights are peaceful
Entrance gate is only about 3+m high. so if you car is higher it has to park outside.
very friendly English speaking stuff.

name: Hotel de l'Amitié
description:
Clean room with double bed and bathroom. Hot water and Wifi.
Rooms 40.000 or 50.000 with breakfast.
Visited many hotels in downtown area and this wasn't the cheapest but at least clean and good mosquito nets on windows. Also a helpful fella Oscar working here speaks good English and can help with changing money on black market (which just recently became highly illegal).

name: Maison de Passage Fondation San Philipo Neri
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Place has not been verified by an overlander

Hotel owned by the San Philipo Neri Foundation, founded by Italian priests. Situated in the lively neighbourhood of Kamenge. Way more interesting and affordable in comparison to the town centre. Rooms are simple but very clean and qualitative to the usual standards here. Prices start at 15 000 FBu pp pn for a room with a single bed. There is a restaurant next door also owned by the foundation. Profits go straight to the foundation that does charitable works in the neighbourhood.

name: Camel Hotel
description: 30,000 per night for a very nice room. Clean and smart hotel. Some English speaking staff. Perhaps the cheapest and highest quality hotel in Bujumbura. Food is expensive here. But right out on the street it is chill enough to find local food. Not so crazy outside as Hotel L’Amitie … although that hotel has the money changers and clubs and good restaurants and consulates next door. Parking is on the street. Peaceful enough neighborhood with security out front all night.

name: Rwanda Consulate
description: Rwanda embassy. Quite helpful. Appears the border between Rwanda and Burundi just opened.

name: Gatumba / Uvira Border crossing
description:
Crossing from Burundi to Congo.
Mask required but not used. Easy checkout of Burundi. No PCR or Vaccine requirements. Lots of officers asking for money. Denied them politely. No bribes paid. No guide needed. Better sometimes if you don’t speak the language.

name: Hilltop Camp
description:
All four official campsite in Ruvunbu NP are not suitable for RTTs. So the rangers showed me that abandoned picnic spot. No facilities only two bandas which give nice shade. Stunning views to the nationalpark. It’s completely quit, no people around. In the morning you can drive down to the river to see hippos, buffaloes and waterbucks. 

Camping is 4,- USD, park entrance 9,- USD.

name: Favina Home
description:
Found that spot on Google and went there to asked if I can stay for a night. Actually it’s a restaurant. There’s a big level parking with two bandas where you can park your car. Fabien the owner was very friendly and helpful and allowed me to stay. Payed $ 10,- to support their growing business. Also helped me finding some petrol on a reasonable price. 

The restaurant is very good, prices are reasonable. The staff is wonderful, great hospitality. I can really recommend that place.

name: Kingfisher Petrol Station
description: Your best bet for fuel in and around Gitega. Al Karim the indian owner was very helpful. I could pass the long queue and could pay in USD which is normally not allowed. Standard fuel Price, I saved 60% compared to the black market.

name: Indian Supermarket
description: Good supermarket to stock up. They change also Dollars to Franc. Karim owns also the Kingfisher Petrol Station outside town

name: Auberge de Kayanza
description:
Nice place for a night before or after visiting Kibira Nationalpark. They allowed me to camp in their yard, used shower and toilets of the hotel. Restaurant available but I cooked my own meal. Very friendly welcoming people, who have never seen a RTT. They only speak French and Kirundi. 

The night was quite, even if it was in town. Payed 20.000,- Franc including a big beer. As I was the first one to camp, there’s no price for it, but I thought that’s an okay price.

name: Atlantis Mart Supermarket
description: Decent supermarket with fruits and veggies, also good fresh meat. Good place to stock up

name: Le Bar Royale
description:
Found that awesome place directly at the beach of Lake Tanganyika. It’s a bar/restaurant with a big beautiful garden, a little paradise south of Bujumbura. 

Charles, the owner, kindly allowed me to stay at the beach. You can cook your own food or use the restaurant. Basic toilets are there as well. Otherwise no facilities but they are constantly working to make improvements.

The whole team was amazing, great hospitality! If you need something - the try to organize it for you. If you are traveling Burundi that’s a place to be

name: Abandoned restaurant on the side of the lake
description: Really good wildcamping spot. You can take a swim on the lake and put your tent under a roof. And there is no people! (which is unbelievable here in Burundi)

name: Interbank Burundi
description:
Here you can get USD with a Visa card, fees are 4% and 40 USD. Perfect if you wanna use the black market exchange rate. 
Go to second floor and the door Bureau de Change

name: Urban Lodge
description: Nice European standard hotel with hot showers, AC and breakfast included. Secure parking. Situated on a quiet street in Bujumbura. Owner Valery speaks English and can help you with suggestions of Bujumbura/Burundi, exchanging money on the black market, petrol and so on. $50 for a double room. A lot more expensive then other options but the value for money is still good

name: Ministere de l’intereur
description:
This is the office of home affairs. You should I theory be able to get permission to exit the border and enter Rwanda. Bring a copy of your request for permission to cross the border, copy of your passports and copy of car documents. 
Head to the top floor to speak with Chief Secretary and he can help you with the request. Then it is a waiting game.

name: PAFE immigration authority
description:
So after you’ve received your written and signed request for leaving the country through the closed border you have to come here with your letter. They will take your letter and want a copy of your passport to process the request. We left our papers and were told to come back in two hours to pick up the permission. 
It seems like the minister is signing permissions at the end of the day. So even though the said two hours, it took just over 3 and they were handing out all the permissions to everyone at the same time. We got approved, so we can leave via the Rwanda-border

name: Gishora Drum Sanctuary
description: This is the Burundi drum sanctuary. We shoved up on Sunday just after 2 pm and got lucky as a tour was just starting. Negotiated the price down to 50000 franc pp. It is a very nice experience. Takes around two hours in total

name: Presbyterian Church Centre
description: Camping in green grounds under trees on a hill right in Bamenda, they open a room for you to have access to ablutions, 4500CFA/night (6,86€) for two people

name: Ekom Falls
description: Camping very close to the beautiful waterfall, no facilities but nice cleared area, Negotiate at the gate for the price, no security needed, ignore all further demands for money at the falls themselves, bit of a hassle in the beginning but still absolutely worthwhile!

name: Seme Beach Hotel
description: Large resort with friendly staff, private volcanic beach, brilliant natural cold spring, only beach showers, free (slow) wifi, camping at the beach car park, 5000CFA/night (7,62€) for two people

name: Tara Plage Hotel
description: Camping directly at beautiful beach, good restaurant, friendly staff, ask for them to open a room for showers and toilets and ignore the workers ablution block, 5000CFA/night (7,62€) for two people

name: Hotel Ilomba
description: Camping on nice beach, very close to waterfalls, good ablutions, friendly staff. We were allowed to stay for free on their beach and just pay for whatever we consumed at the bar/restaurant but there is no guarantee that they will always allow camping.

name: Savannah Botanical Gardens
description: You can camp on nice lawn in the botanical gardens but have to negotiate a price. 5.000 CFA for camping (car and two People).

name: Lake Nyos
description: You can camp on a concreted area overlooking the lake. Just talk to the friendly soldiers and give them a copy of your passport. Note that the lake is known to be the deadliest one in the world due to an incident of a bubble of CO² erupting from it and killing around 1700 people in 1986. Nowadays the pressure is being released regularly but researchers and the military are still stationed here.

name: Cameroon Gabon border
description: If you are arriving after the border has closed talk to the officials and they will point you to a large tarmac area where you can set up camp.

name: Bush camp rubber plantation
description: A good place to stay for a night as there are no villages around only large plantations.

name: Customs Cameroon
description: Get your carnet stamps here.

name: Presbyterian Guest House
description: Camping in the quiet green garden of the guesthouse. Access to shower and toilet of the guesthouse till 20 hours. Dirty outside toilet. Close to Congolese, Gabonese and DR Congo embassies. On Sunday evening a French expat drink with campfire is organized

name: La Maison Catholique
description: Safe place to stay. No facilities. Just need permission of the priest.

name: Miramar Hotel, Limbe, Cameroon
description: 5000 CFA to camp for 2 people. Camped next to the pool. It's a pretty spot on the waterfront with restaurant & bar. Use of the restaurant toilets & we were able to use a shower in a vacant rondavel. Free WiFi also available. Liza & Jason

name: Azi Motel
description: Expensive and busy hotel, 15000CFA (£18) per room. There are rooms at 5000CFA (£6) per night, but they were all taken. Worth the money as rooms are comfortable, just make sure fan and A/C are working. We had to go to reception to get our water turned on.

name: Cameroon Border Auberge
description: Pink building with no signs. Offered rooms with shower only, no toilets. When he showed us the rooms, they looked uncleaned, however he did change the sheets later. We opted for a room to use the shower and camped outside. A room cost 3000CFA (£3.50).

name: Cameroon Border
description: Passports and vehicle carnet stamped. No corruption

name: Presbyterian Mission
description: Hilly campsite next to guest house. 1500 cfa pppn. Good spot for the night before hiking Mount Cameroon. 10mins from Tourist Centre for Moilunt Cameroon. We left car here too.

name: WWF tourist centre Campo
description:
5000 CFA pp for park entry per day (not per 24 hrs). Need a guide 5000 CFA per day and a guard 5000 CFA per day. Car 2000 CFA Camera 2000 CFA. If no space in car the guard and guide will go on a motorbike but they didn't have one at the time so would have charged 10000 CFA. No campsites in the park.  Was too pricey for us so not sure if it is worth it or not. 

in these NP are Gorillas so it should be possible to see them with a bit of luck. entrance 5000 pp pd car 2000 pd photo 2000 pd guide 5000 pd necessary armed security guy 5000 pd necessary . ...no idea what else they charge for! so prices climbes up and as you need 2 days for a gorilla maybe watch what means doubles the price we decided not to go in.

name: Queens Hotel
description: Large basic hotel. 5000CFA for a double room. Nice sitting room on first floor with comfortable couches, serving cold beers

name: Confluence hotel
description:
10000 great spot on river

Place is a bit run down but the rooms are okay and have AC (but only working when there's electricity), bucket shower. Good food (but check the menu and your bill). 10000 CFA.

Currently no internet in the Anglophone part of the country.

name: Hotel Dumonde
description: Nice, clean, secure, quiet hotel, secure parking, double room 12000/fan, 15000/aircon, close to town centre and shops, but still quiet, total petrol station 100m away open 6-22 has snacks, yoghurt, drinks, coffee machine... great for 6am coffee before you hit the border :-)

name: Ķimi Village
description: we asked in this small village to sleep. Very friendly people here so it was no problem for them.

name: wild camp in the mountains
description:
Very nice place on a small track to a village. No traffic here so no worry about it. Very friendly people here and an awesome scene.
you are at 1150m so temperature is tropping down in the night.

name: wild camp
description: you can sleep here very quite. Some friendly people living here. So ask them an say who you are. Only some km from here is the biggest tea plantage you can visit and have a free tour

name: Coffee Shop next to the Cathedral
description:
Amazingly cosy place on the rugged ring road. Fresh coffee (not nescafe), good food, even homemade pizzas with cheese made on the location.

Owner is Edwin, reachable at 676038698. Don't hesitate to call him for any up to date info on the ring road, what to visit or road conditions. This guy is the king of Kumbo and knows everyone.

Oh and if you want to eat, call ahead... 1-2 hour wait generally for food.

name: wild camp at a flat field
description:
nice camp spot at a huge flat field near a farmers house. Very friendly people. 
A friendly Policeman came in the evening and just checked the passport.

name: camp at monastrie
description:
beautiful place to camp with shower and toilet 
They also offer nice rooms and breakfast /dinner
They have a small shop where you can buy honey,coffee, jam ......Al made by there own!
wonderfull peasefull place to relax

name: Hotel Altitel
description: Paved backyard of the hotel, calm and clean facilities. We paid 5000 cfa after negotiation. Good place for a maintenance day.

name: Manjuwele Lodge
description:
Manjuwele Lodge, +237 655748104
owner Svend and Edwige Norgaard
A absolute highlight in Cameroon. New building, tasteful decorated, stunning, good european standard, relaxed, very delicious food, neat&clean!, 45.000CFA for the first 2 days, then 40.000CFA, incl breakfast. 
Martin&Christin

name: German Seamans Mission
description:
Deutsche Seemanns Mission/Seamans mission.
Nice clean hotel, DR 27.000CFA. Camping is possible in the Car Park.

name: Lake  Benakuma
description:
Nice place near the lake on a Privat ground and a house that they stopped to built.
Army came for checking passports and waste our time. They also asked for a permition of tourist dep. as often happens here in this area. At least no problem to sleep here but you have to deal with a lot of people before.

name: wild camp near a house in ISAIBEHSI
description:
Very friendly family near this place.
This seems one of the rare places in this area where you can sleep on a flat ground in the car.
After a while all people of the village came to say hello. But all of them where friendly and respectfull. No bagging!

name: camp at presscraft areal
description:
Very nice and quite place for us under a huge tree. 
Beautiful place to stay and the workers (special Muses) are extremely friendly.
Of course sometimes it is a bit noisy because they work here. But we enjoyed it and all keep you alone. 
The place is founded by Germans 100 years ago. You can see a lot of woodcraft workers here doing their job. Also to buy some of it is possible.
Better here than at a shop😉

name: wild camp in a quarry
description:
nice place to sleep in this small quarry.
no one can see you from the road.

name: Botanic Garden
description:
1000cfa pp
nice garden with a lot of exotic trees. starts to run down what is a shame.
maybe you also camp at the parking lot. just ask😉 the guy is very friendly.

name: mile 6 beach
description:
nice black beach. Lots of people here on weekend. But in night you are alone
1000 cfa pp to camp here. Negotiate if they want more. There is also a security guy here.
showers and toilets are run down and dirty

name: Leaf spring fabric and reperation
description:
if you have problems with your suspension go here. very friendly employees and owner.
He comes from Spain. you can overhaul or get a complete new leaf spring packet here cheap.
also parabolic leafs!
see pic for company sticker

name: pharmacy
description: they speak german, English and French and they have a good  stock

name: Schimpanse Camp near Marienberg
description:
lovely place to stay. Some Schimpanse around and they are used in human so you can play with them. Lovely to do even it is not in their Natur behaviour..
They charge 15000 cfa pp pd plus a big bag of fruits to have a visit here incl. camping
Lotds of money but they take it for the monkey research. 
You can also go with the shimps into the forest what I highly recommend! It was one of the highlights on our tour up to now to hang around and play with them. They are so cute and funny😃

name: Gas filling
description: They have adapters for CADAC

name: SIL Societe de International de Linguistice
description:
Accommodation 18.000 CFA/DR
They have washing machines.
Nice quiet place

name: Auberge, Lolodorf
description: 4500 cfa for a very simple double room, camping possibly allowed for 2000.

name: Grand Bazar du Lac
description: After negotiation we camped for 3000 cfa on the courtyard of the hotel. Opened a room for shower. Its restaurant was expensive / not a very good value for money. A bit noisy.

name: garage polyvalent junior
description:
Usual simple garage with limited tools. 
Monsieur Norbert is quite effective getting second hand parts for Toyotas.

name: Turtle watching Ebodji
description:
here is a small asic eco base where you can stay for overnight.
A very basic museum is also near to here. 
We paid 2000cfa pp for the museum  including a free camping at the beach.
Turtle Saison is Okt to April so this is the time to come here
You also can take a guide for 6000cfa and look for turtles at the beach in the night.

name: Eco Lodge
description:
As the new build lodge is not used anymore and still run down we camped here for free 😉 after asking the neighbour and he said it is no problem.
