Showers and toilets are not usable but you can stand direktly  at the beach under shady trees with a nice view over the sea/river to  Äquatorial Guinea.

name: wild camp in rainforest
description:
perfect place to stay over night in this area. 
It is a hidden free place (10x10m) between huge trees. Beautiful view into forest and you get a bit fresh air here also

name: Bishop House Hotel
description:
It's the Bishop House, but they have a Hotel and even dormitories, so in the 8 people rooms you can stay for 3000 CFA per person and night. Double Room with Fan 10.000 CFA.

Good showers and toilets.

Quite good restaurant, but maybe a little bit expensive.

name: Chutes de la Lobé
description:
Very nice place. Its a river which end in the sea through a waterfall.

the canoo for the trip 500CFA max.

Eating there 30 Shrimps with frites and plantines 5000CFA.

There is no need of guide even if they will offer you and ask you for 10.000.

name: Gabon Embassy
description: Straight forward visa. 70,000 cfa for express visa (collect same day at 17:30) or 50,000 cfa ordinary. Pleasant staff but wear long pants and shirt with sleeves. You need 1 passport photo and copies of hotel booking in Gabon, passport, Cameroon visa, travel insurance, vehicle document, yellow fever vaccination. There is a photocopier on the street outside.

name: Hotel Laginaque
description:
Nice hotel if you are visa shopping in Yaounde. 15,000 cfa/night without air conditioning. 30,000 cfa/night with a/c. We went without and we're fine. Mosquito net over the bed. TV but only a few channels. Very close to shops, restaurants and embassies. Fast internet when power is on. Secure parking. Interesting owner, very rule based but speaks English and French. Reasonable mechanic just meters away but best you watch everything they do. Friend locals all around and the service station on the corner has good coffee and very friendly staff.

Highly recommended.

name: Centre Touristique de Nkolandom
description: A bit pricy, simple room for 18000 but it's a nice place if you want to take a break from roadtripping. Very large premises with swimming pool, restaurant, lake, paths to stroll, caves, an African art museum etc. A bit bizarre but nice and fairly quiet.

name: Malabo Palace Hotel
description:
Affordable sleeping option in Kribi, next to a supermarket, walking distance to fish market and Marina. 20000 CFA for an AC room.
Parking.

name: Hotel Sispen
description: Small basic hotel at 6000 cfa for a double room with shower and toilet. Friendly, easy going staff.

name: Auberge de la vallée
description:
Motel in Ndjolé. 8000 cfa for a double room with fan, which is still a bit overpriced for what you get. Separate showers with toilet that looked clean in the evening, but horrible in the morning. You can take a room for 2h so that says enough I think: a bit noisy 😁. But it does the job.

http://www.motomorgana.com

name: Lake Awing
description: Just to add the price, we ended up paying 3500 for the 2 of us camping and entrance to the lake, we camped under the roof of the restaurant they are building. When they will finish the work you might be able to camp next to the lake again as that's much more nice. He said all money goes to the Awing community but we doubt that a little as he didn't want his workers around when we negotiated the price..

name: Hotel mansfield
description: AC room, parking at back. centre of bamenda. paid 12k.

name: Mbouoh Star Palace
description: Nice hotel. Air con rooms, clean, hot showers. Advertised for 30k cfa, agreed 25k inc basic breakfast. I would not normally pay this much for accomodation, but I had malaria and typhoid a week ago so looking after myself a bit, plus it seems that you can spend 10 to 12k on places in Cameroon and find they're still a bit rubbish. reasonably priced patisserie is worth visiting whether staying or not. I recommend the friands.  secure parking underground.

name: Large bike mechanic
description: Helpful guy collecting and working on big bikes (owns a few classic Boxers), this is his home so not a shop. Ask for Mr. Marcel Abomo (tel. 668786807). He can find the right man for the job. The police in Ebolowa has four F800GS bikes themselves.

name: Pharmacy du Bercail
description: Well stocked pharmacy in the town centre of Ebolowa.

name: Corrupt Gendarmerie check.
description: Gendarmerie check. went through the day before on the way to Nyos with no problems, however on the way back the following day another person was on duty. he was extremely corrupt. Saw him take money off a few people and generally be rude to everyone else. he made up various reasons my papers weren't correct and wanted 25k cfa. spent 2 hours there being patient, before I just rode off.

name: Wild camping next to the road
description: Spot for wild camping, no people around it's under palm trees next to a abandoned house.

name: Tristar hotel
description: hotel with secure parking. no negotiating. room with fan 7.5k. Mosquito net provided.

name: Asta Hotel
description: Nice hotel on outskirts of yaounde. haggle 10k room for 7k. clean, big room with TV and fan. room is shaded all day so quite cool. hotel is behind tradex gas station. nearby junction has wide variety of food options.

name: N9 road to congo - very slippery
description:
paved road here turns to clay road until djoum. they are working to pave it but i suspect another year or 2 will be needed.

passed at beginning of wet season and there had been no rain for 24 + hours. no flooding of the road and generally easy hardpack riding. However, all the logging trucks compact the road and give it a 'shiny' surface inte dry, so when there is any amount of dampness, the top layer of clay is extremely slippery. I dropped the bike once going 15 km per hour, no braking, no Accelerating,  the back wheel just started the slide out on a slight downhill section. Road would be fine in dry, but any amount of rain will make it a challenge

name: Bruce Hotel
description: Handy to the border. 5,000 CFA per night for a double with private bathroom. Sit down toilet (no seat), ceiling fan, OK shower. Power only goes on from 7pm to 5am. Very dirty, rough and run down (we had water leaking through the roof). No towels. Parking is off the road but not secure.

name: Beach north of point noir
description: beatiful place right at the Beach. neverending sandbeach with nice waves.    spent 5 nights there.  bought fresh Fisch from locals. on the weekend People from the City are coming to relax at the Beach.  Restaurant close by, Otherwise you are all alone!

name: Lobeke NP
description:
Office of lobeke np. Could camp for free bevore and After the visit to the Park. 
the Park is one of the Best on our Trip.  saw a gorilla. spend one night IN the Park but you should do more if possible.
5000 pp/pd, 5000 guard/pd, 5000 ecpguard/pd, 2000 car/pd and 2000 each camera/pd
so in total not jeep

name: Quinick Scandinavia
description: Hotel with rooms from 15k to 45k negotiable (we paid 20k for a 25k room). Not too run down or dirty. Friendly staff. Power went off a lot in this town. Restaurant attached had cheap food and neither the pork chop or chicken was overcooked! Secure parking at night. Comfy bed.

name: Super U supermarket
description: HUGE, western style supermarket.  Fresh meat and produce and large housewares/general goods section. Also has a Fnac next door. There is parking but it is pretty tight so no good for large vehicles.

name: Limbe Wildlife Centre
description: An offshoot of Pandrillas (Afi mountain ranch in Nigeria). 3,000 CFA per person. They have gorillas, drills, chimps, baboons, a crocodile and a big snake. Also have a restaurant and gift shop.

name: Congo Embassy
description:
Two pictures with white background. 1 paper with photocopy of passport information, Cameroon visa and Cameroon entry stamp. 1 paper with yellow fever photocopy and name. Hotel reservation.
30.000 CFA 15 day and 50.000 CFA 30 days.
They say that 7 working days to make visa or 4 working days visa express (double price) but I did normal visa and just one day to make it.

name: Abraham Mechanic
description:
Good local motorcycle mechanic, specializes in bigger bikes. Has done work for english overlanders previously, has a few BMW's and Hondas lying around. Excellent choice for those that prefer paying local prices for work. 

Can source parts, equipment, and knows his stuff. 

Look for the big blue steel doors and roof, no sign.

name: Ndawara Mountain Camp I
description:
Bushcamp on 2.100 Meters with very nice Views on the Ndawara Tea Plantations and the whole Surrounding from Mount Oku (2nd highest Peak in Cameroon) until Lake Bamendjing. For us this was the most beautiful Camp around the Ring Road. Only some Shepherds on their Horses came by, no Problem at all. We asked the Security Guys from the Ndawara Tea Plantations below where we could spend the Night and they guided us up here for 2.000 CFA (the Money is for their Moto back to the Village). The Tea Guys have a Water Source for good and free Water down in their Village (at the Tea Factory).
Anja & Lukas.

name: Ndawara Mountain Camp II
description:
Another Camp on a Mountain above the Ndawara Tea Plantations. It's slighty higher than Camp I. The Views are not as nice as in the other Camp but you are completely alone up here. Camping directly above an old Crater that now is a natural Wet Land. Again just ask the Securities from the Tea Village, they will guide you up here. You only pay their Moto back to the Village. Free Water at the Tea Factory.
Anja & Lukas.

name: Ndawara Tea Plantations
description:
The Ndawara Tea Plantations are the biggest private Tea Plantations in the World. The Tea stretches above several Mountains and Hills making it an incredible beautiful Place to visit. They have their own little Tea Village up here that includes a Tea Factory, Ranch, Hospital, Mosque, Supermarket and so on. We spend two Days. On the first Day we explored the Plantations with our Land Cruiser and visited the Workers on the Fields. On the second Day we were given an extensive Introduction about how Tea is made an a Tour around the Tea Factory. They also gave us a Box full of Tea for free. You can sleep up above in the Mountains for free (see iOverlander Bushcamps). They also have free Water at the Factory. In the End you pay whatever you feel is okay. We gave 6.000 CFA for our Guides around the Plantations and Factory as well as the Box of Tea and another 5.000 CFA for a Security Guy for driving up in the Mountain Bushcamps with us and generally showing us around. It was a wonderful Experience.
Anja & Lukas.

name: Awafy Hotel
description:
Decent place to sleep when out on the ring road. Close to the Nkambe market which is quite an interesting place, with produce and cattle from all around. 

Cheapish rooms start at 5k all the way to 25k suites. Prices are negotiable. No AC, but you don't really need it up here. 

More importantly, secure parkinrg behind high walls, and a guard all night.

name: Eden Garden Hotel
description:
Clean basic hotel, off the main road from/to Lake Nyos. Indicated by a tiny sign, so watch out for it. Everyone knows the place so don't hesitate to ask. Somewhat hard to find. 

Basic, but very clean, and has a locked gate for secure parking. 

5000 CFA official price, negotiable, and eggs for the morning.

name: Mansfield Plaza Hotel
description:
3 star Hotel in Bamenda
37 rooms with AC in all rooms,bath tubs,hot water standby generator large parking behind,good restaurant,top security,free wifi,Free coffe.Pets friendly,Rooms with Double beds

name: Bafut Fon Palace
description:
The palace of the Fon (King) of Bafut. Includes a visit of the museum and palace grounds. One of the few museums that was actually worth it. 

4000 CFA pp, slightly negotiable. Got it at 6000 for two. 

We visited on the traditional sunday, (every 8 days, not following usual sundays), so we got to meet the Fon. 

Amazing tour by one of the queens of Bafut, Constance. She is reachable at 675406779. Available on the phone to plan visits, or check in when the traditional sunday will be to plan on when to come.

name: Total
description: Proper gas station where you can also buy motor oil.

name: Consulate of Nigeria
description:
Reported on 2019-12-14: Only resident is allow to apply for the Nigeria visa ! Tourist non resident cannot apply for it 
---
It should be possible to get a Nigerian visa over here. They told us it would take maybe 1 or 2 days. Don't know about the price, since we are driving southwards and don't need the visa anymore... Not possible only for resident only ! Went there today !

name: Mount Cameroon Trekking
description: Nice Team. In the End we did not climb the Mountain (One had a Cold, the other a swollen Foot and Weather was constantly bad). But we can recommend them anyway. After hard Negotiation we would have paid 230.000 CFA (350 Euro) for a 3 Day (2 Nights) Trip including: 1 Guide, 2 Porters, Food, Water, Park Entrance, 1 Tent and 2 Sleeping Mats. You can park your Car at the Presbyterian Guesthouse nearby. Maybe we will come back some day (not in the Rainy Season) and do it. Very friendly Guys.

name: Remache Auto Parts
description: Professional Dealer for new Car Parts. We got a new Toyota Land Cruiser Air Filter here. The Managing Director was very friendly and gave us a 50% Discount because we are Overlander. There is another Car Part Dealer 100 m down the Road.

name: Hotel le Confluent
description:
Basic hotel in Banyo (not much to choose from). Very basic, but has the luxury of secure parking behind locked gate. On the road out towards Tibati. No food unless you go into town, but that's 500m away. 

6000CFA official price, but negotiable. 

At time of visit, no running water because of work done on pipes. Should be back up soon. Private water castle thing so bucket showers are available.

name: Santa Barbara
description:
Basic side-of-the-road restaurant in Ngaoundal, on the road to Meiganga. 

Good food, good prices, open in the day during Ramadan. What else?

name: Ranch de Ngaoundaba
description:
Amazing old hunting ranch in northern Cameroon, about 40km away from Ngaoundéré. Was used by Valéry Giscard d'Estaing, French president in the '70s. 

Incredible history, has been around for 40+ years. Rooms, and huts are available for sleeping, but huge grounds allow camping if you have your equipment. 

Close to no network, this place is made for relaxation and nature. Cows, horses, chicken are everywhere, and there is a beautiful crater lake on the grounds, where you can go swimming. 

Rooms go from 20.000 CFA to 35.000 CFA, but are negotiable. Somewhat expensive, but absolutely worth it for the scenery. 

The food here is incredible. If you've been out in the bush for a while, this place will seem like paradise. Could not recommend enough.

name: DRCongo Embassy since 2017
description:
This is the new location of the embassy.

Dutch citizens.
We did not have time to arrange this visa in Benin(unfortunately, because it's alot cheaper there).

They asked us for;
- 2 photos
- 1 passport copy
- 1 hotelbooking

Ready the next day at 9AM.
CFA 100 000,- per person for a 30 day tourist visa.

Very easy.

name: Residence les champs Elisa
description:
Great hotel worth the money.
CFA 15 000,- for double room with kitchen(stove, microwave, fridge, cutlery), fan and private bathroom with towels.

Free WIFI, but wasn't working properly.
Can buy a phonecard with internet around the corner or ask one of the employees.

The hotel is a bit off the main road, manager doesn't speak English too well. Probably better to book via booking.com(but the address is incorrect) or leschampselisa@gmail.com 
T 673689375 and set a time.
The manager can pick you up at 'Santa Lucia Mvan supermarket' to lead the way.

It is not nearby the embassies but a nice hotel before the Gabon bordercrossing.

name: Santa Lucia Mvan Supermarket
description: Big supermarket with a large variety of food, snacks and alcohol. Bakery and fastfood also available.

name: DR Congo consulate
description: It is possible to get the visa for DRC here. 1 month single entree visa is 85.000 CFA. Shorter and transit visa is not possible. Processing time is 2 working days. Express visa is also possible for an additional of 20.000CFA

name: Motel le Kadey
description:
Decent hotel in Garoua-Boulaï if you're crossing into the Central African Republic. Not much reason to stop here otherwise. 

Secure parking, low walls but barbed wire and guard, on site restaurant. 

Official prices are 10.000 CFA for fan, 15.000 CFA for AC, but as always are negotiable.

name: Shankar mechanic
description: Learned from Abraham and is an electric specialist apparently. Lots of old bikes to pull parts from. Keep an eye on work as many people will have their hands in your engine but if you are in the south side of Yaoundé like we were when we broke down this is a great place to come.

name: Athena Hotel- Titi Garage
description:
All the things an overlander needs. Running water, electricity, secured compound with a gate to park the bikes, and clean enough. We paid 8000cfa but a local biker friend negotiated that for us before they saw we were white. 
Great live music walking distance down the road at Quebec II.

name: L'Escapade
description:
Properly sophisticated hotel and restaurant ran by a French ex pat. Hotel has swimming pool and 2 bars. Rooms range from 20,000 to 50,000 per night. Free WiFi. Way above the quality of most hotels we've seen outside of capital cities. Beautiful area of Cameroon for riding and driving. 

We just had breakfast here, but it was so impressive thought we should post.

name: Bunker
description: Great (primarily) fish restaurant, with outside and internal seating. Stacks of fresh fish piled up and cooked in the heart of the restaurant. Great atmosphere, with everyone from local african businessmen in suits, to expats and cool young African hipsters.

name: 3smotors
description: We came here to repair our Land Rover. It's actually an European quality garage as it's managed by three friendly french guys. They will help you to solve any problem and they are highly professional and quick. They also repair motorbikes. It is easy to get there from the main road and also many shops around. Here is attached a photo with the exact direction, website and phone number.

name: Guest house diocese of Ngaoundere
description: Guest house of the diocese (labelled as such on the street); we had a room with hot shower and two separate large beds with mosquito nets for 7500 franc for 2 people. They also said it would be possible to camp in their garden. Nice shady place with lots of old trees. There was supposed to be wifi but it did not work.

name: Dreamland Hotel
description: Basic hotel on the road from Ngaoundere to Maroua, a little outside Garoua, with a view over the wetlands. Rooms without air condition/with ventilator for 5000 franc, with air condition 7000 franc. TV was working soso, no wifi. The bathroom provides water, but the installations are a disaster. Car can be parked inside the compound. There was kind of a bar/restaurant in the complex, but we did not try it. Ok to stay overnight, since it was not recommended at that time to bush camp in the area.

name: Hotel Maroua Palace
description: Despite the name, it is a regular, but quite large and surprisingly fully booked hotel. We stayed in a double room with a good bed and bathroom (the rest of the room is still awaiting modernization), air condition and Sat TV. Car can be parked on the hotel parking. Room cost 18750 franc. Breakfast is available for 2500 franc. There are some other hotels/auberges in town, but they were fully booked when we were there.

name: Bachua Village
description: Beautiful village that we noticed when we were passing by. We saw beautiful roofs. They invited us inside, beautiful historical place. We met main chef of the village. It is not popular tourist place but worth visiting. After walking around we gave them 5000 CFA for our group of 8 to say thank you. Very friendly and lovely people.  Bushy Gerome was speaking very good english so he explained history of this place.

name: Eden Lodge hotel
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Camping is no longer allowed.

Very peacefull place, 200mtrs from the beach.Free and fast Wi-Fi. There is a place where you can chill and watch tv, if you like. You can sleep in the bungalows for 35.000fcfa p.n. including breakfast. Very nice and friendly staff, especially the owner Sylvain. If you are lucky, like us, you can use the washing machine for free!

name: best hotel
description: small and cheap hotel. lovely People. 5000cf for small room with private toilet and shower.

name: wildcamping at old scool
description: intrance right next to dirtroad n9 wich they did not finish yet. because of rain and darkness we camped with 2 small tents on the scool veranda. french speaking old nightguard lives next to the scool. nice guy. gave him socks and sweater and got avocado in return

name: Hotel Franco
description: basic hotel  but has secure parking underground which can take high vehicles. Average duplex room is CFA 75000.

name: Djimmy Garage
description: very good car and truck mechanic, friendly and knows a lot

name: Wild camp
description: Nice spot with a great view,  next to the house on the top

name: wild camp next to the river
description: Nice spot on the river, and if you are lucky you can see hippo's. We paid 2000 CFA at the landowner.  It's 6 km from the village,  a narrow path but ok for small truck.  Need 4x4

name: Just a small roadside restaurant
description: Eat the beans and ask for the mayonaise, Nice place coffee salades more.

name: Pa Soya
description:
Best Soya in town! 
Soya are beef brochettes. It’s not a restaurant but a small chop selling drinks and Pa Soya preparing the meat in front. You will see a lot of people stopping by and greeting him.

name: Saint John of God Guest House
description:
5000 double room, running water, electricity not stable. Safe compound with security. 
To access: enter the compound of the hospital and turn left up the hill.

We stopped here because of night fall and the place in itself is good but Nguti town is pretty much deserted so nothing going on around

name: Wildcamp next to road near chimpanze camp
description:
Just a little area right next to the dirt road a few meters after the road to the chimpanzee camp. There is space for 1 car and 1 tent. Here you can spend the night before going to the camp the next day, because there is not longer allowed to camp. 
Alternatively you can also go back to Marienberg and ask at the church. 
No one came here during the night and although people from the chimpanzee camp noticed us staying there, they have no problem with it.

name: Ebene Plus Restaurant
description:
Nice local restaurant with fish, pork, boeff and great plantain. Also Spagetti available. Beer is 800 CFA, meals are about 3.000 CFA.
Owner speaks a bit of English

name: Mamfre
description:
ADMIN NOTE: a user reported: 8-6-2018. Ekok-Mamfe road is perfect but there are at least 7 serious military road blocks where the entire vehicle-content is thoroughly inspected. Our coming was reported to Mamfe Police: we were to report there. Entering Mamfe our passports were taken by police and we were escorted to the office. They insist on an armed escort for the Mamfe-Bamenda road and give strong advice to immediately proceed towards Yaounde. No touring the highlands. Mamfe-Douala road is at present too dangerous to travel: Police prohibits taking this route. All contacts were professional and calm and atmosphere was friendly. Yet we had a tough day, as we already had had another 20 stops on the Katsina Ala-Ekokstretch. 
---
police stopped us from entering Mamfre because of potential unrest hazard. we were able to take the side road and reconnect to the Mamfre - Ekok road towards Nigeria. 
Generally no problem driving from Limbe to Ekok. All seemed calm. Lots of army and police presence because of possible unrest.  Mostly a good tarred road (thanks china) but has about 20km of construction detour. Parts have pot holes in villages but not a major problem.

name: La cigale
description: Excellent French restaurant with outstanding food. Definetly worth a visit if in Douala. Mains from 5000-8000, but very good value for the money! Ask for pork steak with cheese, ham and mushroom sauce, it's not on the menu. Delicious!

name: Le jet privé
description: Nice, clean local restaurant with simple but good local food. Chicken with rice is 1500 CFA. Beer Castel is 650 CFA. Run by a vriendly lady. In a more quit street of the center of Kribi. Breakfast possible for 1000 CFA.

name: Toyota Dealer
description:
Cami Toyota 
Official Toyota dealer
New parts for service to be done

name: Catholic Mission
description: We asked here at the catholic mission, if we could stay for 1 night, because the border with Gabun was already closed, when we arrived. Very friendly people! We could have even gotten a room, but decided to sleep in our car. They were welcoming and we could use the toilet in the guestroom. They didn't ask for any money....We still gave 2.000 CFA the next morning like we had in PCC in Buea.

name: Customs Cameroon (Kye Ossi)
description: Get your carnet stamped here. You may have to tell them how it's done, but after that no problems at all.no money asked.

name: Immigration Cameroon (Kye Ossi)
description: Here you get your passports stamped. Officers were all friendly and they stamped everything quickly and without hassle. No money asked.

name: Border Cameroon-Gabon (Kye Ossi)
description:
We used this border in order to skip the 'famous' guy with glasses from the police checkpoint at the other, more northern border. It went all pretty smoothly, but took some time anyway, because all in all our details were written down 6 times. First 3 times in Cameroon before they opened the barrier, but all people are friendly and no one asked for money. 
In Gabon we had to go to the police first, where we had to fill out one immigration form each. There was an official with glasses, but he didn't made any problems. When he asked for our hotel reservation we just said that we are camping and therefore go to a campground in Libreville that we couldn't book upfront. He was ok with that, took down our details and let us go. 
A few meters further on the right is customs, where we got our carnet stamped without problems. After that our details were written down 2 more times from police, but eventually all was fine and we could continue. Passports gotten stamped in Bitam. 
So if you don't have a valid hotel booking and want to skip the police check at the other border we highly recommend to use this border. It also takes some time, but in the end we didn't had a y problems here.

name: Centre Medical Insolafrica (Private hospital)
description:
Very good and reliable private clinic with connections with Spain. It's clean, well organized and modern. Meets European standard. A consult cost 2500 CFA. The dokter speaks English. You can do a blood test to check if the malaria parasite is in your blood and find out if you need medication for it. The test will take one minute and you get the result after one hour. They also have the right medication if you need it. 
Don't go to the hospital in the center of Kribi! What a mess. It's a very old and dirty hospital with a arrogant dokter. You will not get well there but will end up worse.

name: Hotel le Relais
description: Nice, very clean hotel with restaurant. Hot water, ac, TV, Wi-Fi,private parking Prices: 6000-20000 F

name: Fidji Hotel
description: Quite big hotel . Dirty rooms, restaurant serwes only drinks, private parking on the back, no hot water, no Wi-Fi, rooms with AC or with fan. Prices: 8000F with fan, 15000F with AC.

name: La terrasse de l'ocean
description: Restaurant with beautifull view on the ocean. Nice breezzz when it's hot. Nice place, were locals go to, to go for a lunch. Fresh fish, chicken and lobster.  A plate with fresh fish from the grill and plantain or pommes de terres is 3000. you can pick the fish yourself. A beer (castel) is 700.

name: Spar supermarket
description:
not big but European stuff available.
on the other side of the road big open air market. so almost all shoppings can be done here.

name: Ricky hotel
description: Small clean hotel. Dbl room with fan: 10000F, with AC: 15000F. TV, private parking. Bar (restaurant didn't work yet). No running water (at least during our stay) I think the cleanest place to stay in Mamfe.

name: Spar Supermarkt
description: Spar Supermarket with outside secure parking

name: Jep’s Hotel
description:
Simple but big rooms with shower for 11.000. Free fast WiFi downstairs. They might allow camping in the parking lot, not sure though. Secure parking. Restaurant and bar on site. Staff couldn’t care less about us being there, but I’ve seen worse. 

BEWARE: at the time of writing, there was a curfew in Bamenda. It’s forbidden to walk around town after 8.30pm. Really strange to see a super busy town change into completely haunted in a matter of minutes. Make sure you have everything before 8pm, nothing is open after that and it’s illegal to leave the hotel.

name: AGC assurances
description: Paid 38 500 CFA to insure my car for 2 months for all of Central Africa (carte rose). They will try to sell you a vignette for 25 000 as well but you don’t need that since you are traversing Cameroon and not staying (CdP helps as proof).

name: Deep mud
description: The dirt track Kribi - Lolodorf was in an extremely bad state with very deep and slippery mud after yesterday night’s rain. I turned back to Kribi after 15km, scared to damage the car or get stuck in the mud, and so did many locals.

name: Viewpoint
description: Worth the drive up, nice view over Yaoundé

name: VW station, also lot of other brands around
description:
VW station, European standard. 
very helpful

name: Hôtel Bellevue
description:
Simple hotel. Rooms 10 000 with fan, 12 000 AC. Negotiable if you stay longer. 

The rooms are simple but what is really nice about this place is:
- ok wifi all over the hotel 
- very nice bar/restaurant upstairs with great views, cheap beers and good food. 
- friendly staff 
- secure parking for overlanders (in the back, ask for it) 

Not as central as Laginaque but at least this is not a prison! Rooms basic but the terrace is really nice. Recommended.

name: Hotel roberta
description:
Hotel near sportafric
Got the price down to 12.500 
Nice room A-C bath fridge tv and wifi

name: Anita Mega Chicken
description: Simple but super friendly place, at least if you meet the owners (sisters Anita and Mercy). During the the day it's a full restaurant, at night they have a grill going out front with a choice of fish or chicken. I had snapper for 1,500 francs (with plantain on the side) plus a beer for 800 francs. Fish was fresh and owners seem to really care about good food. I was able to get food at 10pm but it probably stops serving relatively soon after this.

name: Hotel Relais
description:
Looks pretty rundown but good value. Basic African hotel. 10.000cfa (they started at 20.000) for a room with 2 double beds (pretty hard matrasses), private bathroom with good shower, western toilet, airco and tv. Pretty centrally located.
Secure parking underneath the hotel.

name: Clifton Hotel
description: A nice hotel with rooms from 10.000. They gave us a VIP room for the same price. Great staff that helped us buy SIM cards and was very welcoming. The room was in excellent condition including a padded wall over the bed. Good location and secure parking for approximately 5 vehicles. Recommended.

name: Hotel Banbin'ngoe
description: A nice hotel. Secure parking, friendly staff, and clean functional rooms. Price was 10.000 but we got a room for 7.000 after a bit of negotiation.

name: Hotel la Metropole
description: Brand new hotel opened in march 2018. Simple clean room good bed with fan 10000. Bigger room with airco huge bed tv,hot shower 20000. We bargained a bit better to 17 for the big room and 8 for the small room. We cooked ourselves on the parking. It’ close to the supermarket and fuel station with high pressure cleaning. They have a bar and snackbar as well. Not close to the centre but nice and quiet.

name: Sasse Falls/Catholic Church
description: A beautifully designed church in front of a  nice waterfall. Very nicely maintained. Free to visit although a small donation was appreciated. GPS is for the parking area, follow the "way in" signs.

name: Customs Post of Cameroon
description:
Small customs office. Officer without uniform. First registration of you.
Refused to exit stamp carnet—needs to be done in Banyo.

name: Wild camp
description: Wild camp in a village on the way to banyo

name: Custom Banyo
description: Stop here to get your temporary importation into Cameroon. This is the first customs office that you’ll come to if you crossed from Gembu. Officers were all kind and professional. The importation permit is free of charge. I’m not sure when/if they close. We arrived at 17:30 and the chief had to come back from his home to fill out the forms. He was very nice and everything was finished in about an hour.

name: Hotel le bien être
description: Basic african hotel. At the moment without electricity and only bucket showers. But there is not much in Tibati

name: Relais Hotel
description:
Nothing special. Bed and pillows were comfortable. Everything was clean. No power in the town when we were there so no water. Owner was very nice and carried a lot of water upstairs for us to use the toilets.  Also he gave us candles. His name is Alfred and speaks English and French well. 

We had 2 rooms for 5,000 each. 

Secure parking.

name: customs
description: douane checkpoint. when the route on the passavant is different to your current route it needs some time for talking and negotiation

name: Auberge Santa
description: Simple hotel, 5000 cfa. Has running water, 3G reception from MTN. Camped in their yard. Overall a good place.

name: express exchange
description: change money here, there are no atms in town

name: hotel municipal
description: basic accommodation, no restaurant, wifi. But there is a bar with cold beer. 10.000 a night

name: Assurance GMC
description: get your carte rose (pink card) here. 10.000 per month. 7am to 6pm open, Monday to Saturday.

name: Pessi Hotel
description: Very nice hotel, remodeled rooms. Good wifi, hot shower, free breakfast, secure parking. Perfect. Room is 20.000 but when I asked if I could have it for 15.000 they accepted immediately

name: Piragua to cross river
description:
Dont come here unless you like extremely hard pists. 
Before crossing river pist ok. After until Lomie my God! Enjoy 

This is the only place to cross the river if you are going to Lomie. Small piragua but we could fit to put Honda Transalp on it. 3km on the river to the other side. Paid 10000cfa.

name: Amazing huge Wood factory city
description:
Wooww, this is the place where all the wood form the area is process and sell to all the world. Huge city build for processing the wood. +200 people working here. We arrived after 3 days journey motorbike and give as beautiful wood house to sleep with shower and electricity. Also did a tour of the factory and the village. When you arrive ask for the chief and he is very cool person. We bought fuel 1000cfa liter and water.
If you have maps.me you will see the road with dots. Its an amazing highway build buy the some company. From Lomie took as 2 days.

name: Mintom Health Center (+ water)
description:
Mintom Health Center. 
Medical doctor, pharmacist and nurses working here. Very kind staff.
Handpump with clear water (ask the key to the pharmacist). Last "safe" water point until the border with Congo.
Very close to local market, tiny shops and restaurant.

name: BOCOM fuel station
description:
Djoum village.
Last fuel station (with the Total station a few meters away) until Ouesso if you are palanning to go to Congo.
Same prices in both stations.

name: 3 consecutive check-points
description:
3 consecutive check-points: grouped in less than 1 km !
- first check: the customs checked all documents (vehicle, insurance, passeports, driving licence)
- second check-point: police and gendarmerie checked again all previous documents + cameroonese "controle technique" papers (of course we hadn't that one) + vaccination cards
- third check-point: all documents
Obviously all those non-friendly officers were looking for something more than just a control ... although didn't dare asking for money ... The whole took about 40 min ...

name: Class Pressing / blanchisserie
description:
Local laundry amongst the others along the main road.
They agreed to wash "a load of casual clothes" although they normaly charge per piece.
Washing only: 2.500 CFA.
Finaly friendly staff. Ready in 1/2 day, good cleaning.
opening hours: 7h- 19h
Closed on Sunday.

name: Mefou Primate Sanctuary
description:
Run by Ape Action Africa, a charity.
Opening hours: 8h30 - 16h30 (but last tour at 15h30)
Entrance fees for foreigners: adult: 7.500 cfa, child: 2.000 cfa
for locals: adult: 1.000 cfa, child: 500 cfa
Best time for visit is around 11h, as they give apes a mid-day snack.
Many chimpanzes, gorillas, mandrills or guenons are easy to watch, very instructive.

name: Consulat du Bénin / Benin Consulate
description:
Benin consulate.
New system for visa: online application (50 eur 30 days, single entry)
However if not working, you can still apply here.
40.000 CFA for 30 days single entry, you have to deposit the document in the morning (8h30-11h) and get the visa the afternoon (13h-15h30)

name: Police Post Boudjounkoura (Banyo), Cameroon
description: Police station, that stamps your passport. They prefer a copy of your passport. The Officers are nice and correct. No fees.

name: Afriland First Bank
description:
The headquarter of the Afriland First Bank is one of the few opportunities to change West Africa Franc to Central Africa Franc. Go to Caisse D on the second floor. No fees on Sept. 2018. You must bring your passport. They make a copy of it.

Opening hours:
Monday to Friday 7h30 - 11h45, 14h30 - 17h45
Saturday 9h00 - 12h00, 16h00 - 17h30

name: Hotel Intourist
description:
nice option. all the western amenities - hot water, good WiFi. comfortable beds, AC, flat screen, quiet, guarded parking. and toilet seats!  Clean and a decent restaurant. No lounge area. 18k you can reserve on booking. com. 

if you come, the north turn east is a more straight shot. Lots of signs, but a little winding. but, if you've made it this far...

name: Official rest area next to the N5 road
description:
Wide free parking place behind official road restaurants. All closed when we arrived around 6 PM (maybe more busy during the WE)
Secured at night by a watchman.
Very quiet, almost no traffic. We were alone, no other truck came althought the parking is designed for.
Human activities start around 7 AM.
Water and toilets avaliable.

name: Alliance Française de Dschang
description:
As any Alliance francaise worldwide, free public library with temporary expos and shows. 
Opening hours: 
monday: 13h -  18h
tuesday - friday: 9h - 18h
saturday: 9h - 16h
Small but free parking place with beautiful view on the lake and the museum of civilizations.

name: Bamoun Sultan Palace & Museum
description:
Palace built buy the famous Sultan Njoya in the early 20th.
Sultan Njoya created the only know written of a black civilisation. Many artefacts and photos.
Fees: 2.000 CFA for the visit. We were escorted by Mr Ali, the museum's curator who was a fantastic storyteller.
Small music band with traditionnal music at the end of the visit. 
Small free parking at the Palace campound.
Opposit the Palace entrance, small traditionnal artefacts market, with plenty masks, statuettes, woodcrafts, etc ... Definitley negociate prices !

name: Lovely site next to the river.
description:
Very nice place for pic-nic or camping (we didn't, but would it be later, we certainely would have !)
Small but almost clear water with pools to refresh. Some ladies washing cloths and kids playing, but far from the village, so might be quiet at night. You can be seen from the road if you have a big rig, but for bikers, you might easily find a place to camp !

name: Huge and hidden pull out in laterite
description:
Huge flat laterite field with nice view over Banyo. 
Well hidden from the road by bush and trees.
Very quiet, no booth around, so no one came to see us.
Good 3G connexion with MTN.

name: River crossing
description:
No bridge here, so you have to cross the river: about 80cm max.
Might depend on the season.
Very step and muddy each side.

name: Grassy flat area next to the river
description:
One of the many wild camping options along to road.
Muddy river a few meters away (but at least, there is a bridge to cross it)
Flat and grassy. Very quiet and beautifull landscape.
Of course no 3G signal.

name: River with clear water.
description:
Here the small river cross the track. One side is the livestock waterpoint, other side is for human ;)
Going to Cameroun, 2km further, you can find the only other waterpoint, but according to locals, this place is much cleaner. (they said: "drinkable")
Nevertheless, due to the amount of cattle around, this water is not potable without treatment.
Could be a nice bivouac with a stunning view if you don't mind cows !

name: Aziz mechanic
description: A good motorcycle mechanic, can source good parts for big bikes. Got a brand new DID chain and sprocket set here. 00237695096310, WhatsApp.

name: Buea
description:
Family run guesthouse with ten rooms all with bathrooms. This is a newly built place and the rooms are lovely, some with views of Mt Cameroon.  Double rooms have very comfortable Queen sized beds, good pillows and clean sheets. Single rooms also have good big beds. It's like home! There is secure parking but ground is concrete so not good for camping. But you are welcome to sleep in your roof tent and negioate a fee for use of amenities. This guesthouse has a house as well and can accomodate a large group. Place is in back dirt streets of Buea, 5 minutes walk to town, on a corner with a reddish brown gate. It's heavenly quiet! Greg, the owner is very friendly, helpful, full of good information and speaks both English and French. Meals are available at reasonable prices. Double rooms are 25,000,cfa single rooms 12,000cfa. Greg's email: chiefmokube@gmail.com
Phone: +237 679864760

name: BOCOM Fuel Station
description: They have a “Forage d’eau portable”, good and clean water, locals come from far to fetch water here. We filled up our tank (500l) no problem. Gave a little tip to the very friendly staff. Water is hard to find in the area!

name: Camping at police station
description: Camped in car in front of police station. Officer we asked for a hotel proposed the police station and guided us here. Very nice officers, charged our electronic devices here. Close to road but not too noisy. Marked is in walking distance. No security concerns in the town in general!

name: Socomar pick up office roro
description:
Here are the offices to get your car released from the port. Last building on the left side.
The customs and PAD (port authorities douala) are at the same place. We had to go to the Chief of littoral 1 customs sector (highest chief in Douala) to get approval to use out carnet. From him we had to go back to all lower chiefs, after the 5th offices they stamped our carnet. Then release from the PAD, same story for hours no progress. when the boss arrived it was fixed. To pay 50k port duties, that is on the other side if the port. Pay the handling costs at Socomar (700Euro) and get your car. It took us 3 whole working days to get this done.
Hope for others that we paved the path. They admitted that is was straight forward but new to them and then you need to speak to the boss of the boss.

name: Cameroon Port Immigration
description: Get your entry stamp here if arriving by boat. Hassle free and fast.

name: Corrupt Port Authority
description:
If you arrive on the ferry, these guys will try to conn you into paying some sort of port release form for your vehicle. In our case, motorcycles.
You do not need to pay them a single penny.
They come meet you as soon as you get off the boat and guide you to their office.
It is a short fat guy with glasses and a hat.
Looks like Toad from the Wind in the Willows.

Funny thing was, the next morning at 8am he was at the petrol station drinking a beer near the pumps. Had the cheek to come chat to us as well and stated he was on his way to church! Lol

www.endurover.com

name: Dream City Hotel
description: Nice new hotel, founded just one month ago. Everything working. Good restaurant. Rooms for 20.000 (with AC) and 15.000 (without AC). The owner is the commander of Banyo. Probably the best hotel in town. No WiFi established yet, but they promised do to it.

name: Clausdel
description: Not super sure about the name but the restaurant is great. You enter in the little side street through a little entrance than you’re getting to the tables. Local food, local prices, super delicious.

name: Baba Bahraini
description: Good restaurant with nice staff. Enjoyed the meals

name: Chez Simon
description: A nice family-run place, it's possible to rent a room from 5000 cfa, 1km near the beach.

name: Bar Alimentation
description: Nice and quiet place where you can eat some typical food from Cameroon. Paid 1000 cfa for bâtons de manioc, some pounded fish and a bottle of water

name: Embassy of Republique Centrafricaine
description: It's possible to obtain the visa here. See pictures for Visa details.

name: L’Afamba
description: Nice Hotel & Restaurant double room CFA 10,000 in Sangmelima. Stayed here on our way towards Gabon 🇬🇦 border.

name: D’Aboulou
description: Border crossing from Cameroon to Gabon. Road suitable for bikes only.

name: River crossing at border only for Motorcycles
description:
River Crossing with Pirouge only suitable for motorcycle 
10000 CFA per bike. No negotiations as it’s a long way back and it’s the border with Gabon

name: Auberge Le Fanda
description:
Small entrance but has large signs above it. Located next to a bank.

Room for 5000 CFA/night has double bed, toilet, shower, sink, desk, and chair. No mosquito net, which is needed. Saw cockroaches in hallway and rats in yard... not wishing to deter people, but it's one of the few cheap places in Kribi.

There are rooms for 7500 CFA/night, which also have a TV, but can't remember what else.

Water and electricity don't always work.

Parking is very limited. Only a small place out front. I kept my motorcycle there for multiple days without issue. Security guards work 24/7 for the bank, which is metres away from entrance to auberge.

Suzanne who works here is kind and friendly.

name: Hotel Pekassa de Karche
description: Actually a pretty nice hotel. Single rooms for 8000. Doubles for 10000. Nicer rooms with AC 25000 with double/two beds. Secure parking behind a gate.

name: K-J Hotel
description:
5500 CFA/night for double bed, en suite, desk, chair, but no mosquito net. No running water. Water is provided in large bin for flushing toilet, bucket showers etc. Electricity sockets and light switches do not work. A secondary light is hard wired to be on during the night (I tucked it behind curtain to make it dark). A guy said I could charge phones etc in the reception. Owner is pleasant and friendly.

Possible to park a 3-4 vehicles, but it's not secure. I was allowed to park my motorcycle inside another building. Could get 2-3 motorcycles in there but would be a squeeze!

The buildings has two levels and stands out from neighbouring buildings. A policeman at the back of the station, by the carrefour, directed me to it, and I could see the roof of the building.

name: Villa Boutanga
description:
Very nice hotel up an a hill. Cool climate and peaceful nature. Quality rooms. Hot shower. Good restaurant.
Rooms with double bed/twin beds 20000. Nicer rooms more.
Absolutely great place to take a day off from the road and just relax.

name: Hotel Lobe
description: Very nice and quiet hotel run by an Italian fella. Clean double room with a balcony ,AC, hot water, comfy bed. 15000 a night (booking.com). Terrace on the roof to relax and enjoy the breeze. Good breakfast for 2000. 10min walk to the beach and the falls. Safe parking at the back behind a gate. WiFi comes and goes.

name: Hotel Adi
description:
5000 / 8000 en suite
nothing crazy, but well located near market.
I could put my motorcycle inside the restaurant for the night, otherwise no fenced parking.

name: Nice view
description: Very nice place to camp. The view is amazing ! You can be hidden from the main road.

name: ATM Société Générale du Cameroun
description: ATM with security guard and bank agency.

name: Chad Consulate
description: Chad consulate. They issued me a tourist visa immediately in 20 minutes.

name: River crossing easy
description: this crossing was easy and road shorter than northern route. hadn't rained much for several days. ankle depth 4 inch 10 cm. sand bottom steep but easy banks

name: short road to Nigeria border
description: shorter road when headed to border.  turn left if headed to border. In good condition easy stream crossings. In rainy season all bets are off :-). but the roads dry out quickly.

name: 200 meters after police station
description: Room for 3 or 4 vehicles 200 meters and in view of the police station but just before the bridge. level spots good place to wait when it rains. Amazing frog serenade in the evening.

name: River crossing with mud
description: this was the most difficult stream crossing between Guroji and Banyo for us as there was deep mud on the far side of stream. Headed towards Banyo. But rear drive van made it.

name: Casino Supermarche Grocery Store
description: Very large well-stocked western style grocery store with a generous variety of alcoholic beverages. Takes credit cards. There's parking for one big rig outside the gated parking lot immediately on the left of the gate.

name: Power Line Clearing
description: Not scenic, but fairly flat parking in the clearing under large power lines. Easy access off a well maintained dirt road. A few locals wandered by and all were friendly.

name: Street Corner
description: Perfect place to share a beer, meet nice people and enjoy some live music . It’s a cultural place where you can have a good discussion and meet local people.

name: Wild camp
description: Huge space that must have been used for building the road. Entrance from the road and easy to find a flat spot hidden from the road. Far enough from the village that no one comes to say hello.

name: Corrupt military check point
description: Corrupt military check point looking to bribe for anything.

name: national museum
description: not as bad as some reviews suggested. as of 2019 also open on Mondays, a little pricy, 5000cfa for an adult, 15000cfa for family but included a guided tour if approx 1h

name: Equatorial Guinea consulate
description:
816 rue koloko
1 photo
1 passport copy
51000 with LOI and residency of Cameroon 
151000 if u dont have LOI and local residency 
same day delivery

name: Custom and immigration Cameroon
description:
3 check points: custom, police and immigration.
If you are traveling from Nigeria with Cdp ask also for passavant. It is mandatory to have it to buy a car insurance in Banyo (Cdp is not enough).
The police check point request à copy of the 2 first pages of the passeport. Make sure you have some with you.

name: Musée des Civilisations Dschang
description:
You can stay overnight on the parking of the museum after or before the visit of this very interesting first class museum. Safe and quiet place. Free of charge.
Restaurant nearby. WC in the museum (close at night)

name: Hôtel Elma  d'Ombessa
description: Small hotel on the road to or from Yaoundé. With quiet and safe parking. We spent one night in our small truck for 5000 CFA. Nice owner and good restaurant. They opened one room for us where we could have a shower.

name: New Hualian Hotel
description: Hotel run by chinese, with a large restaurant. 20,000 to 30,000.

name: Selecte Boulangerie Patisserie
description: Place to buy baked goods and has a small supermarket. Good price not bad. Espresso available

name: Catholic Mission
description: Really welcoming. They told me I could camp anywhere. No water or electricity but I got given water to wash and cook. African shower and toilets

name: Restaurant
description: Friendly place with simple but good food, and beer. Walk down the alley to the left of the bar, until you reach the room with couches and armchairs. Also, at night there is plenty of street food around.

name: Hotel
description: Pretty basic place, but good for one night. Water and electricity only after sundown. Bar/restaurant with average food. Chicken with fried plantain and a large Guinness for 4500. Double room with fan for 8000. Not the cleanest, but not terrible. I didn't bargain on the room, but there's probably a better price if you try. Secured parking with plenty of room, but a big rig might be a squeeze on the entrance

name: Hotel round point palace
description: Decent hotel, newly decorated, European standard rooms (even have key cards for the electricity!) Hot showers, comfy beds and towels. Has Wifi, though only realised as we were leaving so not sure of speed. Negotiated 10,000 for double (started at 13,000) secure parking (gate locked at night) would fit big rigs. Stall across the road does excellent chicken Kebabs and plantain chips  with spicy sauce.

name: Chinese service
description: Big service, guys are doing almost everything. Quick and not expensive

name: Baba Hotel
description: African style bungalows, not bad but quite overpriced. I paid 15k for a big room with AC (no need though). Cheapest room is 12k, most expensive 30k. Advantage: you are outside the town, you can quick start to Yaounde. They have a big parking area, too.

name: Cameroon Immigration
description: We got our passport stamped here without any problems coming from Nigeria. We are traveling with bicycle. (The customs is in Mayo Darlé)

name: Fako lodge
description:
Lodge and campground, beautiful cabins for sleep, up to 3 persons possible. Great view to Buea. No water at the lodge, when we've been there, but they work on the water supply. First stop on the 3 days hiking at Mount Cameroon. 
www.mtcameroonnationalpark.org

name: Mann spring lodge
description:
Beautiful lodge with possibility to camp. Nice cabins up to 3 persons. Lodge with nice location on your way to the craters or the Elephant view point. Second stop on the 3 days hiking at  Mount Cameroon
www.mtcameroonnationalpark.org

name: Municipal restaurant
description:
very good, fresh barbequed fish for CFA 2.000,- fried plantains 500,- beer 1.000,-
Some tables just behind the beach with nice view!!

name: Total Fuel Station
description: Fuel station with pumps and a small shop for some supplies.

name: Large Gravel Area (hidden from road)
description:
As the be suggests! Large Gravel Area hidden from the road, plenty of space to choose from, easily big enough for the biggest of big rigs or our little campervan!


The road north of here to Banyo is rubbish (with the exception of the tar section up/down the big hill just north of this spot).

name: Besides a quiet track in the bush
description:
As the name suggests, we parked about 20m up a quiet side track (no one used this) off a quiet dirt road (a few scooters passed in the night but not sure they even noticed us).

NoteTo get here we used a small wooden bridge, ok in our 3.5tonne Campervan but I'd be nervous if we were heavier....

name: Dolphin beach bar
description:
A beach front restaurant with large grass/sandy parking area overlooking the beach.

We were allowed to camp (in our Campervan) in the carpark (with sea view) after having dinner and drinks (2 large fish with chips and plantain -7000cfa total, beers 1000cfa).

Good food and clean loo available behind the bar.

name: Beach front spot between the trees
description:
small and short track off the main (tar) road. The track/gap between the trees is only about 20m long and ends on the beach (sandy) with overhanging trees either side. You can hear some road noise but also the waves!  

No one came to see us but you are visible from the road (if people happen to glance down the track as they pass).

name: Ebogo
description: A small tourist complex superbly located above the Nyong River.  Many excursions are proposed by pirogue or on foot.  We went for a nice 2-hours pirogue ride up the river which winds majestically through the virgin forest.  30 000 CFA for a pirogue which can carry 2 people and the guide.  The second hike at 5000 CFA pp took us to a cocoa plantation after crossing the river by canoe and walking a few hundred meters into the forest.  A very informative excursion because the guides are from the village and themselves peasants.  They also received a one-year training in botany and ornithology.  Camping in own vehicle on the parking lot above the river for 5000 CFA per night for the location.

name: Old road/ dirt track
description: Hidden from the main road, very quiet at night (only 2/3 trucks) and no one came to see us. This dirt track is accessible from the (Tar) main road on the corner, access is a little bumpy but fine.

name: Customs and douanes
description: After entering Cameroon from Nigeria through Dorofi, we had to come here to get our Passavant. The customs guy on the Cameroon side called ahead and had his boss arrange the document for us.

name: La chateau Turc
description: A good turkish restaurant. A little on the pricey side but all restaurants in this area is on the posh side. Good and clean environment.

name: Allianz
description: insurance for car or motorbike. car is 42000 for two months. motorbike 18500. they don't make any problem about an application like axa will do.

name: Wild camping
description: At the top of the steep muddy hill, after immigration and the river. A grassy, level area to the right of the road, large enough for a few vehicles. The locals use this clearing to access the river below but did not mind us camping there.

name: Zenithe Insurance
description:
very friendly staff. assurance done in 20 minutes.
the best price in the city : 28500fcfa for 2 months for a 4x4 for 6 countries (Cameroon, Tchad, Congo, Centrafrique, Gabon, Guinée équatoriale).
you dont need to buy "la vignette", show your CPD or your passavant.
included :
-contract
-yellow card
-pink card
whatsapp : 675728460.

name: Lac femelle + lac mâle cratères
description:
Amazing place. At almost 2.000 meters you have those beautiful landscapes. Mountains, two lakes, horses, nice people... 
But we need to say that the road to come is difficult. Specially the last 10 kilometers, after Bangem. Possible with a 4x4. In rainy season : impossible, too muddy.
normally, there is an entrance fee but we dont know how much because nobody was here!!! ;-)

name: Embassy Congo Brazzaville
description:
Really thieves. They have asked 120.000fcfa for the visa of 15 days or 140.000fcfa for the Visa of 1 month. Ready in 1 day.
Open from Monday to Friday, 9:30/15:30.
You need to bring :
-2 identity pictures
-copy yellow fever
-hotel booking
-copy of passport.
We didn't pay. We will make it in Yaounde, because it is cheaper!!!

name: Mechanicien - Graisseur Nganso Bernard
description: Close to CAMI Toyota dealer we found this friendly man with a little workshop beside the MRS fuel station. Excellent spot for small maintenance on your car (in our case a Toyota Landcruiser), like changing oil, filters, brake pads etc. He also has gear to lift your car (one corner) and repairing tyres. The good part: if you need original Toyota parts, it is just 100mtr walking 😉 We started at CAMI, but like CFAO, they love paperwork more than cars and a simple job (like in our case checking the braking pads) would take easily 2-3 hours...

name: Boulangerie Patisserie Du Musee Restaurant
description:
Place for food. 
Coffee. 
and bread. 
2000 CFA a plate with chicken, beef and rice.

name: Pigment village
description: Here you can see a pigment village. First enter and talk to the chief of the village and she will give you the permission to see the small people. Dot expect to much they are civilized nothing authentic.

name: Gambas Rustique
description: Cool place by the beach with amazing huge prawns and fish.  You pick your fish and prawns or even crabs first from like a market and then they grill it for you. They serve it with plantains and Myndo.  You can order drinks as well. We paid 10.000 for 3 big prawns incl.  the sides and preparation, the big fish was 9.000 and they grilled it really nicely. There is a nice sunset as well.

name: On the beach
description: Good place just on the beach. Quiet, some houses around with good people. Beautiful sunset.

name: Les Jardins de l’Esterel - shaded bar restaurant
description: Nice bar/restaurant with a green canopied shaded terrace for cold drinks and/or a meal. Easily overlooked while passing by (due to the natural canopy). Draws both a mixed crowd of both locals as well as expats

name: Le Cardinal
description: Nice hotel on the same beach. French owner and very good and friendly service. 40,000cfa per night for two people in a room with 2 beds ... but after speaking we have only paid 30,000cfa. very good food and air conditioning in the rooms

name: Cathédrale Saint-Joseph
description:
i arrived at Kribi at 10pm By hitchhiking..I asked the security of Mission, allowed me to camp here..second day i asked the priest, allowed me to camp 2 more nights, and let me use the Republic shower room..
warmshower！but i need cold water.
can't change the temperature.

name: Shengrong Chinese Service
description: All kinds of vehicles... very quick service.

name: Carrefour Market
description:
the french chain Carrefour Market (like a mini walmart)
good for all your groceries and overlanding restocking

name: Marina Kribi
description: a small marina with a nice pizza oven restaurant

name: The Burger Bar
description: Lovely friendly Burger bar if you want a western world type experience in Yaoundé. Delicious burgers, including the vegetarian. Proper green salads. Chilled vibe. WiFi. And just good people all round.

name: Da tui
description: Modest simple hotel. Not many other chances to stay. Normal.

name: Yamaha
description: Professional and helpful guys. I went there in search of a battery, which they didn't have but offer to recover my one and charge another one. They also offered to send one of their guy to go around the shops to find the most appropriate battery. While there, they had a KTM 250 in the workshop, and were doing works on the forks. They seem knowledgeable people.

name: Ben's Garage
description: Ben is a mechanic that knows his stuff on big bikes. After I desperately tried to solve the issue on my Husqvarna 701 enduro, I had isolated that my fuel injector was not doing its job. Ben came around and managed to get it running. He's tough to negociation so fix your price before. But he will sort your problem. He can also be a little hard to understand. His garage is located opposite "La maison du cycle". There will be big bike/scooter on the street.

name: Street Food
description: Nice place with some seats where you can try different meat cooked over a fire. Plantain and other vegetables as well. Full plate is 4.500, enough for two people. You buy directly guys at the grill. Highly recommend.

name: La Marquise
description: Excellent local restaurant, with nice and peaceful seating. Inside and outside. Lots of space and big parking. In a Little side Road.

name: Embassy of Chad
description: Before covid, they didn't ask for a resident permit of Cameroon, but since May 2021, they renew the requirement which is that all non-Africans who wanna apply for the tourist visa should do so with the resident permit of Cameroon.

name: Sabella
description:
Room at 5000CFA in modest Motel. Great because it is in the center of town.  The rooms are very modest and the shower is with the bucket.
It’s okay if you only want to stay for one night.

name: Mandatory Checkpoint
description:
Ok, long story short - STOP HERE! 

There is no sign for the police and I went straight through the village. I got chased by a police man on a bike who was shooting his AK-47 in the air to get my attention! Its a mandatory Military checkpoint so if you take this route, stop to get signed in. They are kind people here but the area is a bit dangerous due to the civil unrest. Take Care!

name: FRED Garage, Yaounde (Dragage)
description:
FRED Garage is the best garage I have seen in the whole of Africa. It truly deserves the superlative. It has everything, spare parts for motorcycles, cars and even trucks. Didier, the guy in charge, is a French guy who has lived here from 2011. He speaks perfect English and French. Everyone here is incredibly knowledgeable. They can also fabricate things as they have a lathe. If you need to order tyres he is your guy as well. Just a lovely helpful place. Best of luck.

Didier Whatsapp number +237 78288491

name: Garage fred
description:
Best garage in yaounde having many tools and many spare parts and can easly find them. Work on bikes, cars and trucks. 
And you can sleep in the garage securised

Call didier: +237678288491

name: Assurance
description: 2 months for 32000CFA (minimum term). Accepted the Carnet as a vignette so didn’t need one, but took some convincing!

name: Catholic Mission
description: Welcoming and friendly, offered us a room, dinner and breakfast when we asked to camp. Pay as much as you like, we paid 10 000CFA.

name: Hotel Martino
description: Clean rooms, comfortable bed and welcoming staff. Onsite restaurant and bar. Secure, gated parking. 24hr electricity. Rooms from 12000 CFA (single/ no AC) to 21000 CFA (AC + balcony). Soap and towels included. The security guard washed our bikes.

name: Hotel Relais Saint Andrés
description:
15000 - 18000 CFA for AC room with hot water. 

Rooms are a bit dated. There is a restaurant on site but it wasn't open. Wifi was not working. Plenty of parking. In a quiet part of town.

name: Hotel Elephant
description:
10,000 CFA double room, running water, electricity comes on around 7pm. 

Walking distance to shops, market and restaurant. There used to be a restaurant onsite but wasn't open when we were there. 

The place has seen better days. No fan or AC available. No nets on the windows so it can be buggy. You can feel the boards of the bed through the mattress. 

Plenty of parking for motorcycles and overlanding trucks. The entrance is steep and narrow so it might be a challenge for big rigs. 

There are no signs from the main road directing you to the hotel. It is down a short dirt track.

name: Village Auberge
description:
Simple hotel for 5,000 CFA. Not sure of the actual name of the hotel and at the time of writing Google Maps doesn't show much detail but there are only two places to stay in town so if you ask around someone will point you in the right direction. 

The rooms have a wash area where you can shower. Toilets are out the back. There's one shared toilet paper roll for all of the guests, so you might want to bring your own. There are mosquito nets. 

Some rooms are much better than others so be sure to have a look at the options. Avoid the one furthest down the left wing on the right hand side, it smells like something died inside the shower drain. 

Not the cleanest or most comfortable place but ok for a short stay.  

The manager let us park our motorcycles inside the reception area. Plenty of parking for trucks in the yard. It's not gated or guarded.

name: Playce Yaounde - CARREFOUR SUPERMARKET
description: New shopping center with a big Carrefour inside.

name: Sagesse Hotel
description: Great hotel option if you need to spend the night in Kye Ossi. Private ensuite with hot water and fan avilable from 10k CFA (negotiated down to 8k for single occupancy). Overall a clean place, not far from the Cameroonian border control point.

name: SOCAF assurances
description: 27.000 CFA for 2 months for toyota LC (13HP). covering west African countries, incl Congo Gabon Cameroon, and more north-west several countries up to Senegal. Above 17 horsepower its 35.000 CFA

name: Paroisse Catholique
description:
Little Catholic church and bush clinic near the Bossemptélé crossroads. About halfway from Garoua-Boulaï border to Bangui, makes a nice quiet spot to rest. 

This is CAR, so don't expect luxury, but the Togolese Father here will go out of his way to help you. 

He can provide good filtered fuel in a country with no gas stations outside of the capital. 

Security is decent. There's a guard, and for those on bikes you can drive right in to a closed building with metal doors and barres windows. 

3500 FCFA for the better rooms with electricity, 2500 FCFA for the rooms in the building where you can park a motorcycle (no electricity or running water there). 

If you have your own camping gear, ample space to set up shop, although as of mid 2017, I would not advise camping in CAR just yet.

name: Ecole St Charles
description:
Lodgings at the Spiritain priests, in the back of the St Charles school. Safe, secure parking. 

Price has been driven up by the UN crowd, but still better than hotels. 

Wifi, hot shower, secure parking and fan. 12-15k CFA per night.

name: Adoum Mechanic
description:
Incredible mechanic with knowledge of bigger motorcycles. Drives a Ténéré and is the go-to guy for the (admittedly few) big bikes in Bangui. 

Can source parts, even if supply is very limited here. Knows how to place orders from Cameroon and such. 

It's deep in the PK5 muslim majority area so use extreme caution, get up to date info before driving in. 

You can call him ahead of time at the following number to check on security, and if iffy, he can drive out to meet you (french notions required): 75752130

name: DRC Embassy (Congo Democratic)
description:
Embassy of the DRC in Bangui. Issues visas to non-residents without hassle. One doc to fill out, two pictures, photocopy of CAR visa and entry stamps, photocopy of previous DRC visas in passport. 

No mention of invitation letters or guarantees. 

2 month visa was 75.000 CFA. Same day processing. Dropped off at 11 AM, received at 12.30

name: Elephant Hotel
description:
The cheapest and safe place in town. Simple but clean rooms, shared wc and bucket shower. No electricity. Price- 3500 CFA.
When you arrive to Bayanga, go to police station (Commissariat de police) with a passport for registration.

name: Embassy of Chad
description:
easy place to get your chadian visa
1 passport photo
50000 CFA
get it within two hours

name: Consulate of Gabon
description: they don't give visa to people, they said:"here is only consulate, not embassy. we can't give u the visa.we don't have embassy in RCA."

name: Nigerian Embassy
description:
They don't need residence ID here... good
*balance of bank card
*hotel booking
*write form online （immigration.gov.ng） and download
*2 photos

100USD for 30days, no more. start from right now.

name: Embassy of Republic of Congo
description:
3 hours to get visa.
30 days, 70,000 CF, need 2 photos and passport copy only. Friendly and usefully, 1 staff can speak a bit English.

name: Lake and River
description: A nice grass field in front of a (private) lake and very close to a river. Quiet place for a night. There’s the railway but it’s far away, so not a lot of noises from the trains.

name: La Balancoire
description: Boss of the bar called August , allowed me camping in his bar in the night. "u can stay here forever, like ur home.."He have traveled 17 yrs already, so He love travelers and understand overlanders.his bar is big and good price for beer and soda !! coca 500 CF... every morning i bought cakes and breads,yogurt in his wife's baking shop for breakfast, totally 800 CF..only evening have electric, this is CAR capital city..

name: Doli Lodge
description:
The "official" lodge of the park (Dzanga Sangha) and quite good value. There are dorms and private bungalows available. Payed 20'000 CFA per night breakfast included. Restaurant ist really good with an amazing view over the Sanga River.
2min walk away are the park headquarters where you can organize your excursion.

name: Police Checkpoint Bomandjokou
description:
A series of made-up Checkpoints here: Pre-Border control, Police Checkpoint etc.
Just here to make some money. You can and should negotiate. To start with they want at least 15'000 CFA for everything. I ended up paying 7000 CFA, but someone I met came away with only 4000 CFA. At least they're friendly.

name: Immigration Lidjombo
description: Here you can get your visa on arrival for the CAR. 30'000 CFA plus 2000 CFA for the officer. No documents needed.

name: Hotel Shanghai
description:
Middle class hotel under Chinese management. A simple double room (one large bed) with slightly run-down and not repaired bathroom installations cost us 25.000 XAF after a lot of negotiation (list price was 55.000 I believe, including buffet breakfast, while the discount price did not include breakfast), quite cheap for N'Djamena. There is guarded parking space reserved for hotel around the corner. The highlight of this night was the traditional Chinese dinner in the hotel restaurant, delicious, although it cost us the same as the night.
Coffee is clearly overpriced, though, 2000 XAF for Nescafe with milk powder!
Internet access seems to be under Chinese censorship, as well, beware, some pages would not work.
Professionally polite Chinese personnel, many Chinese guests.

name: Centre d'accueil Kabalaye
description: Guest rooms for visitors run by the Kabalaye catholic parish. They cost ~ 20.000 XAF, but no rooms were available when we arrived, as they were waiting to receive refugees at that time. Quiet place around a yard with trees, looks friendly. Reception is closed from 2-4 pm.

name: Sudanese Embassy
description: Sudanese Embassy, there is a counter for visa applications. It is not easy to obtain the visa as a European in Tschad. We first talked to the clerk at the window, he was not sure and asked the embassador. They had to send a written inquiry to Khartoum, and it took them 2 or 3 weeks to get a reply, which was positive. Then, the visa were prepared within 48 hours and cost 28.000 XAF per person for one month. Friendly and helpful people.

name: German Embassy
description: German Embassy. They take care of passport issues, certificates etc. They wrote a "recommendation" for us for the Sudanese Embassy.

name: Hopital de la Renaissance
description: Highly modern and well equipped hospital with European standards. They have a 24-hour emergency access. We went here for malaria treatment.

name: Commisariat Central N'Djamena
description: We had to go here after entering the country coming from Kousseri for another part of the immigration procedure. They ask you to fill in a form and hand over passport photographs, then they stamp your passport; this has to be done max. 3 days after entering the country. Lots of corrupt officials here.

name: Maison de la Culture Baba Moustapha and Cybercafe
description: Large, welcoming cultural center that hosts music live performances and other activities. They have a busy internet café with several computer, you can also bring your own laptop and pay by the hour (1000 XAF). Open Mon-Sat. Very friendly people.

name: KTM Namibia
description:
Very helpful service, especially when BMW is too busy.....
Mitas tire dealer (call ahead for stock). 

Karl Schiele
KTM Motorcycles Namibia CC
No 4 Ruhr Street >> Northern Industrial >> Windhoek >> Namibia
Phone         : +264 (061) 252 799 
Fax              : +264 (061) 258 635
e-mail         : ktm-namibia@iway.na

name: Chinese guesthouse
description: Chinese guesthouse I just walk in to this place and asked for the price here! It is 35000 CAF of chinese lunch and dinner provided ! There is parking lot! Location is v good near Amendine Cafe a popular expat local cafe
